original: blo tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan ni de lta de ltar skye ba'i dngos po gzhan nyid yin te des na 'di ni ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don no //
analyzed: blo tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan ni de lta de ltar skye ba'i dngos po gzhan nyid yin te des na 'di ni ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don no //
translated: The reason for the difference in cognition is the existence of another thing that arises in that way, and therefore this is not ascertained. This is the general meaning.

original: de la bar chod par skye ba'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni bar chad dang bcas pa'i shes pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes sbrel lo //
analyzed: de la bar chod par skye ba'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni bar chad dang bcas pa'i shes pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes sbrel lo //
translated: The thing that arises without interruption is the reason for the cognition with interruption.

original: gzhan nyid du zhes bya ba ni bar med par skye ba gang yin pa zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid du zhes bya ba ni bar med par skye ba gang yin pa zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The other thing is the thing that arises without interruption.

original: khyim dang 'bigs byed gangs ri bzhin //
analyzed: khyim dang 'bigs byed gangs ri bzhin //
translated: Like a house, Vindhya, and the Himalayas.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di dag nyid kyi ci rigs su dper brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di dag nyid kyi ci rigs su dper brjod pa yin te /
translated: These are examples of the above, respectively.

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyi lugs kyis kyang bar ma chad par skyes pa'i khang ba rang nyid @281a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyi lugs kyis kyang bar ma chad par skyes pa'i khang ba rang nyid @281a * //
translated: Thus, even according to the opponent‚Äôs system, a house that arises without interruption has the nature of possessing itself.

original: ldan ba'i bdag nyid dag la bar med pa'i blo'i rgyu mtshan ldan pa gzhan yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: ldan ba'i bdag nyid dag la bar med pa'i blo'i rgyu mtshan ldan pa gzhan yod pa ma yin la /
translated: It does not possess another thing that is the reason for the cognition without interruption.

original: bar chad nas skyes pa de dag nyid la yang bar chad dang bcas pa'i blo'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnam par dbye ba yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bar chad nas skyes pa de dag nyid la yang bar chad dang bcas pa'i blo'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnam par dbye ba yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And even in those that arise from obstruction, there is no reason for the idea of obstruction,

original: yon tan rnams la yon tan med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: yon tan rnams la yon tan med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin to //
translated: because there is no quality in a quality. This has already been explained.

original: gangs can dang 'bigs byed dag la yang bar chad dang bcas pa'i blo'i rgyu rnam bar dbye ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gangs can dang 'bigs byed dag la yang bar chad dang bcas pa'i blo'i rgyu rnam bar dbye ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And in the Himalayas and Vindhyas, there is no reason for the idea of obstruction.

original: phrad pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi ma thob pa ni rnam par dbye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhung lugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phrad pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi ma thob pa ni rnam par dbye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhung lugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The theory is that non-acquisition that precedes contact is the reason for the idea of obstruction.

original: gang yang / bar chad bcas la bar med par //
analyzed: gang yang / bar chad bcas la bar med par //
translated: And also, in the verse that goes, ‚ÄúObstructed, unobstructed,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa des /üîΩlog pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa des / log pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúAll wrong ideas arise from grasping what is similar.‚Äù

original: log pa'i blo thams cad chos mthun pa 'dzin pa las skye ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni ma grub ste /
analyzed: log pa'i blo thams cad chos mthun pa 'dzin pa las skye ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni ma grub ste /
translated: This is not established.

original: 'ga' zhig chos mthun pa la ltos pa med par yang dbang po nyams pa tsam gyis skye bar mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig chos mthun pa la ltos pa med par yang dbang po nyams pa tsam gyis skye bar mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Some see that it arises even without regard to similarity of object, merely through the impairment of the sense faculty.

original: dper na rnam par rtog pa'i sems gzhan du song ba yang mdun na gnas pa'i zla ba gcig gi bdag po tsam gyis rab rib kyis byas pa'i dbang po nyams pa las zla ba gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa shin tu gsal bar snang ba rtog
analyzed: dper na rnam par rtog pa'i sems gzhan du song ba yang mdun na gnas pa'i zla ba gcig gi bdag po tsam gyis rab rib kyis byas pa'i dbang po nyams pa las zla ba gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa shin tu gsal bar snang ba rtog
translated: For example, when the conceptual mind is directed elsewhere, the impairment of the sense faculty due to cataracts produces a very clear appearance of the aspect of two moons, following after the one moon that is present in front.

original: pa'i cha shas kyis ma sbags pa'i blo skye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: pa'i cha shas kyis ma sbags pa'i blo skye ba bzhin no //
translated: The mind is born uncontaminated by the part of imagination.

original: gzhan du gyur pa'i sems can la zhes bya ba 'dis ni zla ba gnyis kyi blo las rnam par rtog ba med ba nyid kyi blo brtan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa'i sems can la zhes bya ba 'dis ni zla ba gnyis kyi blo las rnam par rtog ba med ba nyid kyi blo brtan pa yin no //
translated: By this phrase ‚Äúin the mind of a sentient being who has undergone a transformation,‚Äù the mind that is stable, which is the absence of imagination in the mind of two moons, is shown.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sems la ni chos mthun pa 'dzin pa yod ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sems la ni chos mthun pa 'dzin pa yod ba ma yin te /
translated: In a mind that is without imagination, there is no apprehension of similarity.

original: de ni sngar dang phyis mthong ba'i dngos po gcig nyid du zhen pa'i bdag nyid kyis sngar nyams su myong ba brjod ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sngar dang phyis mthong ba'i dngos po gcig nyid du zhen pa'i bdag nyid kyis sngar nyams su myong ba brjod ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of the cognition that conceives the thing seen previously and later to be one and the same, and it is the nature of the expression that expresses the experience of the thing seen previously.

original: ci ste yang na log pa'i blo thams cad gtso bo'i don 'phen par byed pa nyid du chug mod /
analyzed: ci ste yang na log pa'i blo thams cad gtso bo'i don 'phen par byed pa nyid du chug mod /
translated: But if you accept that all erroneous cognitions impel the meaning of the primary thing,

original: de lta na yang 'dod pa 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'dod pa 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: even so, the desired conclusion is not established.

original: yang na bar med sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sogs pa smos pa ni bar chad med cing skye ba'i dngos po gzung ngo //
analyzed: yang na bar med sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sogs pa smos pa ni bar chad med cing skye ba'i dngos po gzung ngo //
translated: Or else, the expression ‚Äúor else, without interval, etc.‚Äù refers to the thing that arises without interruption.

original: dngos po de nyid bar chad pa dang bar ma chad par skye ba ni de'i rigs can ma yin pa spangs nas 'jug pa'i don du ches dang por sbyar ba'i rnam par dbye ba la sogs pa'i brjod pa nyid kyis dngos su yod pa'i phyir khyed cag giüîΩ'dod pa grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po de nyid bar chad pa dang bar ma chad par skye ba ni de'i rigs can ma yin pa spangs nas 'jug pa'i don du ches dang por sbyar ba'i rnam par dbye ba la sogs pa'i brjod pa nyid kyis dngos su yod pa'i phyir khyed cag giüîΩ'dod pa grub pa ma yin no //
translated: That very thing arises without interruption, and having abandoned that which is not of its type, it engages in the object. The expression ‚Äúor else‚Äù is directly applied to the first, in order to make a distinction. The expression ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to the expression itself. Therefore, your desired conclusion is not established.

original: rna cha can zhes bya ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: rna cha can zhes bya ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúAs for the so-called ear-ringed one‚Äù is as follows.

original: bshad ba rna cha can zhes blo 'di yang //üîΩzhes @281b bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bshad ba rna cha can zhes blo 'di yang // zhes @281b bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The cognition of the ear-ringed one is like that.üîΩThe passage beginning ‚ÄúJust as the difference in the state of the black cow and the ear-ringed one‚Äù is as follows.

original: ji ltar nag pa dang rna cha dag gi gnas skabs kyi khyad par thob pa ni ldan pa skye'i thams cad du ni ma yin pa de bzhin du gnas skabs kyi khyad bar gyi rgyu mtshan can du gyur pa rna cha can zhes bya ba'i blo 'di yin
analyzed: ji ltar nag pa dang rna cha dag gi gnas skabs kyi khyad par thob pa ni ldan pa skye'i thams cad du ni ma yin pa de bzhin du gnas skabs kyi khyad bar gyi rgyu mtshan can du gyur pa rna cha can zhes bya ba'i blo 'di yin
translated: Just as the difference in the state of the black cow and the ear-ringed one is the arising of possession and not in all cases, so too, the cognition called ‚Äúear-ringed one‚Äù is the reason for the difference in state.

original: na ci'i phyir thams cad du 'gyur /
analyzed: na ci'i phyir thams cad du 'gyur /
translated: Why is it not in all cases?

original: nag ba dang rna cha gang dag la gnas skabs kyi khyad par skyes pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: nag ba dang rna cha gang dag la gnas skabs kyi khyad par skyes pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those black cows and ear-ringed ones in whom the difference in state arises are called that.

original: gang yang / gzhan du mthong ba'i dngos po ni //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la /
analyzed: gang yang / gzhan du mthong ba'i dngos po ni // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la /
translated: As for the passage beginning ‚ÄúThe thing seen in one way,‚Äù

original: de 'dra ba'i gnas skabs khyad par de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i gnas skabs khyad par de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the response is ‚ÄúThat difference in state is like that.‚Äù

original: gnas skabs kyi khyad par gang zhig blo 'di'i rgyu mtshan du brjod pa /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi khyad par gang zhig blo 'di'i rgyu mtshan du brjod pa /
translated: Any specific state that is expressed as the reason for this cognition

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa de gnas skabs gzhan du ma dmigs par dgag pa sgrub par byed kyi /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa de gnas skabs gzhan du ma dmigs par dgag pa sgrub par byed kyi /
translated: is refuted when it is not observed in another state.

original: khyed cag gis kun du brtags pa'i ldan pa de /
analyzed: khyed cag gis kun du brtags pa'i ldan pa de /
translated: But the possession that you imagine

original: ldan pa can gyi dngos po las dben pa gang du yang blo la mi snang ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ldan pa can gyi dngos po las dben pa gang du yang blo la mi snang ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: is not seen in the mind anywhere apart from the thing that possesses it.

original: de lta bas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason is not unestablished.

original: gal te 'di snyam du kho bo cag la ldan pa la sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med na khyed cag la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma ci zhig yod snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du kho bo cag la ldan pa la sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med na khyed cag la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma ci zhig yod snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúIf there is no valid cognition that establishes possession for us, what valid cognition is there that refutes it for you?‚Äù

original: ldan pa'i dngos po blo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ldan pa'i dngos po blo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe thing called possession is not observed in the mind.‚Äù

original: sbyor ba ni gang ldan pa'i blo gang yin pa de ni khyed cag gis kun du brtags pa'i ldan pa'i gzhi med par dngos bo'i khyad par tsam las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang ldan pa'i blo gang yin pa de ni khyed cag gis kun du brtags pa'i ldan pa'i gzhi med par dngos bo'i khyad par tsam las byung ba yin te /
translated: The application is this: that cognition which is associated is produced from the mere particular of the entity without the basis of association imagined by you.

original: khang bzangs la sogs pa'i ldan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: khang bzangs la sogs pa'i ldan pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the association of a mansion, etc.

original: nag pa rna cha can zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang ldan pa'i blo nyid yin no zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: nag pa rna cha can zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang ldan pa'i blo nyid yin no zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The cognition of association in ‚Äúblack-earringed‚Äù is also just a cognition of association. This is a natural inference.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na dngos po du ma nye ba na skye ba de ni khyed cag gis kun du brtags pa'i ldan pa dang bral ba dngos po du ma ldan pa tsam las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na dngos po du ma nye ba na skye ba de ni khyed cag gis kun du brtags pa'i ldan pa dang bral ba dngos po du ma ldan pa tsam las byung ba yin te /
translated: Or, in another way, the arising of the cognition of association when many entities are present is produced from the mere association of many entities without the association imagined by you.

original: so sor nges pa'i gnas skabs rnal ma du ma'i yul can bzhin no //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i gnas skabs rnal ma du ma'i yul can bzhin no //
translated: It is like the cognition of the many particular states.

original: ldan pa'i blo 'di yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: ldan pa'i blo 'di yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This cognition of association is also like that. This is a natural inference.

original: ldan pa'i blo zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ldan pa'i blo zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The cognition of association means the cognition of association.

original: tshad ma gnyis po 'di nyid rnam par dbye ba dgag pa la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: tshad ma gnyis po 'di nyid rnam par dbye ba dgag pa la brjod par bya ste /
translated: They are classified as two because they are the cognition of a thing that is differentiated or not differentiated,

original: rnam par dbye ba'i blo yin pa'i phyir ram dngos po du ma nye ba la rag las te /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba'i blo yin pa'i phyir ram dngos po du ma nye ba la rag las te /
translated: because they are dependent on the presence of many things,

original: byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byung ba'i phyir /
translated: or because they arise from the presence of many things.

original: gzhan gyis mngon bar 'dod pa'i rnam par dbye ba dang bral ba'i dngos po'i khyad par tsam rgyu mtshan can yin te /üîΩdper na lug la sogs pa la rnam par dbye ba'i blo'am /
analyzed: gzhan gyis mngon bar 'dod pa'i rnam par dbye ba dang bral ba'i dngos po'i khyad par tsam rgyu mtshan can yin te / dper na lug la sogs pa la rnam par dbye ba'i blo'am /
translated: They are the cognition of a thing that is differentiated by others, or they are the cognition of a thing that is not differentiated by others, or they are the cognition of a thing that is differentiated by itself.üîΩThey are the cognition of a thing that is differentiated by the mind, or they are the cognition of a thing that is differentiated by the body, or they are the cognition of a thing that is differentiated by both.

original: thag shin tu ring ba na gnas pa'i khyim gnyis kyi yul can nam /üîΩ'bigs @282a * //
analyzed: thag shin tu ring ba na gnas pa'i khyim gnyis kyi yul can nam / 'bigs @282a * //
translated: They are the cognition of a thing that is differentiated by the mind, or they are the cognition of a thing that is differentiated by the body, or they are the cognition of a thing that is differentiated by both.üîΩThey are the cognition of a thing that is differentiated by the mind, or they are the cognition of a thing that is differentiated by the body, or they are the cognition of a thing that is differentiated by both.

original: byed dang gangs can gyi blo bzhin no zhes bya ba dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i blo yin no zhes bya ba ni ci rigs pa'i don to //
analyzed: byed dang gangs can gyi blo bzhin no zhes bya ba dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i blo yin no zhes bya ba ni ci rigs pa'i don to //
translated: They are the cognition of a thing that is differentiated by the mind, or they are the cognition of a thing that is differentiated by the body, or they are the cognition of a thing that is differentiated by both.üîΩThey are the cognition of a thing that is differentiated by the mind, or they are the cognition of a thing that is differentiated by the body, or they are the cognition of a thing that is differentiated by both.üîΩThey are the cognition of a thing that is differentiated by the mind, or they are the cognition of a thing that is differentiated by the body, or they are the cognition of a thing that is differentiated by both.

original: ci ste gang gis gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa'i dogs pa ldog par 'gyur ba 'di la bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la gtan tshigs gnod pa can gyi tshad ma ci yod ce na /
analyzed: ci ste gang gis gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa'i dogs pa ldog par 'gyur ba 'di la bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la gtan tshigs gnod pa can gyi tshad ma ci yod ce na /
translated: But if one asks, ‚ÄúWhat is the valid cognition that refutes the reason in the opposite of the probandum?‚Äù

original: gcig ni du ma la 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gcig ni du ma la 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: [The response is:] ‚ÄúOne, the application of the one to the many, etc.‚ÄùüîΩJust as it is not tenable for the one to apply to the many, so too it is not tenable for the world to be essentially one, etc. Since this has been extensively explained in the refutation of the whole, here we will not elaborate further.üîΩThe refutation of difference and non-differenceüîΩThe refutation of the thesis of differenceüîΩThe refutation of the thesis of non-difference

original: ji ltar gcig du ma la 'jug pa mi rigs pa de ltar de gcig la 'jig rten ngo bos zhes bya ba la sogs pas yan lag can dgag par rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir yang 'dir rgya mi bskyed do //üîΩgzhan nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa dag nyid sun 'byung bar bshad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar gcig du ma la 'jug pa mi rigs pa de ltar de gcig la 'jig rten ngo bos zhes bya ba la sogs pas yan lag can dgag par rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir yang 'dir rgya mi bskyed do // gzhan nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa dag nyid sun 'byung bar bshad pa /
translated: The refutation of the thesis of both difference and non-differenceüîΩThe refutation of the thesis of neither difference nor non-differenceüîΩThe refutation of the thesis of the inexpressibleüîΩThe refutation of the thesis of both assertion and non-assertionüîΩThe refutation of the thesis of neither assertion nor non-assertionüîΩThe refutation of the thesis of the existent, the nonexistent, and both

original: gzhan dang gzhan min brjod la sogs //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan min brjod la sogs // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The refutation of the thesis of the existent, the nonexistent, and bothüîΩThe refutation of the thesis of the existent, the nonexistent, and bothüîΩThe refutation of the thesis of the existent, the nonexistent, and bothüîΩThe refutation of the thesis of the existent, the nonexistent, and bothüîΩThe refutation of the thesis of the existent, the nonexistent, and bothüîΩThe refutation of the thesis of the existent, the nonexistent, and bothüîΩThe refutation of the thesis of the existent, the nonexistent, and bothüîΩThe refutation of the thesis of the existent, the nonexistent, and bothüîΩThe refutation of the thesis of the existent, the nonexistent, and bothüîΩThe refutation of the thesis of the existent, the nonexistent, and bothüîΩThe refutation of the thesis of the existent, the nonexistent, and bothüîΩThe refutation of the thesis of the existent, the nonexistent, and bothüîΩThe refutation of the thesis of the existent, the nonexistent, and bothüîΩThe refutation of the thesis of the existent, the nonexistent, and bothüîΩThe refutation of the thesis of the existent, the nonexistent, and bothüîΩThe refutation of the thesis of the existent, the nonexistent, and bothüîΩThe refutation of the thesis of the existent, the nonexistent, and bothüîΩThe refutation of the thesis of the existent, the nonexistent, and both

original: gang las 'di ni gzhan no //
analyzed: gang las 'di ni gzhan no //
translated: The refutation of the thesis of the existent,

original: 'di ni gzhan ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i brjod pa dang rtogs pa dag tu 'gyur ba gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa de'i rgyu mtshan ni go rims bzhin du gzhan nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid yin par grub po //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i brjod pa dang rtogs pa dag tu 'gyur ba gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa de'i rgyu mtshan ni go rims bzhin du gzhan nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid yin par grub po //
translated: The reason for the expression and the understanding ‚ÄúThis is not different‚Äù is, respectively, difference and non-difference.

original: sogs pa'i sgras rtogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras rtogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the understanding.

original: sbyor ba ni gang 'di gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa'i blo de ni bum pa las tha dad pa'i don gzhan du gyur pa'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang 'di gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa'i blo de ni bum pa las tha dad pa'i don gzhan du gyur pa'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: The cognition of difference and non-difference with regard to a pot is not based on a different object that is separate from the pot,

original: de'i shes pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa'i blo bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i shes pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa'i blo bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it is not in accordance with the cognition of that, like the cognition of pleasure, etc.

original: 'di ltar phyogs gcig na gnas pa'i gang bu dag la gzhan dang gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba'i blo 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyogs gcig na gnas pa'i gang bu dag la gzhan dang gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba'i blo 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the cognition of difference and non-difference occurs with regard to pots that are located in different places.

original: re zhig 'di phyogs kyi rgyu mtshan can ma yin la /
analyzed: re zhig 'di phyogs kyi rgyu mtshan can ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is not based on a spatial difference.

original: dus kyi rgyu mtshan can ma yin te /
analyzed: dus kyi rgyu mtshan can ma yin te /
translated: It is not based on a temporal difference,üîΩbecause the cognition of difference and non-difference occurs with regard to a pot that is located in one place at two different times.

original: da ltar ba'i dus gcig la da ltar bar gnas pa phyogs dang yul ma nges pa dang ldan pa'i gzhon nu dang gnas brtan dag la rnam par dbye nas gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa'i blo 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: da ltar ba'i dus gcig la da ltar bar gnas pa phyogs dang yul ma nges pa dang ldan pa'i gzhon nu dang gnas brtan dag la rnam par dbye nas gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa'i blo 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the cognition of difference and non-difference occurs in relation to the youth and the elder who are endowed with the present, which is located in the present, but whose direction and place are not ascertained.

original: de khyad par med na yang khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de khyad par med na yang khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: For, even though there is no difference in the present, there is a difference in the youth and the elder.

original: blo 'di'i rgyu mtshan gzhan brjod par yang mi nus te /
analyzed: blo 'di'i rgyu mtshan gzhan brjod par yang mi nus te /
translated: And the reason for this cognition cannot be stated as anything else.

original: de lta bas na 'di'i rgyu mtshan gang yin bde ni gzhan nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di'i rgyu mtshan gang yin bde ni gzhan nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the reason for this is difference and non-difference.

original: phyogs dus de yi rgyu mtshan min //
analyzed: phyogs dus de yi rgyu mtshan min //
translated: Direction and time are not its reason.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang dus kyis phyogs dang ldan pa'i nye ba dang bskal pa'i dngos po la rgyu mtshan can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang dus kyis phyogs dang ldan pa'i nye ba dang bskal pa'i dngos po la rgyu mtshan can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that direction and time are not the reason for the near and distant things that possess direction.

original: phyogs dang dus kyi sgra dag gis btags nas phyogs dang dus kyi yul phyogs dang ldan pa dag bstan to //
analyzed: phyogs dang dus kyi sgra dag gis btags nas phyogs dang dus kyi yul phyogs dang ldan pa dag bstan to //
translated: The terms ‚Äúdirection‚Äù and ‚Äútime‚Äù are imputed to the objects of direction and time that possess direction and time.

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyis gzhan nyid dang gzhan @282b ma yin pa nyid rnam ba 'di nyis kyang phyogs dang dus kyis byas pa yin no zhes brjod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyis gzhan nyid dang gzhan @282b ma yin pa nyid rnam ba 'di nyis kyang phyogs dang dus kyis byas pa yin no zhes brjod de /
translated: Thus, otherness and non-otherness are also said to be created by direction and time.

original: de la phyogs kyis byas pa'i skye bo ni 'di lta bu yin te /
analyzed: de la phyogs kyis byas pa'i skye bo ni 'di lta bu yin te /
translated: In this regard, the person created by direction is as follows:

original: phyogs gcig na gnas pa'i gang bu dag la lta ba po gcig nye ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: phyogs gcig na gnas pa'i gang bu dag la lta ba po gcig nye ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: In relation to a single person who is situated in one place, a single observer, in dependence on his proximity,

original: 'di ni de las bskal pa yin no zhes gzhan nyid la mi brten pa'i blo skye la /
analyzed: 'di ni de las bskal pa yin no zhes gzhan nyid la mi brten pa'i blo skye la /
translated: thinks, ‚ÄúThis one is distant from that one,‚Äù and a cognition that does not depend on otherness arises.üîΩTherefore, in dependence on that, the cognition arises that the one part of the direction that possesses the other part is other than it.

original: de'i phyir de la ltos nas phyogs kyi phyogs gcig gzhan dang ldan pa las gzhan nyid skye ba dang / bskal ba'i dbang du byas nas 'di ni 'di las nye ba yin no zhes gzhan ma yin pa nyid la dmigs pa'i blo skye sta /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la ltos nas phyogs kyi phyogs gcig gzhan dang ldan pa las gzhan nyid skye ba dang / bskal ba'i dbang du byas nas 'di ni 'di las nye ba yin no zhes gzhan ma yin pa nyid la dmigs pa'i blo skye sta /
translated: In dependence on distance, the cognition arises that thinks, ‚ÄúThis one is near to that one,‚Äù and a cognition that observes non-otherness arises.

original: de la ltos nas phyogs kyi phyogs gcig gzhan dang ldan ba las gzhan ma yin pa nyid skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de la ltos nas phyogs kyi phyogs gcig gzhan dang ldan ba las gzhan ma yin pa nyid skye ba yin no //
translated: In relation to that, the arising of the one part of the direction that is different from the other part is the arising of the direction.

original: dus kyis byas pa'i skye ba'i rim pa yin te /
analyzed: dus kyis byas pa'i skye ba'i rim pa yin te /
translated: The arising of the direction is in terms of time.

original: 'di ltar da ltar ba'i dus kyi dang yul ma nges pa phyogs dang ldan pa'i gzhon nu dang / gnas brtan dag gi nang nas gang zhig skra dkar dang gnyer ma dang smar spyi cer la sogs pas nyi ma shar ba dang nub pa mang ba nyid rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar da ltar ba'i dus kyi dang yul ma nges pa phyogs dang ldan pa'i gzhon nu dang / gnas brtan dag gi nang nas gang zhig skra dkar dang gnyer ma dang smar spyi cer la sogs pas nyi ma shar ba dang nub pa mang ba nyid rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: Thus, in the present time, in the country, in the direction that is not specified, among the young and the elders, one infers the many sunrises and sunsets by the white hair, wrinkles, and gray beard, etc.

original: de la lta ba po gcig la gzhon nu'i dbang du byas nas bskal pa'i blo skye ste /
analyzed: de la lta ba po gcig la gzhon nu'i dbang du byas nas bskal pa'i blo skye ste /
translated: In relation to that, in regard to the young, the cognition of the eon arises for the one seer.

original: de la ltos nas dus kyi phyogs gcig gzhan dang ldan pas gzhan nyid skye ba dang / gnas brtan gyi dbang du byas nas kyang gang zhig spyi cer ma yin pa la sogs pas nyi ma 'char ba dang nub pa dag nyung ba nyid rjes su dpag pa de las gzhon nu nye ba'i blo skye ste de la ltos nas dus kyi phyogs gcig gzhan
analyzed: de la ltos nas dus kyi phyogs gcig gzhan dang ldan pas gzhan nyid skye ba dang / gnas brtan gyi dbang du byas nas kyang gang zhig spyi cer ma yin pa la sogs pas nyi ma 'char ba dang nub pa dag nyung ba nyid rjes su dpag pa de las gzhon nu nye ba'i blo skye ste de la ltos nas dus kyi phyogs gcig gzhan
translated: and in relation to that, the otherness of the one part of time is produced by the possession of the other.

original: dang ldan pas gzhan ma yin ba nyid skye'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang ldan pas gzhan ma yin ba nyid skye'o zhes bya'o //
translated: And in relation to the elder, the youth‚Äôs cognition of the nearness of the sun‚Äôs rising and setting is produced by the inference of their brevity, and in relation to that, the non-otherness of the one part of time is produced by the possession of the other.üîΩThis proof of otherness and non-otherness is inconclusive, because the reason applies to the opposite of the probandum.

original: gzhan nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid sgrub par byed pa 'di ni ma nges pa yin te bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la yang gtan tshigs 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid sgrub par byed pa 'di ni ma nges pa yin te bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la yang gtan tshigs 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes ston pa ni /
translated: The following is stated to show this:

original: ji ltar sngon po la sogs gzugs //
analyzed: ji ltar sngon po la sogs gzugs //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as with the form of blue, etc.,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i //
translated: and so on.

original: 'byung ba ni skye ba ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba ni skye ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúArising‚Äù is birth.

original: de dang lhan cig gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig gnas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTogether with that‚Äù means ‚Äúexisting together with that.‚Äù

original: zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: This is how the words are to be connected.

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the teaching:

original: dper na sngon po la sogs pa dag la rim gyis skye ba'i phyir dus kyi khyad par dang rim gyis gnas pas /
analyzed: dper na sngon po la sogs pa dag la rim gyis skye ba'i phyir dus kyi khyad par dang rim gyis gnas pas /
translated: arising in sequence, and because of the difference in place, such as blue, etc.,üîΩexisting in sequence, and because of the difference in quality, such as blue, etc.,

original: phyogs kyi khyad par yon tan rnams la yon tan med pa'i phyir gzhan nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi yon tan med na yang sngon po gzhan ni sngon po gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa bstan pa
analyzed: phyogs kyi khyad par yon tan rnams la yon tan med pa'i phyir gzhan nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi yon tan med na yang sngon po gzhan ni sngon po gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa bstan pa
translated: not having the quality of being a quality, even though there is no quality of the characteristic of being different or not different, it is taught that one blue is not another blue, and one is not not one.üîΩIn the same way, why not accept that a pot, etc.,

original: yin no // de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pas yang ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
analyzed: yin no // de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pas yang ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
translated: is not different from a cloth, etc.?

original: 'dis ni 'di bstan pa yin te /üîΩgal te 'di la don gzhan du gyur pa'i rgyu @283a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di bstan pa yin te / gal te 'di la don gzhan du gyur pa'i rgyu @283a * //
translated: This is what is taught by this:

original: mtshan nyid tsam sgrub par 'dod na de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid tsam sgrub par 'dod na de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin te /
translated: If one wishes to prove that this is merely a characteristic that is different from the object, then at that time the reason is indeterminate,

original: de ni bsgrub par byas pa las bzlog pa la yang 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bsgrub par byas pa las bzlog pa la yang 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it engages in the opposite of what is to be proven.

original: ci ste rtag par gyur pa'i dus dang phyogs kyi dngos po'i rgyu can gyi khyad par gang yin pa de blo'i rgyu mtshan du bsgrub bar 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste rtag par gyur pa'i dus dang phyogs kyi dngos po'i rgyu can gyi khyad par gang yin pa de blo'i rgyu mtshan du bsgrub bar 'dod na /
translated: But if you maintain that the difference that is the cause of the thing at a particular time and place is the reason for the cognition,

original: de'i tshe dpe med la dam bca' ba yang rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe dpe med la dam bca' ba yang rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yin no //
translated: then even the thesis that there is no example is undermined by inference.

original: 'di ltar brjod bar nus te /
analyzed: 'di ltar brjod bar nus te /
translated: This is how it can be said:

original: gang gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa'i blo yin pa de ni gzhan gyis brtags pa'i yon tan dang bral ba'i don tsam gyis byas pa'i rim gyis skye bar gnas pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin te /üîΩgzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa'i blo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa'i blo yin pa de ni gzhan gyis brtags pa'i yon tan dang bral ba'i don tsam gyis byas pa'i rim gyis skye bar gnas pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin te / gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa'i blo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: That which is the cognition of sameness and difference is the reason for the arising of the mere object that is devoid of the qualities imagined by others, because it is a gradual arising, and because it is a reason for the abiding of the object.üîΩFor example, the cognition of sameness and difference is the reason for the arising of the mere object that is devoid of the qualities imagined by others, because it is a gradual arising, and because it is a reason for the abiding of the object.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa'i blo bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa'i blo bzhin no //
translated: For example, the cognition of sameness and difference with regard to form, etc.

original: bum pa la sogs pa la yang gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa'i blo 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa la yang gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa'i blo 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is a natural inference.

original: gal te sngon po la sogs pa rnams la don gcig la 'du bas gzhan nyid dang gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i blo 'di ni nye bar btags pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te sngon po la sogs pa rnams la don gcig la 'du bas gzhan nyid dang gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i blo 'di ni nye bar btags pa yin te /
translated: If you say that the cognition of difference and non-difference with respect to blue, etc. is a mere designation because of the aggregation of many objects,

original: des na gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
translated: then the reason is not established.

original: sngon po la sogs pa la yang brgyud nas gzhan nyid la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yod par khas blangs pa'i phyir dpe la bsgrub par bya ba ma tshang ba yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa la yang brgyud nas gzhan nyid la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yod par khas blangs pa'i phyir dpe la bsgrub par bya ba ma tshang ba yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the example is incomplete because the reason of difference, etc. is accepted to exist indirectly in blue, etc., that is not so.

original: blo 'khrul ba med pa'i phyir nye bar btags pa nyid du mi rigs so zhes 'di ni bsal zin to //
analyzed: blo 'khrul ba med pa'i phyir nye bar btags pa nyid du mi rigs so zhes 'di ni bsal zin to //
translated: Because the cognition is non-erroneous, it is not reasonable to designate it as a mere designation. This has already been refuted.

original: rang gi rten la yang de dag dmigs pa med pa'i phyir de'i stobs kyis shes pa rigs pa ma yin na /
analyzed: rang gi rten la yang de dag dmigs pa med pa'i phyir de'i stobs kyis shes pa rigs pa ma yin na /
translated: Because they are not observed in their own basis, it is unreasonable that cognition arises by their power.

original: de'i phyir gang las gzugs la sogs pa la de'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang las gzugs la sogs pa la de'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could they be the reason for form, etc.?

original: dus snga ma dang phyi mar 'byung ba'i bde ba la sogs pa dag la yang ci zhig brtag ste /
analyzed: dus snga ma dang phyi mar 'byung ba'i bde ba la sogs pa dag la yang ci zhig brtag ste /
translated: What need is there to investigate the pleasure, etc. that arise in the past and future?

original: de la ni don gcig la 'du ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ni don gcig la 'du ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But in that case, there is no unity of object.

original: gzhan yang dus dang phyogs dag sngar bkag pa nyid kyis med pa'i phyir de'i rgyu can gyi gzhan nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid dag kyang med pa'i phyir gang gis gtan tshigs ma nges par 'gyur ba gang las de'i rgyu mtshan can nyid du dgos /
analyzed: gzhan yang dus dang phyogs dag sngar bkag pa nyid kyis med pa'i phyir de'i rgyu can gyi gzhan nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid dag kyang med pa'i phyir gang gis gtan tshigs ma nges par 'gyur ba gang las de'i rgyu mtshan can nyid du dgos /
translated: Moreover, since time and spatial location have already been refuted, they do not exist. Since they are the causes of difference and non-difference, they do not exist. Therefore, how could the reason be indeterminate? From what is it the reason?

original: gang gis ltos pa'i blo dang lhan cig pa'i de dang ldan pa las gzhan nyid la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba phyogs dang dus dag ni phyogs gcig yang dag par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis ltos pa'i blo dang lhan cig pa'i de dang ldan pa las gzhan nyid la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba phyogs dang dus dag ni phyogs gcig yang dag par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Since spatial location and time do not exist as real unities, difference and so on arise in dependence on the cognition that depends on them.

original: de dag ni gcig gi bdag nyid kyis cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni gcig gi bdag nyid kyis cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not exist as real unities because they are partless, that is, they are not divisible into parts.

original: yan lag tha dad pa nye bar btags pa ni don byed pa'i rjes su byed par yang rigs @283b pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yan lag tha dad pa nye bar btags pa ni don byed pa'i rjes su byed par yang rigs @283b pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not logical that different parts are imputed in dependence on the performance of functions.

original: de ni dngos po'i rang bzhin dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir dang / nye bar btags pa de yang brdzun pa yin pas de'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni dngos po'i rang bzhin dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir dang / nye bar btags pa de yang brdzun pa yin pas de'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Because it is related to the nature of the thing, and because that which is designated is false, therefore it is not indeterminate.

original: gzhan gyi gtan tshigs kyang snga ma bzhin du ma grub par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gtan tshigs kyang snga ma bzhin du ma grub par brjod par bya'o //
translated: And the reason of the opponent should be stated as unestablished, as before.

original: grangs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan dag ni skabs su bab pa'i grangs la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi dngos po sgrub par byed pa de dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
analyzed: grangs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan dag ni skabs su bab pa'i grangs la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi dngos po sgrub par byed pa de dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
translated: Others, such as ‚Äúhaving number,‚Äù etc., are anticipatory objections to the proof of the entities of the qualities of number, etc., which are relevant here.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i grangs la sogs pa'i yon tan 'di thams cad ni rdzas las tha mi dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i grangs la sogs pa'i yon tan 'di thams cad ni rdzas las tha mi dad pa ma yin te /
translated: All of these qualities of number, etc., as they have been explained, are not undifferentiated from substance,

original: de dag ni rdzas de rnams par gcod pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rdzas de rnams par gcod pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the cause of the differentiation of those substances.

original: gang zhig gang gzhan las rnam par gcod par byed pa de dag ni de las tha mi dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gzhan las rnam par gcod par byed pa de dag ni de las tha mi dad pa ma yin te /
translated: That which differentiates something from another is not undifferentiated from it,

original: lhas byin gyi dbyig pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: lhas byin gyi dbyig pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like Devadatta‚Äôs staff, etc.

original: de'i phyir 'di la rdzas las tha mi dad pa bkag pa tsam sgrub na dam bca' ba grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon yod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la rdzas las tha mi dad pa bkag pa tsam sgrub na dam bca' ba grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon yod de /
translated: Therefore, if you prove mere negation of non-difference from substance, you have the fault of proving what is already established.

original: kun rdzob tu yod pa thams cad ni dngos po med pa nyid kyis de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod pa thams cad ni dngos po med pa nyid kyis de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you accept that all existents in the conventional are not expressible as either the same as or different from their non-entities.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dir rna ma phug pa'i lan dogs par byed de /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dir rna ma phug pa'i lan dogs par byed de /
translated: Here, in response to the question, ‚ÄúOr is it . . . ,‚Äù and so on, the opponent‚Äôs position is anticipated:

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He says:

original: tshogs pa dang rgyun dang gnas skabs kyi khyad par rnams ni /
analyzed: tshogs pa dang rgyun dang gnas skabs kyi khyad par rnams ni /
translated: The differences of collection, continuum, and state

original: de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: are not inexpressible as either the same as or different from each other.

original: so sor nges pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they possess qualities that are individually ascertained,

original: gzugs dang ro la sogs pa bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang ro la sogs pa bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: like form, taste, and so on.

original: de ni de kho na nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: de ni de kho na nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: To this, the response is, ‚ÄúIf they are . . . ,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te don dam pa'i chos dang ldan pa nyid gtan tshigs su 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te don dam pa'i chos dang ldan pa nyid gtan tshigs su 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that possession of ultimate qualities is the reason,

original: de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub ste /
translated: At that time, the reason is not established.üîΩFor the Buddha, the existence of the continuum and so on in the conventional sense is not established as having ultimate definitive meaning.üîΩOr, if it is a reason in general,

original: sangs rgyas ba la ni rgyun la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yod pa rnams la don dam par nges pa'i don dang ldan pa nyid du ma grub po //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ba la ni rgyun la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yod pa rnams la don dam par nges pa'i don dang ldan pa nyid du ma grub po //
translated: then it is an uncertain reason, because it is a reason that is not established in the subject, because it is a reason that is not established in the similar class, and because it is a reason that is not established.üîΩWhen it is said in this way,üîΩit is said that the reason is not established in the subject, because it is a reason that is not established in the similar class, and because it is a reason that is not established.

original: 'on te spyir gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: 'on te spyir gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: When it is said in this way,üîΩit is said that the reason is not established in the subject, because it is a reason that is not established in the similar class, and because it is a reason that is not established.üîΩWhen it is said in this way,üîΩit is said that the reason is not established in the subject, because it is a reason that is not established in the similar class, and because it is a reason that is not established.üîΩWhen it is said in this way,

original: de ni nam mkha'i pad ma la sogs pa dag la yang med pa nyid dang / lus can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir la sogs pa brtags pa'i nges pa'i chos yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni nam mkha'i pad ma la sogs pa dag la yang med pa nyid dang / lus can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir la sogs pa brtags pa'i nges pa'i chos yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: it is said that the reason is not established in the subject, because it is a reason that is not established in the similar class, and because it is a reason that is not established.

original: de skad nyid du brjod pa na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de skad nyid du brjod pa na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When it is said in this way,üîΩit is said that the reason is not established in the subject, because it is a reason that is not established in the similar class, and because it is a reason that is not established.üîΩWhen it is said in this way,

original: spyir brtags pas nye bar brjod pa med pa dang ldan pa'i chos ma spangs par brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: spyir brtags pas nye bar brjod pa med pa dang ldan pa'i chos ma spangs par brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: it is said that the reason is not established in the subject, because it is a reason that is not established in the similar class, and because it is a reason that is not established.

original: 'di'i gtan tshigs 'di ni ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i gtan tshigs 'di ni ma nges pa yin te /
translated: When it is said in this way,üîΩit is said that the reason is not established in the subject, because it is a reason that is not established in the similar class, and because it is a reason that is not established.üîΩWhen it is said in this way,üîΩit is said that the reason is not established in the subject, because it is a reason that is not established in the similar class, and because it is a reason that is not established.üîΩWhen it is said in this way,

original: gang gi phyir tha dad pa ste gzhan nyid dang / tha dad med @284a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha dad pa ste gzhan nyid dang / tha dad med @284a * //
translated: it is said that the reason is not established in the subject, because it is a reason that is not established in the similar

original: pa ste gzhan ma yin pa nyid 'di dag ni dngos po kho na la rnam par gnas kyi gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: pa ste gzhan ma yin pa nyid 'di dag ni dngos po kho na la rnam par gnas kyi gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: These non-different things exist only in terms of entities, not in terms of other things.

original: rgyun la sogs pa yang btags par yod pa nyid kyis dngos por yod pa ma yin na de'i phyir ji ltar 'di dag dngos po las tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyun la sogs pa yang btags par yod pa nyid kyis dngos por yod pa ma yin na de'i phyir ji ltar 'di dag dngos po las tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa grub par 'gyur /
translated: Since continuums, etc. are also imputedly existent, they do not exist as entities. Therefore, how could they be established as either different or non-different from entities?

original: de'i phyir de ltar sbyor ba dang po la grangs la sogs pa rdzas las tha mi dad pa bkag pa tsam sgrub na grub pa la sgrub po zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar sbyor ba dang po la grangs la sogs pa rdzas las tha mi dad pa bkag pa tsam sgrub na grub pa la sgrub po zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when the first syllogism merely proves that number, etc. are not different in substance from form, it is proving what is already established.

original: yang ci ste tha mi dad pa bkag pa tsam sgrub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang ci ste tha mi dad pa bkag pa tsam sgrub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But if it is not merely the refutation of non-difference that is proven,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then what is it?

original: dgag pa nyid kyis sgrub ba go bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dgag pa nyid kyis sgrub ba go bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the proof is understood through the negation itself,

original: dgag pa gnyis kyis rdzas las tha dad pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: dgag pa gnyis kyis rdzas las tha dad pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no snyam na /
translated: the second negation proves that number, etc. are different from form.

original: de 'dir gal te rdzas la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dogs par byas nas /üîΩgrangs la sogs pa ma grub phyir //
analyzed: de 'dir gal te rdzas la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dogs par byas nas / grangs la sogs pa ma grub phyir //
translated: Here, if you think that substance and so on are different,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gegs par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gegs par byed do //
translated: he refutes that by saying, ‚ÄúBecause number and so on are not established.‚Äù

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rdzas las tha dad med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rdzas las tha dad med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: ‚Äú As such‚Äù means that they are not non-different.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: gzhan nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to ;üîΩ/ grangs la sogs pa'i rten ma grub pa de nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to ; / grangs la sogs pa'i rten ma grub pa de nyid ston pa ni /
translated: They are different.

original: bsdu ba sogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba sogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: To show that the basis of number and so on is not established, he says, ‚ÄúIn the case of collection and so on.‚Äù

original: de ltar brjod pa yin zhes bya ba ni gcig go gnyis dag go mang po rnams so zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa yin zhes bya ba ni gcig go gnyis dag go mang po rnams so zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú As such‚Äù means ‚Äúone,‚Äù ‚Äútwo,‚Äù ‚Äúmany,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di snyam du rdzas kyi bdag nyid du yod pa'i grangs la sogs pa tha dad du bsgrub par bya ba gzhan nyid do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du rdzas kyi bdag nyid du yod pa'i grangs la sogs pa tha dad du bsgrub par bya ba gzhan nyid do snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that number and so on, which exist in the nature of substance, are established as different, as something else,

original: rang gi ngo bo las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúFrom its own nature‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po la rang gi ngo bo las tha dad pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po la rang gi ngo bo las tha dad pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: An entity does not exist separately from its own nature,

original: de rang bzhin med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rang bzhin med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would be essenceless.

original: 'gal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni phan tshun 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: 'gal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni phan tshun 'gal ba ste /
translated: ‚Äú Contradictory‚Äù means mutually exclusive.

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag la ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis cig car gcig la 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag la ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis cig car gcig la 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since difference and non-difference are characterized by mutual exclusion, they are contradictory in one entity.

original: de lta na re zhig gzhan nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i yon tan rnams bkag nas /
analyzed: de lta na re zhig gzhan nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i yon tan rnams bkag nas /
translated: Thus, first, having refuted the ultimate of difference and non-difference,

original: blo la sogs pa 'bad pa'i mthar thug pa rnams ni bdag la brten pa nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: blo la sogs pa 'bad pa'i mthar thug pa rnams ni bdag la brten pa nyid du 'dod de /
translated: the ultimate of effort, such as the intellect, is refuted.

original: de dag kyang bdag bkag pa nyid kyis bkag par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang bdag bkag pa nyid kyis bkag par blta bar bya'o //
translated: They should be seen as refuted by the refutation of the self.

original: 'di dag bdag la brten par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag bdag la brten par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not tenable that they depend on the self,

original: 'di ltar 'di dag gi skye ba'i rgyu nyid kyis bdag la brten par 'gyur ram gnas pa'i rgyu nyid kyis yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag gi skye ba'i rgyu nyid kyis bdag la brten par 'gyur ram gnas pa'i rgyu nyid kyis yin /
translated: because in that case, would they depend on the self by the cause of their arising or by the cause of their enduring?

original: re zhig skye ba'i rgyu'i rgyu nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig skye ba'i rgyu'i rgyu nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not by the cause of the cause of arising,

original: bde ba la sogs pa rgyu mtshang ba med pa nyid @284b kyis thams cad kyi tshe skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rgyu mtshang ba med pa nyid @284b kyis thams cad kyi tshe skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that pleasure, etc. would arise at all times, since the cause is not defective.

original: gzhan gyi bogs dbyung du med pa ni lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa 'ga' yang yed  pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di lan brgyar dpyad zin to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bogs dbyung du med pa ni lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa 'ga' yang yed  pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di lan brgyar dpyad zin to //
translated: And that which cannot be enhanced by another does not depend on a cooperative condition. This has been analyzed a hundred times.

original: rtag pa ni 'bras bu skyed par nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa ni 'bras bu skyed par nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the permanent capable of producing an effect,

original: de ni rim dang cig car dag gis khyab pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de ni rim dang cig car dag gis khyab pa'i phyir la /
translated: because it is pervaded by gradual and instantaneous activity,

original: rtag pa yang rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa 'gal bar bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa yang rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa 'gal bar bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and it has been demonstrated that it is contradictory for the permanent to be functional either gradually or instantaneously.

original: gnas pa'i rgyu nyid kyis kyang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyu nyid kyis kyang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it tenable that it is the cause of endurance,

original: gnas pa ni gnas pa po las tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas pa ni gnas pa po las tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because endurance is not a different entity from the enduring thing.

original: de'i rgyu yin na gnas pa po'i rgyu nyid brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu yin na gnas pa po'i rgyu nyid brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is its cause, it is said to be the cause of the enduring thing.

original: de yang de ma thag tu bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang de ma thag tu bkag pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, this is immediately refuted.

original: gnas pa po de yang yongs su mthar thug pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas pa po de yang yongs su mthar thug pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the enduring thing is an entity that is completely finished,

original: rgyu 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: it has no cause at all.

original: de de la cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de de la cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not perform any function with regard to it.

original: gnas pa las gnas pa tha dad pa yin na yang des cung zad kyang ma byas te /
analyzed: gnas pa las gnas pa tha dad pa yin na yang des cung zad kyang ma byas te /
translated: If enduring is different from the enduring thing, it does not perform any function with regard to it,

original: don gzhan du gyur pa'i gnas pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa'i gnas pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is the cause of enduring that is different from it.

original: / de lta yin dang cung zad kyang mi byed pa ji ltar de'i rten du 'gyur /
analyzed: / de lta yin dang cung zad kyang mi byed pa ji ltar de'i rten du 'gyur /
translated: If that were so, how could it be the basis of that which does not perform any function at all?

original: de dang 'brel pa'i gnas pa'i rgyu yin pas 'di de'i phan 'dogs par byed pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa'i gnas pa'i rgyu yin pas 'di de'i phan 'dogs par byed pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also unreasonable to state that it assists it because it is the cause of enduring that is related to it,

original: de'i 'brel pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgnas pa la rgyu nyid rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'brel pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro // gnas pa la rgyu nyid rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: because its relation to it is not established.üîΩIt is also unreasonable to state that it is the cause of enduring,

original: rtag pa ni gang du yang nus pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: rtag pa ni gang du yang nus pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
translated: because it is untenable that a permanent thing has any ability at all.

original: gzhan yang gnas par bya ba'i dngos po 'di rang nyid bstan pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan yang gnas par bya ba'i dngos po 'di rang nyid bstan pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yin nam /
translated: Moreover, is this thing that is being supported by something else itself the nature of that which is supported?

original: brten pa'i rang bzhin zhig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: brten pa'i rang bzhin zhig tu 'gyur /
translated: Or is it the nature of that which supports?

original: gal te brtan pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo yin na /
analyzed: gal te brtan pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo yin na /
translated: If it is not the nature of that which is supported,

original: de ji ltar gzhan gyis gnas par nus te /
analyzed: de ji ltar gzhan gyis gnas par nus te /
translated: how could it be supported by something else?

original: de'i rang bzhin nyams par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyams par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that its nature would be impaired.

original: ci ste brten pa'i rang bzhin yin na de ltan yang gnas pa po cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: ci ste brten pa'i rang bzhin yin na de ltan yang gnas pa po cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid de /
translated: But if it is the nature of that which is supported, then that which supports it does not perform any function at all,

original: rang nyid brtan pa'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis de rang nyid gnas par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid brtan pa'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis de rang nyid gnas par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established that it is itself supported by virtue of its own nature of being supported.

original: gzhan yang re zhig lus can gyi dngos po gang dag yin pa de dag 'og tu ltung ba'i gegs byed pa nyid kyis brten pa yin na bde ba la sogs pa 'di gang dag yin pa de dag lus can ma yin pa nyid kyis 'og tu 'gro ba
analyzed: gzhan yang re zhig lus can gyi dngos po gang dag yin pa de dag 'og tu ltung ba'i gegs byed pa nyid kyis brten pa yin na bde ba la sogs pa 'di gang dag yin pa de dag lus can ma yin pa nyid kyis 'og tu 'gro ba
translated: Moreover, if those things that are embodied are supported by the prevention of falling, then what are these things, such as pleasure, that are not embodied?

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ci zhig byed pa na de dag gang rten du 'gyur /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ci zhig byed pa na de dag gang rten du 'gyur /
translated: If they do not exist, what do they do? How could they be the basis of anything?

original: yod pa dang med pa ni cha med pa dang de bas nye bar brjod pa med pa nyid kyis rten du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa ni cha med pa dang de bas nye bar brjod pa med pa nyid kyis rten du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Because existence and nonexistence are not tenable as a basis, since they are partless and inexpressible.

original: @285a * // de ltar bde ba la sogs dang gzhan dag kyang ci rigs par rten nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir yon tan zhes bya ba med do snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: @285a * // de ltar bde ba la sogs dang gzhan dag kyang ci rigs par rten nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir yon tan zhes bya ba med do snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Thus, since pleasure and so on and other things are not established as a basis, it is thought that so-called qualities do not exist.

original: gzhan yang gzhan dag gis blo shes pa rang bzhin du khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhan dag gis blo shes pa rang bzhin du khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, others assert that consciousness is the nature of cognition.

original: ji skad du blo dang / dmigs pa dang shes pa zhes bya ba ni don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du blo dang / dmigs pa dang shes pa zhes bya ba ni don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúCognition, object, and consciousness are not different things.‚Äù

original: de yang de lta bu'i ngo bo yin na yang gzhan dag gis rang rig pa'i ngo bor ni mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: de yang de lta bu'i ngo bo yin na yang gzhan dag gis rang rig pa'i ngo bor ni mi 'dod kyi /
translated: Even though it is of such a nature, others do not assert that it is the nature of reflexive awareness.

original: 'on kyang blo gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang blo gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: However, it is to be understood by another cognition.

original: de lta bur gyur pa ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du rang las ma grub pa'i phyir blo nyid du rigs pa ma yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du rang las ma grub pa'i phyir blo nyid du rigs pa ma yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it does not exist by itself, like form and so on, it is not reasonable to say that it is cognition.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pa dang / sdang ba dang / 'bad pa rnams kyang shes pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'dod pa yang tshad ma'i mtshan nyid brtag par 'gegs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pa dang / sdang ba dang / 'bad pa rnams kyang shes pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'dod pa yang tshad ma'i mtshan nyid brtag par 'gegs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, pleasure, pain, desire, hatred, and effort, which are asserted to be by nature not cognition, are refuted in the chapter on the characteristics of valid cognition.üîΩLike heaviness, wetness, and oiliness, they should be refuted.

original: lci ba nyid dang gsher ba nyid dang snum ba la sogs pa bzhin du dgag pa bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba de ltar nges par byas nas 'di dag gi dgag pa ma byas par 'dus byas pa dgag pa ni /
analyzed: lci ba nyid dang gsher ba nyid dang snum ba la sogs pa bzhin du dgag pa bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba de ltar nges par byas nas 'di dag gi dgag pa ma byas par 'dus byas pa dgag pa ni /
translated: Having ascertained it in this way, without refuting them, the refutation of the conditioned is stated:

original: shugs brjod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: shugs brjod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The so-called conditioned and so on.

original: 'dus byas pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The conditioned is threefold:

original: shugs dang / bag chags dang / gnas pa 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: shugs dang / bag chags dang / gnas pa 'jig pa'o //
translated: force, latent tendencies, and the destruction of endurance.

original: de la shugs zhes bya pa ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang yid de lus can gyi rdzas lnga po dag la 'bad pas bcom pa'i khyad par la ltos pa las skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: de la shugs zhes bya pa ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang yid de lus can gyi rdzas lnga po dag la 'bad pas bcom pa'i khyad par la ltos pa las skyes pa yin te /
translated: The so-called impetus is in the five physical substances, earth, water, fire, air, and mind. It is produced from the special destruction by effort.

original: de yang phyogs kyis bya ba nges pa'i rgyun dang reg pa dang ldan pa'i rdzas dang ldan pa dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang phyogs kyis bya ba nges pa'i rgyun dang reg pa dang ldan pa'i rdzas dang ldan pa dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: It is the cause of the special activity in a certain direction of a substance endowed with contact, and it is in opposition to the special activity in the opposite direction.

original: de bzhin du mda' la sogs pa gang gi dbang gis mda' bar du ltung bar mi 'gyur ba 'bad pa'i khyad par gyis skyed pa las kyi khyad par gyi rgyu can yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mda' la sogs pa gang gi dbang gis mda' bar du ltung bar mi 'gyur ba 'bad pa'i khyad par gyis skyed pa las kyi khyad par gyi rgyu can yin no //
translated: Similarly, the special activity of an arrow, etc., is produced by the special effort of the archer, and it is the cause of the special activity of the arrow, etc., which prevents it from falling in between.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni phyogs kyi bya ba nges pa'i 'bras bus rjes su dpag pa yod pa nyid du grub bo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni phyogs kyi bya ba nges pa'i 'bras bus rjes su dpag pa yod pa nyid du grub bo //
translated: Therefore, it is established that it exists, because it is inferred from the effect of the special activity in a certain direction.

original: gyal ga la sogs pa la ni bor bas snang ba las byung ba las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gyal ga la sogs pa la ni bor bas snang ba las byung ba las skyes pa'o //
translated: In the case of a sling, etc., it is produced from the special activity of the hand, because it is seen to arise from the effort.

original: goms pa'i ming can ni bdag gi yon tan shes pa las skyes pa shes pa'i rgyu gang yin pa 'di brjod do //
analyzed: goms pa'i ming can ni bdag gi yon tan shes pa las skyes pa shes pa'i rgyu gang yin pa 'di brjod do //
translated: The cause of the knowledge of the self‚Äôs qualities is called ‚Äúhabit.‚Äù

original: de yang mthong ba dang thos pa dang nyams su myong ba dag la dran pa dang / ngo shes pa'i 'bras bus dpag pas yod pa nyid du sgrub po //
analyzed: de yang mthong ba dang thos pa dang nyams su myong ba dag la dran pa dang / ngo shes pa'i 'bras bus dpag pas yod pa nyid du sgrub po //
translated: And this is established as existing by inference from the effect of memory and recognition in regard to what is seen, heard, and experienced.

original: gnas pa 'jig pa ni lus can gyi rdzas kyi yon tan gang zhig 'bad pas gzhan du byas pa mkhrad @285b ba'i cha shas bkod pa'i khyad par dus gzhan du gnas pa can rang gi rten du snga ma bzhin du ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du 'jig parüîΩbyed pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa 'jig pa ni lus can gyi rdzas kyi yon tan gang zhig 'bad pas gzhan du byas pa mkhrad @285b ba'i cha shas bkod pa'i khyad par dus gzhan du gnas pa can rang gi rten du snga ma bzhin du ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du 'jig par byed pa ste /
translated: The destruction of stability is the quality of a material substance that has a body, which is made different by effort, and which has a special arrangement of parts that lasts for a while, and which is destroyed in the same way that it was established in its own support.

original: dper na ta la'i lo ma la sogs pa dus yun ring mor bltab pa brkyang bas grol ba yang de lta bu kho nar gnas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ta la'i lo ma la sogs pa dus yun ring mor bltab pa brkyang bas grol ba yang de lta bu kho nar gnas pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the leaves of a palm tree, etc., which are folded for a long time, and are then unfolded by stretching them out.

original: gzhu dang yal ga dang rva la sogs pa dang gos la sogs pa thur du bkug pa dag la de'i 'bras bu mngon pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzhu dang yal ga dang rva la sogs pa dang gos la sogs pa thur du bkug pa dag la de'i 'bras bu mngon pa nyid yin no //
translated: The result of that is manifest in such things as a bow, a branch, a horn, and so on, and in such things as cloth that is drawn taut.

original: mtha' dag ces bya ba rnam pa gsum char yang ngo //
analyzed: mtha' dag ces bya ba rnam pa gsum char yang ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúall‚Äù refers to the three kinds of non-existence.

original: de la shugs zhes bya ba ni las kyi rgyun brjod pa'i 'bras bur ma grub ste /
analyzed: de la shugs zhes bya ba ni las kyi rgyun brjod pa'i 'bras bur ma grub ste /
translated: The so-called ‚Äúinherent nature‚Äù is not established as the result of the continuum of action,

original: dngos po'i tshogs mtha' dag la khyab pa'i skad cig ma 'jig pa bsgrub zin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: dngos po'i tshogs mtha' dag la khyab pa'i skad cig ma 'jig pa bsgrub zin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because the destruction of the moment of the collection of all things has already been established.

original: / de lta bas na de ru rang gi ngo bo thob pa las phyis dngos po thams cad med pa'i phyir 'di bya ba gang gi rgyun gyi rgyur 'gyur ba bya ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / de lta bas na de ru rang gi ngo bo thob pa las phyis dngos po thams cad med pa'i phyir 'di bya ba gang gi rgyun gyi rgyur 'gyur ba bya ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since after the attainment of its own nature, all things do not exist, it does not exist as the cause of the continuum of any action.

original: 'on te rang gi nye bar len ba'i yul yongs su spangs nas dngos po rnams yul la khyab par skye ba nyid kyi bya ba'i rgyun 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te rang gi nye bar len ba'i yul yongs su spangs nas dngos po rnams yul la khyab par skye ba nyid kyi bya ba'i rgyun 'dod na /
translated: But if you assert that the continuum of action is the cause of the production of things that are spread out in all directions, after they have abandoned their own appropriated objects,

original: de'i tshe yang ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: then at that time, it is still not established.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rgyun las de ltar skye ba'i dngos po rgyu dang rkyen sngon du 'gro ba nyid rjes su dpog par byed kyi /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rgyun las de ltar skye ba'i dngos po rgyu dang rkyen sngon du 'gro ba nyid rjes su dpog par byed kyi /
translated: From a continuum that has such a nature, one infers that a thing that arises in that way is preceded by causes and conditions.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i 'dus byas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i 'dus byas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the produced thing that is described in this way,

original: de dang lhan cig rjes su 'gro ba gang du yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig rjes su 'gro ba gang du yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not established anywhere that it exists simultaneously with that.

original: gzhan yang gal te rnam pa de lta bu'i 'dus byas pa'i stobs kyis mda' la sogs pa mi ltung bar gyur na de'i tshe de dag nam yang ltung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te rnam pa de lta bu'i 'dus byas pa'i stobs kyis mda' la sogs pa mi ltung bar gyur na de'i tshe de dag nam yang ltung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if the power of a produced thing of that kind prevents an arrow, etc. from falling, then it would never fall,

original: thams cad du ltung ba'i gegs kyi rgyu shugs kyis gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du ltung ba'i gegs kyi rgyu shugs kyis gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause that prevents its fall would remain in force at all times.

original: de lta yin dang khyad par med pa'i nam mkha'i yul du 'phangs pa'i mda' glo bur du ltung bar dmigs pa gang yin de ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta yin dang khyad par med pa'i nam mkha'i yul du 'phangs pa'i mda' glo bur du ltung bar dmigs pa gang yin de ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
translated: If that were the case, then how could it be tenable that an arrow shot into the sky, which is a region that is not distinguished from any other, falls suddenly?

original: lus can rlung la sogs pa dang phrad bas nus pa nyams par byas pa'i phyir shugs zhig pas ltung ba yin no zhes brjod par nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: lus can rlung la sogs pa dang phrad bas nus pa nyams par byas pa'i phyir shugs zhig pas ltung ba yin no zhes brjod par nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It cannot be said that the arrow falls because its momentum is destroyed by contact with the wind, etc.

original: dang po nyid du ltung bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po nyid du ltung bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would fall from the very beginning.

original: de dang 'gal ba'i rlung dang phrad pa ni thams cad du yod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i rlung dang phrad pa ni thams cad du yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: And it is not the case that it does not contact wind that is contrary to it, because it is everywhere.

original: ci ste yang shugs ni nges pa kho nar dang po stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gal na yang rlung dang phrad pa khyad par du bsad nas 'di mda' yul gzhan du khyed par byed pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste yang shugs ni nges pa kho nar dang po stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gal na yang rlung dang phrad pa khyad par du bsad nas 'di mda' yul gzhan du khyed par byed pa yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the momentum is strong at the beginning and so the arrow moves to another place in spite of the wind that is contrary to it,

original: gal te de lta na gang gis yul shin tu thag ring bar yang de khyer bar mi byed pa phyis de stobs chung bar @286a * //
analyzed: gal te de lta na gang gis yul shin tu thag ring bar yang de khyer bar mi byed pa phyis de stobs chung bar @286a * //
translated: then why does it not move to a very distant place? Later it moves less because its momentum is weak.

original: sus byas / thams cad du khyad par med pa'i rlung dang phrad pa dang ldan pa'i nam mkha'i dkyil du 'phangs pa'i mda' yang bar du ltung bar mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: sus byas / thams cad du khyad par med pa'i rlung dang phrad pa dang ldan pa'i nam mkha'i dkyil du 'phangs pa'i mda' yang bar du ltung bar mthong ba yin no //
translated: An arrow shot into the middle of the sky, which is everywhere the same, is seen to fall.

original: phyis shugs gzhan du gyur par yang brjod mi nus te /
analyzed: phyis shugs gzhan du gyur par yang brjod mi nus te /
translated: It cannot be said that later it changes its momentum,

original: gzhan du skye ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du skye ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no cause for its change.

original: mda' la sogs pa de ni thams cad du 'du ba'i rgyun med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: mda' la sogs pa de ni thams cad du 'du ba'i rgyun med pa kho na'o //
translated: That arrow, etc. has no continuous series anywhere.

original: las zhes bya ba'i rgyu phyis khyad par du 'gyur ba yin no zhes brjod par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: las zhes bya ba'i rgyu phyis khyad par du 'gyur ba yin no zhes brjod par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that the cause called karma later changes into something else,
