original: de la yang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩshugs kyis gzhan du gyur na yang snga ma 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir de'i gnas skabs nyid yin pas mda' mi ldud ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro // shugs kyis gzhan du gyur na yang snga ma 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir de'i gnas skabs nyid yin pas mda' mi ldud ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: because the same objection and response would apply to that.üîΩIf it changes its momentum, then because there would be no cause for the destruction of the previous momentum, it would not fall.

original: de'i 'jig pa'i rgyu rlung dang phrad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'jig pa'i rgyu rlung dang phrad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the cause of its destruction is the contact of the arrow with the wind,üîΩbecause the wind is not always the same.

original: dang po nyid du ltung bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: dang po nyid du ltung bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin to //
translated: This is because it would follow that it would fall apart from the very beginning.

original: rlung thams cad du khyad par goms pa zhes bya ba sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rlung thams cad du khyad par goms pa zhes bya ba sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the assertion that ‚Äúall winds are equally habituated,‚Äù

original: goms par brjod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: goms par brjod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: he says, ‚ÄúHabituation is said to be . . .‚Äù

original: gal te dran pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu las phyir goms pa tsam bsgrub na /
analyzed: gal te dran pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu las phyir goms pa tsam bsgrub na /
translated: If you establish mere habituation to the effect of memory and so on,

original: de'i tshe 'grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: then it would be established without being established.

original: 'di ltar sngar nyams su myong bas bsgos pa'i nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i dngos po de dang phrad pa yang khyad par med pa de'i phyir 'di na ni ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sngar nyams su myong bas bsgos pa'i nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i dngos po de dang phrad pa yang khyad par med pa de'i phyir 'di na ni ci yang ma yin no //
translated: In that case, it would be like the previously experienced object that is imbued with the potential characterized by habituation. Since it is not different from that, it is nothing at all.

original: gang la bag chags zhes bya bar grags pa dran pa la sogs pa'i rgyur 'dod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang la bag chags zhes bya bar grags pa dran pa la sogs pa'i rgyur 'dod pa kho na'o //
translated: That which is renowned as ‚Äúhabitual tendencies‚Äù is asserted to be the cause of memory and so on.

original: ci ste bdag gi yon tan gyi rang bzhin gyis dngos po bsgrub par 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste bdag gi yon tan gyi rang bzhin gyis dngos po bsgrub par 'dod na /
translated: But if you assert that it is established by the nature of the qualities of the self,

original: de'i tshe rnam pa de lta bu dang lhan cig gang du yang dran pa la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid dad /
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam pa de lta bu dang lhan cig gang du yang dran pa la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid dad /
translated: At that time, since memory and so on are not established as concomitant with such aspects, the reason is indeterminate.

original: dam bcas pa yang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: dam bcas pa yang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, the thesis contradicts the inference,

original: de'i rten gyi bdag sngar bkag pa nyid kyis med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rten gyi bdag sngar bkag pa nyid kyis med pa'i phyir /
translated: because the self that is the basis of those does not exist, since it has already been refuted.

original: de yang med par grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la brten pa de ni de med pa na gnas pa thob pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang med par grub pa'i phyir ro // sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la brten pa de ni de med pa na gnas pa thob pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is established that it does not exist.

original: rtsig pa la sogs pa med pa la ri mo bzhin no //
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pa med pa la ri mo bzhin no //
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is based on something else does not exist when that does not exist, like a painting that does not exist when a wall does not exist.

original: gzhan gyi lugs kyis 'dus byas pa yang bdag la brten pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lugs kyis 'dus byas pa yang bdag la brten pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The other system is the observation of a contradictory pervasion, since it is said that the produced is based on the self.

original: ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not unestablished,

original: bdag de ni sngar bsal zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag de ni sngar bsal zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that self has already been refuted.

original: de lta bas na 'dus byas ni sems kyi bag chags kyi bdag nyid du rigs kyi bdag gi yon tan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni @286b tshad ma'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dus byas ni sems kyi bag chags kyi bdag nyid du rigs kyi bdag gi yon tan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni @286b tshad ma'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: Thus, conditioned phenomena are the nature of the mind‚Äôs latent tendencies, not the nature of the self‚Äôs qualities. This is the result of valid cognition.

original: gcig ni tshad mas grub pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: gcig ni tshad mas grub pa'i phyir la /
translated: One is established by valid cognition,

original: gzhan ni bzlog pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni bzlog pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: and the other is refuted.

original: gsum pa yang sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gsum pa yang sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
translated: The third is also refuted.üîΩTo show this, he says:

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩ'di ltar 'di dngos po gnas pa gang yin pa 'jig par byed pa res 'ga' 'di rang nyid mi brtan pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'am /
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'di ltar 'di dngos po gnas pa gang yin pa 'jig par byed pa res 'ga' 'di rang nyid mi brtan pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'am /
translated: ‚ÄúDestruction‚Äù and so on.üîΩThus, in this regard, there are two possibilities: the thing that endures is destroyed, and sometimes it is itself by nature unstable,

original: yang na brtan pa'i rang bzhin yin zhes bya ba phyogs rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: yang na brtan pa'i rang bzhin yin zhes bya ba phyogs rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: or it is by nature stable.

original: gal te mi brtan pa'i rang bzhin yin na de'i tshe 'di skad cig las phyis med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te mi brtan pa'i rang bzhin yin na de'i tshe 'di skad cig las phyis med pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is by nature unstable, then at that time it does not exist after the instant,

original: 'di gang gi 'jig pa por 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di gang gi 'jig pa por 'gyur /
translated: so what is it that is destroyed?

original: 'on te phyogs gnyis pa yin na de'i tshe dngos po la ste brtan pa'i don rnams kyang yod pa la de'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gnyis pa yin na de'i tshe dngos po la ste brtan pa'i don rnams kyang yod pa la de'i ngo bo ste /
translated: But if the second position is accepted, then even things that are stable, i.e.,

original: rang bzhin gyis brtan pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis brtan pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: enduring, would exist, because their nature, i.e., their enduring nature, would exist.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis kun du brtags pas cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i 'jig pa pos ci zhig bya zhes snga ma bzhin du sun 'byin pa brjod par bya'o //üîΩci ste yang dngos po thams cad skad cig ma yin na yang skad cig ma gcig tu gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis kun du brtags pas cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i 'jig pa pos ci zhig bya zhes snga ma bzhin du sun 'byin pa brjod par bya'o // ci ste yang dngos po thams cad skad cig ma yin na yang skad cig ma gcig tu gnas pa'am /
translated: What would destruction do to them? As before, the refutation should be stated.

original: rgyun gyis rjes su 'jug pa la de'i nus par brjod do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: rgyun gyis rjes su 'jug pa la de'i nus par brjod do snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that even though all things are momentary, their capacity is described in terms of their enduring for one moment or in terms of their subsequent engagement in a continuum,

original: 'di la yang rang gi rgyu nyid las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di la yang rang gi rgyu nyid las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna addresses this point:

original: rang gi rgyu nyid las 'grub pa na skad cig gcig nas pa grub ste /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu nyid las 'grub pa na skad cig gcig nas pa grub ste /
translated: When they are established from their own causes, they are established as momentary.

original: 'di ltar 'di dag gi gnas pa ni bdag nyid thob pa'i mtshan nyid la brjod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag gi gnas pa ni bdag nyid thob pa'i mtshan nyid la brjod kyi /
translated: In this way, their endurance is described as the characteristic of obtaining their own nature.

original: rang nyid g-yo ba'i bdag nyid kyi dus phyis gnas pa med pa'i phyir yod pa'i bdag nyid thob ba rnams dus phyis bdag gi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid g-yo ba'i bdag nyid kyi dus phyis gnas pa med pa'i phyir yod pa'i bdag nyid thob ba rnams dus phyis bdag gi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: because at a later time, when it has the nature of motion, it would not be enduring.

original: gnas na yang nam yang mi ldog bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas na yang nam yang mi ldog bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: And even if it were enduring, it would follow that it would never cease to be,

original: snga ma bzhin du phyis kyang khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du phyis kyang khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because, as before, it would not be different later, and it would follow that it would not have that nature.

original: phyi ma phyi ma'i 'bras bu skye ba ni snga ma snga ma'i rgyu'i nus pas byas pa'i phyir rgyun la yang 'dus byas pa'i nus pa 'grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma'i 'bras bu skye ba ni snga ma snga ma'i rgyu'i nus pas byas pa'i phyir rgyun la yang 'dus byas pa'i nus pa 'grub pa ma yin no //
translated: And the arising of the later effect is produced by the power of the earlier cause, so the power of the conditioned does not exist in the continuum.

original: 'o na skad cig ma yin pa 'di 'jig pa por 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na skad cig ma yin pa 'di 'jig pa por 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúBut then this momentary thing would be the destroyer.‚Äù

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond:

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan du 'gyur ba mi srid pa'i phyir rang nyid kyis gnas pa ma yin pas ci zhig byed na 'di de'i 'jig pa por 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan du 'gyur ba mi srid pa'i phyir rang nyid kyis gnas pa ma yin pas ci zhig byed na 'di de'i 'jig pa por 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin to //
translated: But if it is not momentary, then since it is impossible for it to change into something else, it does not endure by itself. So what would it do?

original: yang ji ste 'di 'jig par byed pa por ma gyur mod /
analyzed: yang ji ste 'di 'jig par byed pa por ma gyur mod /
translated: But if it is not a cause of cessation,

original: 'on kyang skad cig ma nyid skyed par byed par 'gyur ro snyam na /üîΩ'di'i @287a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang skad cig ma nyid skyed par byed par 'gyur ro snyam na / 'di'i @287a * //
translated: then it is a cause of momentariness.

original: rgyu nyid ma mthong na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyu nyid ma mthong na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you do not see its cause,üîΩhow can you know that it is momentary?

original: gzhal bya'i de kho na nyid rnam par 'jog pa ni tshad ma la rag las pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhal bya'i de kho na nyid rnam par 'jog pa ni tshad ma la rag las pa yin no //
translated: The determination of the reality of the object of knowledge depends on valid cognition.

original: gang gi de'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba gos la sogs pa la 'di'i rab tu grags pa'i rgyu las ma gtogs pa mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis sam /
analyzed: gang gi de'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba gos la sogs pa la 'di'i rab tu grags pa'i rgyu las ma gtogs pa mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis sam /
translated: The cause of the convention of that is not seen by direct perception or non-apprehension, except for the well-known cause of cloth, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa bzhin du 'bras bu ldog pa las rgyu nyid du mthong ba ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bzhin du 'bras bu ldog pa las rgyu nyid du mthong ba ste /
translated: Or, like the eye, etc., its causality is seen from the cessation of the effect.

original: nges pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nges pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not certain.

original: ci ste nus pa ma mthong ba yang rgyu nyid du rtog par byed na /
analyzed: ci ste nus pa ma mthong ba yang rgyu nyid du rtog par byed na /
translated: If you imagine that even that which is not seen to be capable is a cause,

original: de'i tshe 'dus byas pa'am gzhan dbyug pa la sogs pa yang skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dus byas pa'am gzhan dbyug pa la sogs pa yang skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: then a conditioned thing or something else, such as a stick, would be the cause of arising.

original: brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúShould be investigated‚Äù is the remainder of the verse.

original: gang gis khyed cag nus pa yongs su ma nges pa'i 'dus byas pa'i bdag nyid gcig yongs su brtags pas yongs su tshim par 'gyur ba nus pa ma mthong ba nyid du ni khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: gang gis khyed cag nus pa yongs su ma nges pa'i 'dus byas pa'i bdag nyid gcig yongs su brtags pas yongs su tshim par 'gyur ba nus pa ma mthong ba nyid du ni khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no difference at all between that which is not seen to be capable and that which is imagined to be a conditioned thing, the nature of which is not ascertained.

original: 'di khyed cag gi skye ba'i rgyur 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di khyed cag gi skye ba'i rgyur 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: You do not assert that this is the cause of arising,

original: 'on kyang gos la sogs pa skyes pa yod pa'i dus phyis 'jig par 'gyur ba'i yon tan du 'dod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang gos la sogs pa skyes pa yod pa'i dus phyis 'jig par 'gyur ba'i yon tan du 'dod do //
translated: but you do assert that it is a quality that causes the destruction of cloth, etc., after it has arisen.

original: de la yang 'di ni cung zad kyang mi byed do zhes dang por brjod zin to //
analyzed: de la yang 'di ni cung zad kyang mi byed do zhes dang por brjod zin to //
translated: But we have already stated that it does not perform any function with regard to that.

original: skye ba'i rgyu nyid du khas blangs nas nyes pa 'di brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyu nyid du khas blangs nas nyes pa 'di brjod pa yin te /
translated: This fault is stated in the context of accepting that it is the cause of arising.

original: res 'ga' la rang gi gzhung lugs kyi lugs las 'das nas 'di ltar rtogs par byed do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: res 'ga' la rang gi gzhung lugs kyi lugs las 'das nas 'di ltar rtogs par byed do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Sometimes, having gone beyond the system of one's own scriptures, one thinks, I will understand it in this way.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs thams cad kyi don nye bar sdud par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs thams cad kyi don nye bar sdud par byed do //
translated: Thus and so on summarizes the meaning of everything.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yon tan sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yon tan sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the qualities of the characteristics of dharma and adharma,

original: yid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says endowed with mind and so on.

original: ma mthong ba'i byed pa po ni 'bras bu ster ba bdag gi yon tan bdag dang yid ldan pa las skyes pa rang gi 'bras bu dang 'gal ba med pa'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i byed pa po ni 'bras bu ster ba bdag gi yon tan bdag dang yid ldan pa las skyes pa rang gi 'bras bu dang 'gal ba med pa'o //
translated: The unseen agent, the giver of results, is the quality of the self, born from the self endowed with mind, not contradicting its own result.

original: de yang chos dang chos ma yin pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de yang chos dang chos ma yin pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Moreover, it is twofold, distinguished by dharma and adharma.

original: de la chos ni byed pa po la 'dod pa dang phan pa dang thar pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la chos ni byed pa po la 'dod pa dang phan pa dang thar pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: There, dharma is the cause of desire, benefit, and liberation for the agent.

original: chos ma yin pa ni mi 'dod pa dang mi phan pa dang 'ching ba'i rgyu'o zhes gzhan dag gis ma mthong ba'i mtshan nyid smras pa de 'di ni bdag dang yid dad de dag gi ldan pa de'i rgyu nyid du 'dod pa sngar bkag pa'i phyir rgyu med
analyzed: chos ma yin pa ni mi 'dod pa dang mi phan pa dang 'ching ba'i rgyu'o zhes gzhan dag gis ma mthong ba'i mtshan nyid smras pa de 'di ni bdag dang yid dad de dag gi ldan pa de'i rgyu nyid du 'dod pa sngar bkag pa'i phyir rgyu med
translated: Non-Dharma is the cause of what is undesirable, disadvantageous, and bondage.

original: pas med do zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: pas med do zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Since the characteristics of that which others do not see are stated, and since the cause of that is asserted by us and the mind to be the cause of that, it is established that it does not exist because it is causeless, since it was previously refuted.

original: sgra ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: sgra ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid du 'dod de /
translated: Sound is asserted to be the quality of space.

original: de ni dang po nyid du rim sogs thos zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsal zin pa'i phyir yang 'di'i sun 'byin pa mi brjod do //
analyzed: de ni dang po nyid du rim sogs thos zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsal zin pa'i phyir yang 'di'i sun 'byin pa mi brjod do //
translated: Since it has already been refuted by ‚ÄúFirst, the order of hearing, etc.,‚Äù its refutation is not stated here.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i @287b dka' 'grel las /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i @287b dka' 'grel las /
translated: From the commentary on the Compendium of Principles:

original: yon tan gyi don brtag pa ste bcu drug pa'o /
analyzed: yon tan gyi don brtag pa ste bcu drug pa'o /
translated: This is the sixteenth chapter on the examination of the meaning of quality.

original: // / las kyi tshig gi don dbyung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: // / las kyi tshig gi don dbyung ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to extract the meaning of the words of karma,

original: skad cig gis 'jig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skad cig gis 'jig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said ‚Äúmomentary destruction,‚Äù and so on.

original: mdo las / 'degs pa dang / 'jog pa dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang / 'gro ba zhes bya ba rnams ni las yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mdo las / 'degs pa dang / 'jog pa dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang / 'gro ba zhes bya ba rnams ni las yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Lifting, lowering, bending, extending, and movement are actions.

original: de la 'degs pa ni steng dang 'og gi phyogs dag dang ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu las skye ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'degs pa ni steng dang 'og gi phyogs dag dang ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu las skye ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: Lifting is the action that arises from the cause of possessing and separating the upper and lower directions.

original: dper na lus kyi yan lag gam de dang 'brel pa'i lus can gyi rdzas bod pa la sogs pa la nam mkha' la sogs pa'i steng dang 'og dang thad ka'i cha'i khyad par dag dang ldan pa'i rgyu 'og phyogs kyi cha rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu 'bad pa
analyzed: dper na lus kyi yan lag gam de dang 'brel pa'i lus can gyi rdzas bod pa la sogs pa la nam mkha' la sogs pa'i steng dang 'og dang thad ka'i cha'i khyad par dag dang ldan pa'i rgyu 'og phyogs kyi cha rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu 'bad pa
translated: For example, the cause of possessing the upper, lower, and horizontal directions of space and so on is the action that arises from the cause of separating the lower part of the body and so on, which is the cause of possessing the upper and lower directions of the body or the substance of the body that is connected to it.

original: la sogs pa'i dbang gis las skye ba gang yin pa de ni 'degs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i dbang gis las skye ba gang yin pa de ni 'degs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The action that arises from the power of effort and so on is called lifting.

original: 'di las bzlog pa'i ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu'i las ni 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di las bzlog pa'i ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu'i las ni 'jog pa'o //
translated: Lowering is the opposite of that, possessing and separating the cause of the lower direction.

original: rdzas drang po 'khyog pa nyid kyi rgyu ni bskum pa ste /
analyzed: rdzas drang po 'khyog pa nyid kyi rgyu ni bskum pa ste /
translated: Bending is the cause of straightening a substance.

original: ji skad du dpung pa la sogs pa'i rdzas drang po'i sor mo la sogs pa rtse mo'i yan lag gang dag yin pa de dag nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rang dang ldan pa dag dang rnam par dbye ba dang bdag nyid rtsa ba'i yul dag dang ldan pa
analyzed: ji skad du dpung pa la sogs pa'i rdzas drang po'i sor mo la sogs pa rtse mo'i yan lag gang dag yin pa de dag nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rang dang ldan pa dag dang rnam par dbye ba dang bdag nyid rtsa ba'i yul dag dang ldan pa
translated: The parts of the straight substances such as the arm, the fingers, etc., which are the parts of the top, are separated from the parts of the base, the parts of the bottom, which are their own parts, such as the elbow, etc.

original: na las gang gis dpung pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yan lag can gug por grub par byed pa de ni bskum pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: na las gang gis dpung pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yan lag can gug por grub par byed pa de ni bskum pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The action by which the bent possessor of parts, characterized by the arm, etc., is accomplished is called ‚Äúflexion.‚Äù

original: 'di las bzlog pa'i ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba skyed pa las gang gis yan lag can drang por sgrub par byed pa de ni brkyang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di las bzlog pa'i ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba skyed pa las gang gis yan lag can drang por sgrub par byed pa de ni brkyang ba'o //
translated: The opposite of this, the action by which the straight possessor of parts is accomplished, is called ‚Äúextension.‚Äù

original: yul dang phyogs ma nges pa'i bum pa la sogs pa dang rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: yul dang phyogs ma nges pa'i bum pa la sogs pa dang rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni 'gro ba'o //
translated: The cause of the separation of the pot, etc., which is not determined as to place and direction, is called ‚Äúmotion.‚Äù

original: 'degs pa la sogs pa las rnam pa bzhi ni yul dang phyogs nges pa'i nam mkha' la sogs pa dag dang ldan pa dad rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: 'degs pa la sogs pa las rnam pa bzhi ni yul dang phyogs nges pa'i nam mkha' la sogs pa dag dang ldan pa dad rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: The four actions such as lifting are the cause of the separation of the object from a particular place, etc.

original: 'gro ba ni ma nges pa'i phyogs dang phyogs kyi chos thams cad dang ldan pa dang rnam par dbye bar byed do //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni ma nges pa'i phyogs dang phyogs kyi chos thams cad dang ldan pa dang rnam par dbye bar byed do //
translated: Going is the cause of the separation of all things from an indefinite place and of their connection with a particular place.

original: de nyid kyi phyir las rnam pa lnga kho nas 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir las rnam pa lnga kho nas 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, there are only five actions,

original: 'khyam pa dang g-yo ba dang spro ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'gro ba nyid kyi khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khyam pa dang g-yo ba dang spro ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'gro ba nyid kyi khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because wandering, moving, and stretching are included in going.

original: las rnam pa lnga po 'di yang lus can gyi rdzas la gnas pa'i ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba'i 'bras bus dpag pas yod pa nyid du grub po //
analyzed: las rnam pa lnga po 'di yang lus can gyi rdzas la gnas pa'i ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba'i 'bras bus dpag pas yod pa nyid du grub po //
translated: These five actions are established as existing because they are inferred from the results of connection and separation that occur in substances that possess a body.

original: ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba'i khyad par gyi thun mong gi 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba'i khyad par gyi thun mong gi 'bras bu yin te /
translated: They are common results of the distinction of connection and separation.

original: de'i phyir 'di 'bras bu las grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di 'bras bu las grub bo //
translated: Therefore, they are established from their results.

original: de bzhin du mngon sum gyis kyang yin @288a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du mngon sum gyis kyang yin @288a * //
translated: Likewise, they are also directly perceived,

original: te ; ji skad du grangs dang tshad dang so so ba nyid dang ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba dag dang gzhan nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa nyid dag dang / las rnams ni gzugs can dang 'du ba'i phyir mig gis gzung bar bya ba yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: te ; ji skad du grangs dang tshad dang so so ba nyid dang ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba dag dang gzhan nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa nyid dag dang / las rnams ni gzugs can dang 'du ba'i phyir mig gis gzung bar bya ba yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: as it is said: ‚ÄúNumber, measure, separateness, conjunction, disjunction, otherness, non-otherness, and action are apprehended by the eye because they are material and composite.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na 'di dag ni mdor bsdus pas gzhan gyi gzhung lugs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di dag ni mdor bsdus pas gzhan gyi gzhung lugs bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, in brief, the opponent‚Äôs theory is presented.

original: de'i phyir 'di la ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba dag ni sngar bkag pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu nyid ma grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba dag ni sngar bkag pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu nyid ma grub bo //
translated: Therefore, since conjunction and disjunction have already been refuted, their effect is not established.

original: ci ste bar ma chad par skye ba tsam gyi mtshan nyid kyis ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba dag de'i 'bras bu yin pa nyid kyis rgyu nyid du brjod na de lta na yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin te ;
analyzed: ci ste bar ma chad par skye ba tsam gyi mtshan nyid kyis ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba dag de'i 'bras bu yin pa nyid kyis rgyu nyid du brjod na de lta na yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin te ;
translated: But if conjunction and disjunction are said to be causes because they are the effects of mere arising without interval, then even so, the reason is indeterminate.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i las dang de dag gang du yang rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i las dang de dag gang du yang rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because such an action and its going are not established as being the same.

original: bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pas gtan tshigs la khyab pa'i phyir 'gal ba yang yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pas gtan tshigs la khyab pa'i phyir 'gal ba yang yin no //
translated: It is also contradictory because the reason is pervaded by the opposite of the probandum.

original: rgyu rtsam yod pa nyid du sgrub na yang grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu rtsam yod pa nyid du sgrub na yang grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: If one proves that the cause is existent, it is the proof of what is already established,

original: rlung la sogs pa rnam ba de lta bu'i ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa rnam ba de lta bu'i ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that wind, etc. are the cause of the conjunction and disjunction of that type.

original: khyad par sgrub pa yang dam bca' ba la rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yin te /üîΩ'di ltar bya ba dang 'du ba'i dngos po skad cig ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: khyad par sgrub pa yang dam bca' ba la rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yin te / 'di ltar bya ba dang 'du ba'i dngos po skad cig ma yin pa'am /
translated: The proof of a distinction is also harmed by inference from the thesis,

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa yin /
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa yin /
translated: because action and the state of conjunction are either momentary or not momentary.

original: re zhig skad cig ma ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig skad cig ma ni ma yin te /
translated: First, they are not momentary,

original: de ni skye ba'i yul nyid du zhig pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni skye ba'i yul nyid du zhig pa'i phyir te /
translated: because that which is born is destroyed in the very place,

original: nyams pa'i phyir yul gzhan du phyin par mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams pa'i phyir yul gzhan du phyin par mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible for it to go to another place after decaying.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dag yul gang du zhig pa de ni de'i dus phyis de las yul gzhan du phyin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dag yul gang du zhig pa de ni de'i dus phyis de las yul gzhan du phyin pa ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: whatever is destroyed in a certain place does not go to another place after that time,

original: sgron ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sgron ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like a lamp, etc.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i dngos po thams cad kyang skye ba'i yul nyid du zhig pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i dngos po thams cad kyang skye ba'i yul nyid du zhig pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And all things that are desired to be expressed are destroyed in the very place of their origination. This is the observation of a contradiction with a pervasion.

original: gtan tshigs ma nges ba yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma nges ba yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the reason is not indeterminate,

original: shin tu myur bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shin tu myur bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúeven though they are very quickly destroyed,‚Äù etc.

original: ches myur du 'jig par 'dod pa gang yin de dag de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: ches myur du 'jig par 'dod pa gang yin de dag de lta bu yin no //
translated: Those who assert that things are destroyed very quickly are like that.

original: yang ches myur du 'jig par 'dod pa'i sgron ma la sogs pa yang skye ba'i dus phyis kyi bya ba yin te /
analyzed: yang ches myur du 'jig par 'dod pa'i sgron ma la sogs pa yang skye ba'i dus phyis kyi bya ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, even a lamp, etc., which is asserted to be destroyed very quickly, is an action after the time of origination.

original: 'di ni skad cig drug tu gnas pa nyid kyis skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni skad cig drug tu gnas pa nyid kyis skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because it is not momentary, since it endures for six moments.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause it is seen,‚Äù etc.

original: 'di ltar re zhig rang gi rgyu dang 'brel ba'i dus ni dang po yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig rang gi rgyu dang 'brel ba'i dus ni dang po yin no //
translated: Thus, first of all, there is the time of the connection with its cause.

original: de nas phyis spyi gsal ba'i dus so //
analyzed: de nas phyis spyi gsal ba'i dus so //
translated: Then, there is the time of the manifestation of the universal and the particular.

original: de nas yan lag gi las kyi dus so /üîΩde'i mjug thogs su @288b yan lag rnam par dbye ba'i dus so //
analyzed: de nas yan lag gi las kyi dus so / de'i mjug thogs su @288b yan lag rnam par dbye ba'i dus so //
translated: Then, there is the time of the activity of the parts.üîΩImmediately after that, there is the time of the separation of the parts.

original: de nas rang rtsom bar byed pa'i yan lag gi ldan pa zhig pa'o //
analyzed: de nas rang rtsom bar byed pa'i yan lag gi ldan pa zhig pa'o //
translated: Then, there is the destruction of the parts that make up the whole.üîΩThen, there is the destruction of the substance.

original: de nas rdzas 'jig pa'o zhes bya ba sgron ma la sogs pa'i dngos po yang skad cig ma drug tu gnas par 'dod de /
analyzed: de nas rdzas 'jig pa'o zhes bya ba sgron ma la sogs pa'i dngos po yang skad cig ma drug tu gnas par 'dod de /
translated: Thus, the entity, such as a lamp, is held to last for six moments.

original: de'i phyir dngos po skad cig la 'gro ba dang ldan pa 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir bya ba dang ldan pa thams cad ni skyes pa las dus phyis byung ba nyid kyi bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po skad cig la 'gro ba dang ldan pa 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir bya ba dang ldan pa thams cad ni skyes pa las dus phyis byung ba nyid kyi bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, since no entity is found to last for a second moment, all activity occurs after the arising of the entity.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te //
translated: Nor is the reason unestablished.

original: gzhan ni skad cig ma nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni skad cig ma nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible for anything else to be momentary.

original: ci ste yang gal te kho bo cag gis kyang dngos po rnams skad cig ma nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: ci ste yang gal te kho bo cag gis kyang dngos po rnams skad cig ma nyid du 'dod de /
translated: But if we also assert that things are momentary,

original: de lta na yang 'di dag gi bya ba skye ba'i dus nyid du 'byung bar ci'i phyir mi 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di dag gi bya ba skye ba'i dus nyid du 'byung bar ci'i phyir mi 'gyur snyam na /
translated: why then do their actions not occur at the very time they arise?

original: rgyab dang mdun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyab dang mdun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúWhat is called ‚Äòback‚Äô and ‚Äòfront,‚Äô etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi rgyab kyi yul dang bral la mdun yul dang 'jug pa dang / phrad pa ni 'gro ba po yin pa'am //
analyzed: gang gi rgyab kyi yul dang bral la mdun yul dang 'jug pa dang / phrad pa ni 'gro ba po yin pa'am //
translated: The one who is the goer is the one who is detached from the prior object and engages in the front object, and the one who is the goer is the one who is the basis of the extension of the back, etc., but not the other.üîΩFor example, it is like space, etc.üîΩThe one who is the goer is the one who is the basis of the extension of the back, etc., but not the other.üîΩFor example, it is like space, etc.üîΩThe one who is the goer is the one who is the basis of the extension of the back, etc., but not the other.üîΩFor example, it is like space, etc.üîΩThe one who is the goer is the one who is the basis of the extension of the back, etc., but not the other.üîΩFor example, it is like space, etc.üîΩThe one who is the goer is the one who is the basis of the extension of the back, etc., but not the other.üîΩFor example, it is like space, etc.üîΩThe one who is the goer is the one who is the basis of the extension of the back, etc., but not the other.üîΩFor example, it is like space, etc.üîΩThe one who is the goer is the one who is the basis of the extension of the back, etc., but not the other.üîΩFor example, it is like space, etc.

original: rgyab tu brkyang ba la sogs pa'i rten yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyab tu brkyang ba la sogs pa'i rten yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: The one who is the goer is the one who is the basis of the extension of the back, etc., but not the other.

original: dper na nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin no ;
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin no ;
translated: For example, it is like space, etc.üîΩThe one who is the goer is the one who is the basis of the extension of the back, etc., but not the other.üîΩFor example, it is like space, etc.üîΩThe one who is the goer is the one who is the basis of the extension of the back, etc., but not the other.üîΩFor example, it is like space, etc.

original: / gang gis sngar gyi yul yongs su spangs pa sngon du 'gro ba can rgyab kyi yul non par 'gyur ba skad cig gcig tsam du 'byung ba 'di tsam zhig sdod pa ni yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: / gang gis sngar gyi yul yongs su spangs pa sngon du 'gro ba can rgyab kyi yul non par 'gyur ba skad cig gcig tsam du 'byung ba 'di tsam zhig sdod pa ni yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The one who is the goer is the one who is the basis of the extension of the back, etc., but not the other.üîΩFor example, it is like space, etc.üîΩThe

original: yod ba'i dus su yang 'jig pas dbang byas pa'i phyir yul gzhan du phyin par mi nus so //
analyzed: yod ba'i dus su yang 'jig pas dbang byas pa'i phyir yul gzhan du phyin par mi nus so //
translated: Because it is controlled by destruction, even while it exists, it cannot go to another place.

original: de lta bas na skye ba'i dus su 'byung ba'i bya ba yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na skye ba'i dus su 'byung ba'i bya ba yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the activity of arising is also not tenable.

original: sngon dang phyi ma dag gi mthar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma dag gi mthar yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it at the end of the prior and subsequent,

original: de ni de'i dus na nye bar brjod pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i dus na nye bar brjod pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time, it is not expressed.üîΩTherefore, set aside the question of how that which does not exist even for an instant could go to a very distant place; even going to a place the size of a single atom does not exist.

original: de'i phyir skad cig kyang med pa gang yin pa de yul shin tu thag ring par phyin par 'gyur ba lta re zhig zhog /'on kyang rdul phra rab tsam gyi yul phyogs su phyin pa yang med pa'i phyir skad cig ma la bya ba ga la yod skad
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig kyang med pa gang yin pa de yul shin tu thag ring par phyin par 'gyur ba lta re zhig zhog /'on kyang rdul phra rab tsam gyi yul phyogs su phyin pa yang med pa'i phyir skad cig ma la bya ba ga la yod skad
translated: How could there be activity in an instant?

original: cig ma ma yin pa la yang med do zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: cig ma ma yin pa la yang med do zhes ston pa ni /
translated: To demonstrate that there is no activity even in what is not an instant, he says:üîΩA thing that is supported, etc.

original: dngos po brten na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtag tu gcig gi ngo bo'i dngos po ni skad cig ma ma yin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dngos po brten na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtag tu gcig gi ngo bo'i dngos po ni skad cig ma ma yin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: A thing that is always of a single nature is called ‚Äúnot an instant.‚Äù

original: de ni bya ba dang mi 'du ba gsal rab pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ni bya ba dang mi 'du ba gsal rab pa nyid de /
translated: That is the utter clarity of non-engagement with action,

original: nam mkha' bzhin du thams cad du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du thams cad du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, like space, it is without distinction in all respects.

original: sbyor ba ni gang thams cad du khyad par med pa'i de la ni bya ba srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang thams cad du khyad par med pa'i de la ni bya ba srid pa ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: If it is without distinction in all respects, then action is not possible,

original: nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: like space.üîΩAnd the thing that is asserted to be non-momentary is also without distinction in all respects.

original: skad cig ma ma yin par 'dod pa'i dngos po yang thams cad du khyad par med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'i thal bar @289a * //
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin par 'dod pa'i dngos po yang thams cad du khyad par med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'i thal bar @289a * //
translated: This is the reductio argument that reveals the contradiction with the pervasion.

original: 'gyur ba'o // gal te 'di snyam du skad cig ma ma yin pa'i dngos po khyad par med pa de lta na yang rang bzhin gyis de 'gro ba po la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir bya ba dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur bas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges
analyzed: 'gyur ba'o // gal te 'di snyam du skad cig ma ma yin pa'i dngos po khyad par med pa de lta na yang rang bzhin gyis de 'gro ba po la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir bya ba dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur bas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges
translated: If you think that even though that non-momentary thing is without distinction, it is still endowed with action because it has the nature of a goer, etc., by its very nature, then the reason is not established.

original: pa yin no snyam du sems pa'i dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: pa yin no snyam du sems pa'i dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: In response to this qualm,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says ‚ÄúIf it is without distinction, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te lha spyin la sogs pa skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du 'dod pa 'di dag rang bzhin gyis 'gro ba dang / 'degs pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin na de'i tshe nam yang mi gnas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te lha spyin la sogs pa skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du 'dod pa 'di dag rang bzhin gyis 'gro ba dang / 'degs pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin na de'i tshe nam yang mi gnas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If Devadatta and so on are asserted to be not momentary and to possess going, lifting and so on, then at that time they would never be at rest,

original: thams cad du 'gro ba po la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba po la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they would always possess the nature of a goer and so on.

original: de lta yin dang 'gro ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i lha spyin la sogs pa'i 'di mi g-yo ba'i gnas skabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa med na yang de dag ste 'gro ba la sogs thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'gro ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i lha spyin la sogs pa'i 'di mi g-yo ba'i gnas skabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa med na yang de dag ste 'gro ba la sogs thob par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then Devadatta and so on who possess going and so on would not have going and so on when at rest, but they would obtain going and so on,

original: 'gro ba la sogs pa rtsom pa'i dus bzhin du ngo bo ma dor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba la sogs pa rtsom pa'i dus bzhin du ngo bo ma dor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they would not lose their nature of beginning to go and so on.

original: ci ste skyon 'dis 'jigs nas 'di 'gro ba po ma yin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du khas len par byed pa de lta yin na thams cad kyi tshe mi 'gro ba la sogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste skyon 'dis 'jigs nas 'di 'gro ba po ma yin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du khas len par byed pa de lta yin na thams cad kyi tshe mi 'gro ba la sogs par 'gyur te /
translated: But if you accept that to be so, fearing this error, then Devadatta and so on would not be goers and so on, but if that were so, they would always be non-goers and so on.

original: gcig gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: gcig gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: because it has the nature of one, like space.

original: sogs pa'i sgras /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù

original: 'degs pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'degs pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: refers to the action of lifting and so on.

original: de lta yin dang 'gro ba la sogs pa yod na yang de mi g-yo ba kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'gro ba la sogs pa yod na yang de mi g-yo ba kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then even if going and so on exist, it would be completely immobile,

original: 'gro ba po ma yin pa'i ngo bo ma dor ba'i phyir mi g-yo ba'i gnas skabs bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba po ma yin pa'i ngo bo ma dor ba'i phyir mi g-yo ba'i gnas skabs bzhin no //
translated: because it would not abandon its nature of not being a goer, like the state of immobility.

original: g-yo ba'i las 'di la yod pas g-yo ldan no //
analyzed: g-yo ba'i las 'di la yod pas g-yo ldan no //
translated: It is called ‚Äúendowed with motion‚Äù because this action of motion exists in it.

original: g-yo min ngo bo'i dus bzhin no //
analyzed: g-yo min ngo bo'i dus bzhin no //
translated: It is called ‚Äúimmobile‚Äù because it is like the state of immobility.

original: zhes bya ba la bzhin ni bdun pa'i mtha' can no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la bzhin ni bdun pa'i mtha' can no //
translated: Here ‚Äúlike‚Äù is a suffix that indicates the seventh case, the ablative.

original: ci ste yang 'di gcig gi ngo bo ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste yang 'di gcig gi ngo bo ma yin no //
translated: But if it does not have the nature of one,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then what does it have?

original: 'gro ba po la sogs pa dang 'gro ba po ma yin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnyi ga'i ngo bo yin pas de'i phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'gro ba po la sogs pa dang 'gro ba po ma yin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnyi ga'i ngo bo yin pas de'i phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: It has the nature of both, as a goer and so on and as a nongoer and so on. Therefore the previously explained error does not arise.

original: gtan tshigs kyang ma grub pa yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyang ma grub pa yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In response to this qualm, he says, ‚ÄúIf it is one, etc.‚Äù

original: gcig tshe 'ang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gcig tshe 'ang zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the phrase ‚Äúat the time of going, etc.,‚ÄùüîΩthe word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù

original: 'ang gi sgra ni rim pa tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: 'ang gi sgra ni rim pa tha dad pa ste /
translated: refers to the different stages.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i mjug tu blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i mjug tu blta bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù should be supplied after ‚Äúagain.‚Äù

original: yang gzhan du yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang gzhan du yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: ‚Äúin another way, etc.‚Äù

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIn another way‚Äù means ‚Äúas a goer.‚Äù

original: de lta na ni 'gro ba po nyid dang 'gro ba po ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pas gcig nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'gro ba po nyid dang 'gro ba po ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pas gcig nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it follows that singularity is undermined because of the contradiction of the properties of being a goer and not being a goer, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de skad cig @289b ma nyid du grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de skad cig @289b ma nyid du grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is precisely for this reason that it is established that it is momentary,

original: de dag shin tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag shin tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThey are not at all, etc.‚Äù

original: de dag ces bya ba ni g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i gnas skabs su 'byung ba dag go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i gnas skabs su 'byung ba dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThey‚Äù refers to the states of movement and rest.

original: g-yo dang mi g-yo dngos po bzhin //
analyzed: g-yo dang mi g-yo dngos po bzhin //
translated: Like the entities of movement and rest,

original: zhes bya ba ni lcug ma dang re lde la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lcug ma dang re lde la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like a bundle of reeds.

original: de ltar re zhig dam bca' ba la rjes su dpag pas gnod pa bsgrubs nas /üîΩmngon sum gyis gnod pa yang bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig dam bca' ba la rjes su dpag pas gnod pa bsgrubs nas / mngon sum gyis gnod pa yang bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having established the refutation of the thesis by means of inference,

original: mthong ba nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mthong ba nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he states the refutation by means of direct perception:

original: gang zhig dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa yin pa ma dmigs pa de ni rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams med pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa yin pa ma dmigs pa de ni rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams med pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa yin te /
translated: The non-apprehension of that which has the character of the apprehensible is the convention of non-existence for those who have understanding.

original: dper na phyogs 'ga' zhig na bum pa ma dmigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na phyogs 'ga' zhig na bum pa ma dmigs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the non-apprehension of a pot in a certain place.üîΩAnd also the non-apprehension of karma apart from form, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i las kyang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i las kyang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the non-apprehension of intrinsic nature.

original: de lta de ltar yul gzhan bdag gir byed pas skye ba'i gzugs la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i las ni dbang po'i shes pa la snang bar rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta de ltar yul gzhan bdag gir byed pas skye ba'i gzugs la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i las ni dbang po'i shes pa la snang bar rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, since it appropriates another object, karma is not apprehended as appearing to the sense consciousnesses apart from the arising form, etc.

original: gang yang 'degs pa dang 'jog pa po snyam pa'i brjod pa dang ldan pa'i blo 'di skye ba de ni brjod pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang 'degs pa dang 'jog pa po snyam pa'i brjod pa dang ldan pa'i blo 'di skye ba de ni brjod pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin no //
translated: The cognition that arises with the expression ‚Äúhe raises and he lowers‚Äù is not perception because it is associated with verbal expression.

original: 'di ni las kyi tshig gi don nyams su myong ba'i stobs kyis 'byung bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni las kyi tshig gi don nyams su myong ba'i stobs kyis 'byung bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that this arises by the power of experiencing the meaning of the expression of action,

original: gzugs la sogs pa nyid de lta de ltar skye ba mthong ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nyid de lta de ltar skye ba mthong ba'i phyir ;
translated: because form, etc., are seen to arise in such and such a way.

original: brda ji lta ba bzhin du de dag kho na la zhen nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brda ji lta ba bzhin du de dag kho na la zhen nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one engages in them by adhering to them just as the expression is.

original: 'di yang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag la 'gro ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir zhes de ma thag tu bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'di yang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag la 'gro ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir zhes de ma thag tu bstan zin to //
translated: And this has just been explained, because going, etc., do not exist for the permanent and the impermanent.

original: des na mngon sum kho na las grub pa yin no zhes gang smras pa 'di ni ma grub po //
analyzed: des na mngon sum kho na las grub pa yin no zhes gang smras pa 'di ni ma grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is not established that it is established by perception alone, as you claim.

original: ji skad du bshad pa nyid kyi don nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa nyid kyi don nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize the meaning that has been explained, he says:

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, etc.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni de ma thag tu brjod pa'i mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dag gis bsal zin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbye dang phrad pa mi rigs phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba ni sngon ma dang bye ba mi rigs pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni de ma thag tu brjod pa'i mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dag gis bsal zin pa'i phyir ro // bye dang phrad pa mi rigs phyir // zhes bya ba ni sngon ma dang bye ba mi rigs pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because contact with the past and future is not tenable.üîΩ‚ÄúContact with the past‚Äù means that contact with the past is not tenable.

original: rgyab ma dang phrad pa mi rigs pa'i phyir zhes go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyab ma dang phrad pa mi rigs pa'i phyir zhes go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúContact with the future‚Äù means that contact with the future is not tenable.

original: 'o na gal te ji ltar 'jig rten na 'gro ba'i tha snyad du 'gyur zhe na /üîΩ'dra ba gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'o na gal te ji ltar 'jig rten na 'gro ba'i tha snyad du 'gyur zhe na / 'dra ba gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: But if the past and future do not exist, how can there be the conventions of going and coming in the world?üîΩThe root text states, ‚ÄúThe convention of going and coming is in terms of other similar things.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúOther similar things‚Äù means that they are similar and other.

original: 'dra ba gzhan gyi dngos rnams zhes bya ba ni de dag ni 'dra ba yang yin la gzhan yang yin no zhes bsdu ba byas la de dag kyang yin la dngos @290a * //üîΩpo yang yin zhes tshig rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan gyi dngos rnams zhes bya ba ni de dag ni 'dra ba yang yin la gzhan yang yin no zhes bsdu ba byas la de dag kyang yin la dngos @290a * //üîΩpo yang yin zhes tshig rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThings‚Äù means that they are things.

original: 'dra ba gzhan gyi dngos po de dag bar chad med par rang gi nye bar len pa'i rgyu'i yul spangs nas skye ba yod pa gang yin pa de'i skye ba dmigs pa'i rgyu'i phyir de nyid 'gro ba 'di yin no zhes 'khrul par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan gyi dngos po de dag bar chad med par rang gi nye bar len pa'i rgyu'i yul spangs nas skye ba yod pa gang yin pa de'i skye ba dmigs pa'i rgyu'i phyir de nyid 'gro ba 'di yin no zhes 'khrul par 'gyur te /
translated: That is, it would be mistaken to say that this very thing that is born is the one that goes, because the cause of the perception of its birth is the arising of a similar thing that has abandoned the object that was the cause of its appropriation.

original: dper na 'ga' zhig tu nges pa'i sgron ma yul gzhan du 'gro ba yin no zhes bya ba blo'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig tu nges pa'i sgron ma yul gzhan du 'gro ba yin no zhes bya ba blo'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin te /
translated: For example, it would be the cause of the idea that a lamp that is determined to be in one place goes to another place.

original: sgron ma de nyid yul gzhan du phyin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sgron ma de nyid yul gzhan du phyin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But that lamp does not go to another place,

original: de ni skad cig ma drug tu gnas pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni skad cig ma drug tu gnas pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that it lasts for six moments.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid sngon dang phyi ma'i mthas stong par skye'o zhes brjod de /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid sngon dang phyi ma'i mthas stong par skye'o zhes brjod de /
translated: We say that the intrinsic reality of a thing is born empty of a prior and subsequent end.

original: des na de ni dmigs pa nyid du rigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na de ni dmigs pa nyid du rigs pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is only logical that it is perceived.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na skye ba zhes bya ba 'di ni lnga pa'i mtha' can te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na skye ba zhes bya ba 'di ni lnga pa'i mtha' can te /
translated: Alternatively, this so-called birth ends in the fifth case.

original: bar med par skye ba las 'dra ba gzhan gyi dngos po rnams yul gzhan du dmigs pa'i phyir zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: bar med par skye ba las 'dra ba gzhan gyi dngos po rnams yul gzhan du dmigs pa'i phyir zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The word only is to be supplied from the previous verse.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las //üîΩlas kyi tshogs kyi don brtag pa ste bcu bdun pa'o /üîΩ// rdzas la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyi dang khyad par dbyung ba rtsom mo //
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las // las kyi tshogs kyi don brtag pa ste bcu bdun pa'o / // rdzas la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyi dang khyad par dbyung ba rtsom mo //
translated: The Yukti$a$!ikii says:üîΩThe Yukti$a$!ikii says:üîΩThe Yukti$a$!ikii says:üîΩThe Yukti$a$!ikii says:üîΩThe Yukti$a$!ikii says:üîΩThe Yukti$a$!ikii says:üîΩThe Yukti$a$!ikii says:üîΩThe Yukti$a$!ikii says:üîΩThe Yukti$a$!ikii says:

analyzed: rigs rnams zhes bya ba ni spyi rnams so //
translated: The Yukti$a$!ikii says:üîΩThe Yukti$a$!ikii says:üîΩThe Yukti$a$!ikii says:üîΩThe Yukti$a$!ikii says:

original: de dag kyang rdzas dang yon tan dang las kyi bdag nyid kyi tshig gi don gsum la brten pa'i phyir de bsal ba nyid kyis spangs pa yin no ;üîΩ/ rten med par ni gang du yang brten pa rnams gnas pa yod pa ma yin te /üîΩmi brten pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang rdzas dang yon tan dang las kyi bdag nyid kyi tshig gi don gsum la brten pa'i phyir de bsal ba nyid kyis spangs pa yin no ; / rten med par ni gang du yang brten pa rnams gnas pa yod pa ma yin te / mi brten pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Yukti$a$!ikii says:üîΩThe Yukti$a$!ikii says:üîΩThe Yukti$a$!ikii says:üîΩThe Yukti$a$!ikii says:üîΩThe Yukti$a$!ikii says:

original: rigs smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste bye brag kyang mtha'i rdzas la 'jug pa'i phyir brten pa nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: rigs smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste bye brag kyang mtha'i rdzas la 'jug pa'i phyir brten pa nyid du 'dod do //
translated: The Yukti$a$!ikii says:

original: de'i phyir de dag kyang brten brtsam pa nyid kyis spangs pa de lta na yang slar yang khyad par du sun dbyung ba brjod par 'dod pa rang gi ngo bo nges par shes pa sun dbyung bar nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag kyang brten brtsam pa nyid kyis spangs pa de lta na yang slar yang khyad par du sun dbyung ba brjod par 'dod pa rang gi ngo bo nges par shes pa sun dbyung bar nus pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, they are also refuted by the mere fact that they are dependent. Still, in order to refute them in a special way, it is asserted that their nature can be refuted by ascertaining their nature.

original: re zhig spyi dang bye brag dag gi rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩde la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: re zhig spyi dang bye brag dag gi rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir / de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach the nature of universals and particulars, he says:

original: de la spyi ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la spyi ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therein, a universal is twofold:

original: mchog dang mchog ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mchog dang mchog ma yin pa'o //
translated: supreme and non-supreme.

original: mchog ni yod pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mchog ni yod pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The supreme is called existence.

original: de yang rdzas dang yon tan dang las gsum po mtha' dag la 'jug pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de yang rdzas dang yon tan dang las gsum po mtha' dag la 'jug pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because it is the cause of the cognition that engages all three: substance, quality, and action,

original: spyi kho na yin gyi bye brag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi kho na yin gyi bye brag ni ma yin no //
translated: it is only a universal, not a particular.

original: mchog ma yin pa ni rdzas dang yon tan dang las nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: mchog ma yin pa ni rdzas dang yon tan dang las nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The non-supreme is characterized by substance, quality, and action, etc.

original: de @290b yang rang gi rten rdzas la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyi phyir spyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de @290b yang rang gi rten rdzas la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyi phyir spyi zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, it is called a universal because it is the cause of the cognition that engages its own substratum, such as substance.

original: rang gi rten rigs mi mthun pa dag las ldog pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid kyis khyad par du byed pa'i phyir spyi yin na yang bye brag ces brjod do //
analyzed: rang gi rten rigs mi mthun pa dag las ldog pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid kyis khyad par du byed pa'i phyir spyi yin na yang bye brag ces brjod do //
translated: Even though it is a universal because it is the cause of the cognition that excludes its own substratum from heterogeneous things, it is called a particular because it is distinguished by that cause.

original: 'di ltar yon tan la sogs ba la rdzas ma yin pa dang yon tan ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzlog pa'i blo 'di skye ba sgrub bar byed pa gang yin pa de la yon tan nyid dang rdzas nyid la sogs pa 'di dag nyidüîΩkyi rnam par gnas kyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yon tan la sogs ba la rdzas ma yin pa dang yon tan ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzlog pa'i blo 'di skye ba sgrub bar byed pa gang yin pa de la yon tan nyid dang rdzas nyid la sogs pa 'di dag nyid kyi rnam par gnas kyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the cognition that excludes such things as quality from substance and excludes such things as non-quality from quality arises. The cause of that is these very things, such as quality and substance,üîΩbut not others.

original: rdzas ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzas ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no other thing called non-substance.

original: ltos pa tha dad pa'i phyir gcig dang spyi dang khyad par gyi dngos por mi 'gal ba kho na'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: ltos pa tha dad pa'i phyir gcig dang spyi dang khyad par gyi dngos por mi 'gal ba kho na'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: It is thought that there is no contradiction in being one, a universal, and a particular, because the basis of reliance is different.

original: bye brag gzhan gyi mtshan nyid bshad pa /üîΩbye brag dag kyang kha cig nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag gzhan gyi mtshan nyid bshad pa / bye brag dag kyang kha cig nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the characteristics of the other categories.

original: kha cig ni bye brag kho nar 'dod kyi spyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni bye brag kho nar 'dod kyi spyi ni ma yin te /
translated: Some assert that the categories are only categories, not universals.

original: ldog pa nyid yin pas ldog ste /
analyzed: ldog pa nyid yin pas ldog ste /
translated: They are categories because they are exclusions.

original: ldog pa'i shes pa nyid kyi rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: ldog pa'i shes pa nyid kyi rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: The meaning is that they are the cause of the cognition of exclusion.

original: / de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: / de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: rtag pa'i rdzas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rtag pa'i rdzas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The text says, ‚Äúpermanent substances, etc.‚Äù

original: de skad du yang rtag pa'i rdzas la 'jug pa'i mtha' ni bye brag go zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de skad du yang rtag pa'i rdzas la 'jug pa'i mtha' ni bye brag go zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus, it is explained that the limit of engagement of permanent substances is a category.

original: rtag pa'i rdzas la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab dang nam mkha' dang dus dang phyogs dang bdag dang yid la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa'i rdzas la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab dang nam mkha' dang dus dang phyogs dang bdag dang yid la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúlimit of engagement of permanent substances‚Äù refers to atoms, space, time, direction, self, and mind.

original: 'gro ba 'jig pa dang rtsom pa'i mthar gyur pa'i phyir dang / grol ba'i bdag dang grol ba'i yid ni 'khor ba'i mthar gyur pa'i phyir mtha' nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'jig pa dang rtsom pa'i mthar gyur pa'i phyir dang / grol ba'i bdag dang grol ba'i yid ni 'khor ba'i mthar gyur pa'i phyir mtha' nyid yin no //
translated: The self of the liberated one and the mind of the liberated one are limits because they are the limit of sa·πÉsƒÅra, since they are the end of the destruction and creation of the world.

original: de'i phyir de dag la yod pa ni mtha' zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la yod pa ni mtha' zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, that which exists in them is called an extreme.

original: de dag la gsal bar mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la gsal bar mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the existence of these is called ‚Äúextreme‚Äù because they are not clearly perceived.üîΩThey are called ‚Äúextreme‚Äù because they are not clearly perceived.

original: 'jug pa ni 'di dag rdul phra rab la sogs pa rtag pa'i rdzas la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni 'di dag rdul phra rab la sogs pa rtag pa'i rdzas la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: They engage in the permanent substances such as atoms.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rtag pa'i rdzas la 'jug pa dang / mtha' zhes bya ba gnyi ga gzung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rtag pa'i rdzas la 'jug pa dang / mtha' zhes bya ba gnyi ga gzung ngo //
translated: Therefore, both ‚Äúengagement in permanent substances‚Äù and ‚Äúextreme‚Äù are accepted.

original: de dag kyang phan tshun du tha dad pa'i blo'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi rten gzhan las khyad par byed pas bye brag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang phan tshun du tha dad pa'i blo'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi rten gzhan las khyad par byed pas bye brag ces bya'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúdistinctions‚Äù because they are the cause of the cognition of mutual difference and because they distinguish their own basis from others.

original: yang 'di dag ga las grub ce na /
analyzed: yang 'di dag ga las grub ce na /
translated: From what are they established?

original: gang gi stobs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gi stobs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚Äúby the power of which . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar bdag cag la sogs pas ba lang la sogs pa la byad gzugs dang yon tan dang bya ba dang yan lag dang ldan pa'i rgyu mtshan rta la sogs pa'i shes pa mthong ste 'di ltar ba lang dang dkar po dang myur bar 'gro ba dang nogüîΩrgyas pa zhes bya ba @291a * //üîΩdang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag cag la sogs pas ba lang la sogs pa la byad gzugs dang yon tan dang bya ba dang yan lag dang ldan pa'i rgyu mtshan rta la sogs pa'i shes pa mthong ste 'di ltar ba lang dang dkar po dang myur bar 'gro ba dang nog rgyas pa zhes bya ba @291a * // dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: in the same way, we see the reason for the cognition of a liberated self in the permanent atoms, which have a body, qualities, and actions.

original: de bzhin du bdag cag las khyad par du gyur pa'i rnal 'byor ba rnams /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag cag las khyad par du gyur pa'i rnal 'byor ba rnams /
translated: In the same way, yogis who are superior to us see the reason for the cognition of a liberated self in the permanent atoms, which have a body, qualities, and actions.

original: byad gzugs dang yon tan dang bya ba mtshungs pa'i rdul phra rab rtag pa rnams dang grol ba'i bdag dang yid rnams la rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa na gang gi stobs kyis rten so so la 'di dang mi 'dra'o snyam pa'i shes pa gang las ldog pa'i yul
analyzed: byad gzugs dang yon tan dang bya ba mtshungs pa'i rdul phra rab rtag pa rnams dang grol ba'i bdag dang yid rnams la rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa na gang gi stobs kyis rten so so la 'di dang mi 'dra'o snyam pa'i shes pa gang las ldog pa'i yul
translated: If there is no other reason for the cognition of a liberated self in the permanent atoms, which have a body, qualities, and actions, and in the liberated self and mind, by whose power does the cognition arise in each basis that thinks, ‚ÄúThis is not like that‚Äù?

original: dang dus dang bskal ba ma mthong ba la de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i ngo shes pa rnal 'byor pa rnams la 'byung ba khyad par gyi shes pas dpag pa'i yod pa mtha' dang khyad par grub bo /
analyzed: dang dus dang bskal ba ma mthong ba la de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i ngo shes pa rnal 'byor pa rnams la 'byung ba khyad par gyi shes pas dpag pa'i yod pa mtha' dang khyad par grub bo /
translated: The yogi/nis have a special knowledge that ascertains the existence of the past and future by means of the recognition that ‚Äúthat very thing is this,‚Äù even though they do not see them.

original: de dag kyang bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rten so so la brten pa yin la /
analyzed: de dag kyang bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rten so so la brten pa yin la /
translated: And they are just like the self in that they are based on their respective supports.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis ni mngon sum nyid kyis grub po //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis ni mngon sum nyid kyis grub po //
translated: But the yogi/nis establish them by means of direct perception.

original: ci ste rigs rnams ji ltar grub ce na /
analyzed: ci ste rigs rnams ji ltar grub ce na /
translated: But how are the universals established?

original: yod dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yod dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse says ‚Äúexistence, etc.‚Äù

original: gang zhig gang du gtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed par 'gyur ba de ni de las byung ba yin no zhes rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig gang du gtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed par 'gyur ba de ni de las byung ba yin no zhes rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin la /
translated: That which is concomitant with the presence and absence of something else is posited as arising from that.

original: rdzas la sogs pa la yod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa skye ba yang dbang por gtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ni /
analyzed: rdzas la sogs pa la yod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa skye ba yang dbang por gtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ni /
translated: The arising of the cognition of existence, etc., in regard to substance, etc. is concomitant with the presence and absence of the sense faculties.

original: de las gzhan pa'i dbang po'i shes pa bzhin du ci'i phyir dbang pos bskyed par bya ba'i tha snyad 'jug par mi byed de de lta ma yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dbang po'i shes pa bzhin du ci'i phyir dbang pos bskyed par bya ba'i tha snyad 'jug par mi byed de de lta ma yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Why is it not called a sense faculty, like the other sense consciousnesses? If it were not so, it would follow, absurdly, that it would not be a sense faculty.

original: rjes su dpag pas kyang 'di dag gi yod pa nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas kyang 'di dag gi yod pa nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to prove by inference that these exist, he says, Inference, etc.

original: shes pa'i bye brag ni zhes bya ba ni rdzas la sogs pa'i dngos po dang mi 'dra ba'i rnam pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i bye brag ni zhes bya ba ni rdzas la sogs pa'i dngos po dang mi 'dra ba'i rnam pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The specific consciousness is a consciousness that has a form that is unlike the thing, such as substance, etc.

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan las byung ba can ni rgyu mtshan gzhan las byung ba ste skyes pa de 'di la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan las byung ba can ni rgyu mtshan gzhan las byung ba ste skyes pa de 'di la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It arises from another sign, that is, it is born from another sign.

original: sbyong ba ni dngos po gang gi rnam pa dang mi 'dra ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni de las ma gtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan las byung pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyong ba ni dngos po gang gi rnam pa dang mi 'dra ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni de las ma gtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan las byung pa yin te /
translated: The definition of a specific consciousness is this: any consciousness that has a form that is unlike the thing is one that arises from another sign, that is, from a cause that is other than that thing.

original: gos dang 'phags pa dang bal la sogs pa la dmar po la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no ;üîΩ/ rdzas la sogs pa la yod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs su gzhan dag sems so /
analyzed: gos dang 'phags pa dang bal la sogs pa la dmar po la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no ; / rdzas la sogs pa la yod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs su gzhan dag sems so /
translated: It is like the cognition of red and so on in cloth, wool, and so on.üîΩThis cognition of existence and so on in substance and so on is also like that.

original: tshad ma'i don 'di nyid /
analyzed: tshad ma'i don 'di nyid /
translated: This is how others think of it as a natural argument.üîΩThis very meaning of valid cognition is shown by the statement

original: ba lang glang chen la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos po rnam par 'byed pa la sogs pas bkod pa'i tshad @291b ma ston pa yin te /
analyzed: ba lang glang chen la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos po rnam par 'byed pa la sogs pas bkod pa'i tshad @291b ma ston pa yin te /
translated: beginning with cows, elephants, and so on.

original: de dag dngos po rnam par 'byed pas smras pa /
analyzed: de dag dngos po rnam par 'byed pas smras pa /
translated: They, the differentiators of things, say:

original: ba lang dang phag dang glang po che la sogs pa la ba lang la sogs pa'i shes pa dang brjod ba'i khyad par rnams ni /
analyzed: ba lang dang phag dang glang po che la sogs pa la ba lang la sogs pa'i shes pa dang brjod ba'i khyad par rnams ni /
translated: The distinctions of cognition and expression of cows and so on in cows, pigs, elephants, and so on

original: brda dang cha byad dang gong bu las tha dad pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'dra ba'i rgyu mtshan gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin te zhes smras te /
analyzed: brda dang cha byad dang gong bu las tha dad pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'dra ba'i rgyu mtshan gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin te zhes smras te /
translated: are based on other reasons that are similar to their own nature, which is different from words, attributes, and conglomerations.

original: ba lang la sogs yul nyid yin pa na /
analyzed: ba lang la sogs yul nyid yin pa na /
translated: When the object is a cow, for example,üîΩ

original: gong bu la sogs par rang gi ngo bo'i shes pa dang brjod pa las tha dad pa'i shes pa dang brjod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gong bu la sogs par rang gi ngo bo'i shes pa dang brjod pa las tha dad pa'i shes pa dang brjod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cognition and expression of the universal, etc. are different from the cognition and expression of the individual, the aggregate, etc.

original: ba lang la sogs pa de dag nyid la be'u dang bcas pa'i ba lang khal bkal ba'i ma he zug rdu dang bcas pa'i phag / lcags kyu dang bcas pa'i glang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i brjod pa dang shes pa'i khyad par bzhin no //
analyzed: ba lang la sogs pa de dag nyid la be'u dang bcas pa'i ba lang khal bkal ba'i ma he zug rdu dang bcas pa'i phag / lcags kyu dang bcas pa'i glang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i brjod pa dang shes pa'i khyad par bzhin no //
translated: For example, the expression and cognition of the individual, the universal, etc. are different, as in the case of the expressions and cognitions of a cow with a calf, a buffalo carrying a load, a pig with a thorn, and an elephant with a goad.

original: chos mi mthun pa ni gong bu la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo brjod pa dang shes pa'i khyad par rnams so //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa ni gong bu la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo brjod pa dang shes pa'i khyad par rnams so //
