translated: The dissimilar example is the expression and cognition of the individual, the aggregate, etc.

original: gang dag rgyu mtshan gzhan yin ba de dag ni ba lang nyid la sogs pa yin par grub po //
analyzed: gang dag rgyu mtshan gzhan yin ba de dag ni ba lang nyid la sogs pa yin par grub po //
translated: Those that have a different reason are established as cowness, etc.

original: de la brjod pa ni sgra'o //üîΩshes pa ni shes pa dang brjod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la brjod pa ni sgra'o // shes pa ni shes pa dang brjod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Among them, expression is sound.üîΩCognition is the meaning of cognition and expression.

original: shes pa brjod pa dag nyid khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa brjod pa dag nyid khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
translated: The inclusion of the particular is just cognition and expression.

original: brda ni brdar byas pa'o //
analyzed: brda ni brdar byas pa'o //
translated: A sign is that which is made into a sign.

original: byad gzugs ni dbyibs so //
analyzed: byad gzugs ni dbyibs so //
translated: A shape is a configuration.

original: gong bu ni rdzas so //
analyzed: gong bu ni rdzas so //
translated: A substance is a collection.

original: sogs pa'i sgras gzugs la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras gzugs la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include color and so on.üîΩThe other reasons for similarity are those that are similar to the individual expressions and cognitions of a nature that is different from those.

original: de dag las tha dad pa'i rang gi ngo bo rang gi brjod pa dang shes pa so so la rjes su mthun pa dang khyad par yin pa'i phyir 'dra ba'i rgyu mtshan gzhan rnams gang dag yin pa de dag rgyu mtshan du gang dag la zhes tshig rnamüîΩpar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag las tha dad pa'i rang gi ngo bo rang gi brjod pa dang shes pa so so la rjes su mthun pa dang khyad par yin pa'i phyir 'dra ba'i rgyu mtshan gzhan rnams gang dag yin pa de dag rgyu mtshan du gang dag la zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The words ‚Äúthose that are reasons‚Äù are to be connected with ‚Äúthose that are reasons for similarity.

original: yang na de dag ni brda la sogs pa las tha dad pa yang yin la yod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa dang brjod bar rang gi ngo bo'i rjes su byed pa dang 'dres pa yin zhes tshig rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na de dag ni brda la sogs pa las tha dad pa yang yin la yod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa dang brjod bar rang gi ngo bo'i rjes su byed pa dang 'dres pa yin zhes tshig rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: ‚Äù Alternatively, the words ‚Äúthose that are reasons for similarity‚Äù are to be connected with ‚Äúthose that are different from signs and so on, and that are mixed with the expressions and cognitions of existence and so on that conform to their own natures.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: ‚Äù The rest is as before.

original: smras ste zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
analyzed: smras ste zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is said‚Äù is the thesis.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'i shes pas 'khrul par dogs pa la de yongs su spang ba'i don du ba lang la sogs pa yul nyid yin ba na zhes khyad par du byas so //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'i shes pas 'khrul par dogs pa la de yongs su spang ba'i don du ba lang la sogs pa yul nyid yin ba na zhes khyad par du byas so //
translated: The cognition of the rabbit‚Äôs horns and so on is suspected of being erroneous. In order to completely eliminate that, the qualification ‚Äúwhose object is a cow and so on‚Äù is made.

original: gong bu la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i brjod pa dang shes pa las tha dad pa'i brjod pa dang shes pa gang la yod pa de'i dngos po ni de nyid do zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //üîΩchos mi mthun pa'i gong bu la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i yul can gyi @292a * //
analyzed: gong bu la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i brjod pa dang shes pa las tha dad pa'i brjod pa dang shes pa gang la yod pa de'i dngos po ni de nyid do zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro // chos mi mthun pa'i gong bu la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i yul can gyi @292a * //
translated: The thing that has a designation and cognition that are different from the designation and cognition of the entity of a composite and so on is that very thing itself.üîΩThe cognition and designation of the entity of a composite and so on that have a dissimilar object

original: brjod pa dang shes pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba de la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa na ji skad du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod pa dang shes pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba de la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa na ji skad du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are called ‚Äúdifferent from that and so on.‚Äù If there is no other reason, then the previously stated reason does not exist.

original: 'od byed pas smras pa /
analyzed: 'od byed pas smras pa /
translated: ƒÄlokakara says:

original: ba lang la sogs pa la rjes su 'jug pa'i shes pa ni gong bu la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: ba lang la sogs pa la rjes su 'jug pa'i shes pa ni gong bu la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan las byung ba yin te /
translated: The cognition that engages a cow, etc. arises from a reason that is different from the mass, etc.

original: bye brag dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bye brag dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: because it has a particular,

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: like the cognition of blue, etc.

original: de bzhin du ba lang nyid ni ba lang la don gzhan yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ba lang nyid ni ba lang la don gzhan yin te /
translated: Similarly, cowness is a different object from a cow,

original: shes pa tha dad pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa tha dad pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is the object of a different cognition,

original: gzugs dang reg pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang reg pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like form, touch, etc.

original: de'i shes bya'i tha snyad kyi yul yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i shes bya'i tha snyad kyi yul yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is the object of the convention that it is known,üîΩlike, for example, the horse of Bala.

original: dper na nag pa'i rta bzhin no zhes bya ba ni nag pa las tha dad par bstan pa yin no ;
analyzed: dper na nag pa'i rta bzhin no zhes bya ba ni nag pa las tha dad par bstan pa yin no ;
translated: This is the teaching that it is different from Bala.

original: /'di nyid bstan pa ni ba lang la sogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste go bar zad do //
analyzed: /'di nyid bstan pa ni ba lang la sogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste go bar zad do //
translated: The teaching of this is ‚Äúin a cow, etc.‚Äù and so on. It is easy to understand.

original: de kun snying po med pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: de kun snying po med pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: He replies with ‚Äúall of that is without essence,‚Äù etc.

original: gang yang yod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa ni dbang po'i bya ba yod pa'i phyir dbang po la brten pa yin no zhes smras pa de la /
analyzed: gang yang yod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa ni dbang po'i bya ba yod pa'i phyir dbang po la brten pa yin no zhes smras pa de la /
translated: The cognition of existence and so on is dependent on the sense faculty because the activity of the sense faculty exists.

original: gal te dngos su dbang po'i bya ba'i de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don du 'dod na de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub ste rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis brda gzo ba dang dran pa la sogs pas bar chod pa'i
analyzed: gal te dngos su dbang po'i bya ba'i de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don du 'dod na de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub ste rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis brda gzo ba dang dran pa la sogs pas bar chod pa'i
translated: If you assert that the meaning of the reason is because it occurs immediately after the activity of the sense faculty, then the reason is not established because it is interrupted by conceptual thought, understanding signs, memory and so on.

original: phyir ro // rjes su 'gro ba gcig med par phan tshun zlog pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po rnams brgyud pas kyang tha mi dang pa rnam pa'i shes pa'i rgyu mtshan du rigs pa ma yin zhes bya ba 'di yang brjod par rigs pa ma yin te zhes dogs pa la
analyzed: phyir ro // rjes su 'gro ba gcig med par phan tshun zlog pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po rnams brgyud pas kyang tha mi dang pa rnam pa'i shes pa'i rgyu mtshan du rigs pa ma yin zhes bya ba 'di yang brjod par rigs pa ma yin te zhes dogs pa la
translated: It is also illogical to say that things that are mutually exclusive by nature cannot be the causes of a single subsequent effect even indirectly.

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond: For example,

original: ji ltar skyu ru ra la sogs pa phan tshun shin tu tha dad pa'i lus can rnams kyang re re 'am tshogs pas rjes su 'gro ba med pa yang nad rnam pa sna tshogs pa bzlog pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar skyu ru ra la sogs pa phan tshun shin tu tha dad pa'i lus can rnams kyang re re 'am tshogs pas rjes su 'gro ba med pa yang nad rnam pa sna tshogs pa bzlog pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Just as the amalaka and so on, which have completely different bodies, either individually or collectively, are not concomitant, yet they are endowed with the ability to cure various diseases.

original: de la spyi nyid rnam pa de lta bu'i don bya ba byed pa sgrub par byed do zhes kyang brjod par mi rigs te /
analyzed: de la spyi nyid rnam pa de lta bu'i don bya ba byed pa sgrub par byed do zhes kyang brjod par mi rigs te /
translated: And it is not correct to say that the universal itself performs the function of accomplishing the various actions,

original: gang gi phyir de dag la don byed pa sna tshogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i spyi yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag la don byed pa sna tshogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i spyi yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: because those do not have a universal that exists and accomplishes the various actions.

original: gal te yod na de'i tshe gang 'di 'ga' zhig tu res 'ga' skyu ru ra la sogs pa myur ba dang 'gro bar nad la sogs pa zhi bar byed pa'i nus pa dmigs pa der mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yod na de'i tshe gang 'di 'ga' zhig tu res 'ga' skyu ru ra la sogs pa myur ba dang 'gro bar nad la sogs pa zhi bar byed pa'i nus pa dmigs pa der mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it did exist, then at that time, the observation of the ability of the amalaka and so on to quickly cure diseases in some places and at some times would not occur,

original: spyi gcig gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi gcig gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would have a single nature.

original: zhing dang 'o mas bcus pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed @292b pa'i khyad par bsgrub pa'i spyi nyid don bya ba sna tshogs sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes rigs pa ni ma yin te /üîΩde ni rtag pa nyid kyis zhing la sogs pa'i khyad par las kyang gzhan gyis rnam par 'gyur bar ma skyed pa las ni khyad par 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: zhing dang 'o mas bcus pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed @292b pa'i khyad par bsgrub pa'i spyi nyid don bya ba sna tshogs sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes rigs pa ni ma yin te / de ni rtag pa nyid kyis zhing la sogs pa'i khyad par las kyang gzhan gyis rnam par 'gyur bar ma skyed pa las ni khyad par 'ga' yang med de /
translated: The universal of the specific fabrication of the cow, such as the field, the milk, and so on, is not the cause of the various actions.

original: gcig gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not logical, because it is permanent. It does not generate any difference from the difference of the field and so on, because it is the nature of one.

original: skyu ru ra la sogs pa mi rtag pa rnams ni zhing la sogs pa khyad par las khyad par dang bcas pa yod pas de'i phyir de nyid nad la sogs pa zhi ba la sogs pa zhi ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa yin no // de lta yin
analyzed: skyu ru ra la sogs pa mi rtag pa rnams ni zhing la sogs pa khyad par las khyad par dang bcas pa yod pas de'i phyir de nyid nad la sogs pa zhi ba la sogs pa zhi ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa yin no // de lta yin
translated: But impermanent things such as the myrobalan fruit have a difference from the difference of the field and so on. Therefore they have the ability to pacify such things as disease.üîΩIf that is so,

original: dang bum pa la sogs pa dngos po gzhan yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: dang bum pa la sogs pa dngos po gzhan yang de bzhin te /
translated: other things such as the pot are also like that.

original: rgyu dang rkyen dag las de ltar skye ba'i phyir rang bzhin gyis rnam pa gcig gi ngo shes pa la sogs par 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen dag las de ltar skye ba'i phyir rang bzhin gyis rnam pa gcig gi ngo shes pa la sogs par 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: Because it arises in that way from causes and conditions, there is no error because it would be intrinsically cognized in one aspect, and so on.

original: 'dra bar shes pa la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sogs pa'i sgra chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i don byed par nus pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'dra bar shes pa la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sogs pa'i sgra chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i don byed par nus pa gzung ngo //
translated: With respect to the statement ‚Äúcognition of similarity, and so on,‚Äù the word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the apprehension of clouds and so on.

original: yang ji ltar 'di dag gi brda gzo ba la sogs pa bar du chod pa nyid 'grub pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar 'di dag gi brda gzo ba la sogs pa bar du chod pa nyid 'grub pa yin zhe na /
translated: Again, how is it established that the comprehension of signs and so on are intervening conditions?

original: 'bras bu tsam la zhes bya ba sogs pa smos te brda ma bzung ba rnams la yod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu tsam la zhes bya ba sogs pa smos te brda ma bzung ba rnams la yod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa skye ba ma yin te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúOnly the effect,‚Äù and so on. The cognition of existence and so on does not arise in those who have not comprehended the signs.

original: gzhan du na brda byed pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na brda byed pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the one who makes the signs would be pointless.

original: de lta bas na gcig gi rnam par zhen pa 'di la bar du chod pa'i don byed par nus pa tsam bstan par 'dod pa khyad par gzhan ma spangs par yong pa zhes sgra sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gcig gi rnam par zhen pa 'di la bar du chod pa'i don byed par nus pa tsam bstan par 'dod pa khyad par gzhan ma spangs par yong pa zhes sgra sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this case of the conception of unity, the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is used to indicate that the object is capable of producing an effect that is interrupted by something else, without indicating any other distinction.

original: brda byed pa'am ji ltar dga' bar gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan dngos po'i sgra'o //
analyzed: brda byed pa'am ji ltar dga' bar gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan dngos po'i sgra'o //
translated: Or, as one likes, it is also applied to another, that is, to another thing.

original: de bzhin ba lang la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi sgra yang 'gal ba la sogs pa'i nus pa'i khyad par shes par 'dod pa na brda byed pa yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin ba lang la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi sgra yang 'gal ba la sogs pa'i nus pa'i khyad par shes par 'dod pa na brda byed pa yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù is applied to a particular cow when one wishes to indicate the distinction of its capacity to produce an effect that is not contradictory, and so on.

original: de lta yin dang brda'i dus su phyis tha snyad kyi dus su mthong ba'i ba lang la sogs pa la yang sngar brda gzo //
analyzed: de lta yin dang brda'i dus su phyis tha snyad kyi dus su mthong ba'i ba lang la sogs pa la yang sngar brda gzo //
translated: If that is so, then at the time of the convention, the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù is applied to a particular cow that is seen later at the time of usage.

original: de las de dran par bya'o //
analyzed: de las de dran par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should remember that particular cow.üîΩAfter that, the cognition of its existence and so on arises.

original: de'i 'og tu yod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa skye ba yin zhes gsal ba rab tu shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa skye ba yin zhes gsal ba rab tu shes pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the clear understanding of the object is known.

original: shin tu goms pa 'ga' zhig ni /
analyzed: shin tu goms pa 'ga' zhig ni /
translated: Some who are very familiar

original: ches myur bar skye ba'i phyir 'di dag gi rim pa mi 'dzin la /
analyzed: ches myur bar skye ba'i phyir 'di dag gi rim pa mi 'dzin la /
translated: Because they arise so quickly, their order is not apprehended.

original: goms pa zhan pa ni gsal rab tu 'dzin par byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: goms pa zhan pa ni gsal rab tu 'dzin par byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: But the weak one is the one that clearly apprehends.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa ste /
translated: Therefore means in summary.

original: de'i phyir ni de lta bas na ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir ni de lta bas na ste /
translated: Therefore means because of that.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na brda gzo ba la sogs pas bar du chod pa'i phyir dngos su mi skye bas 'di dag mngon sum nyid du ma grub po /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na brda gzo ba la sogs pas bar du chod pa'i phyir dngos su mi skye bas 'di dag mngon sum nyid du ma grub po /
translated: Therefore, since they arise directly due to the obstruction of the learned and so on, they are not established as direct perception.

original: brgyud nas skye ba na yang mngon sum nyid @293a * //
analyzed: brgyud nas skye ba na yang mngon sum nyid @293a * //
translated: Even if they arise indirectly, it is not logical that they are direct perception.

original: du rigs pa ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: du rigs pa ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: This is because it would follow that anything could be direct perception.

original: dran pa yin pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i dran pa bzhin du yod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa ni mngon sum nyid du rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di las kyang ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dran pa yin pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i dran pa bzhin du yod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa ni mngon sum nyid du rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di las kyang ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The cognition of existence and so on is not logical as direct perception, because it is memory, like another memory. This is also the case.

original: dang por rtog pa med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dang por rtog pa med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, First, there is no conception and so on.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la brda mi byed pa'i phyir mthong ba'i don la mi rtogs pas /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la brda mi byed pa'i phyir mthong ba'i don la mi rtogs pas /
translated: Because it does not designate the intrinsic identity of the object, the cognition of the object of seeing does not understand the object.

original: dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid yul yin pa nyid kyis brjod pa dang 'dres pas dben pa'i chos dang por yod pa'i rnam par shes pa dbang po la brten pa skye'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid yul yin pa nyid kyis brjod pa dang 'dres pas dben pa'i chos dang por yod pa'i rnam par shes pa dbang po la brten pa skye'o //
translated: Therefore, the cognition of the object of seeing arises first, based on the sense faculty, because it has the intrinsic identity of the object as its object, and because it is mixed with expression.

original: de las te phyis mthong ba'i dngos po de nyid la brda gzo'o //
analyzed: de las te phyis mthong ba'i dngos po de nyid la brda gzo'o //
translated: After that, one learns the conventional symbol for that very object of seeing.

original: de'i 'og tu brda ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'i don gyi yul de nges pa nyid kyis mthong ba'i don de nyid la brjod pa'i yod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa skye pa ci ltar dran pa nyid sgrub par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu brda ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'i don gyi yul de nges pa nyid kyis mthong ba'i don de nyid la brjod pa'i yod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa skye pa ci ltar dran pa nyid sgrub par mi 'gyur /
translated: After that, the cognition of the object of seeing, which is the object of the conventional symbol, arises, because it is ascertained just as the conventional symbol. How could it not be established as memory?

original: de las kyang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mthong ba nges pa las so //
analyzed: de las kyang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mthong ba nges pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù means from the ascertainment of what is seen.

original: de dag go zhes bya ba ni yod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag go zhes bya ba ni yod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the cognitions of existence, etc.

original: yang gang las shes pa rnams kyi skye ba'i rim pa 'di nges pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang gang las shes pa rnams kyi skye ba'i rim pa 'di nges pa yin zhe na /
translated: From what is the order of the arising of these cognitions ascertained?

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir yod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa de dag rim pa 'dis skye ba de nyid kyis gzhan du ste yul gzhan du song ba'i sems ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa de dag rim pa 'dis skye ba de nyid kyis gzhan du ste yul gzhan du song ba'i sems ni /
translated: Because those cognitions of existence and so on arise in sequence, the mind that goes elsewhere, to another object,

original: sems yengs pa'o //
analyzed: sems yengs pa'o //
translated: is a distracted mind.

original: mdun na gnas pa'i dngos po mthong ba dngos po'i brda yid la byed pa la sogs pa 'jug pa mngon du phyogs pa ches dang por khyad par thams cad kyi dben pa'i dngos po tsam mthong bar 'jug go //
analyzed: mdun na gnas pa'i dngos po mthong ba dngos po'i brda yid la byed pa la sogs pa 'jug pa mngon du phyogs pa ches dang por khyad par thams cad kyi dben pa'i dngos po tsam mthong bar 'jug go //
translated: When seeing an object that is present in front, the mind engages in the process of considering the sign of the object and so on. First, it engages in seeing the mere thing that is devoid of all distinctions.

original: de lta ma yin te gal te rnam par shes pa thams cad rtog pa dang bcas pa yin na de'i tshe yid gzhan du song bas khyad par thams cad kyis stong pa'i dngos po ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te gal te rnam par shes pa thams cad rtog pa dang bcas pa yin na de'i tshe yid gzhan du song bas khyad par thams cad kyis stong pa'i dngos po ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, if all consciousnesses were conceptual, then how could the mind that has gone elsewhere see a thing that is devoid of all distinctions?

original: dus gcig tu cig car rnam par rtog pa gnyis rigs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dus gcig tu cig car rnam par rtog pa gnyis rigs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical for two conceptual thoughts to occur simultaneously.

original: de lta bas na de ltar dngos su dbang po'i rjes su 'gro ba dang rtog pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid ma grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na de ltar dngos su dbang po'i rjes su 'gro ba dang rtog pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid ma grub po //
translated: Thus, it is not established that the cognition of a universal is directly related to the sense faculty or that it is related to thought.

original: de la / ba lang glang chen la sogs la //
analyzed: de la / ba lang glang chen la sogs la //
translated: In response to the statement, ‚ÄúThe cognition of a cow and so on,‚Äù

original: zhes gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de la /
translated: BhƒÅviveka says,

original: de dag brda la gzo ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag brda la gzo ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is due to their familiarity with the term.‚Äù

original: gal te spyir rjes su byed pa'i 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan tsam 'di dag gi rgyu mtshan du grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te spyir rjes su byed pa'i 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan tsam 'di dag gi rgyu mtshan du grub pa yin te /
translated: If the mere other that is the cause of a related connection to a universal is established as the cause of these,

original: 'di ltar ba lang la sogs pa'i shes pa tha snyad rnams kyi rjes su mthun pa'i @293b 'brel pa can ni ba lang la sogs pa'i brda gzo ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar ba lang la sogs pa'i shes pa tha snyad rnams kyi rjes su mthun pa'i @293b 'brel pa can ni ba lang la sogs pa'i brda gzo ba kho na yin no //
translated: then the cognition of a cow and so on is related to the conventions that accord with it, and it is due to familiarity with the term cow and so on.

original: 'di ltar de yod na 'byung la rigs mi mthun ba'i yid la byed pa yod na mi 'byung ba de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa de nyid 'di dag gi rgyur grub ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de yod na 'byung la rigs mi mthun ba'i yid la byed pa yod na mi 'byung ba de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa de nyid 'di dag gi rgyur grub ste /
translated: Because it arises when that exists and does not arise when a dissimilar mental state exists, that which possesses forward and reverse pervasion is established as the cause of these.

original: der gtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rgyu 'di 'grub pa ni ;
analyzed: der gtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rgyu 'di 'grub pa ni ;
translated: The proof of the invariable concomitance and the reverse concomitance of the reason that belongs to it is

original: de yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nyid kyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nyid kyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows the existence and nonexistence of that.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba ni dal ba ni 'bras bu med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba ni dal ba ni 'bras bu med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the application of the reason is: ‚ÄúThe slow one is without effect.‚Äù

original: ci ste brda nyid la byed pa 'di ni phyogs nyid kyi khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir de dag las ma gtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba rtag pa dang gcig pu'i spyi zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa can 'di dag gi rgyu mtshan du sgrub na /
analyzed: ci ste brda nyid la byed pa 'di ni phyogs nyid kyi khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir de dag las ma gtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba rtag pa dang gcig pu'i spyi zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa can 'di dag gi rgyu mtshan du sgrub na /
translated: But if this is taken to be the case with respect to mere convention, then since it is included within the position itself, it is established as the reason for those that are not excluded from that, namely, the relation called the universal of the permanent and the single.

original: de'i tshe dpe bsgrub par bya ba ma tshang ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe dpe bsgrub par bya ba ma tshang ba yin no //
translated: In that case, the example is incomplete with respect to the probandum.

original: de lta bur gyur pa dang gang du yang rjes su 'gro ba ma grub ste /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa dang gang du yang rjes su 'gro ba ma grub ste /
translated: And it is not established that it is invariably concomitant with that,

original: gang yang be'u dang myu gu la sogs pa 'di dag be'u dang bcas pa la sogs pa brjod pa dang shes pa'i rgyu nyid du brjod de /
analyzed: gang yang be'u dang myu gu la sogs pa 'di dag be'u dang bcas pa la sogs pa brjod pa dang shes pa'i rgyu nyid du brjod de /
translated: because it is said that the calves, sprouts, and so on are the cause of the expression and the cognition of the possession of the calves, and so on.

original: de dag kyang de'i rgyu can nyid du ma grub ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang de'i rgyu can nyid du ma grub ste /
translated: And they are not established as the cause of that.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid thob pa can gyi dngos po 'di rnams ni dngos su brjod pa dang shes pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu nyid du yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid thob pa can gyi dngos po 'di rnams ni dngos su brjod pa dang shes pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu nyid du yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: These things that have obtained their own characteristics are not the cause of the particularity of expression and cognition.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni ngag dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi spyod yul las 'das pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni ngag dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi spyod yul las 'das pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the own characteristic has the nature of being beyond the sphere of all speech and thought.

original: de'i phyir dpe bsgrub bya ma tshang ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dpe bsgrub bya ma tshang ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the example is incomplete with respect to the probandum.

original: brgyud pas rgyu nyid du rtogs par byed na ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: brgyud pas rgyu nyid du rtogs par byed na ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If you try to understand it as the cause of that by way of a continuum, there is an absurd consequence.

original: thams cad thams cad la brgyud pas nye bar sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad thams cad la brgyud pas nye bar sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because everything is connected to everything else by way of a continuum.

original: 'o na gal te de lta na phyi rol gyi lcags kyu la sogs pa 'di rgyu nyid du ji ltar nges bar byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te de lta na phyi rol gyi lcags kyu la sogs pa 'di rgyu nyid du ji ltar nges bar byed ce na /
translated: Well, if that is so, how do you ascertain that this external iron hook, etc. is the cause?

original: nang tsam la ni brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nang tsam la ni brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBased on just the internal,‚Äù etc.

original: re zhig lcags kyu la sogs pa brtags pa nye bar len pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni rnam par rtog par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: re zhig lcags kyu la sogs pa brtags pa nye bar len pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni rnam par rtog par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: The hook, etc., are not the intrinsic identity of the appropriated, as has been explained.

original: kun rdzob pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par rtog pa'i bzo bos sbrul pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo yin pa nyid kyis nang tsam la yod pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: kun rdzob pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par rtog pa'i bzo bos sbrul pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo yin pa nyid kyis nang tsam la yod pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: That which is conventional has the nature of being created by the artist of imagination, and thus it exists only in the mind,

original: phyi rol ni ma yin no //üîΩskye bos mthong ba dang rnam par brtag pa dag gi rnam par dbye ba mi shes pa nyid kyis de'i rnam pa phyi rol lta bur zhen pa na phyi rol gyi dngos po nyid la rgyug pas de'i phyir lcags kyu la sogs pa rnams phyi rol gyi ngo
analyzed: phyi rol ni ma yin no // skye bos mthong ba dang rnam par brtag pa dag gi rnam par dbye ba mi shes pa nyid kyis de'i rnam pa phyi rol lta bur zhen pa na phyi rol gyi dngos po nyid la rgyug pas de'i phyir lcags kyu la sogs pa rnams phyi rol gyi ngo
translated: not externally.

original: bo nyid du ma grub bo //
analyzed: bo nyid du ma grub bo //
translated: People, not understanding the difference between what is seen and what is imagined, conceive of the form of the latter as external, and thus run after external things. Therefore, the hook, etc., are not established as external entities.

original: @294a * // lcags kyu sogs zhes bya ba dang ; dmigs nas zhes bya ba snga ma dang sbrel bar bya'o //
analyzed: @294a * // lcags kyu sogs zhes bya ba dang ; dmigs nas zhes bya ba snga ma dang sbrel bar bya'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúthe hook, etc.‚Äù and ‚Äúhaving observed‚Äù are connected with the previous line.

original: phyi rol gyi ngo bo nyid du nges pa'i nang tsam du yod pa'i lcags kyu la sogs pa la dmigs nas phyi rol la 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ngo bo nyid du nges pa'i nang tsam du yod pa'i lcags kyu la sogs pa la dmigs nas phyi rol la 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that, having observed the mere internal hook, etc., which are ascertained as having an external nature, one engages in the external.

original: nang tsam ni blo'o //
analyzed: nang tsam ni blo'o //
translated: The mere internal is the mind.üîΩAnd also,

original: gang yang / ba lang la sogs yul nyid na //
analyzed: gang yang / ba lang la sogs yul nyid na //
translated: the object itself, such as a cow, etc.

original: zhes khyad par du byas pa de yang mi rigs pa nyid de /
analyzed: zhes khyad par du byas pa de yang mi rigs pa nyid de /
translated: That is also unreasonable, because there is no object of exclusion.

original: rnam par gcad par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyu nyid smos te /
analyzed: rnam par gcad par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyu nyid smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúThe cause of the cognition of non-existence,‚Äù etc.

original: khyed cag gi bya ba dang / yon tan gyi tha snyad med pa nyid kyang med pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid du brjod pa de yang mi rigs so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyed cag gi bya ba dang / yon tan gyi tha snyad med pa nyid kyang med pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid du brjod pa de yang mi rigs so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that the mere absence of the conventions of action and quality is the cause of the cognition of non-existence is also unreasonable.

original: bya ba la sogs pa med pa rgyu nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa med pa rgyu nyid du brjod do //
translated: The absence of action, etc. is stated to be the cause.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu skyed par byed par nus pa rgyu nyid du brjod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu skyed par byed par nus pa rgyu nyid du brjod la /
translated: Thus, that which is able to generate an effect is stated to be the cause.

original: nus pa de yang dngos po la brten pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa de yang dngos po la brten pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that potentiality is itself dependent on a thing.

original: gal te dngos med pa yang rnam pa de lta bu'i nus pa dang ldan par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dngos med pa yang rnam pa de lta bu'i nus pa dang ldan par 'gyur na /
translated: If a non-thing also had such a potentiality,

original: de'i tshe ji ltar dngos po nyid du sgrub par mi byed de /
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar dngos po nyid du sgrub par mi byed de /
translated: then why would it not be established as a thing?

original: dngos po'i rgyu mtshan nyid de tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rgyu mtshan nyid de tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mere character of a thing is just that.

original: de lta yin dang med pa'i ngo bo nyid spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang med pa'i ngo bo nyid spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that were the case, the nature of non-existence would be rejected,

original: med pa ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nyams pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nyams pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because non-existence is the mere loss of the intrinsic reality of a thing.

original: gzhan yang gal te bya ba dang yon tan med pa med pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te bya ba dang yon tan med pa med pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: Moreover, if the non-existence of action and quality were the cause of the cognition of non-existence,

original: de'i tshe yod pa la sogs pa yang med pa rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yod pa la sogs pa yang med pa rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then existence and so on would also be the cause of non-existence.

original: de la yang ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du bya ba yang yon tan gyi tha snyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du bya ba yang yon tan gyi tha snyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that regard, like the horn of an ass and so on, action also would not have the name of quality.

original: gtan tshigs kyang ma grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir gong bu gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyang ma grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir gong bu gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the reason is also unestablished, he says, ‚ÄúThe cognition of a mass, etc.,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gis 'di dag de'i shes ba las gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba ba lang la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams ni gong bu la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i don gzhan du gyur par des pa yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis 'di dag de'i shes ba las gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba ba lang la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams ni gong bu la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i don gzhan du gyur par des pa yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The cognitions of cows, etc., do not exist as objects that are different from a mass, etc., by which they would be different from the cognition of that.

original: dam bca' ba yang rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dam bca' ba yang rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the thesis is also undermined by inference, he says,

original: gang phyir rjes 'gro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang phyir rjes 'gro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the cognition of a cow, etc.,‚Äù and so on.

original: khyed cag gis rjes su 'gro ba'i shes pa gong bu la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan dmigs par gyur pa sgrub par 'dod na de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: khyed cag gis rjes su 'gro ba'i shes pa gong bu la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan dmigs par gyur pa sgrub par 'dod na de yang mi rigs te /
translated: If you assert that the cognition of a cow, etc., is the observation of a reason that is different from a mass, etc., that is not correct.

original: de mi snang ba'i phyir dang mi mthun pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi snang ba'i phyir dang mi mthun pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not appear and because a color and shape that are incompatible with it appear.

original: 'di ltar khyed cag gis kha dog dang dbyibs @294b dang yi ge dang rnam pas stod pa ni ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i spyi yin par brjod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed cag gis kha dog dang dbyibs @294b dang yi ge dang rnam pas stod pa ni ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i spyi yin par brjod la /
translated: Thus, you say that the universals such as cowness are indicated by color, shape, name, and form.

original: rnam par shes pa la yang kha dog la sogs pa snang ba dang ldan bar nyams su myong ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la yang kha dog la sogs pa snang ba dang ldan bar nyams su myong ste /
translated: And you experience consciousness as having the appearance of color, etc.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar 'di'i dmigs pa yi ge la sogs pas stong pa ma yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar 'di'i dmigs pa yi ge la sogs pas stong pa ma yin par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could its object not be empty of letters, etc.?

original: gzhan gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa ni gzhan dmigs pa yin par rigs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa ni gzhan dmigs pa yin par rigs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical that consciousness having the aspect of one thing is the apprehension of another,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to the absurd conclusion that anything could be the cause of anything.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang dang mi 'dra ba'i don snang ba shes pa de ni de 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang dang mi 'dra ba'i don snang ba shes pa de ni de 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: That consciousness which appears as an object that is dissimilar to itself does not apprehend that object,

original: dper na sgra'i shes pa gzugs 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sgra'i shes pa gzugs 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: like the consciousness of sound, which does not apprehend form.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i shes pa yang rigs dang mi 'dra ba'i kha dog la sogs pa snang ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //üîΩsgra dang gsal bar snang ba can //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i shes pa yang rigs dang mi 'dra ba'i kha dog la sogs pa snang ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o // sgra dang gsal bar snang ba can //
translated: The cognition that follows is also the appearance of a color, etc., that is not of the same type.

original: zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la //
translated: The words ‚Äúand the appearance of the manifest‚Äù are to be supplied.

original: sgra ni ba lang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad dang / gsal ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: sgra ni ba lang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad dang / gsal ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Sound is the conventional expression ‚Äúcow,‚Äù etc. The manifest is the nature of color and shape.

original: de dag snang ba ni gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de dag snang ba ni gsal ba'o //
translated: The appearance of these is the manifest.

original: de 'di la yod pas de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Since it exists in this, it is endowed with that.

original: yi ge ni pa dang la la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge ni pa dang la la sogs pa'o //
translated: The letters are pa, la, etc.

original: bde byed bdag pos smras pa /
analyzed: bde byed bdag pos smras pa /
translated: The lord of the Bhargas said:

original: sngon po la sogs spyi ni sngon po la sogs pa rnam pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs spyi ni sngon po la sogs pa rnam pa nyid yin te /
translated: The universal of blue, etc., is the very form of blue, etc.

original: gzhan du na sngon bo zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa rjes su 'jug pa'i shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na sngon bo zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa rjes su 'jug pa'i shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the cognition that follows would not be of that form, i.e., blue.

original: de lta yin dang gtan tshigs ma yin la rjes su dpag pa yang mi 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin dang gtan tshigs ma yin la rjes su dpag pa yang mi 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the reason is not a reason, and the inference is not contradictory.

original: de lta bas na 'dir spyi yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir spyi yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, here he says, ‚ÄúIn that case, generality would not exist in the particular blue, etc., because they are not different in aspect.‚Äù

original: de lta na ni sngon po la sogs pa'i yon tan las sngon po nyid la sogs pa'i spyi bye brag yod par mi 'gyur te /üîΩrnam pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni sngon po la sogs pa'i yon tan las sngon po nyid la sogs pa'i spyi bye brag yod par mi 'gyur te / rnam pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, the generality of blue, etc., would not exist in the particular blue, etc., because they are not different in aspect.

original: 'di snyam du sngon po la sogs pa yon tan ni rjes su 'gro ba ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sngon po la sogs pa yon tan ni rjes su 'gro ba ma yin la /
translated: If you think that the quality of blue, etc., is not a universal,

original: spyi ni yul dang dus tha dad pa'i gsal ba la rjes su 'gro bas des na rnam pa tha dad pa yod do snyam na /
analyzed: spyi ni yul dang dus tha dad pa'i gsal ba la rjes su 'gro bas des na rnam pa tha dad pa yod do snyam na /
translated: but that the universal is a universal that pervades the particulars in different places and times, and that therefore there is a difference in aspect,

original: gcig nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gcig nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: One would not see the universal as different from the particular.

original: mngon sum gyi sngon po la sogs pa'i yon tan la ma gtogs pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i rjes su 'gro ba gzhan sngon po nyid la sogs pa rjes su 'jug pa snang ba ni ma nges te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi sngon po la sogs pa'i yon tan la ma gtogs pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i rjes su 'gro ba gzhan sngon po nyid la sogs pa rjes su 'jug pa snang ba ni ma nges te /
translated: One would not see the universal as different from the particular, because one would not see the universal as different from the quality of blue, etc., that is directly perceived.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i sngon po la sogs pa gcig snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i sngon po la sogs pa gcig snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because one would see only the uncommon blue, etc., as one.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i sems la yang sngon po nyid la sogs pa gnyis pa snad ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i sems la yang sngon po nyid la sogs pa gnyis pa snad ba ma yin te /
translated: Also, the mind that conceives blue does not conceive a second object such as blue.

original: mthong ba ji lta ba bzhin du des nges pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di @295a * //
analyzed: mthong ba ji lta ba bzhin du des nges pa'i phyir ro // 'di @295a * //
translated: Because it ascertains blue in accordance with what is seen.

original: snyam du ji ltar khyed cag gi skad cig ma nyid snang yang zhen pa rnams kyis rnam par phye nas mi mtshon pa de bzhin du spyi 'di yang yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: snyam du ji ltar khyed cag gi skad cig ma nyid snang yang zhen pa rnams kyis rnam par phye nas mi mtshon pa de bzhin du spyi 'di yang yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think, Just as you say that although momentariness appears, it is not indicated by those who conceive it because it is distinguished, so too this generality exists,

original: de yang mi rigs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs pa kho na ste /
translated: that is illogical.

original: de mthong ba'i stobs kyis gsal ba tha dad pa'i sgra dang blor 'gyur ba yin no zhes gang brjod pa de mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de mthong ba'i stobs kyis gsal ba tha dad pa'i sgra dang blor 'gyur ba yin no zhes gang brjod pa de mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable to say that the power of seeing that generality produces a different sound and awareness that is clear.

original: khyad par byed pa ma mtshon par khyad par du bya ba la blo skye ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par byed pa ma mtshon par khyad par du bya ba la blo skye ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Because awareness does not arise in regard to that which is distinguished without indicating the distinguisher.

original: dper na dbyig pa ma mthong bar dbyig pa can no snyam pa'i shes pa mi 'byung ba de bzhin du 'di la yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na dbyig pa ma mthong bar dbyig pa can no snyam pa'i shes pa mi 'byung ba de bzhin du 'di la yang 'gyur te /
translated: For example, just as the cognition thinking he has a stick does not occur without seeing the stick, so it is here.

original: 'di ltar khyed cag gis khyad par rang la sgra dang shes pa'i spyod yul las 'das par brjod pa la /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed cag gis khyad par rang la sgra dang shes pa'i spyod yul las 'das par brjod pa la /
translated: In this way, you say that the particular is beyond the domain of sound and consciousness.

original: rang las blo dang sgra'i yul las 'das pa'i lus can khyad par de dag kyang spyi mthong ba'i stobs kyis rtogs pas shes pa ji ltar de nyid mi mtshon pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: rang las blo dang sgra'i yul las 'das pa'i lus can khyad par de dag kyang spyi mthong ba'i stobs kyis rtogs pas shes pa ji ltar de nyid mi mtshon pa zhes bya ba /
translated: But the body, which is beyond the domain of mind and sound, is also understood by the power of seeing the universal. Therefore, how can consciousness not represent reality?

original: gzhan yang gang gi ltar na mngon sum rtogs pa med pa yin pa de'i ltar na snang yang ma mtshon to zhes bya ba 'di brjod par rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi ltar na mngon sum rtogs pa med pa yin pa de'i ltar na snang yang ma mtshon to zhes bya ba 'di brjod par rigs te /
translated: Moreover, according to those who claim that perception is nonconceptual, it is correct to say that even though the object is perceived, it is not represented.

original: mtshon pa ni nges pa'i shes pa'i bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshon pa ni nges pa'i shes pa'i bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because representation is the activity of a ascertaining consciousness.

original: khyed cag gang gi mngon sum thams cad rtog pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs de'i mi mtshon pa nyid mi rigs te /
analyzed: khyed cag gang gi mngon sum thams cad rtog pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs de'i mi mtshon pa nyid mi rigs te /
translated: But it is incorrect to say that according to the position that all perception is conceptual that the object is not represented.

original: mi 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it would follow that the object would not be apprehended.

original: rang gi don rtogs pa gang yin pa 'di nyid nges pa rnams kyi nges pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi don rtogs pa gang yin pa 'di nyid nges pa rnams kyi nges pa yin no //
translated: This very realization of one‚Äôs own purpose is the ascertainment of the ascertained.

original: de dag des pa dang ldan pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dag des pa dang ldan pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are not endowed with gentleness,

original: de ni 'dzin par byed pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'dzin par byed pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would not be the very thing that apprehends.

original: sngon po la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i don gzhan du gyur pa grub par khas blangs nas kyang khyed cag gi 'dod pa grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i don gzhan du gyur pa grub par khas blangs nas kyang khyed cag gi 'dod pa grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if one accepts that the object that is different from blue, etc. is established, your assertion is not established,

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i don rjes su dpag pas gnod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i don rjes su dpag pas gnod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the object to be proven, which is desired, is undermined by inference.

original: des na khyab pa ma grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na khyab pa ma grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that the pervasion is not established,

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúAnother reason,‚Äù and so on.

original: mi brtan pa las dben pa'i zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa las dben pa ste /
analyzed: mi brtan pa las dben pa'i zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa las dben pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIsolated from impermanence‚Äù means isolated from impermanence.

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means permanent.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'grub ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'grub ce na /
translated: Why is it not established?

original: rim gyis 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rim gyis 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it arises gradually.

original: ba lang la sogs pa'i brjod pa dang shes pa rnams zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: ba lang la sogs pa'i brjod pa dang shes pa rnams zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: gal te rnam pa de lta bu'i spyi'i chos 'di dag gi rgyu nyid du gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa de lta bu'i spyi'i chos 'di dag gi rgyu nyid du gyur na /
translated: If these general properties were the cause of the expressions and cognitions of cow and so on,

original: de'i tshe 'di dag rim gyis skye bar mi 'gyur gyi /üîΩrgyu mtshang ba med pa'i phyir cig car skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di dag rim gyis skye bar mi 'gyur gyi / rgyu mtshang ba med pa'i phyir cig car skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: then they would not arise in sequence,üîΩbecause their cause would be complete.

original: cig car skye ba'i dngos po du ma bzhin no //
analyzed: cig car skye ba'i dngos po du ma bzhin no //
translated: They would arise simultaneously, like many simultaneous entities.

original: gzhan gyis @295b phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa la ni ltos pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis @295b phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa la ni ltos pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And there would be no dependence on something that is not helpful.

original: da ni gtan tshigs grub pa nyid du khas blangs nas 'khrul pa nyid du bshad pa ni /
analyzed: da ni gtan tshigs grub pa nyid du khas blangs nas 'khrul pa nyid du bshad pa ni /
translated: Now, having accepted the reason as established, he explains the error:

original: tshig gi don sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshig gi don sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the words ‚Äúsound‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi tshig gi don zhes rjes su 'gro ba'i shes par 'gyur ba tshig gi don drug po rnams la tshig gi don nyid ces bya ba gzhan yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshig gi don zhes rjes su 'gro ba'i shes par 'gyur ba tshig gi don drug po rnams la tshig gi don nyid ces bya ba gzhan yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The six meanings of the words do not have another called ‚Äúmeaning of the words.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du gang gis de dag la yod ces bya ba'i shes par 'gyur ba yod pa dang spyi dang bye brag dang 'du ba dag la yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang gis de dag la yod ces bya ba'i shes par 'gyur ba yod pa dang spyi dang bye brag dang 'du ba dag la yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, the cognition that is called ‚Äúexistence‚Äù does not exist in existence, universals, particulars, or composites.

original: yod pa ni rdzas dang yon tan dang las rnam po kho na la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa ni rdzas dang yon tan dang las rnam po kho na la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because existence is only present in substances, qualities, and actions.

original: rdzas la sogs pa la spyi'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad gzhan dgag par 'dod pa'i phyir de'i sgo nas 'khrul pa ma brjod do //
analyzed: rdzas la sogs pa la spyi'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad gzhan dgag par 'dod pa'i phyir de'i sgo nas 'khrul pa ma brjod do //
translated: Since we wish to refute the convention of the universal as the reason for the existence of substances and so on, we do not mention confusion in that regard.

original: 'di snyam du yod pa la sogs pa 'di la yang yod pa dmigs pa'i tshad ma nyid kyi yul chos yod de /
analyzed: 'di snyam du yod pa la sogs pa 'di la yang yod pa dmigs pa'i tshad ma nyid kyi yul chos yod de /
translated: If you think that even in the case of existence and so on, the object of the valid knowledge that perceives existence is the property of the object of existence,

original: de'i phyir 'di la yang tha snyad 'di gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa med pa kho na'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la yang tha snyad 'di gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa med pa kho na'o snyam du sems na /
translated: then in that case, since this convention is also based on another reason, it is certainly not confused.

original: de la gzhan chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la gzhan chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, the root text states, ‚ÄúThe so-called other property . . .‚Äù

original: chos gzhan rgyu mtshan nyid du khas len na 'khrul ba'i skyon de'i gnas skabs nyid yin no //
analyzed: chos gzhan rgyu mtshan nyid du khas len na 'khrul ba'i skyon de'i gnas skabs nyid yin no //
translated: If you accept that another phenomenon is the reason, then the error of confusion is still present.

original: gang gi phyir chos gzhan de la yang chos de yod do zhes yod pa'i blo yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos gzhan de la yang chos de yod do zhes yod pa'i blo yod pa kho na'o //
translated: Because when there is another phenomenon, the cognition that it exists exists.

original: de la yang chos gzhan len na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang chos gzhan len na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept another phenomenon in that case, then there is the fallacy of an infinite regress.

original: gzhan dag kyang chos gzhan gyi rten yin pa'i phyir chos can nyid du thal ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang chos gzhan gyi rten yin pa'i phyir chos can nyid du thal ba yin no //
translated: And because other phenomena are the basis of the subject, it follows that they are the subject.

original: de lta yin dang chos can ni tshig gi don drug kho na'o zhes bya ba'i drug gi grangs nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang chos can ni tshig gi don drug kho na'o zhes bya ba'i drug gi grangs nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then the number six in the statement ‚ÄúThe subject is only six things‚Äù would not be definite.

original: ci ste thug pa med pas 'jigs nas chos gzhan mi brten pa de'i tshe tshig gi don rnams la yod pa la sogs pa'i chos 'jug pa'i shes pa 'di dag gis gtan tshigs 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: ci ste thug pa med pas 'jigs nas chos gzhan mi brten pa de'i tshe tshig gi don rnams la yod pa la sogs pa'i chos 'jug pa'i shes pa 'di dag gis gtan tshigs 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: If, fearing an infinite regress, you do not accept another phenomenon, then the reason in the statement ‚ÄúThe cognition that the property exists in the subject exists‚Äù is erroneous.

original: 'di thun mong gi ma nges pa ma yin mod ldog pa the tshom za ba gang gis spang zhes bya ba 'di bshad pa ni thams cad nye bar sdud pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di thun mong gi ma nges pa ma yin mod ldog pa the tshom za ba gang gis spang zhes bya ba 'di bshad pa ni thams cad nye bar sdud pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúwhat is to be abandoned‚Äù is ‚Äúthe inclusion of all‚Äù and so forth.

original: chos can thams cad du gtan tshigs la bsgrub byas khyab pa ston pa ni thams cad nye bar sdud pa'o //
analyzed: chos can thams cad du gtan tshigs la bsgrub byas khyab pa ston pa ni thams cad nye bar sdud pa'o //
translated: The demonstration of the pervasion of the reason by the probandum in all subjects is the inclusion of all.

original: 'di snyam du 'dir khyab pa rigs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du 'dir khyab pa rigs pa nyid yin te /
translated: In this regard, the pervasion is reasonable,

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan med na dngos po de'i shes pa mi 'dra bar ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan med na dngos po de'i shes pa mi 'dra bar ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
translated: because if there is no other reason, how could the cognition of that thing be different?

original: shes pa mang po yul mi gcig pa rnams mi 'dra ba yod pa ma yin no //üîΩgal te yod na de'i tshe gzugs @296a * //
analyzed: shes pa mang po yul mi gcig pa rnams mi 'dra ba yod pa ma yin no // gal te yod na de'i tshe gzugs @296a * //
translated: There is no difference in the many cognitions of a single object.

original: dang rol sogs pa'i shes pa rnams kyang yul tha dad par grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang rol sogs pa'i shes pa rnams kyang yul tha dad par grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were, then the cognitions of form, taste, and so on would not be established as different objects.

original: yul tha dad pa rnam par 'jog pa ni shes pa tha dad byas pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: yul tha dad pa rnam par 'jog pa ni shes pa tha dad byas pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems na /
translated: The determination of different objects is made on the basis of different cognitions.üîΩIf you think this,

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: that is also unreasonable.

original: don dam bar spyi'i shes pa dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul gcig tu rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam bar spyi'i shes pa dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul gcig tu rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: In the ultimate, it is not logical for a general consciousness to be a single entity that is the object of the characteristics of the nature of things.üîΩ

original: brjod pa dang 'dres pa'i shes pas rang gi mtshan nyid yul du mi byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on kyang dngos po gcig po de gang las ldog pa de'i rgyu mtshan can de la brda ji lta ba bzhin du goms pa'i dngos po de yang nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas 'ongs pa rnam par rtog pa dang brjod pa spyi med na yang gal te rnam
analyzed: brjod pa dang 'dres pa'i shes pas rang gi mtshan nyid yul du mi byed pa'i phyir ro // 'on kyang dngos po gcig po de gang las ldog pa de'i rgyu mtshan can de la brda ji lta ba bzhin du goms pa'i dngos po de yang nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas 'ongs pa rnam par rtog pa dang brjod pa spyi med na yang gal te rnam
translated: In the ultimate, it is not logical for a general consciousness to have a single object that is the intrinsic character of an entity because a consciousness that is mixed with expression does not take intrinsic character as its object.

original: par rtog pa 'jug na de'i cho 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: par rtog pa 'jug na de'i cho 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: However, when one is accustomed to a sign that is the opposite of a single entity, then even without a conceptual or verbal generality that has come about through the experience of that entity, if a conceptual consciousness engages it, what contradiction is there?

original: de'i phyir khyab pa med do zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyab pa med do zhes brjod de /
translated: Therefore, there is no pervasion.

original: gang yang / ba lang sogs la rjes gang las ldog pa de'i rgyu mtshan can de la brda ji lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang yang / ba lang sogs la rjes gang las ldog pa de'i rgyu mtshan can de la brda ji lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Also, the statement ‚Äúthat sign which is the opposite of a cow and so on‚Äù and so forth.

original: 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni de ma thag tu bshad pa'i gtan tshigs sun 'byin ba nyid kyis te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni de ma thag tu bshad pa'i gtan tshigs sun 'byin ba nyid kyis te /
translated: ‚ÄúBy this very same‚Äù means by the very same refutation that was just explained.

original: de la skyon mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la skyon mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the error is the same.

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa sgrub pa la sogs pa 'di la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa sgrub pa la sogs pa 'di la yang mtshungs so //
translated: In this way, the error is the same in the case of the proof of the thesis.

original: sogs pa'i sgras dpe bsgrub byas stong pa dang gtan tshigs ma grub dang / 'khrul pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras dpe bsgrub byas stong pa dang gtan tshigs ma grub dang / 'khrul pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù are meant to include the examples that are empty with respect to the probandum, the reason that is not established, and the reason that is contradictory, and so on.üîΩIt is also explained that the reason is contradictory in another way.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang 'khrul pa nyid du bshad pa rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya bal sogs pa sogs pa smos pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang 'khrul pa nyid du bshad pa rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya bal sogs pa sogs pa smos pa ste /
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refer to the following.üîΩThe reason that is the property of the position is not established, because the reason that is the property of the position does not exist in the similar example.

original: gang gis 'tshed pa po dang 'don pa po zhes bya ba rjes su 'jug pa'i shes bar 'gyur ba de la gcig rjes su 'gro ba'i rgyu mtshan 'tshed par byed pa nyid dang 'don par byed pa nyid la sogs pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis 'tshed pa po dang 'don pa po zhes bya ba rjes su 'jug pa'i shes bar 'gyur ba de la gcig rjes su 'gro ba'i rgyu mtshan 'tshed par byed pa nyid dang 'don par byed pa nyid la sogs pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The reason that is the property of the position does not exist in the similar example.

original: de bzhin du snga na med pa la sogs pa med pa gzhi la med pa'o snyam pa'i shes pa ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du snga na med pa la sogs pa med pa gzhi la med pa'o snyam pa'i shes pa ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: Likewise, how can the cognition of nonexistence, such as ‚Äúnonexistent before,‚Äù etc., occur in the absence of a basis?

original: de la yang spyi yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la yang spyi yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: And in that case, there is no universal,

original: de ni dngos po la brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dngos po la brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is dependent on the thing.

original: 'dod pas sbyar ba'i ngo bo rgyal po zla ba gzir ba la sogs pa dang / nam mkha'i dkyil du brtags pa'i khang pa dkar po la sogs pa dang zhig pa dang ma skyes pa'i rgyal po mang pos bkur ba dang dung la sogs pa'i blo gcig rjes su 'gro ba med par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dod pas sbyar ba'i ngo bo rgyal po zla ba gzir ba la sogs pa dang / nam mkha'i dkyil du brtags pa'i khang pa dkar po la sogs pa dang zhig pa dang ma skyes pa'i rgyal po mang pos bkur ba dang dung la sogs pa'i blo gcig rjes su 'gro ba med par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How can there be a cognition of the nonexistent, such as the king Candragupta, etc., who are connected with desire, or a white house, etc., imagined in the middle of the sky, or the past and future kings Mahasammata and Drona, etc., without a universal?

original: de la yang spyi yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la yang spyi yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: And in that case, there is no universal,

original: de ni gsal ba la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gsal ba la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is dependent on the manifestation.

original: 'tshed pa po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'tshed pa po la sogs pa shes pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'tshed pa po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'tshed pa po la sogs pa shes pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of the cook, etc. is not established by the words ‚Äúthe cook,‚Äù etc.

original: 'tshed pa @296b po la sogs pa dag la las kyis rgyu mtshan can gyi blo yin no zhes brjod par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'tshed pa @296b po la sogs pa dag la las kyis rgyu mtshan can gyi blo yin no zhes brjod par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not correct to say that the cognition of the reason of the action is in the cook, etc.

original: las de yang gsal ba re re la gsal ba bzhin du tha dad pa khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las de yang gsal ba re re la gsal ba bzhin du tha dad pa khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you accept that action is different, like the individual manifestations.

original: tha dad pa dag la rjes su 'gro ba med bar rjes su 'gro ba'i shes pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tha dad pa dag la rjes su 'gro ba med bar rjes su 'gro ba'i shes pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not tenable that a cognition that is not related to different things is related to them.

original: khyed cag gis gsal ba thams cad la rjes su zhugs pa'i spyi brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: khyed cag gis gsal ba thams cad la rjes su zhugs pa'i spyi brtags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore you impute a universal that pervades all manifestations.

original: gal te las rjes su 'gro bas stong yang tha mi dad pa'i shes pa dang brjod pa'i rgyur 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te las rjes su 'gro bas stong yang tha mi dad pa'i shes pa dang brjod pa'i rgyur 'gyur na /
translated: If action were the cause of nondifferent cognition and expression even though it is empty of relation,

original: de'i tshe gang gis de dag yongs su spangs nas spyi de'i rgyu nyid du rtog bar byed pa gsal ba dag la ci zhig gsung /
analyzed: de'i tshe gang gis de dag yongs su spangs nas spyi de'i rgyu nyid du rtog bar byed pa gsal ba dag la ci zhig gsung /
translated: then what is the use of positing a universal that is the cause of those, abandoning those individual manifestations?

original: gzhan yang gal te 'tshed pa po la sogs pa la shes pa las kyi rgyu mtshan can du 'gyur na de'i tshe bya ba dang bral ba ste 'tshed par mi byed pa la 'tshed pa po zhes bya ba shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te 'tshed pa po la sogs pa la shes pa las kyi rgyu mtshan can du 'gyur na de'i tshe bya ba dang bral ba ste 'tshed par mi byed pa la 'tshed pa po zhes bya ba shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if the one who cooks, etc. were to be the consciousness that has the action as its causal condition, then at that time, the one who cooks, etc. would not be the one who cooks, etc. because he would be devoid of action.

original: gang gis bya ba dang bral ba la yang shes par 'gyur bo khyed cag gis rigs pa bzhin du las rtag tu nye bar 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis bya ba dang bral ba la yang shes par 'gyur bo khyed cag gis rigs pa bzhin du las rtag tu nye bar 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But you do not accept that the action is always present in the same way that the consciousness is present.

original: gang zhig gang gi rgyu mtshan yin pa de ni de med par 'byung bar 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rgyu mtshan yin pa de ni de med par 'byung bar 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible for that which is the causal condition of something to occur without that thing,

original: ha cang thal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ha cang thal ba'i phyir te /
translated: because that would be absurd.

original: de lta na thams cad kyi rgyur 'gyur ro //üîΩ'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i las ni de'i shes pa'i rgyu mtshan du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na thams cad kyi rgyur 'gyur ro // 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i las ni de'i shes pa'i rgyu mtshan du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: In that case, everything would be the cause of everything.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa de dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa de dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Past and future action are not suitable as the causal condition of the consciousness because they do not exist.

original: med pa yang rgyur mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa yang rgyur mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also untenable that a nonexistent is a cause.

original: bde byed bdag po na re /
analyzed: bde byed bdag po na re /
translated: The master ≈öubhagupta says:

original: 'tshed pa po la sogs pa rjes su 'jug pa'i shes pa de'i las kyi rigs dang 'brel pa'i bya ba dang ldan pa de las 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'tshed pa po la sogs pa rjes su 'jug pa'i shes pa de'i las kyi rigs dang 'brel pa'i bya ba dang ldan pa de las 'gyur te /
translated: The cognition that engages the object, such as the one who cooks, possesses the action that is related to the type of action.

original: des na bya ba dang bral ba la yang bya bas bstan pa'i rgyu mtshan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na bya ba dang bral ba la yang bya bas bstan pa'i rgyu mtshan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, even when it is devoid of action, it is still indicated by the action.

original: 'tshed pa po la sogs pa'i shes pa zhes nges par byed pa yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: 'tshed pa po la sogs pa'i shes pa zhes nges par byed pa yin no zhes zer te /
translated: Thus, it is ascertained that the cognition is the one who cooks, etc.

original: de ston pa ni gal te zhig pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ston pa ni gal te zhig pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation of this is ‚ÄúIf the one who cooks is the one who has ceased cooking. . . . ‚Äù

original: des zhes bya ba ni bya bas so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni bya bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means by the action.

original: bstan pa'i rgyu ni bya ba nyid kyis rigs so //
analyzed: bstan pa'i rgyu ni bya ba nyid kyis rigs so //
translated: The reason for the indication is the action itself.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúIf the one who cooks is the one who has ceased cooking. . . . ‚Äù

original: rang gi rten ni bya ba'i rigs te /
analyzed: rang gi rten ni bya ba'i rigs te /
translated: The basis of that is the type of action.

original: de nyid bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid bya ba yin no //
translated: That itself is the action.

original: rten 'dzin pa med par rigs 'ba' zhig 'dzin pa 'am gnas pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rten 'dzin pa med par rigs 'ba' zhig 'dzin pa 'am gnas pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Without the apprehension of the basis, there is no apprehension or existence of the type alone.

original: mi brten pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi brten pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be baseless.

original: 'di snyam du lan cig rigs mtshon pa nyid kyi phyir las dang bral na yang de'i rgyu mtshan gyi shes pa de'i rten la 'jug go snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du lan cig rigs mtshon pa nyid kyi phyir las dang bral na yang de'i rgyu mtshan gyi shes pa de'i rten la 'jug go snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that even when separated from the action, the cognition of that reason is applied to its basis because the type was once indicated,

original: dbyig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩde lta @297a * //
analyzed: dbyig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / de lta @297a * //
translated: then it is said: ‚ÄúThe stick, etc.‚Äù

original: na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, there would be an absurd consequence.

original: dbyig pa la sogs pa'i rigs rnams lan cig mtshon pa'i phyir lha spyin la sogs pa dbyig pa la sogs dor ba de dag la yang dbyig pa can dang rna cha can zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i blor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbyig pa la sogs pa'i rigs rnams lan cig mtshon pa'i phyir lha spyin la sogs pa dbyig pa la sogs dor ba de dag la yang dbyig pa can dang rna cha can zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i blor 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the types of the stick, etc. were once indicated, then even when Devadatta, etc. have discarded the stick, etc., the cognition of ‚Äúthe one with a stick‚Äù and ‚Äúthe one with earrings‚Äù would occur.

original: 'tshed pa po nyid la sogs pa'i rigs 'di la yang yod do zhes bya bar yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'tshed pa po nyid la sogs pa'i rigs 'di la yang yod do zhes bya bar yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that this type of the cooker, etc. exists.

original: deng skyes pa la yang rigs yod pa'i phyir 'tshed pa po la sogs pa'i blor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: deng skyes pa la yang rigs yod pa'i phyir 'tshed pa po la sogs pa'i blor 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the type exists even in one born today, the cognition of ‚Äúthe cooker,‚Äù etc. would occur.

original: 'di snyam du dper na yod pa zhes bya ba'i blo 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yod pa yin na yang thams cad du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du rigs kyang rten gyi khyad par dang 'du ba can du 'gyur na yang thams cad du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di snyam du dper na yod pa zhes bya ba'i blo 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yod pa yin na yang thams cad du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du rigs kyang rten gyi khyad par dang 'du ba can du 'gyur na yang thams cad du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, though the potential is a cause of the occurrence of the object, it does not occur in all cases.

original: des na deng skyes pa'i gnas skabs su rigs dang 'du ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na deng skyes pa'i gnas skabs su rigs dang 'du ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, at the time of birth, the potential is not a cause of the occurrence of the object.

original: 'du ba can zhes bya ba mi mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: 'du ba can zhes bya ba mi mtshon pa ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúoccurrence‚Äù is not a metaphor.

original: gsal ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gsal ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba yang shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the term ‚Äúnonmanifest‚Äù is also not a metaphor.

original: 'o na de lta na nam yang de de dang 'du bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na nam yang de de dang 'du bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then it would never occur in that way,

original: 'di ltar ches dang por rigs dang rdzas de dag de dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin dang mi mthun pa'i phyir 'du ba mi skye la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ches dang por rigs dang rdzas de dag de dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin dang mi mthun pa'i phyir 'du ba mi skye la /
translated: because at first, the substance of the potential and the object are not compatible with the nature of that which is related, so the occurrence of the object does not arise.

original: phyis kyang de dang mi mthun ba de'i gnas skabs nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyis kyang de dang mi mthun ba de'i gnas skabs nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Later, it is not compatible with that, because it is just the state of that.

original: ji ltar 'du bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar 'du bar 'gyur /
translated: How could it occur?

original: gang gis de phyis khyad par can du 'gyur ba khyed cag gi lugs kyis rdzas skad cig ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de phyis khyad par can du 'gyur ba khyed cag gi lugs kyis rdzas skad cig ma ni ma yin no //
translated: But in your system, the substance is not momentary, so how could it later become special?

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'du ba can no //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'du ba can no //
translated: ‚ÄúJust like that‚Äù means just like the assemblage.
