original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni rigs dang rdzas dag gi'o //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni rigs dang rdzas dag gi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTheir‚Äù refers to the type and substance.

original: de bdag nyid ces bya ba ni  ma'i rang bzhin mi mthun pa'i ngo bo ma dor ba nyid pa'o //
analyzed: de bdag nyid ces bya ba ni  ma'i rang bzhin mi mthun pa'i ngo bo ma dor ba nyid pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIts nature‚Äù means the nature of the mother, which does not discard its own incompatible essence.

original: ji ste rdzas mi rtag pa nyid du khas len na de'i tshe yang nyes pa yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ste rdzas mi rtag pa nyid du khas len na de'i tshe yang nyes pa yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: If one asserts that the substance is impermanent, then at that time there is also a fault. To demonstrate this, it says:

original: gal te gsal bzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te gsal bzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If the manifestation is impermanent,

original: gal te mi rtag pa nyid kyis gsal ba khyad bar du 'gyur ba yin na rigs rtag pa'i phyir sngar bzhin du byis kyang de dang 'du ba'i mi mthun pa'i ngo bo yod pa'i phyir phyis kyang 'du ba can du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa nyid kyis gsal ba khyad bar du 'gyur ba yin na rigs rtag pa'i phyir sngar bzhin du byis kyang de dang 'du ba'i mi mthun pa'i ngo bo yod pa'i phyir phyis kyang 'du ba can du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If the manifestation is impermanent, and it becomes special, then because the type is permanent, just as before, the child would also be impermanent, and because the incompatible essence exists, how could it later become an assemblage?

original: dus phyis 'byung ba'i rdzas 'du ba dang mi mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la rigs ni thams cad gnas pa yin no zhes brjod par yang mi nus te /
analyzed: dus phyis 'byung ba'i rdzas 'du ba dang mi mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la rigs ni thams cad gnas pa yin no zhes brjod par yang mi nus te /
translated: It cannot be said that the substance that occurs later is of a different nature from the substance that was combined, because the class remains the same.

original: de dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin gyi rigs rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir rdzas kyang rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin gyi rigs rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir rdzas kyang rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And it follows, absurdly, that the substance would be permanent because the class that is the nature of the relation would remain forever.

original: 'brel pa can gnyis pa med na /
analyzed: 'brel pa can gnyis pa med na /
translated: If there is no second related object,

original: de dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin mi mthun par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin mi mthun par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not logical for the nature of the relation to be different.

original: 'tshed pa la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'od @297b byed par smras pa'i lan dogs par byed pa yin te des smras pa /
analyzed: 'tshed pa la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'od @297b byed par smras pa'i lan dogs par byed pa yin te des smras pa /
translated: The response to the assertion of the followers of Brihaspati is stated in the line ‚ÄúCooking, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di ni gtan tshigs kyi don brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gtan tshigs kyi don brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is a statement of the meaning of the reason.

original: 'tshed pa po la sogs pa'i sgras rjes su 'jug pa yang yin la //
analyzed: 'tshed pa po la sogs pa'i sgras rjes su 'jug pa yang yin la //
translated: The words ‚Äúcooker,‚Äù etc., are used,

original: 'tshed pa po nyid ces bya ba'i spyi yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'tshed pa po nyid ces bya ba'i spyi yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but there is no universal ‚Äúcooker,‚Äù etc.

original: de bzhin du ba lang la sogs pa la rjes su 'jug pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du ba lang la sogs pa la rjes su 'jug pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Likewise, the so-called subsequent consciousness of a cow and so on.

original: 'di ltar khyad par gyi shes pa glo bur ba ma yin pas des na 'di'i gtan tshigs kyi don gong bu'i shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i shes pa rgyu mtshan gzhan las skye ba zhes bya ba 'di yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyad par gyi shes pa glo bur ba ma yin pas des na 'di'i gtan tshigs kyi don gong bu'i shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i shes pa rgyu mtshan gzhan las skye ba zhes bya ba 'di yin gyi /
translated: Since the consciousness of a specific object is not a sudden consciousness, the meaning of the reason is this: ‚ÄúThe consciousness arises from a different cause than the consciousness of a composite object.‚Äù

original: rjes su 'jug pa'i shes pa thams cad spyi nyid las byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa'i shes pa thams cad spyi nyid las byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: However, not all subsequent consciousnesses arise from a universal.

original: de ltar yin na 'tshed par bya ba'i gtso bo'i sgrub byed gang yin pa de 'tshed pa po'i sgras brjod pa /
analyzed: de ltar yin na 'tshed par bya ba'i gtso bo'i sgrub byed gang yin pa de 'tshed pa po'i sgras brjod pa /
translated: If that were the case, the object of the primary act of cooking would be expressed by the word cooker.

original: gtso bo de yang 'tshed pa po gzhan la yang yod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /üîΩgtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: gtso bo de yang 'tshed pa po gzhan la yang yod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na / gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: Since that primary object also exists for another cooker, there is no fault.üîΩTo respond to that, he says, ‚ÄúWhat is this primary object?‚Äù

original: gtso bo zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / gal te nus pa yin na de mi rigs te /
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / gal te nus pa yin na de mi rigs te /
translated: If it is potency, that is illogical.

original: de'i rten so so la nges pa nyid kyis gsal ba gzhan la rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rten so so la nges pa nyid kyis gsal ba gzhan la rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is ascertained in relation to each individual basis, and because it is clear, not extending to other things.

original: rdzas la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin rang dbang can yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rdzas la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin rang dbang can yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it an independent nature that is the nature of substance, etc.,

original: rdzas su 'gro ba med pa de nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas su 'gro ba med pa de nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist as a substance.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni tshig gi don drug las tha dad par 'dod pa'i chos bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni tshig gi don drug las tha dad par 'dod pa'i chos bzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes any phenomenon that is asserted to be different from the six categories.

original: gang yang rgyu mtshan gzhan las skye ba zhes bya ba 'di yin gyi zhes smras pa de la /
analyzed: gang yang rgyu mtshan gzhan las skye ba zhes bya ba 'di yin gyi zhes smras pa de la /
translated: As for what you said, ‚ÄúIt is the arising from another reason,‚Äù

original: spyi brtsal nas rgyu mtshan gzhan cung zad cig yod do zhes sgrub par byed na /
analyzed: spyi brtsal nas rgyu mtshan gzhan cung zad cig yod do zhes sgrub par byed na /
translated: if you prove that there is some other reason apart from the universal,

original: grub pa la sgrub ste /
analyzed: grub pa la sgrub ste /
translated: then you are proving what is already established,

original: brda yid la byed pa rgyu mtshan du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brda yid la byed pa rgyu mtshan du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you assert that the mental attention to the sign is the reason.

original: khyad par sgrub na rjes su 'gro ba ma tshang ba dang / 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i shes pas 'khrul pa yang yin no //
analyzed: khyad par sgrub na rjes su 'gro ba ma tshang ba dang / 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i shes pas 'khrul pa yang yin no //
translated: If you prove a distinction, then there is the fault of overextension, and the cognition of cooking, etc., is mistaken.

original: des na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'jug sdud par byed de /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'jug sdud par byed de /
translated: He concludes by saying ‚ÄúTherefore,‚Äù etc.

original: des na ste de'i phyir ro //üîΩgang gi phyir rgyu mtshan gzhan rnam par dpyad pa na 'tshed pa po la sogs pa'i yul la mi 'thad pa de'i phyir brda ji lta ba bzhin du 'tshed pa po'i zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa dang ldan pa rigs mi mthun pa rnam par gcod
analyzed: des na ste de'i phyir ro // gang gi phyir rgyu mtshan gzhan rnam par dpyad pa na 'tshed pa po la sogs pa'i yul la mi 'thad pa de'i phyir brda ji lta ba bzhin du 'tshed pa po'i zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa dang ldan pa rigs mi mthun pa rnam par gcod
translated: Therefore, for that reason.

original: pa'i dngos po tsam nges pa tha dad pa'i dngos po 'tshed pa po la sogs pa la yang tha mi dad pas blo ste shes pa skye ba yin te /
analyzed: pa'i dngos po tsam nges pa tha dad pa'i dngos po 'tshed pa po la sogs pa la yang tha mi dad pas blo ste shes pa skye ba yin te /
translated: Since the object, the cooker, etc., is not tenable when the other reason is analyzed, therefore, the cognition, the consciousness, arises in regard to the object, the cooker, etc., which is a mere thing that excludes what is not of the same type, and which is a thing that is ascertained in accordance with the convention, without being different from it.

original: thams cad du rigs mi mthun pa rnam par gcod pa yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang gi phyir de ltar spyi med na yang ba lang la sogs pa la brda ji lta ba bzhin du rnam pa @298a * //
analyzed: thams cad du rigs mi mthun pa rnam par gcod pa yod pa'i phyir ro // gang gi phyir de ltar spyi med na yang ba lang la sogs pa la brda ji lta ba bzhin du rnam pa @298a * //
translated: Because in all cases, there is the exclusion of what is not of the same type.

original: tha mi dad pa'i des  pa'i shes pa dag 'byung ba'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i des  pa'i shes pa dag 'byung ba'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Since, in this way, even though the universal does not exist, the consciousnesses that are ascertained in accordance with the convention arise in regard to the cow, etc., without being different in aspect, therefore, the reason is indeterminate.

original: de ltar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas med pa la med pa'i blo zhes bya ba de sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas med pa la med pa'i blo zhes bya ba de sgrub par byed do //
translated: Thus, he proves the cognition of non-existence with the words ‚Äúthus, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid spyi'i shes pa'i rgyu mtshan la khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid spyi'i shes pa'i rgyu mtshan la khyab pa yin te /
translated: This is the pervasion of the reason of the cognition of the universal.

original: 'di lta ste brda gzo ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste brda gzo ba'o //
translated: It is like the cognition of the conventional symbol.

original: de lta ma yin na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa la med pa'o zhes par rjes su 'jug pa'i sgra dang blo gang gis 'gal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa la med pa'o zhes par rjes su 'jug pa'i sgra dang blo gang gis 'gal bar 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, what is the contradiction in the words and cognition of ‚Äúnon-existence‚Äù in regard to the son of a barren woman, etc.?

original: 'di la rigs pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la rigs pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no logical reason for this.

original: de ni dngos po dang 'du ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dngos po dang 'du ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the mere combination of the thing and the symbol.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'gal zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu bshad pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'gal zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu bshad pa /
translated: Why is there no contradiction? The reason is stated:üîΩBecause they are engaged in the conventional symbol that is meaningless.

original: de dag don med pa'i ni brda'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rigs la sogs pa'i don med pa brda gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag don med pa'i ni brda'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rigs la sogs pa'i don med pa brda gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has a conventional symbol that is meaningless in regard to the meaning of the universal, etc., is so described.

original: de'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ni rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ni rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are engaged in that, i.e., because they follow it.

original: de dag ni shes dang sgra dag ste brda tsam gyis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag ni shes dang sgra dag ste brda tsam gyis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are cognition and sound, because they follow and reverse in accordance with mere convention.

original: 'di ni bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dir bde byed bdag po'i lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dir bde byed bdag po'i lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
translated: This is the response to the doubt expressed here by the word ‚Äúvase,‚Äù etc.

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He says:

original: dngos po med pa de dag la khyad par med pa'i shes pa mthong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa de dag la khyad par med pa'i shes pa mthong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The cognition that does not perceive a difference in those non-existent things is not a perception of a difference.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then is it?

original: bum pa'i snga na med pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa'i snga na med pa'o //
translated: It is the cognition of the non-existence of the vase prior to its production,

original: bum pa'i zhig nas med pa zhes bya ba de lta bu thams cad du med pa'i shes pa dngos po khyad par can nyid la med pa dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: bum pa'i zhig nas med pa zhes bya ba de lta bu thams cad du med pa'i shes pa dngos po khyad par can nyid la med pa dmigs pa yin te /
translated: and the cognition of the non-existence of the vase after its destruction. In all cases, the cognition of non-existence is the perception of a particular existent that is non-existent.

original: de lta bas na de'i blo thams cad du khyad par du gtogs pa'i spyi'i dbang gis 'jug pa'i phyir 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i blo thams cad du khyad par du gtogs pa'i spyi'i dbang gis 'jug pa'i phyir 'khrul pa med do //
translated: Therefore, because all those cognitions operate by the power of a universal that is included in a particular, there is no error.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni blo ste rnal ma dang sbrel lo //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni blo ste rnal ma dang sbrel lo //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to cognition, and is connected with ‚Äúreal.‚Äù

original: de ltar min zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //üîΩmi 'dra ba dang lhan cig de la brten pa med pa zhes bya ba tshig rnam par sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar min zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do // mi 'dra ba dang lhan cig de la brten pa med pa zhes bya ba tshig rnam par sbyar ba'am /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúNo, because . . .‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúbecause it is not similar and it does not depend on that‚Äù is a compound word.

original: gcig tu bsdu ba'i zlas dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu bsdu ba'i zlas dbye ba yin no //
translated: Or it is a compound word that is a dvandva compound.

original: mi 'dra ba'i phyir dang de la brten pa med pa'i phyir de ltar mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba'i phyir dang de la brten pa med pa'i phyir de ltar mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not tenable because it is not similar and it does not depend on that.

original: de la re zhig mi 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di rgyas par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig mi 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di rgyas par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: To prove that it is not similar, he says,

original: bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúA vase and so on . . .‚Äù

original: khyad par gcig rnam pa tha mi dad pa'i blo'i rgyu mtshan du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par gcig rnam pa tha mi dad pa'i blo'i rgyu mtshan du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable that a single difference is the reason for a cognition that is not different in aspect.

original: gcig nyid kyis spyi thams cad kyi 'bras bu bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig nyid kyis spyi thams cad kyi 'bras bu bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because a single difference has already established the result of all universals.

original: spyi du ma rtog pa don med par thal @298b bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi du ma rtog pa don med par thal @298b bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It follows that it is pointless to conceive of many universals.

original: de lta bas na bum pa nyid la sogs pa'i spyi'i dbang gis bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i blor 'gyur du chug mod /
analyzed: de lta bas na bum pa nyid la sogs pa'i spyi'i dbang gis bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i blor 'gyur du chug mod /
translated: Therefore, let us assume that the cognition ‚Äúpot‚Äù and so on arises due to the universal ‚Äúpot‚Äù and so on.

original: shin tu mi 'dra ba'i dngos po med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar de'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur /
analyzed: shin tu mi 'dra ba'i dngos po med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar de'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur /
translated: But how could the cognition ‚Äúnon-existent‚Äù and so on arise due to the universal ‚Äúnon-existence‚Äù and so on, since they are completely dissimilar?

original: yod pa'i dbang gis ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i blor 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i dbang gis ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i blor 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The cognition ‚Äúcow‚Äù and so on does not arise due to the universal ‚Äúexistence.‚Äù

original: dngos po rnam par 'byed par smras pa /
analyzed: dngos po rnam par 'byed par smras pa /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika says:

original: rgyu mtshan dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes pa thams cad du 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes pa thams cad du 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not asserted that all cognitions that accord with their cause are universals.

original: 'di ltar glang po dang rta dang rda ba dang seng lding la sogs pa 'dus pa dang mang po nyid kyi grangs dmag dang nags la sogs pa'i blo rnams kyi rgyu mtshan yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar glang po dang rta dang rda ba dang seng lding la sogs pa 'dus pa dang mang po nyid kyi grangs dmag dang nags la sogs pa'i blo rnams kyi rgyu mtshan yin la /
translated: For example, the cause of the cognition ‚Äúan army,‚Äù ‚Äúa forest,‚Äù and so on is the collection of many things such as elephants, horses, and so on.

original: btung ba skyur po la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyu mtshan ni rigs mi mthun pa'i rdzas sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: btung ba skyur po la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyu mtshan ni rigs mi mthun pa'i rdzas sbyar ba yin no //
translated: The cause of the cognition ‚Äúsour‚Äù and so on is the combination of different substances.

original: de lta ma yin na mang po sbyar ba zhes bya ba'i shes pas 'gyur ro zhes bya ba /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mang po sbyar ba zhes bya ba'i shes pas 'gyur ro zhes bya ba /
translated: Otherwise, the cognition called ‚Äúcombining many‚Äù would be the cognition of a universal.

original: gal te blo ni zhes bya bas dogs par byas nas /
analyzed: gal te blo ni zhes bya bas dogs par byas nas /
translated: If you think this,

original: gal te tha dad ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: gal te tha dad ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: he replies, ‚ÄúIf the cognition of a universal is different . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni spyi'i blo'o//
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni spyi'i blo'o//
translated: ‚Äú This‚Äù refers to the cognition of a universal.

original: brda'i tha dad ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: brda'i tha dad ni khyad par ro //
translated: ‚Äú The difference in the sign‚Äù is the difference in the particulars.

original: yang gang gis de skad du brjod pa 'di la khyad par du 'phags pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: yang gang gis de skad du brjod pa 'di la khyad par du 'phags pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the superiority of this method of positing universals?

original: khyad par shes na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khyad par shes na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIf one knows the difference . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: rgyu'i dngos po ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par rtogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i dngos po ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: The causal relation is to be understood through the relation of concomitance and the relation of the absence of error.

original: de yang spyi'i blo la 'dod pas sbyar ba'i brda gzo ba tsam du nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang spyi'i blo la 'dod pas sbyar ba'i brda gzo ba tsam du nges pa yin te /
translated: And that is ascertained merely through the knowledge of the sign that is accepted in the cognition of a universal.

original: 'di ltar re zhig dang por khyad par gyi yul la nyams su myong ba'i shes pa skye'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig dang por khyad par gyi yul la nyams su myong ba'i shes pa skye'o //
translated: Thus, first of all, a cognition that experiences a particular arises.

original: de skyes pa na brda byed par 'dod pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de skyes pa na brda byed par 'dod pa 'byung ngo //
translated: When that arises, there is the desire to make a sign.

original: 'dod pa de las brda de byed pa ste byas pa'o //üîΩde nas de nyid tha snyad kyi dus su thos pa ste mnyan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa de las brda de byed pa ste byas pa'o // de nas de nyid tha snyad kyi dus su thos pa ste mnyan pa'o //
translated: The sign is made, that is, created, from that desire.üîΩThen, at the time of convention, it is heard, that is, it is listened to.

original: 'di thos pa las thos pa ji lta ba bzhin du brda'i yul la dus phyis gzo ba'o //
analyzed: 'di thos pa las thos pa ji lta ba bzhin du brda'i yul la dus phyis gzo ba'o //
translated: From that hearing, the recollection of the object of the sign occurs later.

original: de las te gzo ba las tha dad pa de dag nyid la de nges pas 'jug pa las bum pa'i snyam pa la sogs pa'i blo skye ba sgrub par byed pas gnag rdzi'i bar la 'di tsam zhig blo 'di'i rgyu nyid du nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de las te gzo ba las tha dad pa de dag nyid la de nges pas 'jug pa las bum pa'i snyam pa la sogs pa'i blo skye ba sgrub par byed pas gnag rdzi'i bar la 'di tsam zhig blo 'di'i rgyu nyid du nges pa yin no //
translated: From that, that is, from recollection, the cognition of the thought of a pot, etc. arises from the engagement of ascertainment of those very things. Therefore, up to the cowherd, this much is ascertained to be the cause of this cognition.

original: nus pa ma mthong ba'i spyi rgyu nyid du rtogs pa na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nus pa ma mthong ba'i spyi rgyu nyid du rtogs pa na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one understands the generality to be the cause without seeing the capacity, there would be an absurd consequence.

original: de yang rtog na nus pa ma mthong ba nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir gzhan yang ci'i phyir mi rtog 'di rgyas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang rtog na nus pa ma mthong ba nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir gzhan yang ci'i phyir mi rtog 'di rgyas pa'i phyir /
translated: If one doubts that, then because of being the same in not seeing the capacity, why would one not doubt the other?

original: 'dre ba rjes su mthun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dre ba rjes su mthun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to elaborate on that, he says, ‚ÄúThe mixing is in accordance with the name,‚Äù and so on.

original: rjod par byed pa khyed cag gis spyi'i blo la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan tha dad pa spangs nas ngo bo ma yin pa'i dmigs pa zhes @299a * //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa khyed cag gis spyi'i blo la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan tha dad pa spangs nas ngo bo ma yin pa'i dmigs pa zhes @299a * //
translated: You proponents of consciousness have abandoned the reasonings of the mind in general and so forth, and you say that the object of the non-entity is not an entity.üîΩ

original: bya ba'i spyi rtogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba'i spyi rtogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: You, the proponents of universals, have abandoned the reasonings of the general cognition, etc., and you say that the cognition of a universal is the cognition of a non-entity called ‚Äúthe observed object.‚Äù

original: gal te yang brtags pa'i spyi de yang gzhan gyi rnam pa can gyi blo skye ba de'i tshe ji skad du bshad pa'i nus pa mthong ba brtags par 'gyur ba nyid mchog yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang brtags pa'i spyi de yang gzhan gyi rnam pa can gyi blo skye ba de'i tshe ji skad du bshad pa'i nus pa mthong ba brtags par 'gyur ba nyid mchog yin no //
translated: If the universal that is imagined is the cause of the arising of a cognition that has the aspect of something else, then it is best to admit that the power of the universal is as we have explained it.

original: de lta na ni ma mthong ba'i brtag pa byas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni ma mthong ba'i brtag pa byas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not admitted, then the imagined universal is not seen.

original: gzhan yang tha mi dad pa'i spyi ji ltar mi 'dra ba'i blo spyad par byed ces dris pa na /
analyzed: gzhan yang tha mi dad pa'i spyi ji ltar mi 'dra ba'i blo spyad par byed ces dris pa na /
translated: Moreover, when asked, ‚ÄúHow does the non-different universal serve as the object of different cognitions?‚Äù

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: the opponent replies, ‚ÄúIt is like this:

original: 'di ni dngos po rnams gyis nges pa so sor nges pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po rnams gyis nges pa so sor nges pa yin te /
translated: The particular entities are ascertained individually,

original: gal te gcig yin na yang rnam pa du ma'i shes pa skyed par bya bar nus pa yin no zhes bya bar gdon mi za bar brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: gal te gcig yin na yang rnam pa du ma'i shes pa skyed par bya bar nus pa yin no zhes bya bar gdon mi za bar brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: but if they are one, they are capable of producing a cognition with many aspects.‚Äù

original: gal te de lta na nus pa shes pa mthu nges pa'i tha dad pa de dag nyid la nus pa nges pa ci'i phyir rtog par mi byed /
analyzed: gal te de lta na nus pa shes pa mthu nges pa'i tha dad pa de dag nyid la nus pa nges pa ci'i phyir rtog par mi byed /
translated: If that is so, then why not imagine that the capacity is ascertained in relation to those very different cognitions that ascertain the capacity?

original: de lta yin na nyams su myong ba dang mi gsal ba rjes su bsgrubs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na nyams su myong ba dang mi gsal ba rjes su bsgrubs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, then the experience and the unclear [image] would be established as the same.

original: 'di snyam du spyi yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis nus pa nges pa yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du spyi yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis nus pa nges pa yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that a universal is ascertained by positive and negative concomitance,

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then the root text states, ‚ÄúIf it is nonexistent, it is not produced . . .‚Äù

original: med pas ma skyes pa'i phyir yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di dag der gtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i rjes su byed pa nyid rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: med pas ma skyes pa'i phyir yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di dag der gtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i rjes su byed pa nyid rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is nonexistent, it is not produced. Therefore it is not tenable that these cognitions of existence, nonexistence, and so on are subsequent states that conform to the object.

original: gal te 'di spyi'i rjes su byed par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'di spyi'i rjes su byed par 'gyur na /
translated: If this were to conform to a universal,

original: de'i tshe spyi thams cad du gnas pas ci'i phyir rtag tu mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe spyi thams cad du gnas pas ci'i phyir rtag tu mi 'gyur /
translated: then since the universal would be present everywhere, why would it not always be perceived?

original: spyi ni 'ga' zhig la ltos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi ni 'ga' zhig la ltos pa ma yin te /
translated: A universal does not depend on anything else.

original: de'i khyad par gzhan gyis bogs dbyung du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i khyad par gzhan gyis bogs dbyung du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its special attributes cannot be enhanced by anything else.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag der gtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i rjes su byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag der gtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i rjes su byed pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, they are not subsequent to the existence of universals, nor do they conform to them.

original: ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor do they conform to the cessation of universals.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe yod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di skye ba de'i tshe der spyi med pa rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe yod pa la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di skye ba de'i tshe der spyi med pa rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni brjod par mi nus te /
translated: Thus, when the cognition of existence and so on arises, it is not possible to say that the cause of that is the nonexistence of universals.

original: rtag pa rnams rtag tu gnas pa nyid kyis ldog pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa rnams rtag tu gnas pa nyid kyis ldog pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for permanent things to cease, since they remain forever.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag la der gtogs pa'i ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag la der gtogs pa'i ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are also not subsequent to the cessation of universals.üîΩSince the cognition of substance and so on is not the result of universals, it is not the result of anything else.üîΩTherefore, the cognition of substance and so on is not the result of universals.üîΩSince the cognition of substance and so on is not the result of universals, it is not the result of anything else.üîΩTherefore, the cognition of substance and so on is not the result of universals.

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin du rgyu mtshan gzhan khas blangs pa na spyi la sogs pa'i blo'i nyes pa yin pa de lta bas na gzhan gyi yon tan la sogs pa la rdzas ma yin pa dang las ma yin pa la sogs pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yon tan
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin du rgyu mtshan gzhan khas blangs pa na spyi la sogs pa'i blo'i nyes pa yin pa de lta bas na gzhan gyi yon tan la sogs pa la rdzas ma yin pa dang las ma yin pa la sogs pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yon tan
translated: Since the cognition of substance and so on is not the result of universals, it is not the result of anything else.üîΩTherefore, the cognition of substance and so on is not the result of universals.üîΩSince the cognition of substance and so on is not the result of universals, it is not the result of anything else.üîΩTherefore, the cognition of substance and so on is not the result of universals.üîΩSince the cognition of substance and so on is not the result of universals, it is not the result of anything else.üîΩTherefore, the cognition of substance and so on is not the result of universals.üîΩSince the cognition of substance and so on is not the result of universals, it is not the result of anything else.üîΩTherefore, the cognition of substance and so on is not the result of universals.üîΩSince the cognition of substance and so on is not the result of universals, it is not the result of anything else.üîΩTherefore, the cognition of substance and so on is not the result of universals.üîΩSince the cognition of substance and so on is not the result of universals, it is not the result of anything else.üîΩTherefore, the cognition of substance and so on is not the result of universals.üîΩSince the cognition of substance and so on is not the result of universals, it is not the result of anything else.üîΩTherefore, the cognition of substance and so on is not the result of universals.üîΩSince the cognition of substance and so on

original: nyid la sogs pa'i spyi'i khyad par yod pa la sogs spyi la spyi zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba shes pa'i rgyu mtshan don du ma dang 'du ba yin no zhes gang brjod pa de yang bsal @299b ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di bshad pa ni
analyzed: nyid la sogs pa'i spyi'i khyad par yod pa la sogs spyi la spyi zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba shes pa'i rgyu mtshan don du ma dang 'du ba yin no zhes gang brjod pa de yang bsal @299b ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di bshad pa ni
translated: The reason for the cognition of the generality of generality, which is called ‚Äúgenerality,‚Äù is the multiplicity of objects and their collection.üîΩThis is also refuted.

original: / rdzas la sogs pa min pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: / rdzas la sogs pa min pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúIt is not substance and so on,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di brtags pa na yang ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di brtags pa na yang ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: This is also taught to demonstrate that it is illogical.

original: de'i phyir spyi'i blo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi'i blo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúTherefore the cognition of generality,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te spyi'i blo'i gcig gi rgyu mtshan don du ma la 'du ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te spyi'i blo'i gcig gi rgyu mtshan don du ma la 'du ba yin na /
translated: If the reason for the cognition of generality is the collection of many objects,

original: grangs dang ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba dang yan lag can gyi rdzas la sogs pa la rdzas du ma ston pa nyid yod pa'i phyir de dag la yang spyi'o snyam pa'i blo'i rgyu mtshan 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: grangs dang ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba dang yan lag can gyi rdzas la sogs pa la rdzas du ma ston pa nyid yod pa'i phyir de dag la yang spyi'o snyam pa'i blo'i rgyu mtshan 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: then since many substances are demonstrated in the enumeration of substance, the divisions, and the parts of substance and so on, they would also be the reason for the cognition of generality.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no difference.

original: yod pa la sogs pa'i blo gcig gi rgyu nyid kyang yod pa la sogs ba'i rnam pas rang gi bdag nyid la nges pa'i phyir spyi gzhan la brten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa la sogs pa'i blo gcig gi rgyu nyid kyang yod pa la sogs ba'i rnam pas rang gi bdag nyid la nges pa'i phyir spyi gzhan la brten pa ma yin no //
translated: The cause of a single cognition of existence, etc. is the existence, etc. itself, which is ascertained in itself, and therefore the universal does not depend on another.

original: de ltar yin dang de'i stobs kyis kyang spyi dag la spyi'i snyam pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i shes pa skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang de'i stobs kyis kyang spyi dag la spyi'i snyam pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i shes pa skye ba ma yin no //
translated: And if that is so, then even by its power, the cognition that engages in the universal in the form of a universal is not produced.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: de phyir tha dad dag la gcig /'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gang yin te //
analyzed: de phyir tha dad dag la gcig /'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gang yin te //
translated: what is the reason for the engagement of a single cognition in different things?

original: yod pa sogs la spyi sgra'am //
analyzed: yod pa sogs la spyi sgra'am //
translated: Either the word for universal is applied to existence, etc.

original: yang na blo gcig byed pa yin //
analyzed: yang na blo gcig byed pa yin //
translated: or a single cognition is produced.

original: zhes ku m'a ra ri las smras pa 'di yang 'brel pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes ku m'a ra ri las smras pa 'di yang 'brel pa med pa yin no //
translated: This statement in KumƒÅrila‚Äôs Sloka-vƒÅrttika is also irrelevant.

original: de ltar re zhig mi 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ste bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig mi 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ste bshad zin to //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúbecause they are dissimilar‚Äù has been explained.

original: de la brten pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brten pa med phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it does not depend on that‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba de 'chad par 'dod nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de 'chad par 'dod nas /
translated: is explained as follows.

original: bum pa nyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba smos te spyi bum pa la sogs pa dag la 'du ba med pa dag la ni ma yin te de dag ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa nyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba smos te spyi bum pa la sogs pa dag la 'du ba med pa dag la ni ma yin te de dag ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch things as pots‚Äù are universals, not collections, because the latter are non-entities.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar med pa de dag la bum pa la sogs pa de las gzhan la 'du bas spyi'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa'i shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar med pa de dag la bum pa la sogs pa de las gzhan la 'du bas spyi'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa'i shes par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could a cognition that conforms to the universal of a pot arise in regard to those non-existent things through the aggregation of those things that are other than a pot?

original: rta la sogs pa gcig gi rnam pa shes pa'i rgyu mtshan ni glang po nyid la sogs pa ma yin no //üîΩ'on te 'di lta ste dper na ro mngar ro //
analyzed: rta la sogs pa gcig gi rnam pa shes pa'i rgyu mtshan ni glang po nyid la sogs pa ma yin no // 'on te 'di lta ste dper na ro mngar ro //
translated: The reason for the cognition of the aspect of a single horse, etc., is not an elephant, etc.

original: nub mo bsil lo //
analyzed: nub mo bsil lo //
translated: But, in the same way that one says ‚Äúsweet taste,‚Äù ‚Äúcool at night,‚Äù

original: lci'o zhes bya ba lta bur gzhan du 'jug pas kyang gzhan du shes pa skye bar mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: lci'o zhes bya ba lta bur gzhan du 'jug pas kyang gzhan du shes pa skye bar mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: and ‚Äúheavy,‚Äù is it not seen that a cognition arises in regard to one thing through the engagement of another?

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To this, we reply:

original: 'dir don gcig la brten pa min zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir don gcig la brten pa min zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúHere, it is not the case that a cognition arises in regard to a single object.‚Äù

original: rdzas gang kho na la mngar ba nyid 'du ba de kho na la bsil ba nyid la sogs pa yang yin pa'i phyir don gcig la 'du ba'i stobs kyis 'dir gzhi mthun par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rdzas gang kho na la mngar ba nyid 'du ba de kho na la bsil ba nyid la sogs pa yang yin pa'i phyir don gcig la 'du ba'i stobs kyis 'dir gzhi mthun par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because sweetness and coolness, etc. are found in the same substance, they are found in the same thing by the power of their being found in the same thing.üîΩBut the universals nonexistence, potness, etc. are not found in the same substance, because

original: med pa bum pa nyid la sogs pa'i spyi dang lhan cig gang du yang rdzas gcig la 'du ba ni ma yin te /üîΩnye bar brjod pa med pa de ni gang du @300a * //
analyzed: med pa bum pa nyid la sogs pa'i spyi dang lhan cig gang du yang rdzas gcig la 'du ba ni ma yin te / nye bar brjod pa med pa de ni gang du @300a * //
translated: they are not related to anything.

original: yang 'du ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang 'du ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not related to anything, because they are not related.

original: 'dir gal te khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'od byed pa'i lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gal te khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'od byed pa'i lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
translated: Here, if one says that the universal and the particular are related, etc. this is a question anticipating an answer from the Illuminationist.

original: des smras pa /üîΩbum pa nyid la sogs pa'i spyi na bum pa la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yin la /
analyzed: des smras pa / bum pa nyid la sogs pa'i spyi na bum pa la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yin la /
translated: He says:üîΩThe universals potness, etc. are related to the particulars pot, etc. by the relation characterized by inherence.

original: med pa rnams ni khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: med pa rnams ni khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: But nonexistents are related by the relation characterized by the relation of qualifier and qualified.

original: de lta yin dang spyi dang med pa dag don gcig la 'du ba'i 'brel pa 'di la yang tha snyad kyi rgyu yod pa kho na'o zhe'o //
analyzed: de lta yin dang spyi dang med pa dag don gcig la 'du ba'i 'brel pa 'di la yang tha snyad kyi rgyu yod pa kho na'o zhe'o //
translated: If that were so, then the relationship of inherence would be the cause of the convention in the case of the identity of the universal and the particular.

original: de la lan gdab pa'i phyir /üîΩ'brel pa gzhan ni yod pa na //
analyzed: de la lan gdab pa'i phyir / 'brel pa gzhan ni yod pa na //
translated: In response to that, he says,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen there is another relationship,‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po rnams kyi phan tshun khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po ni 'brel pa gzhan gyis bskyed pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi phan tshun khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po ni 'brel pa gzhan gyis bskyed pa yin te /
translated: The mutual difference and nondifference of things is produced by another relationship.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: dper na dbyig pa dang lha spyin dag dang rgyal po dang skyes bu dag gi rje khol gyi dngos po la sogs pa'i 'brel pa la brten nas khyad par dang khyad par can yin no //
analyzed: dper na dbyig pa dang lha spyin dag dang rgyal po dang skyes bu dag gi rje khol gyi dngos po la sogs pa'i 'brel pa la brten nas khyad par dang khyad par can yin no //
translated: the relationship of master and servant, etc., between Devadatta and a stick, and between a king and a man, is based on another relationship.

original: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po la rgyu mtshan du gyur pa'i 'brel pa gzhan de med pa la khyad par can dang khyad par de ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po la rgyu mtshan du gyur pa'i 'brel pa gzhan de med pa la khyad par can dang khyad par de ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: When there is no other relationship that is the reason for the difference and nondifference of things, how could there be difference and nondifference?

original: gzhan du na ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, there would be an absurd consequence.

original: de lta na ni thams cad kyi khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni thams cad kyi khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then everything would be a particular.

original: da ni ji ltar 'brel pa med par 'jig rten na bum pa'i snga na med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po rtogs she na /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar 'brel pa med par 'jig rten na bum pa'i snga na med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po rtogs she na /
translated: Now, how is it that in the world, without any relation, one understands the thing that is qualified, such as the non-existence prior to the pot, etc.?

original: bum pa 'di'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bum pa 'di'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The expression ‚Äúthis pot‚Äù is used, etc.

original: sngar med par gyur nas yod pa zhes bya ba'i don de tsam zhig shes par 'dod pa la blo 'di brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: sngar med par gyur nas yod pa zhes bya ba'i don de tsam zhig shes par 'dod pa la blo 'di brtags pa yin te /
translated: The idea is that one wishes to understand the mere fact that something exists after not having existed previously, and this idea is designated as the cognition.

original: dngos po las don gzhan du gyur pa lta bu dang 'brel pa lta bu'i snga na med pa rtog pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po las don gzhan du gyur pa lta bu dang 'brel pa lta bu'i snga na med pa rtog pa skye ba yin no //
translated: The non-existence prior to the pot is imagined as something different from the thing, as if it were related to it.

original: de'i bsam pa'i dbang gis 'dir khyad par dang khyad par gyi dngos po yin gyi don dam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i bsam pa'i dbang gis 'dir khyad par dang khyad par gyi dngos po yin gyi don dam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is only by the power of the intention that there is a thing that is qualified and a qualifier here, but not ultimately.

original: ji ltar rtogs pa'i bzo bos bcos pa'i dpa' ba la sogs pa'i chos kyi khyad par nyid nye bar bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs pa'i bzo bos bcos pa'i dpa' ba la sogs pa'i chos kyi khyad par nyid nye bar bzung ba yin te /
translated: The particularities of the hero, etc., imagined by the creator of the story are taken as real.

original: gang du khyed cag gis dngos po la brten pa'i khyad par dang khyad pa can gyi dngos po bzung ba der gdon mi za par 'brel pa gzhan btsal bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang du khyed cag gis dngos po la brten pa'i khyad par dang khyad pa can gyi dngos po bzung ba der gdon mi za par 'brel pa gzhan btsal bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Wherever you apprehend a specific thing that is based on an entity and a specific thing that is based on a different entity, then, without a doubt, you must search for another relation.

original: gzhan du na rnam par gzhag pa nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na rnam par gzhag pa nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the presentation would not be ascertained.

original: gzhan yang bde byed bdag pos smras pa'i lan 'di ni klan ka dang rjes su mthun pa nyid ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir med pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bde byed bdag pos smras pa'i lan 'di ni klan ka dang rjes su mthun pa nyid ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir med pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Moreover, in order to demonstrate that the response stated by the opponent is not consistent with the objection, it says, ‚ÄúThe cognition of nonexistence does not exist,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang @300b 'di bum pa med pa dang snam bu med pa dang ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa la med pa'i snyam pa'i rje su 'gro ba'i shes pa 'jug pa'i shes pa de la kho bo cag gi spyi med na yang rjes su 'gro ba'i
analyzed: gang @300b 'di bum pa med pa dang snam bu med pa dang ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa la med pa'i snyam pa'i rje su 'gro ba'i shes pa 'jug pa'i shes pa de la kho bo cag gi spyi med na yang rjes su 'gro ba'i
translated: In this regard, with regard to the nonexistence of a pot, the nonexistence of a cloth, the nonexistence of a rabbit‚Äôs horns, and so on, the cognition that engages in the thought ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù is seen to exist.

original: shes pa mthong ba'i phyir gzhan du spyi rtog pa don med do zhes klan ka byas kyi /
analyzed: shes pa mthong ba'i phyir gzhan du spyi rtog pa don med do zhes klan ka byas kyi /
translated: Therefore, although we do not accept a universal, the cognition of the universal is seen to exist.

original: bum pa la sogs pa rigs mthun pa mang po rnams kyis gang snga na med pa la sogs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa rigs mthun pa mang po rnams kyis gang snga na med pa la sogs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the cognition of a pot and so on that is absent prior to the many things of the same type.üîΩIf that is so, what follows from that?

original: gal te de lta yin na de las cir 'gyur zhe na khyad par la ni gnas pa'i spyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na de las cir 'gyur zhe na khyad par la ni gnas pa'i spyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe universal that abides in the particular,‚Äù and so on.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i khyad par la gnas pa'i spyi bum pa yid la sogs pa gang yin pa de'i rten bum pa la sogs pa nyid la 'jug gi snam bu la sogs pa rten gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i khyad par la gnas pa'i spyi bum pa yid la sogs pa gang yin pa de'i rten bum pa la sogs pa nyid la 'jug gi snam bu la sogs pa rten gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: The universal of pot that abides in the particular pot and so on engages its basis, the pot and so on, but not in other bases such as cloth.

original: de ji ltar snga na med pa la sogs pa la mi mthun pa'i snam bu la sogs pa la yod pa de las shes par 'gyur zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de ji ltar snga na med pa la sogs pa la mi mthun pa'i snam bu la sogs pa la yod pa de las shes par 'gyur zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: How is it that it exists in cloth and so on, which are incompatible with the pot and so on that are absent prior to it?

original: thams cad du rjes su 'gro ba'i spyi gcig yod do zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad du rjes su 'gro ba'i spyi gcig yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is a single universal that pervades everything,

original: de dag la ni rjes su 'jug / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag la ni rjes su 'jug / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThey are pervaded by that,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang las 'di'i shes par 'gyur ba rigs mi mthun pa'i dngos po du ma bum pa la sogs pa mtha' dag la khyab pa'i spyi gzhan yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang las 'di'i shes par 'gyur ba rigs mi mthun pa'i dngos po du ma bum pa la sogs pa mtha' dag la khyab pa'i spyi gzhan yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But there is no other universal that pervades all things of a dissimilar type, such as a pot, from which its cognition arises.

original: 'di snyam du de'i stobs kyis med pa'i shes par 'gyur ba yod pa zhes bya ba'i spyi chen po yod do snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du de'i stobs kyis med pa'i shes par 'gyur ba yod pa zhes bya ba'i spyi chen po yod do snyam na /
translated: If you think that there is a universal called existence, the cognition of which arises by the power of that,

original: de mi rigs te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi rigs te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is illogical because it is mistaken.üîΩBecause, apart from the six categories, there is no other category such as analytical cessation and so on, the cognition of nonexistence that you have is a universal that pervades all things of a dissimilar type.

original: 'di ltar tshig gi don drug las ma gtogs pa'i so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa la sogs pa'i tshig don gzhan med pa'i phyir khyed la med pa'i blo gang dag kun du rgyu pa dang / gang yang brtags pa'i gtam rgyud slu ba pa la sogs pa rdzas ma yin pa'i rang bzhin rnams kyi don dam pa med pa zhes bya ba'i blo rnams de dag la khyad par du gtogs pa'i spyi gang yin pa de'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ba gang yin khyed
analyzed: 'di ltar tshig gi don drug las ma gtogs pa'i so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa la sogs pa'i tshig don gzhan med pa'i phyir khyed la med pa'i blo gang dag kun du rgyu pa dang / gang yang brtags pa'i gtam rgyud slu ba pa la sogs pa rdzas ma yin pa'i rang bzhin rnams kyi don dam pa med pa zhes bya ba'i blo rnams de dag la khyad par du gtogs pa'i spyi gang yin pa de'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ba gang yin khyed
translated: And the cognition of nonexistence that you have with regard to the ultimate nature of those that are not substances, such as the deceptive stories of the Tƒ´rthikas, is a universal that pervades all things of a dissimilar type.

original: kyi lugs kyis so sor brtags pa la sogs pa 'di dag la yod pa nyid yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kyi lugs kyis so sor brtags pa la sogs pa 'di dag la yod pa nyid yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In the system of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas, these, such as the ‚Äúascertained‚Äù and so on, do not exist as real entities.

original: 'dis ni gzhon nu ma len gyis //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhon nu ma len gyis //
translated: This refutes the following statement by KumƒÅralƒÅta:

original: snga na med pa la sogs spyi //
analyzed: snga na med pa la sogs spyi //
translated: ‚ÄúThe general properties of nonexistence prior to the existence of the effect and so on

original: dngos po mi 'dod ma yin nam //
analyzed: dngos po mi 'dod ma yin nam //
translated: are not accepted as real entities.

original: 'di la spyi med sogs ngo bo //
analyzed: 'di la spyi med sogs ngo bo //
translated: In this regard, the general properties of nonexistence prior to the existence of the effect and so on

original: yod pa nyid ni spyi yin no //üîΩzhes gang smras pa /
analyzed: yod pa nyid ni spyi yin no // zhes gang smras pa /
translated: are real entities.‚Äù

original: de yang bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang bsal ba yin te /
translated: This is also refuted.

original: la sogs ngo bo ni skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: la sogs ngo bo ni skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe general properties of nonexistence prior to the existence of the effect and so on‚Äù is the particularities of nonarising and so on.

original: de la yang nyes pa @301a * //
analyzed: de la yang nyes pa @301a * //
translated: In this regard, the fault

original: 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid yin te /
translated: is this.

original: gang gis de med pa'i shes par 'gyur ba gzhung lugs gzhan gyi dngos po rnams dang brtags pa'i gtam rgyud rnams la ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de med pa'i shes par 'gyur ba gzhung lugs gzhan gyi dngos po rnams dang brtags pa'i gtam rgyud rnams la ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the treatises of other systems, the existence of these particularities of nonarising and so on is not accepted.

original: de nges pa'i brtags pa'i yod pa de la phyi rol gyi don gyis stong par rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nges pa'i brtags pa'i yod pa de la phyi rol gyi don gyis stong par rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the existence of these particularities is ascertained by inference, then you realize that external objects are empty.

original: gal te nge lta na  sgra'i don mtha' dag rtag pa gcig pu'i yod pa dang bral ba rnam par rtog pa tsam gyi bdag nyid du ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
analyzed: gal te nge lta na  sgra'i don mtha' dag rtag pa gcig pu'i yod pa dang bral ba rnam par rtog pa tsam gyi bdag nyid du ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
translated: If you do, then why not accept that all the meanings of words are devoid of existence as permanent unities, and are only of the nature of conceptual thought?

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: It is not so,

original: rtag pa dang gcig pur yod pa la sogs pa'i don khas len na yod pa dang skye ba tha mi dad de /
analyzed: rtag pa dang gcig pur yod pa la sogs pa'i don khas len na yod pa dang skye ba tha mi dad de /
translated: because if one accepts the meaning of permanent, unitary existence, then existence and production are not different,

original: bogs dbyung du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bogs dbyung du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no way to improve on that.

original: ji ltar tha dad pa'i ngo bor rtogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i klan ka spang dka' ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar tha dad pa'i ngo bor rtogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i klan ka spang dka' ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be difficult to avoid the criticism, ‚ÄúHow could you understand it to be a different nature?‚Äù

original: da ni 'dod pas bkod pa'i ngo bo dang / zhig pa'am ma skyes pa rnams la zhes bya ba de bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'dod pas bkod pa'i ngo bo dang / zhig pa'am ma skyes pa rnams la zhes bya ba de bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to prove the statement, ‚ÄúThings that are desired, or that have ceased, or that have not yet arisen,‚Äù

original: 'dod pas sbyar ba'i gzugs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dod pas sbyar ba'i gzugs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe form that is desired,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dod pas sbyar ba'i ngo bo ste rang bzhin gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas sbyar ba'i ngo bo ste rang bzhin gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has the nature that is desired, that is, the nature that is produced, is so called.

original: de dang por gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dang por gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: It is said that it exists at first.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni zhig pa dang ma skyes pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni zhig pa dang ma skyes pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include cessation, nonarising, and so on.

original: gang gis de'i rgyu mtshan can de dag la blos 'gyur ba brtags pa la sogs pa la spyi yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de'i rgyu mtshan can de dag la blos 'gyur ba brtags pa la sogs pa la spyi yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The universal does not exist in the conceptual thought that imagines those as its objective condition.

original: 'di snyam du brtags pa la spyi med mod /
analyzed: 'di snyam du brtags pa la spyi med mod /
translated: You may think, ‚ÄúGranted, the universal does not exist in the conceptual thought that imagines it,

original: 'das pa dang ma skyes ba la ni de'i rgyu mtshan can gyi blor 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma skyes ba la ni de'i rgyu mtshan can gyi blor 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: but the conceptual thought that imagines the past and future has those as its objective condition.‚Äù

original: de ni log yin te /
analyzed: de ni log yin te /
translated: That is incorrect.

original: rten med par 'ba' zhig pa mi gnas pa gang yin pa 'di ni brten pa rnams kyi chos yin te /
analyzed: rten med par 'ba' zhig pa mi gnas pa gang yin pa 'di ni brten pa rnams kyi chos yin te /
translated: It is a law of dependent origination that what is solitary and without a basis does not endure.

original: mi brten pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi brten pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that it would be without a basis.

original: 'ba' zhig pa rnams gnas su chug mod /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa rnams gnas su chug mod /
translated: Even if you allow that what is solitary endures,

original: de lta na yang nyes pa yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang nyes pa yod pa kho na ste /
translated: still there is a fault.

original: spyi 'ba' zhig 'dzin par khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi 'ba' zhig 'dzin par khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you do not accept that the universal is apprehended.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said,

original: spyi rtogs pa ni rang gi rten dang dbang po phrad pa la ltos pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi rtogs pa ni rang gi rten dang dbang po phrad pa la ltos pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe realization of the universal depends on the contact of its basis and the sense faculty.‚Äù

original: spyi 'ba' zhig pa yang 'dzin na spyi'i blo las gsal ba nges par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: spyi 'ba' zhig pa yang 'dzin na spyi'i blo las gsal ba nges par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If you apprehend a universal alone, then the clear ascertainment of the object would not be from the cognition of the universal.üîΩ

original: de'i tshe gsal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe gsal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you grasp a universal alone, then the cognition of the universal would not be clear, because at that time there would be no clarity.

original: 'di ni gsal ba rnams kyi spyi yin no zhes bya ba'i 'brel par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni gsal ba rnams kyi spyi yin no zhes bya ba'i 'brel par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: And it would not be related to the individual things, saying ‚ÄúThis is the universal of those,‚Äù

original: rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar / 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan yod na spyi de'i gsal bya yin pa'am /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar / 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan yod na spyi de'i gsal bya yin pa'am /
translated: because there would be no reason.

original: de'i bskyed par bya ba nyid yin pa'am /
analyzed: de'i bskyed par bya ba nyid yin pa'am /
translated: In this way, if there were a reason for the relation, then the universal would be the manifestor of the individual things, or it would be the product of the individual things, or it would be the grasper of the individual things, in dependence on the individual things.

original: de @301b 'dzin pa la ltos na 'dzin pa yin grang de lar zhig das gsal bar byas pa'i phyir spyi de dang 'brel pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de @301b 'dzin pa la ltos na 'dzin pa yin grang de lar zhig das gsal bar byas pa'i phyir spyi de dang 'brel pa ma yin te /
translated: But the universal is not related to the individual things, because it is not manifested by the individual things.

original: rtag pa nyid kyis gzhan gyis phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa ni khyad par med pa'i phyir gsal bya nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyis gzhan gyis phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa ni khyad par med pa'i phyir gsal bya nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is permanent, it is not suitable to be the manifestor of the individual things, because it is not benefited by anything else, since it is without difference.

original: gang zhig gang gi phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa de ni de'i gsal bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa de ni de'i gsal bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: That which does not benefit something else is not the manifestor of that.

original: 'bigs byed kyi gangs can bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bigs byed kyi gangs can bzhin no //
translated: like the snow mountains of Vindhya.

original: spyi'i gsal ba yag de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i gsal ba yag de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The general statement is like that.

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa yang gsal bar byed pa nyid yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa yang gsal bar byed pa nyid yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that which does not assist is also that which illuminates, then there is the fault of overpervasion,

original: thams cad thams cad kyi gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad thams cad kyi gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: because everything would illuminate everything.üîΩTherefore, since impermanence is accepted, it is not reasonable that they are dependent on arising, and since they are apprehended as singular, it is not reasonable that they are dependent on consciousness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir de dag la skye ba'i gzhan gyi dbang du rigs pa ma yin la 'ba' zhig 'dzin pa'i phyir de shes pa'i gzhan gyi dbang yang ma yin pas phyogs gsum char yang srid pa ma yin no
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir de dag la skye ba'i gzhan gyi dbang du rigs pa ma yin la 'ba' zhig 'dzin pa'i phyir de shes pa'i gzhan gyi dbang yang ma yin pas phyogs gsum char yang srid pa ma yin no
translated: Thus the three positions are not possible.

original: // de ltar yin dang spyir rtogs pa ni rang gi rten dang dbang po phrad pa la ltos pa yin no zhes gang brjod pa de mi rigs te /
analyzed: // de ltar yin dang spyir rtogs pa ni rang gi rten dang dbang po phrad pa la ltos pa yin no zhes gang brjod pa de mi rigs te /
translated: In that case, it is unreasonable to state that the realization of a universal depends on the sense faculty contacting its basis.

original: rten nyid mi rung ba'i phyir de la yod pa dang dbang po phrad pa la sogs pa la ltos par ga las 'gyur /
analyzed: rten nyid mi rung ba'i phyir de la yod pa dang dbang po phrad pa la sogs pa la ltos par ga las 'gyur /
translated: Since it is not a basis, how could it depend on being in contact with a sense faculty?

original: sogs pa smos pas bdag dang yid phrad pa dang // snang ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas bdag dang yid phrad pa dang // snang ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes being in contact with the self and the mind, and light and so on.

original: rtogs pa nyid kyis khyad par gzhan gyis bogs dbyung du med pa'i phyir 'di 'ga' zhig tu gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa nyid kyis khyad par gzhan gyis bogs dbyung du med pa'i phyir 'di 'ga' zhig tu gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Since it is a realization, it cannot be enhanced by any other factor, so it does not depend on anything else.

original: de lta yin dang gal te de rang gi yul can gyi shes pa skyed par nus na de'i tshe thams cad du de bskyed par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta yin dang gal te de rang gi yul can gyi shes pa skyed par nus na de'i tshe thams cad du de bskyed par 'gyur la /
translated: If it is like that, then if it is able to generate a consciousness that has it as its object, it would generate it at all times.

original: ci ste mi nus na nam yang bskyed par ci 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste mi nus na nam yang bskyed par ci 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is not able to do so, then it would never generate it.

original: de'i nus pa'am mi nus pa'i rang gi ngo bo de sus kyang gzhan du bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: de'i nus pa'am mi nus pa'i rang gi ngo bo de sus kyang gzhan du bya bar mi nus te /
translated: No one can change its nature, whether it is able to generate a consciousness or not.

original: rtag pa nyid nyams par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid nyams par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because its permanence would be undermined.

original: ci skad du /
analyzed: ci skad du /
translated: As it is said:üîΩWhat is the point of a permanent entity

original: de yis nus pa'am mi nus pa'i //üîΩrang bzhin gyis ni gnas pa gang //
analyzed: de yis nus pa'am mi nus pa'i //üîΩrang bzhin gyis ni gnas pa gang //
translated: that is either always able or always unableüîΩto produce an effect?

original: rtag par khyad par byar med 'di //
analyzed: rtag par khyad par byar med 'di //
translated: This is always undifferentiated.

original: de dag su yis bshig par nus //
analyzed: de dag su yis bshig par nus //
translated: Who can destroy it?

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: And also:

original: gang yang / ba lang nyid ni ba lang las /
analyzed: gang yang / ba lang nyid ni ba lang las /
translated: Cows are different from cowness.üîΩThis is said, but it is not definite in the case of the cook, etc.

original: don gzhan yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de ni 'tshed pa po la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: don gzhan yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de ni 'tshed pa po la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: To show this, he says:

original: ba lang nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ba lang nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Cows are different from cowness, etc.

original: 'di ltar 'tshed pa po la sogs pa dag las 'tshed pa po nyid la sogs @302a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'tshed pa po la sogs pa dag las 'tshed pa po nyid la sogs @302a * //
translated: Thus, even though cowness, etc. are not different from the cook, etc.,

original: pa la don gzhan du gyur pa med na yang 'tshed pa po 'tshed pa po zhes bya ba blo tha dad pa'i yul nyid du 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: pa la don gzhan du gyur pa med na yang 'tshed pa po 'tshed pa po zhes bya ba blo tha dad pa'i yul nyid du 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: the cook, etc. are the objects of different cognitions, and are called ‚Äúcook,‚Äù etc.

original: lhas byin gyi 'tshed pa po nyid ces tha dad pa'i rnam par dbye ba yang 'gyur bas des na gtan tshigs thun mong gi ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: lhas byin gyi 'tshed pa po nyid ces tha dad pa'i rnam par dbye ba yang 'gyur bas des na gtan tshigs thun mong gi ma nges pa yin no //
translated: And the different classifications of Devadatta‚Äôs cowness would also occur. Therefore, the reason is not definite in the case of a common locus.

original: rtags ngan gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni ku m'a ra ri las smras pa ste /
analyzed: rtags ngan gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni ku m'a ra ri las smras pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAnother bad reason‚Äù is one stated by KumƒÅrila.

original: de la rtags dan de dag ni 'di dag tu brjod de /üîΩba lang gi gong bu tha dad pa dag la /
analyzed: de la rtags dan de dag ni 'di dag tu brjod de / ba lang gi gong bu tha dad pa dag la /
translated: The signs of that are stated as follows.

original: ba lang gi blo gang yin pa 'di ni ba lang nyid gcig gi rgyu mtshan can yin te /
analyzed: ba lang gi blo gang yin pa 'di ni ba lang nyid gcig gi rgyu mtshan can yin te /
translated: The cognition of a cow is the sign of the single cause of cowhood in the different aggregates of a cow,

original: ba lang du snang ba'i phyir dang / gcig gi rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ba lang gi gong bu gcig gi yul can gyi blo bzhin no //
analyzed: ba lang du snang ba'i phyir dang / gcig gi rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ba lang gi gong bu gcig gi yul can gyi blo bzhin no //
translated: because it appears as a cow and because it has the aspect of a single cow, like the cognition of a single aggregate of a cow.

original: yang na ba lang gi blo gang yin pa 'di ni khra bo las byung pa ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: yang na ba lang gi blo gang yin pa 'di ni khra bo las byung pa ma yin pa'am /
translated: Or, the cognition of a cow is not generated from a multicolored object,

original: de las ma gtogs pa don gzhan du 'gyur ba la dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de las ma gtogs pa don gzhan du 'gyur ba la dmigs pa yin te /
translated: because it is not observed as a different object from that,

original: de med pas yang 'byung ba'i phyir bum pa la sa'i blo bzhin no //
analyzed: de med pas yang 'byung ba'i phyir bum pa la sa'i blo bzhin no //
translated: like the cognition of earth in a pot, because it is generated again when that is destroyed.

original: de'i thams cad du song ba ci ltar 'grub ce na /
analyzed: de'i thams cad du song ba ci ltar 'grub ce na /
translated: How is its omnipresence established?

original: brjod pa / ba lang gi blo gang yin pa 'di ni re re la 'du ba'i don gyi yul can yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa / ba lang gi blo gang yin pa 'di ni re re la 'du ba'i don gyi yul can yin te /
translated: The cognition of a cow is the object of the meaning of the collection of each part,üîΩbecause it is the cognition of a cow, like the cognition of a pot.

original: gang bu re re la dngos po'i rnam pa ma lus pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir bsal ba so so'i yul can gyi blo bzhin no //
analyzed: gang bu re re la dngos po'i rnam pa ma lus pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir bsal ba so so'i yul can gyi blo bzhin no //
translated: because each son has the nature of the entity in its entirety, like the cognition that has each individual as its object.

original: 'di gcig nyid du yang grub pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di gcig nyid du yang grub pa kho na ste /
translated: It is also established as being one,

original: 'di ltar gal te yang so so la spyi'i bdag nyid thams cad kyis yongs su rdzogs pa de lta na yang de ni gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te yang so so la spyi'i bdag nyid thams cad kyis yongs su rdzogs pa de lta na yang de ni gcig kho na ste /
translated: because even though each one is complete with the nature of the universal, it is still only one,

original: gcig gi rnam pa can gyi blos gzung bar byas pa'i phyir dgag pa dang ldan pa'i ngag dag la bram ze la sogs pa ldog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gcig gi rnam pa can gyi blos gzung bar byas pa'i phyir dgag pa dang ldan pa'i ngag dag la bram ze la sogs pa ldog pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is apprehended by the cognition that has the aspect of one, like the Brahman, etc., that are excluded by the negation in the statement ‚ÄúBrahman alone is true.‚Äù

original: tha dad pa dag la tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa dag la tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: The cognition that has the aspect of nondifference with regard to different things is mistaken,

original: des na de'i stobs kyis dngos po'i de kho na nyid rnam par 'jog pa 'brel pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: des na de'i stobs kyis dngos po'i de kho na nyid rnam par 'jog pa 'brel pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang brjod par mi nus te /
translated: and therefore it is not possible to say that the establishment of the reality of things by its power is unrelated.

original: 'di ltar 'di la rgyu'i nyes pa med la gnod par byed pa'i shes pa bstan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di la rgyu'i nyes pa med la gnod par byed pa'i shes pa bstan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, there is no fault of cause, and it is not shown that there is a consciousness that is harmed.

original: de lta bas na log pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir 'di ni mi rigs so zhe'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na log pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir 'di ni mi rigs so zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, since there is no reason for error, this is not reasonable.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: tha dad gong bu ba lang blo //
analyzed: tha dad gong bu ba lang blo //
translated: The cognition of an ox in a variegated object

original: ba lang nyid gcig rgyu mtshan can //üîΩba lang snang dang gcig nyid phyir //
analyzed: ba lang nyid gcig rgyu mtshan can // ba lang snang dang gcig nyid phyir //
translated: Is one, having the cause of ox-ness.üîΩBecause it appears as an ox and is one,

original: ba lang gong bu gcig blo bzhin //
analyzed: ba lang gong bu gcig blo bzhin //
translated: Like the cognition of an ox in a variegated object.

original: khra bos ba lang blo min pa'am //
analyzed: khra bos ba lang blo min pa'am //
translated: The cognition of an ox is not variegated,

original: de las gzhan pa dmigs pa'ang yin //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dmigs pa'ang yin //
translated: Nor is it the observation of something other than that.

original: de med par ni yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de med par ni yod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it exists without that,

original: bum pa la ni sa blo bzhin //
analyzed: bum pa la ni sa blo bzhin //
translated: Like the cognition of earth in a pot.

original: @302b ba lang blo ni re re la //
analyzed: @302b ba lang blo ni re re la //
translated: The cognition of an ox in each

original: 'du ba'i don yul can yang yin //
analyzed: 'du ba'i don yul can yang yin //
translated: Is also the possessor of the object of the meaning of collection.

original: so sor ma lus ngo bo'i phyir //
analyzed: so sor ma lus ngo bo'i phyir //
translated: Because of the nature of each individual,

original: gsal ba so so'i blo bzhin no //
analyzed: gsal ba so so'i blo bzhin no //
translated: Like the cognition of each individual manifestation.

original: rigs ni re rer 'du ba 'ang yin //
analyzed: rigs ni re rer 'du ba 'ang yin //
translated: The class is also a collection of each,

original: re re ba yi blo yin phyir //
analyzed: re re ba yi blo yin phyir //
translated: Because it is the cognition of each individual.

original: dgag pa dang ldan ngag rnams la //
analyzed: dgag pa dang ldan ngag rnams la //
translated: In the case of negations and affirmations,

original: bram ze la sogs zlog pa bzhin //
analyzed: bram ze la sogs zlog pa bzhin //
translated: Like the reversal of brahmin and so on.

original: ba lang nyid la gcig ngos blo //
analyzed: ba lang nyid la gcig ngos blo //
translated: The cognition of the oneness of the cow

original: log par brjod par nus ma yin //
analyzed: log par brjod par nus ma yin //
translated: cannot be said to be erroneous.

original: 'di la gnod pa'i shes pa'am //
analyzed: 'di la gnod pa'i shes pa'am //
translated: There is no cognition that contradicts it,

original: rgyu yi nyes pa yod ma yin //üîΩzhes kyang bshad do //
analyzed: rgyu yi nyes pa yod ma yin // zhes kyang bshad do //
translated: nor is there any fault in the cause.

original: de'i phyir 'dir re zhig bsgrub bya ma mtshang ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir re zhig bsgrub bya ma mtshang ba yin te /
translated: Thus, in this case, the probandum is not established,

original: ba lang gcig nyid ma grub pa'i phyir de'i rgyu mtshan can gyi ba lang gcig gi blo yang grub pa yin no //
analyzed: ba lang gcig nyid ma grub pa'i phyir de'i rgyu mtshan can gyi ba lang gcig gi blo yang grub pa yin no //
translated: because the oneness of the cow is not established, and the cognition of the oneness of the cow, which has that as its reason, is also not established.

original: ji ste phyir rgyu mtshan gcig nyid sgrub pa de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ste phyir rgyu mtshan gcig nyid sgrub pa de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: If you prove the oneness of the reason, then it is the establishment of what is already established,

original: rigs mi mthun pa rnam par gcod pas ba lang gi ldog pa gcig brtags pa rgyu mtshan du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa rnam par gcod pas ba lang gi ldog pa gcig brtags pa rgyu mtshan du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the exclusion of dissimilar instances is considered to be the reason for the designation of the oneness of the cow's exclusion.

original: ba lang gi blo khra bo las ma yin no zhes pa 'di yang dngos su de la skye ba dgag pa sgrub na grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
