analyzed: ba lang gi blo khra bo las ma yin no zhes pa 'di yang dngos su de la skye ba dgag pa sgrub na grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: This statement it is not from a multicolored cow is also the establishment of what is already established, if you prove the negation of its arising in that [multicolored cow] directly.

original: de ni rang gi mtshan nyid nyams su myong ba dang yid la byed pa la sogs par bar du chod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rang gi mtshan nyid nyams su myong ba dang yid la byed pa la sogs par bar du chod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is interrupted by the experience of its own characteristic and by the attention, etc.

original: 'di de brgyud nas kyang de las mi 'byung ngo zhes sgrub na de'i tshe dam bca' ba nyams su myong ba dang 'gal ba dang dpe yang bsgrub bya ma mtshang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di de brgyud nas kyang de las mi 'byung ngo zhes sgrub na de'i tshe dam bca' ba nyams su myong ba dang 'gal ba dang dpe yang bsgrub bya ma mtshang ba yin no //
translated: If you prove that it does not arise from that even indirectly, then your thesis contradicts experience, and your example is not established.

original: gzhan la dmigs pa nyid sgrub na yang khro bo nye ba na 'di ni ba lang ngo zhes blo skye ba gang yin pa de gal te de las gzhan la dmigs pa'o zhes bsgrub na 'di'i tshe 'di la yang nyams su myong ba dang 'gal te /
analyzed: gzhan la dmigs pa nyid sgrub na yang khro bo nye ba na 'di ni ba lang ngo zhes blo skye ba gang yin pa de gal te de las gzhan la dmigs pa'o zhes bsgrub na 'di'i tshe 'di la yang nyams su myong ba dang 'gal te /
translated: If you prove that it has another object, then the cognition that arises when one is angry, ‚ÄúThis is a cow,‚Äù if you prove that it has another object, then at that time it contradicts experience.

original: 'di ltar de ni gong bu nye ba nges pa na 'jug la dpe yang bsgrub bya ma tshang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni gong bu nye ba nges pa na 'jug la dpe yang bsgrub bya ma tshang ba yin no //
translated: Because it engages when the mass is near, and your example is not established.

original: ci ste de med cing khu yul sogs pa nye ba na de ltar 'jug pa'i blo gang yin pa de las gzhan la dmigs so zhes bya bar bsgrub na de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub po //
analyzed: ci ste de med cing khu yul sogs pa nye ba na de ltar 'jug pa'i blo gang yin pa de las gzhan la dmigs so zhes bya bar bsgrub na de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub po //
translated: But if you prove that it is the mind that engages in that way when the object is present, and that it observes something other than that, then you are proving what is already established.

original: gal te dngos po yod pa la dmigs pa'o zhes sgrub na de'i tshe ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te dngos po yod pa la dmigs pa'o zhes sgrub na de'i tshe ma nges pa yin no //
translated: If you prove that it observes an existent thing, then that is not established.

original: 'di ni don dam par dngos po yod pa la dmigs pa ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang yang re re la yongs su rdzogs pa'i don gyi yul can nyid du bsgrub pa de la yang spyir sgrub pa la grub pa sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni don dam par dngos po yod pa la dmigs pa ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin pa'i phyir ro // gang yang re re la yongs su rdzogs pa'i don gyi yul can nyid du bsgrub pa de la yang spyir sgrub pa la grub pa sgrub pa yin te /
translated: Because it has already been shown that ultimately there is not the slightest observation of an existent thing.

original: dngos po re re la de ma yin pa'i ngo bo las log pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nges par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po re re la de ma yin pa'i ngo bo las log pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nges par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And if you prove that it has an object that is a complete whole, then that also is a proof of what is already established, because it is ascertained that the nature of a thing is the opposite of the nature of what is not that.

original: 'on te spyi zhes bya ba rtag pa gcig pu @303a * //
analyzed: 'on te spyi zhes bya ba rtag pa gcig pu @303a * //
translated: But if you say that the object is a permanent, unitary,

original: re re la yongs su rdzogs pa'i dngos por gyur pa'i tshig gi don can nyid sgrub na de'i tshe dpe bsgrub bya ma tshang zhing gtan tshigs kyang ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: re re la yongs su rdzogs pa'i dngos por gyur pa'i tshig gi don can nyid sgrub na de'i tshe dpe bsgrub bya ma tshang zhing gtan tshigs kyang ma nges pa yin te /
translated: If you prove that each one has a meaning that is a complete thing, then the example is incomplete with respect to the probandum, and the reason is not established.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i chos kyis gang du rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i chos kyis gang du rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not established that any phenomenon is pervaded by that mode.

original: gcig bdag nyid thams cad kyis mang po dag la yongs su rdzogs pa nyid yin na gsal ba phan tshun tha dad pa thams cad ngo bo gcig nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gcig bdag nyid thams cad kyis mang po dag la yongs su rdzogs pa nyid yin na gsal ba phan tshun tha dad pa thams cad ngo bo gcig nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If the nature of one is complete in many, then all the different individual things would have the same nature.

original: gsal ba gcig gi mthar thug pa'i rang bzhin gyi spyi'i dngos pos reg pa'i phyir gsal ba gcig gi ngo bo bzhin no //
analyzed: gsal ba gcig gi mthar thug pa'i rang bzhin gyi spyi'i dngos pos reg pa'i phyir gsal ba gcig gi ngo bo bzhin no //
translated: Because they would be touched by the nature of the limit of one individual thing, just like the nature of one individual thing.

original: yang na spyi du ma nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na spyi du ma nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, the universal would be multiple.

original: cig car dngos po du ma la yongs su rdzogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir yul ches ring ba na gnas pa'i snod na yod pa'i ches mang ba'i bil ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas gnod
analyzed: cig car dngos po du ma la yongs su rdzogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir yul ches ring ba na gnas pa'i snod na yod pa'i ches mang ba'i bil ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas gnod
translated: This is the refutation by inference.

original: pa'o // des na 'di la gnod par byed pa'i shes pa yod pa yang ma yin no zhes gang smras pa de ni ma grub ste /
analyzed: pa'o // des na 'di la gnod par byed pa'i shes pa yod pa yang ma yin no zhes gang smras pa de ni ma grub ste /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that there is no cognition that refutes this.

original: gnod pa sngar bshad zin pa'i phyir dang ; 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa sngar bshad zin pa'i phyir dang ; 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The refutation has already been explained and will be explained.

original: gal te yang rigs gcig nyid du sgrub na yang rigs re re dang 'du ba nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir blo gcig gis gzung bar byas pa nyid du ma grub pas gtan tshigs gzhan ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang rigs gcig nyid du sgrub na yang rigs re re dang 'du ba nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir blo gcig gis gzung bar byas pa nyid du ma grub pas gtan tshigs gzhan ma grub pa yin no //
translated: If, on the other hand, it is established as a single type, then because it is not established as a combination of each type, it is not established as being apprehended by a single cognition. Therefore, the reason is not established.

original: bram ze la sogs pa zlog pa yang don dam par dngos po du ma yin te /
analyzed: bram ze la sogs pa zlog pa yang don dam par dngos po du ma yin te /
translated: Even if it is refuted as a Brahmin, etc., ultimately it is not a multiplicity.

original: dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dpe bsgrub bya ma tshang ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dpe bsgrub bya ma tshang ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is not a thing‚Äù is an incomplete example.

original: btags pa'i gcig nyid sgrub na grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: btags pa'i gcig nyid sgrub na grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: If you prove the one-ness of the imagined, it is a proof of what is already established,

original: btags pa'i sel ba'i ngo bo gcig tu 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btags pa'i sel ba'i ngo bo gcig tu 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you accept the one-ness of the imagined as the nature of the exclusion.

original: gang yang 'di la rgyu'i nyes pa yod pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa de yang ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang yang 'di la rgyu'i nyes pa yod pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa de yang ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: And what you say, ‚ÄúThere is no fault of cause in this,‚Äù is not established,

original: ma rig pa'i bag chags thog ma med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i bag chags thog ma med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is the fault of the cause of the beginningless predispositions of ignorance.

original: de'i phyir de ltar tshul 'dis rtags ngan 'di dag sun dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar tshul 'dis rtags ngan 'di dag sun dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in this way, these bad reasons should be refuted.

original: de ltar re zhig gzhan gyis smras pa'i spyi'i sgrub byed rnams rgyas par sun 'byin pa brjod nas spyi'i gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma brjod par 'dod nas gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig gzhan gyis smras pa'i spyi'i sgrub byed rnams rgyas par sun 'byin pa brjod nas spyi'i gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma brjod par 'dod nas gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Having thus extensively stated the refutation of the proofs of the general assertions of the other, wanting to state the refuting valid cognition of the general, he says, ‚ÄúMoreover,‚Äù and so on.

original: gdon mi za bar spyi tha dad pa dag la 'jug par 'dod par bya dgos te /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar spyi tha dad pa dag la 'jug par 'dod par bya dgos te /
translated: Therefore, it is definitely necessary to accept that it is applied to many different things.

original: de lta ma yin na ji ltar de dag la de'i rgyu mtshan can gyi gcig gi rnam pa can gyi blo nges par 'grub par 'gyur /üîΩde la 'di'i 'jug pa gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'am /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ji ltar de dag la de'i rgyu mtshan can gyi gcig gi rnam pa can gyi blo nges par 'grub par 'gyur / de la 'di'i 'jug pa gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'am /
translated: Otherwise, how could the cognition of oneness, which has that as its cause, be ascertained with regard to them?üîΩIn this regard, is the characteristic of endurance the cause of its application?

original: @303b de mngon par gsal ba'i mtshan nyid yin /
analyzed: @303b de mngon par gsal ba'i mtshan nyid yin /
translated: Or is it the cause of its manifestation?

original: gnas pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /üîΩrang gi ngo bo mi 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'am /
analyzed: gnas pa yang rnam pa gnyis te / rang gi ngo bo mi 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'am /
translated: Endurance is also of two types:üîΩIs the characteristic of the non-disintegration of its own nature?

original: thur du ltung ba'i mtshan nyid gegs byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin grang /
analyzed: thur du ltung ba'i mtshan nyid gegs byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin grang /
translated: Or is it the characteristic of the prevention of falling downward?

original: de la re zhig dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not the cause of its application because it is permanent.

original: rtag pa'i phyir rang nyid kyis rang bzhin mi 'jig par grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgnyis pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir rang nyid kyis rang bzhin mi 'jig par grub pa'i phyir ro // gnyis pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is established by itself that its nature does not disintegrate.üîΩSecond, it is not the cause of its manifestation because it is not an object of knowledge.

original: lus can ma yin pa dang thams cad du song ba dag gi phyir bya ba med pa nyid kyis thur du ltung ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa dang thams cad du song ba dag gi phyir bya ba med pa nyid kyis thur du ltung ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the cause of its manifestation because it is not an object of knowledge.

original: de'i phyir rten rnams de'i gegs byed pa nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rten rnams de'i gegs byed pa nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable that the supports are the obstruction of that.

original: tha dad pa dag pa spyi gnas pa gang yin pa de ni gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang lan ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: tha dad pa dag pa spyi gnas pa gang yin pa de ni gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang lan ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: This is also not an answer: ‚ÄúThat which is the abiding of the universal of the different is abiding.‚Äù

original: 'du ba de nyid dpyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du ba de nyid dpyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that very collection is to be analyzed.

original: 'di ltar rten dang brten pa logs shig ma yin par grub pa'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid de ni 'du ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rten dang brten pa logs shig ma yin par grub pa'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid de ni 'du ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, that which has the characteristic of the nature of the established support and supported is called a collection.

original: spyi'i brten pa de yang de dang 'brel pa'i gnas pa nyid kyis sam /
analyzed: spyi'i brten pa de yang de dang 'brel pa'i gnas pa nyid kyis sam /
translated: And that universal support is either by the abiding of the connection with that,

original: des gsal bar bya ba nyid kyis yin zhes bya ba 'di nyid dpyod pa rtsom pa yin no //üîΩphan tshun ma 'dres pa'i bdag nyid rnams kyi cung zad kyang mi byed pa don gzhan du 'gyur ba rigs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des gsal bar bya ba nyid kyis yin zhes bya ba 'di nyid dpyod pa rtsom pa yin no // phan tshun ma 'dres pa'i bdag nyid rnams kyi cung zad kyang mi byed pa don gzhan du 'gyur ba rigs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: or by the very illumination of that. This is the beginning of the analysis.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not reasonable that those with a nature of mutual non-mixture do not perform any function, because that would be absurd.

original: de lta na ni thams cad thams cad kyi 'du bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni thams cad thams cad kyi 'du bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, everything would be a collection of everything.

original: 'di ltar phan tshun ldog pa'i lus can gyi dngos po sre bar byed pa gang yin pa de 'du bar brtags te /
analyzed: 'di ltar phan tshun ldog pa'i lus can gyi dngos po sre bar byed pa gang yin pa de 'du bar brtags te /
translated: Thus, that which is the mixing of things that have mutually exclusive bodies is imagined to be contact.

original: don gzhan du gyur pa yod na yang rang gi bdag nyid la gnas pa'i phan tshun tha dad pa rang bzhin 'brel pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa yod na yang rang gi bdag nyid la gnas pa'i phan tshun tha dad pa rang bzhin 'brel pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But even if there were a different object, there is no contact of different natures that abide in their own natures,

original: rang gi ngo bo nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that their own nature would be lost.

original: don gzhan du gyur ba de la 'du ba po zhes mi byed na ni rtsod pa med pas don gzhan du gyur pa'i gnas pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur ba de la 'du ba po zhes mi byed na ni rtsod pa med pas don gzhan du gyur pa'i gnas pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: If one does not call that which is a different object a ‚Äúmixer,‚Äù then since there is no dispute, it is not logical that it abides as a different object.

original: 'bo ba'i gegs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyi la rten du rtog pa shin tu 'brel pa med par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bo ba'i gegs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyi la rten du rtog pa shin tu 'brel pa med par ston pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe obstruction to mixing‚Äù and so on teaches that it is utterly incoherent to imagine that a universal is the basis of contact.

original: 'bo ba med pa ni 'bo ba dang bral ba rnams te /
analyzed: 'bo ba med pa ni 'bo ba dang bral ba rnams te /
translated: That which is without mixing is that which is free from mixing.

original: lus can ma yin pa dang thams cad du song ba dag gis 'bo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa dang thams cad du song ba dag gis 'bo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is not a body and that which pervades everything is without mixing.

original: des na gsal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na gsal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is also illogical that the characteristic of manifestation is a real entity.

original: 'di ltar des gsal ba ni de'i yul can gyi shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid yin gyi /üîΩrtag pa gzhan du byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar des gsal ba ni de'i yul can gyi shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid yin gyi / rtag pa gzhan du byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: In this way, manifestation is the generation of the consciousness that has it as its object.

original: rang bzhin yongs su rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //üîΩde lta yin dang gal te rang nyid kyis shes pa skyed par nus na de'i tshe ci'i phyir @304a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin yongs su rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no // de lta yin dang gal te rang nyid kyis shes pa skyed par nus na de'i tshe ci'i phyir @304a * //
translated: It is not the characteristic of the complete expansion of the nature of a real entity because it is impossible for a permanent phenomenon to act as another.

original: gsal ba'i rgyu la ltos par 'gyur /
analyzed: gsal ba'i rgyu la ltos par 'gyur /
translated: If that were the case, if it were able to generate consciousness by itself, then why would it depend on the cause of manifestation?

original: 'on te mi nus na de'i tshe yang gzhan gyis khyad par bogs dbyung du med pa'i phyir de la ltos pa rigs dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te mi nus na de'i tshe yang gzhan gyis khyad par bogs dbyung du med pa'i phyir de la ltos pa rigs dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: But if it is not able to do so, then it is illogical that it depends on it because it cannot be enhanced by another.

original: gzhan gyis khyad par du byed par khas len na yang mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis khyad par du byed par khas len na yang mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If you accept that it is enhanced by another, then it follows that it is impermanent.

original: de lta na gsal ba bzhin du thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir spyi dngos por mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na gsal ba bzhin du thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir spyi dngos por mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: In that case, like manifestation, it would not be a universal because it would not be shared in common.

original: de lta bas na brjod pa dang sgra dag yod pa'i phyir ma lus pa nyid ni spyi'i tshig gi don yin par brjod do //
analyzed: de lta bas na brjod pa dang sgra dag yod pa'i phyir ma lus pa nyid ni spyi'i tshig gi don yin par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, because the expression and the sound exist, the expression ‚Äúthe universal of all‚Äù is used.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan cung zad med pa de ni de la 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan cung zad med pa de ni de la 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: That which has no reason for engaging in something does not engage in it,

original: 'bigs byed la gangs can bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bigs byed la gangs can bzhin no //
translated: like the Vindhya mountain does not engage in engaging the Himalaya mountain.

original: spyi yang tha dad pa dag la 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: spyi yang tha dad pa dag la 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: And there is not the slightest reason for the universal to engage in different things. This is the non-apprehension of the pervader.

original: bum sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa skyon gzhan yang 'chad do //
analyzed: bum sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa skyon gzhan yang 'chad do //
translated: Another fault is explained by ‚Äúthe pot, etc.‚Äù

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i rigs tha dad pa ni bum pa nyid dang sa nyid la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i rigs tha dad pa ni bum pa nyid dang sa nyid la sogs pa ste ;
translated: The different kinds of pot, etc., are the universals of pot, earth, etc.

original: thams cad du song ba nyid du brjod pa na res 'ga' rang gi rten tsam la khyab pa nyid du brjod ba'am /
analyzed: thams cad du song ba nyid du brjod pa na res 'ga' rang gi rten tsam la khyab pa nyid du brjod ba'am /
translated: When it is said that they pervade everything, sometimes it is said that they pervade just their own bases.

original: yang na gang gsal bas stong pa'i yul thams cad na yod pa yin zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa gnyis so //
analyzed: yang na gang gsal bas stong pa'i yul thams cad na yod pa yin zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa gnyis so //
translated: Or else, it is the two concepts: ‚ÄúIt exists in all the places that are empty of the manifest‚Äù and ‚ÄúIt exists in the unmanifest.‚Äù

original: mchog gi rigs bzhin zhes bya ba la mchog ces bya bas yul chen po nyid kyis yod pa brjod do //
analyzed: mchog gi rigs bzhin zhes bya ba la mchog ces bya bas yul chen po nyid kyis yod pa brjod do //
translated: ‚ÄúLike the supreme principle‚Äù ‚Äî the word ‚Äúsupreme‚Äù indicates existence by way of a great object.

original: 'di yang yul chen po nyid tsam du mtshungs pa nyid kyis dper byas kyi gsal ba'i bar na gnas pa'i yul la khyab pa nyid kyis de yang de'i tshe chos ma gtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang yul chen po nyid tsam du mtshungs pa nyid kyis dper byas kyi gsal ba'i bar na gnas pa'i yul la khyab pa nyid kyis de yang de'i tshe chos ma gtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: This is given as an example because it is similar to the mere fact of a great object, but it is not the case that it pervades the object that exists between the manifestations, because it is not a property of that.

original: de la phyogs dang po la nyes pa bshad pa /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po la nyes pa bshad pa /
translated: The fault in the first position is explained:

original: de la dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case, etc.‚Äù

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i gsal bas stong pa'i yul du bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po skyes pa na de dag de rigs kyi bye brag bum pa la sogs pa rnams ji ltar de la ste bum pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa'am mthong bar 'gyur zhes
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i gsal bas stong pa'i yul du bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po skyes pa na de dag de rigs kyi bye brag bum pa la sogs pa rnams ji ltar de la ste bum pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa'am mthong bar 'gyur zhes
translated: When a thing such as a pot is produced in a place that is empty of the manifest such as a pot, how could those such as the pot, which are the particular instances of that type, enter into or see that, i.e., the pot, etc.?

original: bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: mi shes te khong du mi chud do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi shes te khong du mi chud do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the meaning of ‚Äúnot known‚Äù and ‚Äúnot penetrated.‚Äù

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rtag phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rtag phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of permanence,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar de dag bum pa la sogs pa gsal ba tha dad pa dang lhan cig skye bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag bum pa la sogs pa gsal ba tha dad pa dang lhan cig skye bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Thus, those [permanent entities] would be produced together with the different manifestations such as the pot,

original: de na snga nas gnas par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de na snga nas gnas par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or they would exist there previously,

original: yul gzhan nas 'ongs par gyur pa de'i tshe der mthong ba'am 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: yul gzhan nas 'ongs par gyur pa de'i tshe der mthong ba'am 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: or they would come from another place. At that time, they would be seen or engaged there.

original: gang gang gi phyir de dag skye ba @304b ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gang gi phyir de dag skye ba @304b ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are permanent.

original: snga nas gnas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: snga nas gnas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They do not exist there previously.

original: thams cad du khyab pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du khyab pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not pervade everything.

original: yul gzhan nas 'ongs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yul gzhan nas 'ongs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They do not come from another place.

original: bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are without action.

original: de lta bas na ji ltar de dag la de dag 'jug pa'am dmigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta bas na ji ltar de dag la de dag 'jug pa'am dmigs par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could they be engaged or observed there?

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang du skye ba ma yin zhing snga nas gnas pa yang ma yin zhing phyis yul gzhan nas 'ongs pa dang ldan pa yang ma yin pa de dag der dmigs pa'am 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang du skye ba ma yin zhing snga nas gnas pa yang ma yin zhing phyis yul gzhan nas 'ongs pa dang ldan pa yang ma yin pa de dag der dmigs pa'am 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: The application is that which is not born in a certain place, nor does it exist from before, nor does it come from another place later. Those are not observed or engaged in there.

original: ri bong gi mgo la de'i rva bzhin no //
analyzed: ri bong gi mgo la de'i rva bzhin no //
translated: Like the horn of a rabbit.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po la des stong pa'i yul du skye ba dang ldan pa'i spyi yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po la des stong pa'i yul du skye ba dang ldan pa'i spyi yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: In the case of a thing such as a pot, the universal that has the property of being born in a place that is empty of it is also like that. This is the non-observation of the pervader.

original: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The reason is not indeterminate,

original: da la 'jug pa dang dmigs pa dag gi rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da la 'jug pa dang dmigs pa dag gi rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other mode of engagement and observation in this case.

original: phyogs gnyis pa la yang nyes pa bshad pa /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la yang nyes pa bshad pa /
translated: The fault in the second position is also explained:

original: rang rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwith its own basis‚Äù and so on.

original: rang gi rten dang dbang po ldan pa la sogs pa'i dmigs pa'i rgyu la ste /
analyzed: rang gi rten dang dbang po ldan pa la sogs pa'i dmigs pa'i rgyu la ste /
translated: It is with regard to the cause of the object, such as possessing its own basis and faculties.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni bdag dang yid phrad pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni bdag dang yid phrad pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include the contact of self and mind and so on.

original: de'i phyir gsal ba tha dad ba gcig la rigs tha dad pa de dag 'dzin pa na rigs mi mthun pa gsal ba tha dad pa'i bar thams cad du yang dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsal ba tha dad ba gcig la rigs tha dad pa de dag 'dzin pa na rigs mi mthun pa gsal ba tha dad pa'i bar thams cad du yang dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, when one apprehends those different types in a single different individual, one would also apprehend all the different individuals of different types.

original: de dag bdag nyid ji ltar ba bzhin du ngo bo gcig nyid kyis re re la gzung ba'i ngo bo las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag bdag nyid ji ltar ba bzhin du ngo bo gcig nyid kyis re re la gzung ba'i ngo bo las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the same entity just as they are, they are not different from the entity apprehended in each individual.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to make this point even clearer, he says:

original: gal te shes las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te shes las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If it is the cognition of the object, etc.

original: ji ltar mthong ba'i gsal ba dang 'du ba'i spyi'i ngo bo shes zin pa las gsal ba'i par na gnas pa'i spyi'i ngo bo tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba'i gsal ba dang 'du ba'i spyi'i ngo bo shes zin pa las gsal ba'i par na gnas pa'i spyi'i ngo bo tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If the universal that resides in the different individuals is different from the previously cognized universal that is the nature of the aggregation of the individuals as they are seen,

original: de'i tshe de yang 'dzin par 'gyur te ;
analyzed: de'i tshe de yang 'dzin par 'gyur te ;
translated: then at that time it would be apprehended,

original: bzung zin pa'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du bzung zin pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzung zin pa'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du bzung zin pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not be different from the previously apprehended individual nature.

original: ji ste de 'dzin pa ma yin pa de lta yin na ma gzung ba'i ngo bo dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ste de 'dzin pa ma yin pa de lta yin na ma gzung ba'i ngo bo dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is not the apprehender, then because it is not different from the nature of the non-apprehended,

original: de bzhin du mthong ba'i gsal ba dang 'du ba yang 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong ba'i gsal ba dang 'du ba yang 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: in the same way, the manifestation and the collection that are seen would not be apprehended.

original: ci ste gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid du khas len par bying na de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid du khas len par bying na de'i tshe /
translated: But if you accept that it has the nature of both, then

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir rang bzhin tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir rang bzhin tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it follows that it would have a different nature from each, because it would possess mutually contradictory properties.

original: 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa yang yin la gcig kyang yin no zhes sems rnal du gnas pas brjod par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa yang yin la gcig kyang yin no zhes sems rnal du gnas pas brjod par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable for a mind that abides in reality to say that it possesses the mutually contradictory properties of apprehending and not apprehending, and that it is one.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i @305a * //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i @305a * //
translated: Because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: phyir ro ; / de lta na ni sna tshogs rdzas gcig tu 'gyur la /
analyzed: phyir ro ; / de lta na ni sna tshogs rdzas gcig tu 'gyur la /
translated: If that were so, the various would be one substance.

original: de lta yin dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it would follow that they would arise and disintegrate simultaneously.

original: de lta ma yin na gcig ces bya ba ming tsam du 'gyur la ming la ni rtsod pa yang med do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gcig ces bya ba ming tsam du 'gyur la ming la ni rtsod pa yang med do //
translated: If it were not so, then the so-called one would be a mere name, and there is no dispute about names.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rigs rnam pa thams cad du sun phyung nas sbyor ba dgod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rigs rnam pa thams cad du sun phyung nas sbyor ba dgod pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, having thus refuted the universal in every way, in order to set forth the syllogism,

original: shing sogs shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shing sogs shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe cognition of a tree, etc.,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang dag rim can nyid dag rjes su 'jug pa nyid dang / dngos po nyid dang / skye ba dang ldan pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa de dag ni gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa'i rtag pa dang gcig pu dang thams cad du song ba'i spyi las byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dag rim can nyid dag rjes su 'jug pa nyid dang / dngos po nyid dang / skye ba dang ldan pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa de dag ni gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa'i rtag pa dang gcig pu dang thams cad du song ba'i spyi las byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Those that possess the attributes of being sequential, being engaged, being an entity, being produced, and so on, do not arise from a universal that is permanent, unitary, and all-pervading, imagined by others.

original: 'tshed pa po la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'tshed pa po la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like the cognition of the cooker, etc.

original: shing sngon pa la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di dag kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal bas khyad pa dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: shing sngon pa la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di dag kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal bas khyad pa dmigs pa ste /
translated: The cognition of a green tree, etc., is also like that. This is the observation of a contradiction, a specific observation.

original: de rtag pa'i dngos po dang 'gal ba mi rtag pa'i dngos pos rim can nyid la sogs pa la khyab ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rtag pa'i dngos po dang 'gal ba mi rtag pa'i dngos pos rim can nyid la sogs pa la khyab ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the thing that is permanent is excluded from the thing that is impermanent, which pervades the sequential, etc.

original: rtag pa ni rim dang rim ma yin pa dag gis don byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa ni rim dang rim ma yin pa dag gis don byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
translated: The reason is inconclusive, because it is contradictory for a permanent thing to perform a function either sequentially or non-sequentially.

original: dpe la bsgrub bya ma tshang ba yang sngar rgyas par bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir dpe ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dpe la bsgrub bya ma tshang ba yang sngar rgyas par bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir dpe ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: And the example is not unestablished, because it has already been established in detail earlier that the probandum is not absent from the example.

original: gnod par byed pa gzhan yang bshad pa /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa gzhan yang bshad pa /
translated: Another fault is stated:

original: yang na ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang na ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Or else, the term ‚Äúendowed‚Äù and so on.

original: de la ldan pa sun 'byin pa na gcig nyid du ma la 'jug pa mi rigs gnod byed tshad ma'o zhes bya ba 'dis gnod par byed pa brjod do //
analyzed: de la ldan pa sun 'byin pa na gcig nyid du ma la 'jug pa mi rigs gnod byed tshad ma'o zhes bya ba 'dis gnod par byed pa brjod do //
translated: Here, in refuting the endowment, the statement ‚Äúit is not tenable for oneness to be engaged with plurality‚Äù expresses the refutation.

original: de ni ji ltar gcig du ma 'jug pa mi rigs pa de bzhin du yan lag can sun 'byin pa na de gcig 'jug pa bstan pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed de /
analyzed: de ni ji ltar gcig du ma 'jug pa mi rigs pa de bzhin du yan lag can sun 'byin pa na de gcig 'jug pa bstan pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed de /
translated: Just as it is illogical for one to be included in many, so too, when the possessor of parts is refuted, it is concluded by ‚ÄúIf one is included in many, the possessor of parts does not exist‚Äù and so on.

original: gang dag bye brag pa la sogs pas gsal ba las rigs gcig tu tha dad par 'dod pa de dag la nyes pa 'di brjod kyi /
analyzed: gang dag bye brag pa la sogs pas gsal ba las rigs gcig tu tha dad par 'dod pa de dag la nyes pa 'di brjod kyi /
translated: This fault is stated in regard to those who assert that the class is different from the individual, such as the Vai≈õe·π£ikas.

original: yang gang dag rgyal ba pa dang rgyal dpog pa dang grangs can pa la sogs pa rigs tha mi dad pa'am gnyi ga'i ngo bor 'dod pa de dag gis brjod pa'i rigs nam mkha'i gos can gyi zhar la 'gegs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang gang dag rgyal ba pa dang rgyal dpog pa dang grangs can pa la sogs pa rigs tha mi dad pa'am gnyi ga'i ngo bor 'dod pa de dag gis brjod pa'i rigs nam mkha'i gos can gyi zhar la 'gegs par 'gyur ro //
translated: But those who assert that the class is not different from the individual or that it is the nature of both, such as the Jaina, SƒÅ·πÉkhya, and so on, are refuted in the context of the sky-clad one.

original: 'di ni bye brag pa dang rigs pa can gyis brtags pa'i rigs dgag pa'i skabs yin pas sun ma phyung ste /
analyzed: 'di ni bye brag pa dang rigs pa can gyis brtags pa'i rigs dgag pa'i skabs yin pas sun ma phyung ste /
translated: Since this is the context of refuting the class imputed by the Vai≈õe·π£ikas and NaiyƒÅyikas, it is not refuted here.

original: skabs ma yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: skabs ma yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is because it is not the context.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel @305b las spyi'i tshig gi ngon brtag pa ste bco brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel @305b las spyi'i tshig gi ngon brtag pa ste bco brgyad pa'o /
translated: words, the eighteenth chapter of this commentary on the ‚ÄúDifferentiation ofüîΩthe Middle and the Extremes.‚ÄùüîΩParticular refutations

original: // / bye brag ba sun dbyung ba'i phyir gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: // / bye brag ba sun dbyung ba'i phyir gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To refute the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, he says, ‚ÄúNothing is . . .‚Äù

original: re zhig khyad par gyi mtshan nyid rtag pa'i rdzas la 'jug pa nyid dang / mtha'i rdzas la 'byung ba nyid gang yin pa de ni mi srid pa'i skyon gyis sun phyung ba'i phyir mtshan nyid ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: re zhig khyad par gyi mtshan nyid rtag pa'i rdzas la 'jug pa nyid dang / mtha'i rdzas la 'byung ba nyid gang yin pa de ni mi srid pa'i skyon gyis sun phyung ba'i phyir mtshan nyid ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: The characteristics of the particular, that is, the characteristic of the permanent substance, and the characteristic of the final substance, are not characteristics because they are refuted by the error of impossibility.

original: rtag pa'i rdzas ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa'i rdzas ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no such thing as a permanent substance.üîΩThis is because it has already been refuted earlier that a substance is permanent.

original: de ni sngar rdzas rtag par bkag zin pa'i phyir te ji ltar 'di dag gis 'jug pa de 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ni sngar rdzas rtag par bkag zin pa'i phyir te ji ltar 'di dag gis 'jug pa de 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: How could these be established?üîΩIt is also not the case that these are established as existing by the power of

original: gang yang rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi khyad par gyi shes pa'i stobs kyis 'di dag yod pa nyid du sgrub pa de la yang ma nges pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: gang yang rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi khyad par gyi shes pa'i stobs kyis 'di dag yod pa nyid du sgrub pa de la yang ma nges pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: the particular consciousness of the yogi/nyo. This is shown in the followingüîΩverses.

original: de'i gal te rdul phran zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gal te rdul phran zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If you say that the atom, etc.

original: 'di ltar rdul phra rab la sogs pa'i ngo bo rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa'i phyir phan tshun sil bur 'gyur ba'am /üîΩ'dres par 'gyur ba yin grang /
analyzed: 'di ltar rdul phra rab la sogs pa'i ngo bo rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa'i phyir phan tshun sil bur 'gyur ba'am / 'dres par 'gyur ba yin grang /
translated: are the nature of the atom, etc., then they are either mutually discrete or mixed.

original: gal te phyogs dang po yin na de'i tshe rang nyid kyis dngos po ma 'dres par dmigs pa las de dag la rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi phan tshun mi 'dra ba'i blor gyur pa'i phyir bye brag gzhan brtags pa don med do //
analyzed: gal te phyogs dang po yin na de'i tshe rang nyid kyis dngos po ma 'dres par dmigs pa las de dag la rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi phan tshun mi 'dra ba'i blor gyur pa'i phyir bye brag gzhan brtags pa don med do //
translated: If they are discrete, then, since they are perceived as discrete entities by themselves, it is pointless to imagine other distinctions, since the yogis have a mutual difference of opinion about them.

original: ci ste phyogs gnyis pa yin na de'i tshe ji ltar bye brag gi tshig gi don gzhan nye ba na yang phan tshun tha dad pa'i ngo bo dag la rnal 'byor pa rnams la mi 'dra ba'i shes pa ma 'khrul ba skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ste phyogs gnyis pa yin na de'i tshe ji ltar bye brag gi tshig gi don gzhan nye ba na yang phan tshun tha dad pa'i ngo bo dag la rnal 'byor pa rnams la mi 'dra ba'i shes pa ma 'khrul ba skye bar 'gyur /
translated: But if they are mixed, then how can the yogis have a nonerroneous different cognition of them, since they are mutually different in nature, even when the words of the distinction are near?

original: de ni 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: That would be erroneous,

original: de ma yin pa la de ltar 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma yin pa la de ltar 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it engages what is not there.

original: de lta yin dang rnal 'byor pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ste /
analyzed: de lta yin dang rnal 'byor pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ste /
translated: If that were so, then the yogi would not be a yogi,

original: 'khrul pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: because he would possess a mistaken consciousness.

original: gzhan yang gal te bye brag ces bya ba tshig gi don gzhan med par mi 'dra ba'i blo mi skye na de ji ltar bye brag de dag nyid la mi 'dra ba'i blor 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te bye brag ces bya ba tshig gi don gzhan med par mi 'dra ba'i blo mi skye na de ji ltar bye brag de dag nyid la mi 'dra ba'i blor 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, if a different meaning called ‚Äúdistinction‚Äù does not arise, then how could a different cognition arise in regard to those distinctions?

original: de dag la bye brag gzhan yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag la bye brag gzhan yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: There is no other distinction in them,

original: thug pa med par thal par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / bye brag la mi 'jug pa'i phyir rtag pa'i rdzas la 'jug pa dang mtha' yin no zhes khas blangs pas nyams par yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thug pa med par thal par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / bye brag la mi 'jug pa'i phyir rtag pa'i rdzas la 'jug pa dang mtha' yin no zhes khas blangs pas nyams par yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that there would be an infinite regress, and because it would follow that the absurd consequence of the proposition that it engages permanent substance would be undermined, since it does not engage distinctions.

original: ci ste rang nyid kyis de dag phan tshun mi 'dra ba'i blo'i rgyu nyid du khas len par byed na de'i tshe rdul phra rab la sogs pa rnams kyi yang de'i rgyu nyid rang nyid las yin la rag mod /üîΩgang gis de dag rang nyid kyis phan tshun ldog pa'i lus can gyi yod pa yang rdul phra rab la sogs pa phan tshun mi 'dra ba'i shes pa @306a * //
analyzed: ci ste rang nyid kyis de dag phan tshun mi 'dra ba'i blo'i rgyu nyid du khas len par byed na de'i tshe rdul phra rab la sogs pa rnams kyi yang de'i rgyu nyid rang nyid las yin la rag mod / gang gis de dag rang nyid kyis phan tshun ldog pa'i lus can gyi yod pa yang rdul phra rab la sogs pa phan tshun mi 'dra ba'i shes pa @306a * //
translated: But if you accept that they are the causes of the cognition of each other, then the cause of the cognition of the difference of the subtle particles and so on would be their own nature.

original: skyed pa'i rgyu mi 'dod pa 'dir de dag la sdang ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: skyed pa'i rgyu mi 'dod pa 'dir de dag la sdang ba ci zhig yod /
translated: Why do you, who do not accept that the cognition of the difference of the subtle particles and so on is the cause of the cognition of the difference of the bodies of the different things, hate them?

original: bye brag rnams la yang 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'di la rmongs pa las ma gtogs pa 'di la rgyu cung zad kyang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: bye brag rnams la yang 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'di la rmongs pa las ma gtogs pa 'di la rgyu cung zad kyang ma mthong ngo //
translated: We see no reason at all for the claim that the differences are desired, other than the confusion about this.

original: ji ltar khyi sha zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di la bkra shis blo gros kyi lugs kyi lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te ;
analyzed: ji ltar khyi sha zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di la bkra shis blo gros kyi lugs kyi lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te ;
translated: The following is a response to the argument of Matibhadra:

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He says:

original: ji ltar khyi sha la sogs pa rang nyid kyis mi gtsang ba nyid yin la de dang 'brel pas gzhan dag kyang yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar khyi sha la sogs pa rang nyid kyis mi gtsang ba nyid yin la de dang 'brel pas gzhan dag kyang yin te /
translated: Just as dog meat and so on are impure by nature and other things are impure by association with them,

original: de bzhin du 'di la yang de'i bdag nyid kyis bye brag gzhan dag la rang nyid kyis ldog pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin la de dang 'brel bas rdul phra rab dag kyang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la yang de'i bdag nyid kyis bye brag gzhan dag la rang nyid kyis ldog pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin la de dang 'brel bas rdul phra rab dag kyang yin no //
translated: so too, in this case, by their own nature, other particulars are the cause of the cognition of difference and by association with them, atoms are also.

original: gzhan yang de'i bdag nyid la yang shes pa gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan gzhan can du 'gyur ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de'i bdag nyid la yang shes pa gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan gzhan can du 'gyur ba nyid yin te /
translated: Moreover, even in their own nature, they would be the cause of another cognition, which has another as its object.

original: dper na / sgron mas bum pa la sogs pa la yin gyi sgron ma la bum pa la sogs pa dag gis ni ma yin zhes bya bar nges pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / sgron mas bum pa la sogs pa la yin gyi sgron ma la bum pa la sogs pa dag gis ni ma yin zhes bya bar nges pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a lamp is the cause of the cognition of a pot and so on, but a pot and so on are not the cause of the cognition of a lamp.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the pot and so on.

original: 'di de bzhin zhes bya ba ni mi 'dra ba mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: 'di de bzhin zhes bya ba ni mi 'dra ba mtshon pa ste /
translated: This is just like that is an illustration of nondifference.

original: rdul phra rab la sogs pa rnams ni bye brag rnams kho na las yin la bye brag rnams rang nyid kyis so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdul phra rab la sogs pa rnams ni bye brag rnams kho na las yin la bye brag rnams rang nyid kyis so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The atoms, etc. are from the particulars themselves.

original: 'on te mi gtsang zhes bya bas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: 'on te mi gtsang zhes bya bas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: But if you reply, ‚Äúimpure,‚Äù

original: dngos po rnams kyi mi gtsang nyid //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi mi gtsang nyid //
translated: the reply is, ‚ÄúThe impurity of thingsüîΩis not ultimate.‚Äù

original: ces bya ba ni rtogs pas sbyar ba yin gyi nges pa med pa'i phyir don dam pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rtogs pas sbyar ba yin gyi nges pa med pa'i phyir don dam pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This is a statement of opinion, not definitive, because there is no certainty.

original: 'di ltar rdzas gang kho na gtsang sbra can la sogs pa 'ga' zhig mi gtsang ba nyid du snang ba de kho na gzhan ro sreg mkhan la sogs pa gtsang ba nyid du snang ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdzas gang kho na gtsang sbra can la sogs pa 'ga' zhig mi gtsang ba nyid du snang ba de kho na gzhan ro sreg mkhan la sogs pa gtsang ba nyid du snang ngo //
translated: For whatever substance is impure for some, such as the pure, that very substance is pure for others, such as the cremation ground dwellers.

original: gcig la phan tshun 'gal ba'i ngo bo du ma tshogs pa rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig la phan tshun 'gal ba'i ngo bo du ma tshogs pa rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not logical for a single thing to have a multiplicity of mutually exclusive natures,

original: gcig nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would undermine the very idea of a single thing.

original: rnam pa gcig tu ma dngos po rnams dngos su mi gtsang ba yin du chug mod de lta ma yin na 'di dpe dang mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu ma dngos po rnams dngos su mi gtsang ba yin du chug mod de lta ma yin na 'di dpe dang mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: In one sense, the things are actually impure, but if that were not so, then this example would not be similar.

original: 'di ltar zas la sogs pa'i dngos po khyi sha la sogs pa mi gtsang ba'i rdzas dang phrad pa las sngar gyi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin dor nas mi gtsang ba gzhan nyid skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar zas la sogs pa'i dngos po khyi sha la sogs pa mi gtsang ba'i rdzas dang phrad pa las sngar gyi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin dor nas mi gtsang ba gzhan nyid skye ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the substance of food, etc., having come in contact with impure substances such as dog meat, having abandoned its former pure nature, generates another impurity.

original: des na 'di dag gi gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can gyi mi gtsang ba nyid rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di dag gi gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can gyi mi gtsang ba nyid rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that their impurity is due to something else.

original: de bzhin du gang gis 'di dag gi mi 'dra ba gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can du 'gyur brdul phra rab la sogs pa dag la rgyu mtshan cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang gis 'di dag gi mi 'dra ba gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can du 'gyur brdul phra rab la sogs pa dag la rgyu mtshan cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the atoms, etc., have no reason at all for becoming something else, i.e., something impure.

original: rdul phra rab @306b la sogs pa rtag pa de dag ni skye ba med pa'i phyir de 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab @306b la sogs pa rtag pa de dag ni skye ba med pa'i phyir de 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those permanent atoms, etc., do not arise, because they are not produced.

original: de bzhin sgron ma'i dpe la yang gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can bum pa la sogs pa'i shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu nyid sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin sgron ma'i dpe la yang gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can bum pa la sogs pa'i shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu nyid sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the example of the lamp should be applied to the cause of the cognition of a pot, etc., which has another reason.

original: mi mthun blo ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas bye brag gis gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: mi mthun blo ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas bye brag gis gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma bshad pa yin te /
translated: The explanation of the invalidating valid cognition by way of the specific is by the cognition of the dissimilar, etc.

original: 'di la yang snga ma bzhin du rang gi ngo bo dang 'brel pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang snga ma bzhin du rang gi ngo bo dang 'brel pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Here, as before, the connection with the intrinsic nature should be stated.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las bye brag gi tshig gi don brtag pa ste bcu dgu ba'o /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las bye brag gi tshig gi don brtag pa ste bcu dgu ba'o /
translated: This concludes the investigation of the meaning of the specific words in the Difficult Points of the Compendium of Reality, the nineteenth chapter.

original: // /'du ba sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: // /'du ba sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the collection, it is said,

original: snal ma 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: snal ma 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This cloth, etc.

original: rten dang brten par gyur pa so so ma yin par grub pa rnams kyi 'di'i blo'i rgyu'i 'brel pa gang yin pa 'di de yang snal ma 'di la snam bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di la blo'i khyad par las don gzhan du rtogs te /
analyzed: rten dang brten par gyur pa so so ma yin par grub pa rnams kyi 'di'i blo'i rgyu'i 'brel pa gang yin pa 'di de yang snal ma 'di la snam bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di la blo'i khyad par las don gzhan du rtogs te /
translated: For those who establish the non-difference of the support and the supported, whatever is the connection of this cognition's cause, that is also understood as a different object from the difference of cognition in this cloth, etc.

original: dper na yod pa dang rdzas nyid la sogs pa rnams rang gi rten la bdag dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes pa'i phyir rang gi rten la sogs pa dag dang phan tshun las don gzhan du gyur pa yin pa de bzhin du 'du ba yang tshig gi don
analyzed: dper na yod pa dang rdzas nyid la sogs pa rnams rang gi rten la bdag dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes pa'i phyir rang gi rten la sogs pa dag dang phan tshun las don gzhan du gyur pa yin pa de bzhin du 'du ba yang tshig gi don
translated: For example, existence, substance and so on are different from their basis and so forth because they are the objects of a consciousness that is compatible with their basis and so on.

original: lnga la snal ma 'di dag la snam bu /üîΩrdzas 'di rnams tshig la yon tan dang las dag / rdzas dang yon tan dang las 'di dag la yod la /
analyzed: lnga la snal ma 'di dag la snam bu / rdzas 'di rnams tshig la yon tan dang las dag / rdzas dang yon tan dang las 'di dag la yod la /
translated: Similarly, the meaning of the term is also different from the five terms.üîΩFor example, the meaning of the term cloth is different from the five terms such as thread,üîΩthe meaning of the term substance is different from the five terms such as quality and action,

original: rdzas 'di la rdzas nyid yon tan 'di la yon tan nyid las 'di la las nyid /
analyzed: rdzas 'di la rdzas nyid yon tan 'di la yon tan nyid las 'di la las nyid /
translated: the meaning of the term substance is different from the five terms such as substance, the meaning of the term quality is different from the five terms such as quality, the meaning of the term action is different from the five terms such as action,üîΩthe meaning of the term substance is different from the five terms such as substance and the meaning of the term substance is different from the five terms such as substance.

original: rdzas 'di la mtha'i bye brag ces bya ba la sogs pa bye brag gi shes pa mthong ba'i phyir tshig gi don lnga po dag las don gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yin par shes so //
analyzed: rdzas 'di la mtha'i bye brag ces bya ba la sogs pa bye brag gi shes pa mthong ba'i phyir tshig gi don lnga po dag las don gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yin par shes so //
translated: Because the consciousness that perceives the specific attributes of substance, such as the specific attribute called end, sees that, it is understood that the meaning of the term is different from the five terms.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dag la gang gi rnam pa dang mi 'dra ba'i shes pa de ni de las don gzhan du 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan can yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dag la gang gi rnam pa dang mi 'dra ba'i shes pa de ni de las don gzhan du 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan can yin te /
translated: The application is this: when a cognition has a form that is not like something, it has a reason for being a different object from it.

original: lha spyin la dbyig pa can gyi shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: lha spyin la dbyig pa can gyi shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a cognition of Devadatta with a club.

original: tshig gi don lnga la 'di la zhes bya ba'i shes pa 'di yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyis gtan tshigs su sems so //
analyzed: tshig gi don lnga la 'di la zhes bya ba'i shes pa 'di yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyis gtan tshigs su sems so //
translated: The meaning of the words is this: the cognition of this has that as its nature. This is the inference of the nature.

original: 'di ni 'brel ba bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar de med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'brel ba bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar de med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to show the connection, he says, ‚ÄúBecause it does not exist in the absence of that,‚Äù and so on.

original: rgyu mtshan med par 'byung na rtag tu yod pa la sogs pa thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med par 'byung na rtag tu yod pa la sogs pa thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
translated: If it arose without a reason, the absurd consequence would be that it would always exist, and so on. This is the valid cognition that refutes.

original: de ltar re zhig bye brag pa la sogs pa'i lugs kyis 'du ba 'di la blo'i rtags kyi rjes su dpag par bya ba yin la rigs pa can gyi lugs kyis ni 'di la blo'i mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig bye brag pa la sogs pa'i lugs kyis 'du ba 'di la blo'i rtags kyi rjes su dpag par bya ba yin la rigs pa can gyi lugs kyis ni 'di la blo'i mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: Thus, according to the systems of the Vai≈õe·π£ikas and so on, this collection is to be inferred by the reason of cognition. According to the system of the NaiyƒÅyikas, it is to be understood by the direct perception of cognition.

original: 'di ltar de @307a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar de @307a * //
translated: It is like this.üîΩ

original: dag ni mngon sum gyi bya ba yod pa na snal ma 'di dag la snam bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir mngon sum nyid yin par smra'o //
analyzed: dag ni mngon sum gyi bya ba yod pa na snal ma 'di dag la snam bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir mngon sum nyid yin par smra'o //
translated: Thus, when the activity of direct perception exists, the cognition ‚Äúcloth‚Äù arises in regard to these threads, etc. Therefore, they maintain that direct perception is direct perception.

original: 'du ba de yang ji ltar ldan pa 'brel pa can dag la tha dad pa de bzhin du tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'du ba de yang ji ltar ldan pa 'brel pa can dag la tha dad pa de bzhin du tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: And that collection is not different from those that are related, just as they are related.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: dngos po bzhin du ste /
analyzed: dngos po bzhin du ste /
translated: It is like an entity.

original: yod pa bzhin du de'i rtags khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / khyad par gyi rtags pa med pa'i phyir thams cad du 'du ba gcig nyid yin no //
analyzed: yod pa bzhin du de'i rtags khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / khyad par gyi rtags pa med pa'i phyir thams cad du 'du ba gcig nyid yin no //
translated: Because the sign of that is not different from that which exists, and because the sign of a difference does not exist, the collection is one in all cases, just as it exists.

original: ldan pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin te /üîΩrgyu med pa nyid kyi phyir yod pa nyid bzhin du rtag pa nyid du grub pa la /
analyzed: ldan pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin te / rgyu med pa nyid kyi phyir yod pa nyid bzhin du rtag pa nyid du grub pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúLike a relation‚Äù is an example of a dissimilar property.üîΩBecause of the absence of a cause, like existence, permanence is established.

original: tshad mas rgyu ma dmigs pa'i phyir rgyu med pa nyid du grub po //
analyzed: tshad mas rgyu ma dmigs pa'i phyir rgyu med pa nyid du grub po //
translated: Because the cause is not perceived by a valid cognition, the absence of a cause is established.

original: 'di ni 'di la'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun 'byin pa rtsol te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di la'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun 'byin pa rtsol te /
translated: This is the refutation by the passage beginning ‚ÄúBut if it is the cloth that is in the threads. . . .

original: de'i phyir 'dis gtan tshigs gzhi ma grub par bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis gtan tshigs gzhi ma grub par bshad do //
translated: ‚Äù Therefore, this passage explains that the reason is not established.

original: snal ma 'di dag la snam bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i blo rnams rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la rjes su chags pas brtags pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: snal ma 'di dag la snam bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i blo rnams rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la rjes su chags pas brtags pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: The ideas ‚ÄúThese threads are cloth,‚Äù etc., are mere imputations due to attachment to one‚Äôs own philosophical tenets.üîΩIt is not reasonable that they arise in the world in that way. Therefore, the subject of the thesis is not established.

original: 'jig rten na de bzhin du skye ba rigs pa ni ma yin pas de'i phyir bsgrub bya'i chos can ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten na de bzhin du skye ba rigs pa ni ma yin pas de'i phyir bsgrub bya'i chos can ma grub pa yin no //
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúThe subject is not established‚Äù proves that the subject is not established.üîΩIf the various things that are the basis of the idea of cloth were the cloth, then the idea of cloth would arise from them, just as the idea of a pot arises from a pot.üîΩBut the idea of cloth does not arise from them. Therefore, the subject is not established.

original: rten dang brten par zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos can ma grub pa de nyid sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rten dang brten par zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos can ma grub pa de nyid sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúThe subject is not established‚Äù proves that the subject is not established.

original: de dag la sna tshogs pa nyid mtshon par 'gyur ba de dag nyid brten par 'gyur ba yin na 'jig rten pa 'di la'i blo 'byung bar mthong ste /üîΩdper na kham gzhong 'di na bil ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de dag la sna tshogs pa nyid mtshon par 'gyur ba de dag nyid brten par 'gyur ba yin na 'jig rten pa 'di la'i blo 'byung bar mthong ste /üîΩdper na kham gzhong 'di na bil ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: If the various things that are the basis of the idea of cloth were the cloth, then the idea of cloth would arise from them, just as the idea of a pot arises from a pot.üîΩBut the idea of cloth does not arise from them. Therefore, the subject is not established.

original: snal ma dang snam bu dgal sna tshogs pa nyid mtshon pa'am yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: snal ma dang snam bu dgal sna tshogs pa nyid mtshon pa'am yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And the various threads and cloth are not the cause of the cognition of cloth.

original: de ji ltar de ltar de la 'di la'i blor 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar de ltar de la 'di la'i blor 'gyur /
translated: How could the cognition of cloth arise from them?

original: 'di snyam du gal te kho bo cag gis 'di la'i blo 'di grub mtha'i stobs kyis brtags pa yin pa de lta na yang khyed cag gis 'di'i rgyu mtshan brjod par bya dgos so snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te kho bo cag gis 'di la'i blo 'di grub mtha'i stobs kyis brtags pa yin pa de lta na yang khyed cag gis 'di'i rgyu mtshan brjod par bya dgos so snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúEven if we investigate the cognition of cloth through the power of philosophical theory, you must state the reason for this,‚Äù

original: rang gi 'dod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: we say:üîΩThose who do not assert something as the cause of something else, how could they, having imagined it as the effect, investigate and dispute its cause?

original: gang dag gang gi rgyu nyid du mi 'dod pa de ni ji ltar rang nyid kyis 'bras bur brtags nas de'i rgyu brgal zhing brtag par byed gang gis 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'bras bur brtags nas de'i rgyu brgal zhing brtag par byed pa khyed cag gis 'dod pa'i
analyzed: gang dag gang gi rgyu nyid du mi 'dod pa de ni ji ltar rang nyid kyis 'bras bur brtags nas de'i rgyu brgal zhing brtag par byed gang gis 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'bras bur brtags nas de'i rgyu brgal zhing brtag par byed pa khyed cag gis 'dod pa'i
translated: Those who, through the power of their assertions, imagine something as an effect, investigate and dispute its cause.

original: dbang gis 'bras bu 'di rtog par byed pa khyed cag bdag nyid la brgal zhing brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang gis 'bras bu 'di rtog par byed pa khyed cag bdag nyid la brgal zhing brtag par bya'o //
translated: You who imagine this effect through the power of your assertions should investigate and dispute yourselves.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin ni 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin ni 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The nature of things does not follow after desire.

original: 'di dag ni rang @307b dgar 'jug pa'i phyir de las dngos po grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni rang @307b dgar 'jug pa'i phyir de las dngos po grub pa ma yin te /
translated: These things are not established from that, because they engage by themselves.

original: thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be an infinite regress.

original: 'di ltar khyed cag gis kun du brtags pa'i dngos po la 'ga' zhig gzhan du yang brtags par nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed cag gis kun du brtags pa'i dngos po la 'ga' zhig gzhan du yang brtags par nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, it is possible for you to imagine some other thing in regard to the thing imagined by you.

original: gzhan yang snal ma 'di la snam bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i blo 'jig rten na ma grub pa 'ga' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang snal ma 'di la snam bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i blo 'jig rten na ma grub pa 'ga' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Moreover, not only is the cognition of cloth in thread and so on not established in the world,üîΩbut rather, the opposite is established.

original: 'on kyang de las bzlog pa nyid du grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩshing la yal ga zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩshing la yal ga ril brag ces bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu 'jig rten na mthong gi / yal ga la shing /
analyzed: 'on kyang de las bzlog pa nyid du grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir / shing la yal ga zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / shing la yal ga ril brag ces bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu 'jig rten na mthong gi / yal ga la shing /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:üîΩThe cognition of a tree in a branch and so on is seen in the world, but not the cognition of a branch in a tree.

original: brag dag la ri zhes ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: brag dag la ri zhes ni ma yin no ;
translated: The cognition of a mountain in a rock and so on is seen in the world, but not the cognition of a rock in a mountain.

original: / shing la yang yal ga zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i blo de yang 'du ba'i dbang gis ma yin gyi /
analyzed: / shing la yang yal ga zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i blo de yang 'du ba'i dbang gis ma yin gyi /
translated: The cognition of a tree, a branch, etc. is not due to the power of aggregation.

original: 'on kyang mi 'gro ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa'i brjod par 'dod pa'i yal ga dang brag dag las tha dad pa ma rtogs pa nyid du gnas pa'i lhag ma'i phrag pa la sogs pa'i yal lag de dag ni bar med par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang mi 'gro ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa'i brjod par 'dod pa'i yal ga dang brag dag las tha dad pa ma rtogs pa nyid du gnas pa'i lhag ma'i phrag pa la sogs pa'i yal lag de dag ni bar med par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, the remaining parts of the tree, the trunk, etc. are not perceived as separate from the branch and the rock, which are the objects of the desire to speak.

original: 'dir mi 'gro ba'i sgras 'gro ba med pa'i phyir shing dang ri la 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir mi 'gro ba'i sgras 'gro ba med pa'i phyir shing dang ri la 'dod do //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúnon-moving‚Äù refers to trees and rocks because they do not move.

original: de dag la yang zhes bya ba ni brag dang yal ga dag la'o //
analyzed: de dag la yang zhes bya ba ni brag dang yal ga dag la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn them‚Äù means in the rocks and branches.

original: 'di dag ces bya ba ni ri dang shing dag go //üîΩ'o na bum pa 'di la gzugs so //üîΩdri 'o // ro'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba ni ri dang shing dag go // 'o na bum pa 'di la gzugs so // dri 'o // ro'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThese‚Äù refers to the mountains and trees.üîΩNow, what is the object of the cognition that is well-known in the world, such as ‚ÄúThis is a pot,‚Äù

original: reg go // g-yo ba'o zhes bya ba 'jig rten na rab tu grags pa'i shes pa gang yin pa 'di 'du pa ma gtogs pa gzhan gang zhig yul zhe na /
analyzed: reg go // g-yo ba'o zhes bya ba 'jig rten na rab tu grags pa'i shes pa gang yin pa 'di 'du pa ma gtogs pa gzhan gang zhig yul zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúThis is form,‚Äù ‚ÄúThis is smell,‚Äù ‚ÄúThis is taste,‚Äù ‚ÄúThis is touch,‚Äù ‚ÄúThis is moving‚Äù?

original: bum pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bum pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúThe vase, etc.‚Äù

original: de'i bdag nyid ni shes pas gzugs la sogs pa rnams bum pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni shes pas gzugs la sogs pa rnams bum pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs te /
translated: is stated. The nature of that is the form, etc. that are understood as the nature of the vase.

original: 'jig rten na zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten na zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the world‚Äù is the remainder.

original: bum pa las gzugs ni bum pa'i rang bzhin gyi gzugs te /
analyzed: bum pa las gzugs ni bum pa'i rang bzhin gyi gzugs te /
translated: The form of the vase is the form that is the nature of the vase.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the nature of the vase, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa mang po dag la thun mong ma yin pa'i nus pa'i khyad par bstan par 'dod na de las gzhan pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnam par bcad nas bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra sbyor te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mang po dag la thun mong ma yin pa'i nus pa'i khyad par bstan par 'dod na de las gzhan pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnam par bcad nas bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra sbyor te /
translated: If one wishes to teach the uncommon capacity of many things such as form, then the term vase, etc. is applied after the exclusion of other things such as form.üîΩThe term vase, etc. is applied in order to clarify the uncommon capacity of each to produce effects such as eye consciousness.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i sgar ni re re la thun mong ma yin pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'grub pa'i nus pa gsal bar bya ba'i don du sbyor bar byed ces de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra'i khyad par tha
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i sgar ni re re la thun mong ma yin pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'grub pa'i nus pa gsal bar bya ba'i don du sbyor bar byed ces de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra'i khyad par tha
translated: Therefore the term vase, etc. is applied in order to clarify the uncommon capacity of each to produce effects such as eye consciousness.

original: dad 'phen par byed pas gzhi mthun pa med pa'i phyir gzhi tha @308a * //
analyzed: dad 'phen par byed pas gzhi mthun pa med pa'i phyir gzhi tha @308a * //
translated: because there is no common locus for the two, since faith is a cause of increase.

original: dad pa nyid kyis de'i bdag nyid kyis de'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dad pa nyid kyis de'i bdag nyid kyis de'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the two are understood to be different in terms of their own nature.

original: ci'i phyir gnyi ga sbyar zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gnyi ga sbyar zhe na /
translated: Why are the two combined?

original: gzugs dang bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzugs dang bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúform, pot, etc.,‚Äù

original: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra ni gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas skabs thams cad kyi rjod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra ni gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas skabs thams cad kyi rjod par byed pa yin te /
translated: because the word ‚Äúform‚Äù and so on expresses all the states of form and so on.

original: 'di ltar ji ltar bum pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa zhes brjod pa de bzhin du snam bu la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa dag la yang yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar ji ltar bum pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa zhes brjod pa de bzhin du snam bu la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa dag la yang yin no //
translated: Just as form and so on that exist in the nature of a pot are called ‚Äúform‚Äù and so on, so too are those that exist in the nature of a cloth and so on.

original: de ltar na gzugs la sogs pa sgra 'ba' zhig las gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas ci yin pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs la sogs pa sgra 'ba' zhig las gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas ci yin pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus the word ‚Äúform‚Äù alone does not express the specific state of form and so on.

original: bum pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba de lta bu sbyor ba na de dag ni bum pa'i bdag nyid yin no zhes rnam par bcad nas rtogs so //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba de lta bu sbyor ba na de dag ni bum pa'i bdag nyid yin no zhes rnam par bcad nas rtogs so //
translated: When one uses expressions such as ‚Äúvase, etc.,‚Äù one understands by exclusion that they are the nature of a vase.

original: de bzhin du bum pa'i sgra yang dkar po dang ser po dang g-yo ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa bum pa'i gnas skabs thams cad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bum pa'i sgra yang dkar po dang ser po dang g-yo ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa bum pa'i gnas skabs thams cad brjod pa yin te /
translated: In the same way, the word ‚Äúvase‚Äù expresses all the states of the vase, such as ‚Äúwhite,‚Äù ‚Äúyellow,‚Äù ‚Äúmoving,‚Äù etc.

original: de'i phyir 'ba' zhig pa las khyad par rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'ba' zhig pa las khyad par rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the particular is not understood from the word alone.

original: bum pa la gzugs dkar po zhes bya ba la sogs pa sbyor ba na ni de las gzhan pa'i gzugs la sogs pa bcad nas rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bum pa la gzugs dkar po zhes bya ba la sogs pa sbyor ba na ni de las gzhan pa'i gzugs la sogs pa bcad nas rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: When one uses expressions such as ‚Äúwhite color of the vase,‚Äù one understands by excluding the color, etc., of other things.

original: de lta yin dang de ltar 'gyur ba'i khyad par de brjod pa'i phyir de bzhin de bum pa la sogs pa la gzugs zhes bya ba gang dag sbyar te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang de ltar 'gyur ba'i khyad par de brjod pa'i phyir de bzhin de bum pa la sogs pa la gzugs zhes bya ba gang dag sbyar te /
translated: In this way, the particular is expressed, and therefore the word ‚Äúcolor,‚Äù etc., is applied to the vase, etc.

original: sgra zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: sgra zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúsound‚Äù is the remainder.

original: sgra de dag la brten nas bum pa la sogs pa 'di dag la bum pa la gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa des shes pa 'jug gi /'du ba la brten nas 'jug pa ni ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: sgra de dag la brten nas bum pa la sogs pa 'di dag la bum pa la gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa des shes pa 'jug gi /'du ba la brten nas 'jug pa ni ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: The meaning of the passage is this: The cognition of these things, such as the pot, etc., occurs in the form of 'pot', 'form', etc., on the basis of those words, and not on the basis of the collection.

original: 'di'i rgyu smras pa ni thams cad kyis khyad par ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di'i rgyu smras pa ni thams cad kyis khyad par ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The reason for this is stated: because all do not see the difference.
