original: gang gis blo 'di 'du ba'i rgyu mtshan can du 'gyur ba 'du ba dang bum pa dang gzugs la sogs pa thams cad phan tshun tha dad du dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis blo 'di 'du ba'i rgyu mtshan can du 'gyur ba 'du ba dang bum pa dang gzugs la sogs pa thams cad phan tshun tha dad du dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For, the collection and the pot, etc., are not perceived as different from each other, by which this cognition would be a sign of the collection.

original: 'dis ni gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid dang dam bcas pa la rjes su dpag pas gnod pa nyid bstan to //üîΩgang yang 'di la'i blo khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la /
analyzed: 'dis ni gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid dang dam bcas pa la rjes su dpag pas gnod pa nyid bstan to // gang yang 'di la'i blo khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la /
translated: This shows that the reason is inconclusive and that the thesis is contradicted by inference.üîΩNow, in response to the statement, because the cognition of this is not different, etc.

original: gal te dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, If it is said that the cognition of this is not different, etc., etc.

original: gal te 'jig rten gsum na 'du ba gcig yod par gyur na de'i @308b tshe gyo mo dag la snam bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i blor 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten gsum na 'du ba gcig yod par gyur na de'i @308b tshe gyo mo dag la snam bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i blor 'gyur zhing /
translated: If there were a single universal in the three worlds, then the cognition of a cloth in potsherds and so on would occur.

original: rta la sogs pa yang ba lang nyid la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir de ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rta la sogs pa yang ba lang nyid la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir de ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: And because horses and so on have the universal of cow, that would occur.

original: de lta yin dang khra bo la sogs pa'i bye brag bzhin du glang po la sogs pa la yang ba lang la sogs pa'i shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang khra bo la sogs pa'i bye brag bzhin du glang po la sogs pa la yang ba lang la sogs pa'i shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then just as there is a difference in the cognition of a variegated object, there would also be a difference in the cognition of an elephant and so on.

original: 'di ltar gang gi phyir 'du ba'i stobs kyis snal ma dag la snam bu'i snyam pa'i rtog par brjod pa snam bu'i 'du ba 'di gyo mo la sogs pa yang yod pas ci'i phyir de ltar rtogs par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi phyir 'du ba'i stobs kyis snal ma dag la snam bu'i snyam pa'i rtog par brjod pa snam bu'i 'du ba 'di gyo mo la sogs pa yang yod pas ci'i phyir de ltar rtogs par mi 'gyur /
translated: In that case, why would the cognition of a cloth not occur in potsherds and so on, since the universal of cloth exists in potsherds and so on by the power of inherence?

original: 'di snyam du gyo mo dag la snam bu brten pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gyo mo dag la snam bu brten pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If you think that potsherds do not support a cloth,

original: des na de la de ltar rtogs par mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa de yang log pa yin te ;
analyzed: des na de la de ltar rtogs par mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa de yang log pa yin te ;
translated: then that is also wrong.

original: 'di ltar gang gi snal ma dag kho na la snam bu yod cing de la blo mi 'gyur ba 'du ba'i dbang gis snal ma dag la yang snam bu brten pa zhes bya bar brjod pa gang yin pa'i 'du ba de gyo mo dag la yang ci ste
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi snal ma dag kho na la snam bu yod cing de la blo mi 'gyur ba 'du ba'i dbang gis snal ma dag la yang snam bu brten pa zhes bya bar brjod pa gang yin pa'i 'du ba de gyo mo dag la yang ci ste
translated: Why is it not the case that the same relation exists between the potsherds?

original: med / 'on kyang snal ma snam bu'i 'du ba zhes bstan pa gang yin pa de kho na bum pa'i gyo mo dag la yin te /
analyzed: med / 'on kyang snal ma snam bu'i 'du ba zhes bstan pa gang yin pa de kho na bum pa'i gyo mo dag la yin te /
translated: The relation that is taught to exist between the threads and the cloth exists between the potsherds and the pot.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar 'tshol bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar 'tshol bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, why is it not sought in the potsherds?üîΩThus, the cognition of the potsherds is not different from the cognition of the pot.

original: des na de'i phyir blo bar chad med pa ste bar chad dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de'i phyir blo bar chad med pa ste bar chad dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the cognition is uninterrupted, that is, free from interruption.

original: de'i phyir rdzas dang yon tan dang / las rnams kyi rdzas nyid dang / yon tan nyid dang / las nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams kyi 'brel pa gcig yin pa'i phyir tshig gi don la rnam par dbye ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdzas dang yon tan dang / las rnams kyi rdzas nyid dang / yon tan nyid dang / las nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams kyi 'brel pa gcig yin pa'i phyir tshig gi don la rnam par dbye ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the relation of substance, quality, and action, such as the substantiality of substance, the quality of quality, and the action of action, etc., would be one, and the meaning of the word would be undifferentiated.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas glang po la sogs pa la ba lang la sogs pa'i blor thal bar 'gyur ba sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas glang po la sogs pa la ba lang la sogs pa'i blor thal bar 'gyur ba sgrub par byed do //
translated: Thus, etc. proves that it would follow that an elephant, etc. would be the cognition of a cow, etc.

original: de kha cig na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bkra shis blo gros kyi lan dogs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de kha cig na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bkra shis blo gros kyi lan dogs par byed pa yin te /
translated: One, etc. expresses the doubt of Bhavaviveka‚Äôs answer.

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He says:

original: gal te yang 'du ba gcig yin pa de lta na yang rten dang brten par nges pa'i phyir tshig gi don lnga 'chol bar 'gyur ba ma yin te //
analyzed: gal te yang 'du ba gcig yin pa de lta na yang rten dang brten par nges pa'i phyir tshig gi don lnga 'chol bar 'gyur ba ma yin te //
translated: Even if there is only one collection, still, because the basis and the based are ascertained, the five categories are not confused.

original: 'di ltar rdzas dag kha na la rdzas nyid dang / yon tan dag kho na la yon tan nyid dang / las dag kho na la las nyid ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa so sor nges pa'i rten rnam par bcad nas rtogs pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdzas dag kha na la rdzas nyid dang / yon tan dag kho na la yon tan nyid dang / las dag kho na la las nyid ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa so sor nges pa'i rten rnam par bcad nas rtogs pa skye ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the cognition arises by excluding the individual ascertained basis, such as substance alone is substance, quality alone is quality, and action alone is action.

original: 'o na de lta na tshig gi don re re la 'du ba tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na tshig gi don re re la 'du ba tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Well, in that case, each category would have a different collection.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, etc.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba'i 'du ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi shes pa thams cad du tha mi dad pa'i rnam pas rjes su mi 'gro bar mthong ba'i phyir thams cad du 'du ba ni gcig yin no zhes bya bar @309a * //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba'i 'du ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi shes pa thams cad du tha mi dad pa'i rnam pas rjes su mi 'gro bar mthong ba'i phyir thams cad du 'du ba ni gcig yin no zhes bya bar @309a * //
translated: Because it is seen that the consciousness that is the basis of the term ‚Äúthis‚Äù does not follow the aspect that is undifferentiated in all cases, it is understood that ‚Äúone‚Äù is the basis of all.

original: rtogs so // gcig nyid yin na yang rdzas nyid la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi blo so sor nges pa'i rten rnam par bcad nas ldog pa ste /
analyzed: rtogs so // gcig nyid yin na yang rdzas nyid la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi blo so sor nges pa'i rten rnam par bcad nas ldog pa ste /
translated: Even though it is one, the substance itself is ascertained as the basis of the cognition of the reason, because it is seen that it does not follow the exclusion of the individual.

original: rjes su mi 'gro bar mthong ba'i phyir rdzas la sogs pa'i rigs rnams ldog pa nyid du shes te /
analyzed: rjes su mi 'gro bar mthong ba'i phyir rdzas la sogs pa'i rigs rnams ldog pa nyid du shes te /
translated: Because it is seen that it does not follow the exclusion of the individual, the substance itself is known to be the exclusion of the individual.

original: des na tshig gi don lnga 'chol bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na tshig gi don lnga 'chol bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the five meanings of the word are not confused.

original: yang ji ltar 'brel pa khyad par med na yang 'di dag gi rten dang brten pa so sor nges par rigs she na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar 'brel pa khyad par med na yang 'di dag gi rten dang brten pa so sor nges par rigs she na /
translated: Again, how is it that, even though the relation is not differentiated, the basis and the dependent are ascertained as individual?

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúFor example,‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar kham gzhong dang zho dag gi ldan pa gcig yin na yang rten dang brten pa nges par 'gyur ba de bzhin du rdzas la sogs pa rnams kyi 'du ba gcig yin na yang gsal bya dang gsal byed kyis nus pa tha dang pa'i phyir rten dang
analyzed: ji ltar kham gzhong dang zho dag gi ldan pa gcig yin na yang rten dang brten pa nges par 'gyur ba de bzhin du rdzas la sogs pa rnams kyi 'du ba gcig yin na yang gsal bya dang gsal byed kyis nus pa tha dang pa'i phyir rten dang
translated: Just as a bowl and yogurt are one possessor of the state of being conjoined, but the support and supported are ascertained, so too, even though the collection of substances and so on is one, the supported and support are ascertained because the object to be clarified and the clarifier have different power.üîΩ

original: brten pa so sor nges pa yin no //
analyzed: brten pa so sor nges pa yin no //
translated: Just as a bowl and yogurt are one possession, but the support and the supported are ascertained, so too, even though the collection of substances and so on is one, the supported and the support are ascertained individually because the capacity of the manifestor and the manifested is different.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rten dang brten pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rten dang brten pa nges pa'o //
translated: That is the ascertainment of the support and the supported.

original: gcig na zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: gcig na zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: The response to that is stated in the verse: If one form is the support of another form, then all forms would be the support of all forms.

original: kho bo cag la ni gzugs la sogs pa nyid gzugs la sogs pa la brten pa'i nges pa ma grub kyi 'on kyang khyed cag nyid la yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag la ni gzugs la sogs pa nyid gzugs la sogs pa la brten pa'i nges pa ma grub kyi 'on kyang khyed cag nyid la yin no //
translated: We do not establish the ascertainment of form and so on as the support of form and so on, but rather you do.

original: 'du ba de yang thams cad du gcig nyid du khas len pa na 'thad par dga'o zhes thal bsgrub par byed de /
analyzed: 'du ba de yang thams cad du gcig nyid du khas len pa na 'thad par dga'o zhes thal bsgrub par byed de /
translated: If you accept that collection is one in all cases, then it is logical to accept that the collection of all forms is the support of one form.

original: 'di ltar rdzas kho na la rdzas nyid ces bya ba de lta bu'i nges par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni 'du ba'i stobs nyid las yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdzas kho na la rdzas nyid ces bya ba de lta bu'i nges par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni 'du ba'i stobs nyid las yin no //
translated: Thus, the assertion that only substance is called substance is due to the power of aggregation.

original: rdzas nyid la sogs pa de'i yang 'du ba gang yin pa de kho na yon tan la sogs pa la yang yod de /
analyzed: rdzas nyid la sogs pa de'i yang 'du ba gang yin pa de kho na yon tan la sogs pa la yang yod de /
translated: That which is the aggregation of substance and so on also exists in quality and so forth,

original: yon tan nyid la sogs pa de dag dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan nyid la sogs pa de dag dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are related to those qualities and so on.

original: gal te 'brel pa yod pa de lta na yang de nyid de la 'du ba yin no zhes ji ltar nges she na /
analyzed: gal te 'brel pa yod pa de lta na yang de nyid de la 'du ba yin no zhes ji ltar nges she na /
translated: Even if that relation exists, how can it be ascertained that it is the aggregation of just that?

original: de dag gi 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag gi 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says ‚Äúthat of those,‚Äù and so on.

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni rdzas nyid dang yon tan nyid la sogs pa rigs dag gi'o //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni rdzas nyid dang yon tan nyid la sogs pa rigs dag gi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat of those‚Äù refers to the types of substance, quality, and so on.

original: de lta yin dang rgyu mtshan tha mi dad pa'i phyir de 'chol bar thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog par dka'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de lta yin dang rgyu mtshan tha mi dad pa'i phyir de 'chol bar thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog par dka'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: If that were so, it would be difficult to avoid the consequence that they would be mixed because the reasons are not different.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te rdzas la rdzas nyid kyi 'du ba gang yin pa de kho na yon tan la sogs pa dag la yon tan nyid la sogs pa mi 'gyur na de'i tshe ldan pa bzhin du rten so so la 'du ba tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rdzas la rdzas nyid kyi 'du ba gang yin pa de kho na yon tan la sogs pa dag la yon tan nyid la sogs pa mi 'gyur na de'i tshe ldan pa bzhin du rten so so la 'du ba tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the mere collection of substance in substance itself does not become the mere collection of qualities, etc., in qualities, etc., then, like the possessor of qualities, the collection would be different in each basis.

original: gang yang rdzas nyid sogs rgyu mtshan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa de la rdzas nyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang yang rdzas nyid sogs rgyu mtshan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa de la rdzas nyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: As for the statement, ‚ÄúThe mere collection of substance, etc., is not the reason,‚Äù the mere collection of substance, etc.,

original: rgyu mtshan ma tshang ba med pa yod pa na 'bras bu ldog pa ste med pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ma tshang ba med pa yod pa na 'bras bu ldog pa ste med pa mi rigs te /
translated: is not the reason for the existence of the effect, because when the reason is not complete, the effect does not exist.

original: de'i 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid du @309b thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid du @309b thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it would follow that it would not be the effect of that.

original: de lta na blo ldog par mi rung ba'i phyir rten dang brten pa de'i nges pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: de lta na blo ldog par mi rung ba'i phyir rten dang brten pa de'i nges pa mi rigs so //
translated: In that case, it is not possible that the basis and the dependent are ascertained in that way, because it is not possible for the mind to be reversed.

original: 'on te rdzas kho na rdzas nyid rten te gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad las nges par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rdzas kho na rdzas nyid rten te gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad las nges par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is it not ascertained that substance itself is the basis of substance, etc., from the conventions of ‚Äúit is based‚Äù and ‚Äúit is located‚Äù?

original: de la brten pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la brten pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case, the basis, etc., are not tenable.‚Äù

original: khyed cag gis 'du ba de nyid las brten pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa brjod de /
analyzed: khyed cag gis 'du ba de nyid las brten pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa brjod de /
translated: You have described the very same collection as the basis, etc.

original: de yang thams cad la khyad par med pa na ji ltar nges pa 'di rigs pa yin /
analyzed: de yang thams cad la khyad par med pa na ji ltar nges pa 'di rigs pa yin /
translated: But if that is so, since there is no difference between them, how could this ascertainment be tenable?

original: 'di lta bas na rten dang brten pa'i dngos po de'i brten pa la sogs pa 'di yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di lta bas na rten dang brten pa'i dngos po de'i brten pa la sogs pa 'di yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the basis, the based, and the based, etc., are not tenable.

original: 'di dag ni rten dang brten ba dang lhan cig grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rten dang brten ba dang lhan cig grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are simultaneously established and have the same nature.

original: 'on gsal bya gsal byed kyi nus pa nges pa las nges par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on gsal bya gsal byed kyi nus pa nges pa las nges par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But the capacity of the manifest and the manifester is ascertained from ascertainment.

original: gsal bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gsal bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe manifest, etc.‚Äù

original: rdzas la sogs pa rnams ni rdzas nyid kyi spyi gsal bar byed pa gang brjod pa de ni 'du ba'i stobs nyid kyis yin te /
analyzed: rdzas la sogs pa rnams ni rdzas nyid kyi spyi gsal bar byed pa gang brjod pa de ni 'du ba'i stobs nyid kyis yin te /
translated: The manifest, etc., of substances, etc., is described as the manifestation of the generality of substantiality, etc.

original: 'di ltar gang kho na las rdzas nyid rdzas la 'du ba de kho na las des de gsal ba'o zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang kho na las rdzas nyid rdzas la 'du ba de kho na las des de gsal ba'o zhes brjod do //
translated: Thus, it is said that that very thing from which a substance is derived is also that from which it is manifested.

original: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni bde bar gshegs pa pas brjod pa las te /
analyzed: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni bde bar gshegs pa pas brjod pa las te /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom another‚Äù means from the statements of the Sugata.

original: shes pa skyed par rung ba'i rang bzhin skyed pa las so //
analyzed: shes pa skyed par rung ba'i rang bzhin skyed pa las so //
translated: [The meaning is that] a substance is manifested from that which has the nature of being capable of producing cognition.

original: gang gi phyir yong pa la sogs pa'i rtag pa rnams kyang 'du bar 'dod la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yong pa la sogs pa'i rtag pa rnams kyang 'du bar 'dod la /
translated: Because you assert that permanent things, such as a substance, can enter into a relationship,

original: rtag pa rnams skye bar rigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa rnams skye bar rigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: it is not reasonable that permanent things arise.

original: 'di nyid mar me la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas sgrub par byed de /üîΩgang yang kham gzhong dang zho'i ldan pa dpe nyid du smras pa de yang kho bo cag la ma grub po zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid mar me la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas sgrub par byed de / gang yang kham gzhong dang zho'i ldan pa dpe nyid du smras pa de yang kho bo cag la ma grub po zhes ston pa ni /
translated: This is established by the example of a lamp, etc.üîΩThe example of a pot and yogurt that you cite is not established for us.

original: kham gzhong zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kham gzhong zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is demonstrated by the passage that begins ‚ÄúA pot and yogurt are not the same.‚Äù

original: gong bu zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'i tshig gi don sun dbyung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gong bu zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'i tshig gi don sun dbyung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúaggregate‚Äù is refuted.

original: ldan pa gcig yin du chug mod de lta na yang thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs pa kho na'o zhes ston pa ni de las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ldan pa gcig yin du chug mod de lta na yang thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs pa kho na'o zhes ston pa ni de las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúIn that case, etc.‚Äù

original: de las zhes bya ba ldan pa las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ldan pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means in the case of inherence.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba ni zho la kham gzhong zhes bya ba ldan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa'i blor thal bar 'gyur ba ste ldan pa'i rgyu mtshan khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba ni zho la kham gzhong zhes bya ba ldan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa'i blor thal bar 'gyur ba ste ldan pa'i rgyu mtshan khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absurd consequence is that the cognition of the meaning of the word inherence would be like the cognition of the word ‚Äúbowl‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúbowl of yogurt,‚Äù because there would be no difference in the reason for inherence.

original: gang yang rgyu ma dmigs pa'i phyir 'du ba rtag pa yin no zhes smras pa de la /
analyzed: gang yang rgyu ma dmigs pa'i phyir 'du ba rtag pa yin no zhes smras pa de la /
translated: Someone might say, ‚ÄúThe conjunction is permanent because its cause is not perceived.‚Äù

original: 'di ni rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgal te 'du ba rtag pa nyid du gyur na de'i tshe rang gi rten dag la de dag rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir bum pa la @310a * //
analyzed: 'di ni rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gal te 'du ba rtag pa nyid du gyur na de'i tshe rang gi rten dag la de dag rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir bum pa la @310a * //
translated: To respond to that, he says, ‚ÄúIf it were permanent, etc.‚Äù

original: sogs pa rnams kyang rtag par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sogs pa rnams kyang rtag par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the conjunction were permanent, then it would follow that the pot, etc., would also be permanent, because those would always remain in their own supports.

original: 'di ltar 'du ba yod pa nyid las 'di dag rang gi rten dag la gnas par 'dod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du ba yod pa nyid las 'di dag rang gi rten dag la gnas par 'dod la /
translated: Thus, they assert that these things abide in their own supports due to the existence of their assembly.

original: 'du ba de yang rtag pas ci'i phyir 'di dag rtag tu gnas par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'du ba de yang rtag pas ci'i phyir 'di dag rtag tu gnas par mi 'gyur /
translated: But since that assembly is permanent, why don‚Äôt they always abide?

original: rang gi rtsom byed ces bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin no ;
analyzed: rang gi rtsom byed ces bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin no ;
translated: The response of others is anticipated in the phrase ‚Äúdue to the destruction of its own composition,‚Äù and so on.

original: /'di snyam du bum pa la sogs pa rang rtsom par byed pa'i yan lag gang dag yin pa de dag bye ba'am zhig pas bum pa la sogs pa 'jig pa yin te /
analyzed: /'di snyam du bum pa la sogs pa rang rtsom par byed pa'i yan lag gang dag yin pa de dag bye ba'am zhig pas bum pa la sogs pa 'jig pa yin te /
translated: They think, ‚ÄúA vase and so on is destroyed due to the destruction or separation of its own parts that compose it.

original: dper na snam bu'i 'khal ba dang 'thag pa dag gi bya ba la sogs pa rig pa dang ldan pa'i rdzas la sogs pa dag las 'jig pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na snam bu'i 'khal ba dang 'thag pa dag gi bya ba la sogs pa rig pa dang ldan pa'i rdzas la sogs pa dag las 'jig pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the destruction of a vase is like the destruction of the action of weaving a cloth due to the separation of the intelligent substances and so on.

original: ji skad du reg pa dang ldan pa'i rdzas dang 'brel pa dang 'bras bu dang 'gal ba las 'jig go zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du reg pa dang ldan pa'i rdzas dang 'brel pa dang 'bras bu dang 'gal ba las 'jig go zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúDestruction is due to the separation of a substance that is in contact with contact and due to the effect that is incompatible with it.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du blo ni blo gzhan gyis 'jig pa la sgra yang sgra gzhan gyis so zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lugs yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du blo ni blo gzhan gyis 'jig pa la sgra yang sgra gzhan gyis so zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lugs yin no //
translated: Likewise, the mind is destroyed by another mind, and sound by another sound. This is the opponent‚Äôs view.

original: des na 'du ba yod na yang gnas pa'i rgyu lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan med pa'i phyir dang ; 'gal ba'i rkyen dang phrad pas bum pa la sogs pa rtag par thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'du ba yod na yang gnas pa'i rgyu lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan med pa'i phyir dang ; 'gal ba'i rkyen dang phrad pas bum pa la sogs pa rtag par thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'o //
translated: Therefore, even if there is a collection, there is no cause for endurance, because there is no other co-operating cause, and because there is no fault of the consequence that the pot, etc. would endure forever, since it is in contact with the condition that is incompatible with endurance. This is the opponent‚Äôs belief.

original: de lta ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas len 'debs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas len 'debs par byed pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äú It is not so,‚Äù etc. is the refutation of that.

original: 'di ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ni mi rigs te /
translated: This is not correct.

original: 'di ltar gyo mo la sogs pa rang rtsom par byed pa'i yan lag de dag rang rtsom par byed pa'i yan lag gzhan la 'du la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gyo mo la sogs pa rang rtsom par byed pa'i yan lag de dag rang rtsom par byed pa'i yan lag gzhan la 'du la /
translated: Thus, the parts of the pot, etc. that are produced from themselves are assembled from other parts that are produced from themselves.

original: de dag kyang gzhan dag la ste rdul phra rab kyi bar du 'dod la /
analyzed: de dag kyang gzhan dag la ste rdul phra rab kyi bar du 'dod la /
translated: And those are assembled from others, up to the atoms.

original: rdul phra rab de yang rtag pa'i phyir gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab de yang rtag pa'i phyir gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And that atom is permanent, so it does not change into something else.

original: de lta yin dang thams cad kyi rang rtsom par byed pa'i yan lag rnams la 'du ba thams cad du yod pa'i phyir 'jig pa'am bye bar gal 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta yin dang thams cad kyi rang rtsom par byed pa'i yan lag rnams la 'du ba thams cad du yod pa'i phyir 'jig pa'am bye bar gal 'gyur /
translated: If that were so, then since all the parts that compose it would exist in all the composites, how could they be destroyed or separated?

original: kyang gi sgras ni de rtsom par byed pa'i rdzas rnams 'ba' zhig tu ma zad bya ba la sogs pa rnams kyang yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni de rtsom par byed pa'i rdzas rnams 'ba' zhig tu ma zad bya ba la sogs pa rnams kyang yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that not only the substances that compose it, but also the actions, etc., are like that.

original: gal te rang rtsom par byed pa'i yan lag rnams 'jig par khas len na de'i tshe 'du ba 'di yang nges par 'jig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rang rtsom par byed pa'i yan lag rnams 'jig par khas len na de'i tshe 'du ba 'di yang nges par 'jig par 'gyur te /
translated: If one accepts that the parts that compose it are destroyed, then at that time this composite would definitely be destroyed.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'brel pa can ni ldog pa na //
analyzed: 'brel pa can ni ldog pa na //
translated: Because when the related disintegrates,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: etc.

original: 'di nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir 'brel pa can ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir 'brel pa can ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to prove just this, he says, ‚ÄúWhen the related disintegrates, etc.‚Äù

original: de lta yin dang 'brel pa can zhig pa'i phyir ldan pa zhig pa bzhin du 'du ba la mi rtag pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'brel pa can zhig pa'i phyir ldan pa zhig pa bzhin du 'du ba la mi rtag pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then because the related disintegrates, the composite would be impermanent, like the disintegration of the related.

original: yang na ma zhig pa'i @310b ldan pa'i rdzas gnyis bzhin du 'brel pa ma zhig pa'i phyir 'brel pa can rnams gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ma zhig pa'i @310b ldan pa'i rdzas gnyis bzhin du 'brel pa ma zhig pa'i phyir 'brel pa can rnams gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, like the two substances of the conjunction that has not yet perished, the connection does not perish, and so the connected things endure.

original: de lta ma yin na gnyig yang de dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin nyams par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gnyig yang de dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin nyams par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then the nature of both as connected would be destroyed.

original: 'brel pa can gcig ces bya ba la sogs pas gzhan dag rtsod par byed do //
analyzed: 'brel pa can gcig ces bya ba la sogs pas gzhan dag rtsod par byed do //
translated: Others argue as follows:

original: 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: They think as follows:

original: gal te gtan tshigs dang po 'brel pa can mtha' dag zhig pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don du 'dod na de'i tshe gtan tshigs phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub ste /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs dang po 'brel pa can mtha' dag zhig pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don du 'dod na de'i tshe gtan tshigs phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub ste /
translated: If the first reason, ‚Äúbecause all the connected things have perished,‚Äù is accepted as the meaning of the reason, then the reason is not established with respect to part of the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: gang du yang 'brel pa can 'di dag 'jig pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang du yang 'brel pa can 'di dag 'jig pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: For nowhere is there the destruction of these connected things,

original: 'jig pa'i dus na yang dul phra rab rnams lus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i dus na yang dul phra rab rnams lus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even at the time of destruction the subtle particles remain.

original: ci ste ji zhig ltar 'brel pa zhig pa nyid srid pa'i dbang du byas nas gtan tshigs su brjod na de'i tshe ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste ji zhig ltar 'brel pa zhig pa nyid srid pa'i dbang du byas nas gtan tshigs su brjod na de'i tshe ma nges pa yin te /
translated: But if, in some way, the destruction of the relation is possible, and you take that as the reason, then it is not established for you.

original: gal te 'brel pa can gcig 'ba' zhig tu zhig pa de lta na yang 'brel pa can gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can 'di'i ga nas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'brel pa can gcig 'ba' zhig tu zhig pa de lta na yang 'brel pa can gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can 'di'i ga nas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if only one of the related things is destroyed, how could the other one be the reason for the destruction of the other?üîΩIn this way, by this method, possession would also be permanent.

original: de lta na tshul 'dis ldan pa yang rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes dogs par byas nas gzhan dag len 'debs pa ni ldan min tha dad phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de lta na tshul 'dis ldan pa yang rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes dogs par byas nas gzhan dag len 'debs pa ni ldan min tha dad phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Others raise an objection, saying that possession is not permanent because it is different from the possessed things.

original: ldan pa ni ldan pa can so so la tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: ldan pa ni ldan pa can so so la tha dad pa yin te /
translated: Possession is different for each possessed thing.

original: des na 'di mi rtag pa nyid du rigs kyi 'du ba ni 'gro ba 'di la zhes bya ba'i shes pa'i rgyu mtshan can tha mi dad pa'i phyir gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: des na 'di mi rtag pa nyid du rigs kyi 'du ba ni 'gro ba 'di la zhes bya ba'i shes pa'i rgyu mtshan can tha mi dad pa'i phyir gcig kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that it is impermanent. But the collection is the reason for the cognition of this world, and it is not different, so it is only one.

original: des na 'di mi rtag pa nyid du mi rigs te /
analyzed: des na 'di mi rtag pa nyid du mi rigs te /
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable that it is impermanent.

original: gzhan du yang 'brel pa can gzhan la de dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du yang 'brel pa can gzhan la de dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it would be observed in other related things.

original: gal te de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: gal te de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: In response to this, the opponent says, ‚ÄúIf it is like this . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar gang dag rang gi rgyu la sogs pa dang 'du ba'i bum pa la sogs pa de dag zhig pa na de dag ni rang gi rgyu dag la 'grub pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'du ba 'di brtags pa de nyid ci /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang dag rang gi rgyu la sogs pa dang 'du ba'i bum pa la sogs pa de dag zhig pa na de dag ni rang gi rgyu dag la 'grub pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'du ba 'di brtags pa de nyid ci /
translated: Thus, when vases and so on that are produced from their causes and so on disintegrate, if the disintegration of those vases and so on is the mere disintegration of their causes and so on, then what is the point of postulating the disintegration of those vases and so on?

original: de dag zhig pa na 'brel pa can gzhan dag la yod dam 'on te dper na ldan pa can so so la ldan pa can mang po tha dad pa de bzhin du gzhan nyid yin /
analyzed: de dag zhig pa na 'brel pa can gzhan dag la yod dam 'on te dper na ldan pa can so so la ldan pa can mang po tha dad pa de bzhin du gzhan nyid yin /
translated: When they disintegrate, do they exist in other related things? Or, like the many different things that possess attributes, is it that they are different?

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni bye ba bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni bye ba bzung ngo //
translated: The term ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the ten million.

original: de la gal te phyogs dang po yin na de'i tshe sngar gyi gnas skabs bzhin du 'jug pa ma zhig pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa gnas pa kho nar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la gal te phyogs dang po yin na de'i tshe sngar gyi gnas skabs bzhin du 'jug pa ma zhig pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa gnas pa kho nar 'gyur la /
translated: If the first is the case, then just as they were before, they would not disintegrate, and so vases and so on would remain.

original: bum pa la sogs pa de dag kyang mi gnas na 'jug pa mi gnas pa'i phyir 'du ba mi gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa de dag kyang mi gnas na 'jug pa mi gnas pa'i phyir 'du ba mi gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: If those such as the pot do not endure, then their engagement does not endure, and therefore their assembly does not endure.

original: de lta ma yin na 'jug pa'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'jug pa'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, they would not have the nature of engagement.

original: @311a * // yang na de lta bur gyur pa'i rang dbang can phan mi 'dogs pa la 'du ba 'jug go zhes tha snyad 'dogs na ming tsam du 'gyur gyi de ltar dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @311a * // yang na de lta bur gyur pa'i rang dbang can phan mi 'dogs pa la 'du ba 'jug go zhes tha snyad 'dogs na ming tsam du 'gyur gyi de ltar dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, if one conventionally designates the engagement of such an independent entity that does not benefit as an assembly, it would be mere nominality, but it does not exist as a thing.üîΩAs such means that if it is so that it has the nature of engagement, then because of that it is mere nominality.

original: de lta na zhes bya ba ni de la 'jug pa'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba de lta yin na de'i phyir ming tsam nyid yin gyi skyon gang yin pa brtag pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba ni de la 'jug pa'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba de lta yin na de'i phyir ming tsam nyid yin gyi skyon gang yin pa brtag pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The error is this.

original: 'brel pa can zhig pa las sngar yang 'brel pa can ma zhig pa'i gnas skabs na yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'brel pa can zhig pa las sngar yang 'brel pa can ma zhig pa'i gnas skabs na yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The state of the non-disintegration of the related entity prior to the disintegration of the related entity is what is meant by the phrase ‚Äúin the state of the non-disintegration of the related entity.‚Äù

original: bum pa la sogs de dag rang gi rten la 'jug pa'i 'du ba de yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs de dag rang gi rten la 'jug pa'i 'du ba de yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because those such as the pot have the assembly that engages in their own basis.

original: yod pa'i stobs kyis 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod pa'i stobs kyis 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not established by the power of existence.

original: phyis bzhin te /
analyzed: phyis bzhin te /
translated: It is like the later.

original: 'du ba'i rgyu zhig pa bzhin du don dam par 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du ba'i rgyu zhig pa bzhin du don dam par 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, like the cause of aggregation being destroyed, there is no engagement ultimately.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gtan tshigs kyi don ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gtan tshigs kyi don ston pa yin no //
translated: Thus, etc. shows the meaning of the reason.

original: ci ste gzhan nyid yin pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs gnyis pa yin na de'i tshe ldan pa la sogs pa bzhin 'du ba mang po nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan nyid yin pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs gnyis pa yin na de'i tshe ldan pa la sogs pa bzhin 'du ba mang po nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: But if the position of difference is the second, then, like possession, etc., there would be the fault of multiplicity of conjunctions.

original: de lta yin dang 'du ba tha dad pa dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di'i khas blangs pa nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'du ba tha dad pa dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di'i khas blangs pa nyams pa yin no //
translated: If that were so, then the assertion that conjunction is not different would be undermined.

original: de lta bu sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras rgyu don med pa dang / mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal ba dang / dngos po thams cad rim ma yin par skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa gzhan gzung ste /
analyzed: de lta bu sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras rgyu don med pa dang / mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal ba dang / dngos po thams cad rim ma yin par skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa gzhan gzung ste /
translated: Such, etc. The word such refers to other faults, such as the purposelessness of the cause, the contradiction with perception, etc., and the fault that all things would be produced simultaneously.

original: 'di ltar rang gi rgyu dang 'du ba'am dad pa dang 'du ba ni skye bar brjod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi rgyu dang 'du ba'am dad pa dang 'du ba ni skye bar brjod la /
translated: Thus, the meeting or conjunction of a cause with its effect or the meeting or conjunction of faith with its effect is called arising.

original: 'du ba yang rtag pa'i phyir gang du yang 'bras bu skye ba las rgyu rnams nus pa med do zhes bya ba ni rgyu don med pa'o //
analyzed: 'du ba yang rtag pa'i phyir gang du yang 'bras bu skye ba las rgyu rnams nus pa med do zhes bya ba ni rgyu don med pa'o //
translated: But since the meeting or conjunction is permanent, causes are not capable of producing any effect anywhere, and thus the cause is pointless.

original: de bzhin du ldan pa ni las gang yang rung ba las skye ba dang gnyi ga'i las las skye ba dang / ldan pa las skye ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ldan pa ni las gang yang rung ba las skye ba dang gnyi ga'i las las skye ba dang / ldan pa las skye ba yin te /
translated: Similarly, the meeting or conjunction of a cause with its effect is the arising of any karma, the arising of both karma, and the arising of the meeting or conjunction.üîΩThis contradicts the sutra that teaches the arising of consciousness arising from the meeting or conjunction of the sense faculty and object, and so on.

original: dbang po dang don phrad pa las skyes pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa skye bar ston pa'i mdo dang 'gal ba dang / de bzhin du mngon sum la sogs pas rtog pa'i rgyu s'a lu dang mig la sogs pa dang 'gal ba dang /
analyzed: dbang po dang don phrad pa las skyes pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa skye bar ston pa'i mdo dang 'gal ba dang / de bzhin du mngon sum la sogs pas rtog pa'i rgyu s'a lu dang mig la sogs pa dang 'gal ba dang /
translated: Similarly, it contradicts the cause of conception, such as rice, eyes and so on.

original: de bzhin du 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyi skye ba ni rtag pa nyid kyis rim pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po rnams rim gyis skye bar mthong ba dang 'gal ba dang / de lta yin dang shes pa cig car mi skye ba ni yid kyi rtags so zhes bya ba'i rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyi skye ba ni rtag pa nyid kyis rim pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po rnams rim gyis skye bar mthong ba dang 'gal ba dang / de lta yin dang shes pa cig car mi skye ba ni yid kyi rtags so zhes bya ba'i rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba dang /
translated: If that were the case, it would contradict the tenets of our own system that the nonarising of consciousness in a single moment is a sign of the mental faculty.üîΩBecause of arising being permanent, there would be no benefit to the world, and therefore it would be pointless to compose treatises, and so on.

original: skye ba rtag pa'i phyir 'gro ba la phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pas bstan bcos rtsom pa don med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ches mang po dag @311b gis 'brel pa med pa ste /üîΩ'thad par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba rtag pa'i phyir 'gro ba la phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pas bstan bcos rtsom pa don med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ches mang po dag @311b gis 'brel pa med pa ste / 'thad par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: There are many such contradictions, but they are not tenable.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel bas 'du ba'i tshig gi don brtag pa ste nyi shu pa'o /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel bas 'du ba'i tshig gi don brtag pa ste nyi shu pa'o /
translated: This is the twentieth chapter, the chapter on the analysis of the meaning of the words of the assembly, of the Commentary on the Compendium of Principles.

original: // / sgro btags rnam pa'i sgra dang shes pa'i spyod yul can //
analyzed: // / sgro btags rnam pa'i sgra dang shes pa'i spyod yul can //
translated: The domain of consciousness and sound that is the aspect of superimposition.

original: zhes bya ba bsgrub pa'i don du skabs dgod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bsgrub pa'i don du skabs dgod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to establish this, he sets forth the context.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIf, etc.‚Äù

original: bsgrub pa sgra'i don du smra ba rnams kyi lta ba ni don dam pa'i dngos po nyid sgra'i gzung bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsgrub pa sgra'i don du smra ba rnams kyi lta ba ni don dam pa'i dngos po nyid sgra'i gzung bar bya ba ste /
translated: The view of those who maintain that affirmation is the meaning of a word is that the meaning of a word is an ultimate entity.

original: des na sgra dag gis dngos su sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag gis dngos po'i rang bzhin ston par byed pa'i phyir sgrub pa nyid sgra'i don no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na sgra dag gis dngos su sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag gis dngos po'i rang bzhin ston par byed pa'i phyir sgrub pa nyid sgra'i don no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, since words directly reveal the nature of entities through affirmation and negation, affirmation is the meaning of a word.

original: sel ba smra ba rnams kyi lta ba ni don dam par sgra rnams kyi brjod par bya ba dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sel ba smra ba rnams kyi lta ba ni don dam par sgra rnams kyi brjod par bya ba dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The view of those who maintain that exclusion is the meaning of a word is that ultimately the meaning of a word is not an entity, that is, the nature of an object.

original: tha mi dad pa'i don dag la tha dad pa'i rnam par zhen pas 'jug pa'i phyir sgra las byung ba'i shes pa thams cad ni 'khrul pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i don dag la tha dad pa'i rnam par zhen pas 'jug pa'i phyir sgra las byung ba'i shes pa thams cad ni 'khrul pa nyid yin no //
translated: Since words operate by way of the conception of difference with regard to undifferentiated objects, all cognitions arising from words are mistaken.

original: 'khrul pa nyid yin na yang gang du brgyud pas dngos po dang 'brel pa der don la mi slu ba yin no zhes bya ba yin no ;
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid yin na yang gang du brgyud pas dngos po dang 'brel pa der don la mi slu ba yin no zhes bya ba yin no ;
translated: Even though it is an error, it is nondeceptive with regard to the thing that is related to it through the causal process.

original: / de la rnam par rtog pa'i blos don tha mi dad pa dag la sgro btags pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni gzhan las ldog pa'i dngos po nyams su myong ba'i stobs kyis 'ongs pa'i phyir dang / rang nyid kyang gzhan las ldog pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: / de la rnam par rtog pa'i blos don tha mi dad pa dag la sgro btags pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni gzhan las ldog pa'i dngos po nyams su myong ba'i stobs kyis 'ongs pa'i phyir dang / rang nyid kyang gzhan las ldog pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir dang /
translated: The nature that is the superimposition by the conceptual mind of a thing that is not different from its referent is called ‚Äúthe exclusion of other‚Äù because it arises through the power of the experience of a thing that is the opposite of other, because it itself appears as the opposite of other,

original: gzhan las ldog par brjod pa'i 'khrul pa dang lhan cig gcig nyid du nges pa'i phyir dang / gzhan sel ba'i dngos po rtogs pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir gzhan sel zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan las ldog par brjod pa'i 'khrul pa dang lhan cig gcig nyid du nges pa'i phyir dang / gzhan sel ba'i dngos po rtogs pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir gzhan sel zhes brjod do //
translated: because it is ascertained as being the same as the error that is the expression of the exclusion of other, and because it has the effect of the understanding of the thing that is the exclusion of other.

original: des na sel ba sgra'i don yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: des na sel ba sgra'i don yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Therefore it is established that the referent of a word is an exclusion.

original: de la sgrub pa smra ba rnams rtsod par byed de /
analyzed: de la sgrub pa smra ba rnams rtsod par byed de /
translated: The proponents of positive expressions argue as follows:

original: gal te khyed cag gi rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / bye brag dang / 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par de bye brag dag don dam par sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan du yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te khyed cag gi rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / bye brag dang / 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par de bye brag dag don dam par sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan du yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If the particularities of substance, quality, action, universal, particular, and inherence do not exist as the reasons for the application of terms in reality,

original: de'i phyir ji ltar 'jig rten na rdzas la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu mtshan dang dbyig pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i brjod pa dang yongs su rtog par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar 'jig rten na rdzas la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu mtshan dang dbyig pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i brjod pa dang yongs su rtog par 'gyur /
translated: then how could there be in the world the reasons for the application of terms such as ‚Äúsubstance‚Äù and so on, and the conceptions ‚Äúpossessor of a stick‚Äù and so on?

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na dbyig pa can dang rva can zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra dang blo dag rdzas kyi khyad par can du grags la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na dbyig pa can dang rva can zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra dang blo dag rdzas kyi khyad par can du grags la /
translated: In this way, in the world, terms such as ‚Äúpossessor of a stick‚Äù and ‚Äúpossessor of horns‚Äù and so on and the conceptions are renowned as possessing a substance.

original: dkar po nag po zhes bya ba yon tan gyi khyad par can dang / g-yo'i 'khor ro zhes bya ba las kyi rgyu mtshan can dang / yod do snang ngo zhes bya ba yod pa'i rgyu mtshan dang / ba lang dang / rta dang / glang @312a * //
analyzed: dkar po nag po zhes bya ba yon tan gyi khyad par can dang / g-yo'i 'khor ro zhes bya ba las kyi rgyu mtshan can dang / yod do snang ngo zhes bya ba yod pa'i rgyu mtshan dang / ba lang dang / rta dang / glang @312a * //
translated: The white and black are those that have special qualities, the circle of deception are those that have the reason of karma, the exists and appears are those that have the reason of existence, and the cow, horse, and ox are those that have the reason of convention.

original: po zhes bya ba spyi dang bye brag gi khyad par can dang / snal ma 'di dag la snam bu zhes bya ba 'du ba'i stobs kyis yin te /
analyzed: po zhes bya ba spyi dang bye brag gi khyad par can dang / snal ma 'di dag la snam bu zhes bya ba 'du ba'i stobs kyis yin te /
translated: The word white is a word that has the distinction of a quality; the word cow is a word that has the distinction of a class; the word black is a word that has the distinction of a particular quality; the word cow's calf is a word that has the distinction of a particular action; the word circle of the cow's herd is a word that has the distinction of a particular cause; the word exists and the word appears are words that have the distinction of existence; the words cow, horse, and elephant are words that have the distinction of a general and particular class; the word cloth is a word that has the distinction of a whole that is powerful in the sense of being an aggregate of threads.

original: de la rdzas la sogs pa 'di dag med na dbyig pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra dang blo dag yul med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la rdzas la sogs pa 'di dag med na dbyig pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra dang blo dag yul med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If these substances and so on did not exist, then words such as stick-holder and cognitions would have no objects.

original: sogs pa smos pa re re dang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa re re dang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The word and so on is to be applied in each case.

original: des na re re zhing dbyig pa can dang rva can zhes bya ba la sogs pa rigs mthun pa'i sgra blo dag gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: des na re re zhing dbyig pa can dang rva can zhes bya ba la sogs pa rigs mthun pa'i sgra blo dag gzung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, each of these words such as stick-holder and horn-holder is a word that has the distinction of a class.

original: mtha'i bye brag ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kho na'i gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir de dag ni sogs pa'i sgras mi gzung ngo //
analyzed: mtha'i bye brag ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kho na'i gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir de dag ni sogs pa'i sgras mi gzung ngo //
translated: The specific differences are not mentioned by the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù because they are to be grasped only by the yogis.

original: de dag rgyu mtshan med par yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de dag rgyu mtshan med par yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that they are without a reason,

original: de dag thams cad thams cad kyi byad  par med par 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad thams cad kyi byad  par med par 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that they would occur without any restriction.

original: de dag dbye ba med par 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag dbye ba med par 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And they do not occur without distinction,

original: de lta bas na rdzas la sogs pa yod do zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na rdzas la sogs pa yod do zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: Therefore, the existence of substance, etc. is the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang phan tshun ma 'chol bar 'jug pa de dag ni rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang phan tshun ma 'chol bar 'jug pa de dag ni rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever occurs without mutual confusion has a reason,

original: rna ba la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: like the consciousnesses of the ear, etc.

original: dbyig pa can la sogs pa'i sgra dang shes pa dag kyang 'chol ba med par 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: dbyig pa can la sogs pa'i sgra dang shes pa dag kyang 'chol ba med par 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The sounds and consciousnesses of the clubman, etc. occur without confusion. This is a natural inference.

original: rgyu mtshan med pa nyid yin na thams cad du khyad par med par 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med pa nyid yin na thams cad du khyad par med par 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
translated: If it were causeless, it would follow that it would engage all objects indiscriminately.

original: smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: The response to that is stated in the lines beginning ‚ÄúIf you say . . .‚Äù

original: de la gal te 'di dag dngos su phyi rol gyi yul du gyur pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa nyid du sgrub par 'dod na bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa
analyzed: de la gal te 'di dag dngos su phyi rol gyi yul du gyur pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa nyid du sgrub par 'dod na bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa
translated: If you assert that these are based on external objects, then the reason is indeterminate because there is no valid cognition that contradicts the opposite of the probandum.

original: yin no // ci ste gang ci yang rung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa nyid du 'dod na de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub ste /
analyzed: yin no // ci ste gang ci yang rung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa nyid du 'dod na de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub ste /
translated: If you assert that they are based on any object, then the reason is established in the opponent.

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag gi 'di dag rgyu mtshan gang gi brjod pa'i bag chags sad par 'dod pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag gi 'di dag rgyu mtshan gang gi brjod pa'i bag chags sad par 'dod pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: This is because we assert that these are based on the awakening of the latent potentialities of expressions.

original: yul du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yul du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not objects.

original: 'khrul pa nyid kyis sgra las byung ba'i shes pa thams cad yul med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid kyis sgra las byung ba'i shes pa thams cad yul med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of delusion itself, all cognitions arising from words are devoid of objects.

original: nad tsam la gnas zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i bag chags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nad tsam la gnas zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i bag chags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase abiding in mere sound means abiding in consciousness, which is to say, abiding in the latent impressions of consciousness.

original: 'di dag nyid lung gi khungs kyis bstan pa'i phyir sgra rnams gang dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di dag nyid lung gi khungs kyis bstan pa'i phyir sgra rnams gang dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate these very [points] through scriptural quotations, [the text] says, Whatever words..., and so forth.

original: yul du gang dang gang zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yul du gang dang gang zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi la sogs pa'o //
translated: Whatever objects... refers to specific characteristics, universals, and so forth.

original: de ni chos nyid yin zhes @312b bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin yin pa ste /
analyzed: de ni chos nyid yin zhes @312b bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin yin pa ste /
translated: That is the intrinsic nature means that is their essence.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni ngag gi lam thams cad las 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni ngag gi lam thams cad las 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The essence of things is beyond all verbal expressions.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ming ni gang dang gang gis ni //
analyzed: ming ni gang dang gang gis ni //
translated: Whatever names there are

original: chos ni gang dang gang brjod pa //
analyzed: chos ni gang dang gang brjod pa //
translated: for whatever phenomena are expressed,

original: de ni de na yod pa min te //
analyzed: de ni de na yod pa min te //
translated: they do not exist in that way,

original: de ni de rnams chos nyid yin //
analyzed: de ni de rnams chos nyid yin //
translated: for that is their intrinsic nature.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus he says.

original: ci ste sgra las byung ba'i shes pa 'khrul pa nyid dang / yul med bdag la tshad ma ci yod ce na /
analyzed: ci ste sgra las byung ba'i shes pa 'khrul pa nyid dang / yul med bdag la tshad ma ci yod ce na /
translated: But if the cognition that arises from words is mistaken, and if there is no object, what is the evidence that it exists?

original: gang tha dad pa dag la tha mi dad par zhen nas 'jug pa'i phyir sgra las byung ba'i shes pa 'di thams cad 'khrul pa yin no zhes pa 'di la kho bo cag gis tshad ma bshad zin to //
analyzed: gang tha dad pa dag la tha mi dad par zhen nas 'jug pa'i phyir sgra las byung ba'i shes pa 'di thams cad 'khrul pa yin no zhes pa 'di la kho bo cag gis tshad ma bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained the evidence that all of these cognitions that arise from words are mistaken, because they engage their objects by conceiving of what is different as non-different.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig yin de yin pa la de'o snyam du shes pa de ni 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig yin de yin pa la de'o snyam du shes pa de ni 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: A cognition that conceives of what is x as being x is mistaken.

original: smig rgyu la chur shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: smig rgyu la chur shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the cognition of water in a mirage.

original: don tha dad pa dag la tha mi dad par zhen pa'i sgra las byung ba'i shes pa 'di yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: don tha dad pa dag la tha mi dad par zhen pa'i sgra las byung ba'i shes pa 'di yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The cognition that arises from words that conceives of different objects as non-different is also like that. This is a natural inference.

original: gang gis gtan tshigs ma grub bo zhes bya bar 'gyur ba 'di'i gzung bar bya ba spyi dngos por gyur pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis gtan tshigs ma grub bo zhes bya bar 'gyur ba 'di'i gzung bar bya ba spyi dngos por gyur pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The object universal that exists as a real entity and in virtue of which it might be said that the evidence is not established does not exist.

original: de ni sngar rgyas par bkag zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sngar rgyas par bkag zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this has already been extensively refuted earlier.

original: yang na spyi yod du chug mod de lta na yang de ni tha dad pa dag las don gzhan du gyur pa nyid yin na tha dad pa dag la tha mi dad par zhen pa ni 'khrul pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang na spyi yod du chug mod de lta na yang de ni tha dad pa dag las don gzhan du gyur pa nyid yin na tha dad pa dag la tha mi dad par zhen pa ni 'khrul pa nyid yin no //
translated: Or, even if one grants that a universal exists, in that case, it would be something different from the different things, but the conception of it as not different from the different things is just an error.

original: de dag ldan pa zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi gzhan dang gzhan du mtshungs pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ldan pa zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi gzhan dang gzhan du mtshungs pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It would be called ‚Äúendowed with them,‚Äù but it is not logical that it is similar to each of them.

original: spyi don gzhan du gyur pa nyid ma yin na yang don dam par sna tshogs pa thams cad dngos po gcig yin du chug mod /
analyzed: spyi don gzhan du gyur pa nyid ma yin na yang don dam par sna tshogs pa thams cad dngos po gcig yin du chug mod /
translated: Even if the universal were not something different from the different things, it is still possible that ultimately all diversity is one thing.

original: de la spyi'i shes pa ni 'khrul pa nyid yin la mtshungs pa'i shes pa ni dngos po gcig gi yul la ma yin te /
analyzed: de la spyi'i shes pa ni 'khrul pa nyid yin la mtshungs pa'i shes pa ni dngos po gcig gi yul la ma yin te /
translated: But the cognition of a universal is just an error, and the cognition of similarity is not with respect to the object of a single thing.

original: de ni tha da dpa'i 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni tha da dpa'i 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is preceded by the apprehension of the different.

original: 'khrul pa 'di nyid du grub pa na yul med par yang grub ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa 'di nyid du grub pa na yul med par yang grub ste /
translated: When this error is established, the nonexistence of objects is also established.

original: rang gi rnam pa gtan nas skyed par byed pa'i dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i don 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rnam pa gtan nas skyed par byed pa'i dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i don 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no object whatsoever that has the characteristic of being the object that produces its aspect at all.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na yul med pa nyid rnam pa gzhan du bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na yul med pa nyid rnam pa gzhan du bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: In another way, the nonexistence of the object is to be proven in another way:

original: sgra rnams gang kho na la brda byas pa de kho na de dag gi yul du rigs kyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra rnams gang kho na la brda byas pa de kho na de dag gi yul du rigs kyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: It is logical that the object of words is only that to which a linguistic sign is assigned, not another,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because otherwise there would be an absurd consequence.

original: 'di dag dngos po 'ga' zhig la don dam par brda yang dag yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir blo dang sgra ni yul med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag dngos po 'ga' zhig la don dam par brda yang dag yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir blo dang sgra ni yul med pa yin no //
translated: Since these words do not have a real linguistic sign in any object ultimately, therefore the mind and words have no object.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la dngos su brda ma byas pa de dag @313a * //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la dngos su brda ma byas pa de dag @313a * //
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is not directly assigned a linguistic sign

original: ni don dam par de brjod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ni don dam par de brjod pa ma yin te /
translated: in regard to something is not ultimately a linguistic expression of that,

original: nog la sogs ba dang ldan pa'i gong bu la rta'i sgras brda ma byas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nog la sogs ba dang ldan pa'i gong bu la rta'i sgras brda ma byas pa bzhin no //
translated: like the sign of a horse not being assigned to a mass that has a hump and so on.

original: yang dag par dngos po thams cad la sgra thams cad brda byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par dngos po thams cad la sgra thams cad brda byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is not the case that all words are used to designate all things‚Äù is a non-observation of a more extensive property.

original: brda byas pa nyid rjod par byed pa la khyab pa'i phyir la de 'di la med do //
analyzed: brda byas pa nyid rjod par byed pa la khyab pa'i phyir la de 'di la med do //
translated: Because being used to designate is a property that pervades being a word, and that property does not exist in this case.

original: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gang phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gang phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this reason is not unestablished, the root text says, ‚Äúbecause . . . ‚Äù and so forth.

original: 'di ltar brda bzung ba'i dngos po sgra'i don nyid du rnam par 'jog pa na res 'ga' rang gi mtshan nyid de thun mong ma yin pa'am /üîΩrigs sam / de 'brel te rigs de dang 'brel pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar brda bzung ba'i dngos po sgra'i don nyid du rnam par 'jog pa na res 'ga' rang gi mtshan nyid de thun mong ma yin pa'am / rigs sam / de 'brel te rigs de dang 'brel pa'am /
translated: When the thing that is understood through a conventional symbol is posited as the meaning of a word, is it posited as the specific, uncommon characteristic of that thing?üîΩOr is it posited as the type, that is, as the thing that is related to that type?

original: rigs dang ldan pa'i dngos po pa'am /
analyzed: rigs dang ldan pa'i dngos po pa'am /
translated: Or is it posited as the thing that possesses the type?

original: blo'i rnam pa zhig rnam par 'jog par byed ces brtag grang /
analyzed: blo'i rnam pa zhig rnam par 'jog par byed ces brtag grang /
translated: Or is it posited as a mental aspect?

original: de la thams cad la brda mi srid pa'i phyir sgra'i don nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: de la thams cad la brda mi srid pa'i phyir sgra'i don nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: Of these, it is not reasonable to posit it as the meaning of a word because it is impossible for a conventional symbol to apply to the specific characteristic.

original: de nyid du zhes bya ba 'dis ni kun rdzob pa'i sgra'i don ma bkag par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid du zhes bya ba 'dis ni kun rdzob pa'i sgra'i don ma bkag par bstan pa yin te /
translated: This ‚Äúin reality‚Äù shows that the meaning of the conventional terms is not refuted.

original: de'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction with our own words.

original: de lta ma yin na dam bca' ba rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dam bca' ba rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that were not so, the thesis would contradict our own words.

original: 'di lta rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa 'di dag sgras bstan nas 'di dag sgra'i don ma yin pa nyid du bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'di lta rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa 'di dag sgras bstan nas 'di dag sgra'i don ma yin pa nyid du bstan par mi nus te /
translated: Thus, having indicated these intrinsic identities, etc., with terms, it is impossible to indicate that they are not the referents of those terms.

original: de bstan par 'dod nas sgras rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa ston pa ni 'di dag sgra'i don nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de bstan par 'dod nas sgras rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa ston pa ni 'di dag sgra'i don nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur la /
translated: If one wishes to indicate that, then by indicating intrinsic identity, etc., with terms, one would be accepting that they are the referents of those terms.

original: yang dam bca' ba de nyid 'gegs pa'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: yang dam bca' ba de nyid 'gegs pa'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal lo //
translated: And because that thesis is refuted, there would be a contradiction with our own words.

original: 'dis ni 'do byed pas /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'do byed pas /
translated: This also clarifies the following statement:

original: sgra rnams rjod byed ma yin na //
analyzed: sgra rnams rjod byed ma yin na //
translated: If terms do not express,

original: dam bca' gtan tshigs 'gal ba yin //üîΩzhes gang smras pa de yang gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: dam bca' gtan tshigs 'gal ba yin //üîΩzhes gang smras pa de yang gsal ba yin no //
translated: The thesis contradicts the reason.

original: kho bo cag ni rnam pa thams cad du skra'i don la skur pa 'debs par mi byed de /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni rnam pa thams cad du skra'i don la skur pa 'debs par mi byed de /
translated: We do not deny the existence of hair in any way,

original: de ni gnag rdzi'i bar la shin tu grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gnag rdzi'i bar la shin tu grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is well known to cowherds and others.

original: 'on kyang de la gzhan gyi sgro btags pa de kho na nyid du yod pa'i chos gang yin pa de 'gegs par byed kyi chos can ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de la gzhan gyi sgro btags pa de kho na nyid du yod pa'i chos gang yin pa de 'gegs par byed kyi chos can ma yin no //
translated: However, we do deny that any existent thing exists in reality as it is imagined by others, but not that the thing itself exists.

original: de la re zhig rang gi mtshan nyid la brda med par bstan pa'i phyir sgra'i don ma yin pa nyid bstan pa'i don du de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩre zhig sgra rnams kyis /
analyzed: de la re zhig rang gi mtshan nyid la brda med par bstan pa'i phyir sgra'i don ma yin pa nyid bstan pa'i don du de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // re zhig sgra rnams kyis /
translated: In order to show that the thing itself is not the meaning of the word, he says, ‚ÄúIn that case,‚Äù etc., in order to show that the thing itself does not have a conventional symbol.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid rjod pa min //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid rjod pa min //
translated: First of all, words do not express the thing itself,üîΩbecause there is no conventional agreement about it.

original: zhes bya ba ni de la brda byas pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de la brda byas pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The idea is that there is no conventional agreement about it.

original: ji ltar brda med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar brda med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is there no conventional agreement?

original: brda dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: brda dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe conventional agreement,‚Äù etc.

original: brda dang tha snyad dag tu phyin pa ste @313b thob pa'i dus gang yin pa der khyab pa ste /
analyzed: brda dang tha snyad dag tu phyin pa ste @313b thob pa'i dus gang yin pa der khyab pa ste /
translated: When the convention and the expression are obtained, at that time there is no pervasion.

original: khyab par byed pa de dang bral ba'i rgyu'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid de la brda med do zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa de dang bral ba'i rgyu'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid de la brda med do zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: Because the cause of the pervasion is absent, the expression does not exist for that intrinsic identity.

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: brda ni tha snyad kyi don du byed kyi zhen pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brda ni tha snyad kyi don du byed kyi zhen pas ni ma yin no //
translated: The expression is made for the sake of the convention, not for the sake of the object.

original: des na gang kho na'i brda dang tha snyad du phyin pa'i dus su khyab pa nyid yod la de kho na la tha snyad 'dogs pa po rnams brda byed par rigs kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gang kho na'i brda dang tha snyad du phyin pa'i dus su khyab pa nyid yod la de kho na la tha snyad 'dogs pa po rnams brda byed par rigs kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, at the time when the expression and the convention are obtained, there is pervasion, and only then is it proper for those who use the expression to make the expression, not otherwise.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la ni brda dang tha snyad du phyin pa'i dus su khyab par byed pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la ni brda dang tha snyad du phyin pa'i dus su khyab par byed pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: For intrinsic identity, at the time when the expression and the convention are obtained, there is no pervasion.

original: de lta bas na de la brda byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de la brda byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the expression is not made for that.

original: yang ci'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid la brda dang tha snyad du phyin pa'i dus su khyab par byed pa nyid med ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid la brda dang tha snyad du phyin pa'i dus su khyab par byed pa nyid med ce na /
translated: Moreover, why is there no pervasion when a signifier and a convention are applied to a specific characteristic?

original: yul dus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yul dus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause of the difference of place, etc.,‚Äù

original: yul la sogs pa tha dad pas khra bo la sogs pa'i gsal ba tha dad pa phan tshun shin tu ldog pa'i lus can 'di dag ni phan tshun rjes su 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yul la sogs pa tha dad pas khra bo la sogs pa'i gsal ba tha dad pa phan tshun shin tu ldog pa'i lus can 'di dag ni phan tshun rjes su 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: and so on. Because of the difference of place, etc., the different manifestations such as multicolored are mutually exclusive, and these have bodies that are not mutually inclusive.

original: de la gcig la brda byas pa'i skyes bus gzhan la tha snyad du byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gcig la brda byas pa'i skyes bus gzhan la tha snyad du byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, a person who has been taught one of them will not apply the convention to the other.

original: snang ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras kha dog dbyibs dang skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras kha dog dbyibs dang skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: ‚Äú Appearance, etc.‚Äù The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes color, shape, momentariness, etc.

original: tha snyad mthong ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni des na de la brda med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad mthong ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni des na de la brda med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú The convention is not seen‚Äù means that because of that, the reason is not unestablished, since there is no signifier for it.üîΩIn order to demonstrate that it is also not unestablished,

original: ma nges pa yang ma yin no zhes bsten pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma nges pa yang ma yin no zhes bsten pa'i phyir /
translated: he says,

original: brda ma bzung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: brda ma bzung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is: ‚ÄúThe meaning is not grasped from the word, because the word is not related to the meaning.‚Äù

original: gang la brda gzung ba de la de skad ces bya la /
analyzed: gang la brda gzung ba de la de skad ces bya la /
translated: The meaning is grasped from the word, because the word is related to the meaning.

original: brda gzung ba med pa de ni brda ma bzung ba'o //
analyzed: brda gzung ba med pa de ni brda ma bzung ba'o //
translated: The meaning is not grasped from the word, because the word is not related to the meaning.

original: sgra las zhes bya ba ni ming las so //
analyzed: sgra las zhes bya ba ni ming las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the word‚Äù means from the name.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rigs mi 'dra ba'i don bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rigs mi 'dra ba'i don bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means like a meaning that is not related.

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the explanation:
