original: gal te sgras brda ma bzung ba'i don ston par byed na de'i tshe ba lang gi sgra yang brda ston par byed par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te sgras brda ma bzung ba'i don ston par byed na de'i tshe ba lang gi sgra yang brda ston par byed par 'gyur la /
translated: If the meaning that is not related to the word were to be expressed, then the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù would express the meaning of the word ‚Äúhorse.‚Äù

original: brda byed pa yang don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brda byed pa yang don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: And the use of the word would be pointless.

original: de lta bas na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yin pa'i phyir khyab pa grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yin pa'i phyir khyab pa grub po //
translated: Therefore, because the absurd consequence is a valid reason that refutes the opponent‚Äôs position, the pervasion is established.

original: brda ma byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs 'di nyid slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos /
analyzed: brda ma byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs 'di nyid slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos /
translated: This very reason, ‚Äúbecause it is not related,‚Äù and so on, was stated by Master DignƒÅga:

original: sgra yis tha dad nam yang ni //
analyzed: sgra yis tha dad nam yang ni //
translated: A word never expresses a difference,

original: brjod pa ma yin mtha' med phyir //
analyzed: brjod pa ma yin mtha' med phyir //
translated: because the end is limitless.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis bstan te /
translated: This is indicated by the phrase ‚Äúbecause of the absence of an end.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar mtha' med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis brda med pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtha' med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis brda med pa nyid bstan to //
translated: Thus, the phrase ‚Äúbecause of the absence of an end‚Äù indicates the absence of a sign.

original: des na 'od byed pas /
analyzed: des na 'od byed pas /
translated: Therefore, the Illumination states:

original: gal te sgra phyogs su byed na de'i tshe @314a * //
analyzed: gal te sgra phyogs su byed na de'i tshe @314a * //
translated: If the term ‚Äúend‚Äù is taken to refer to a direction,

original: mtha' med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir gzhi tha dad pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: mtha' med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir gzhi tha dad pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: then, because of the absence of an end, the reason is a reason based on a different property.

original: 'on te tha dad pa rnams nyid phyogs su byed na de'i tshe rjes su 'gro ba can dang ldog pa can gyi dpe yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir mtha' med pa gtan tshigs ma yin no zhes gang smras pa de yang bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa rnams nyid phyogs su byed na de'i tshe rjes su 'gro ba can dang ldog pa can gyi dpe yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir mtha' med pa gtan tshigs ma yin no zhes gang smras pa de yang bsal ba yin no //
translated: But if the term ‚Äúend‚Äù is taken to refer to the individual things themselves, then, because there is no example that is both similar and dissimilar, the absence of an end is not a valid reason.

original: yang de nyid kyis smras pa dag gi ltar na khyad par med pa'i tha dad pa rnams sgra dag gis rjod par byed pa de'i ltar na nyes pa 'di yin gyi /
analyzed: yang de nyid kyis smras pa dag gi ltar na khyad par med pa'i tha dad pa rnams sgra dag gis rjod par byed pa de'i ltar na nyes pa 'di yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, the Illumination states:üîΩ‚ÄúAccording to the opponent, the term ‚Äòend‚Äô refers to individual things that are not distinguished by a difference in kind.

original: kho bo cag ni yod pa'i khyad par gyis rdzas dang yon tan dang las rnams brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni yod pa'i khyad par gyis rdzas dang yon tan dang las rnams brjod pa yin te /
translated: We say that substance, quality, and action are distinguished by existence.

original: 'di ltar gang dang gang na yod pa la sogs pa'i spyi mthong ba de dang der yod pa la sogs pa'i sgra sbyor la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang dang gang na yod pa la sogs pa'i spyi mthong ba de dang der yod pa la sogs pa'i sgra sbyor la /
translated: Thus, the word ‚Äúexists‚Äù and so on is applied to that which is seen to be a universal of existence and so on.

original: yod pa la sogs pa'i spyi ni gcig nyid yin te /
analyzed: yod pa la sogs pa'i spyi ni gcig nyid yin te /
translated: The universal of existence and so on is a single entity.

original: de'i phyir spyis mtshon pa'i don dag la brda byed pa srid pa'i phyir mtha' med pa rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba de yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir spyis mtshon pa'i don dag la brda byed pa srid pa'i phyir mtha' med pa rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba de yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, because it is possible to use a sign to indicate the meaning of a universal, the fault of infinite regress does not arise.

original: yod pa la sogs pa dngos por gyur pa'i spyi de dag las tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: yod pa la sogs pa dngos por gyur pa'i spyi de dag las tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di bsgrubs zin to //
translated: This is not correct, because it has already been established that the universal of existence and so on is either different or not different from the things that possess it.

original: yang na spyi yod du chug mong de lta na yang tha dad pa gcig la spyi du ma yod pa'i phyir yod pa la sogs pa'i sgra ma 'chol bar sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na spyi yod du chug mong de lta na yang tha dad pa gcig la spyi du ma yod pa'i phyir yod pa la sogs pa'i sgra ma 'chol bar sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, even if you accept that a universal exists, because many universals exist in a single different thing, the words ‚Äúexists‚Äù and so on would not be applied unerringly.

original: yod pa la sogs pa sgras ma bstan par yod pa la sogs pa des tha dad pa gzhan mtshon par bya ba'i phyir brda byed par nus pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: yod pa la sogs pa sgras ma bstan par yod pa la sogs pa des tha dad pa gzhan mtshon par bya ba'i phyir brda byed par nus pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Nor is it possible to make a convention to indicate something different from what is expressed by the word, such as existence, etc.,üîΩbecause it is not taught by the word.

original: brda ma byas pa'i yod pa la sogs pa la sgra 'jug pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: brda ma byas pa'i yod pa la sogs pa la sgra 'jug pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not the case that the word is used for existence, etc., without making a convention,

original: de lta yin dang phan tshun bsten pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang phan tshun bsten pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: because if that were the case, there would be the error of mutual dependence.

original: ci ste yang rtog pa po rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las rang nyid tha snyad du byed pa dmigs pa'i phyir yod pa la sogs pa'i sgra dag gis brda ston par byed do snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste yang rtog pa po rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las rang nyid tha snyad du byed pa dmigs pa'i phyir yod pa la sogs pa'i sgra dag gis brda ston par byed do snyam na /
translated: But if one thinks that the speaker makes a convention with the words ‚Äúexistence,‚Äù etc., because he himself observes concomitance and reversal,

original: de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: that also is not correct.

original: mtha' med pa tha dad pa'i yul can gyi tha snyad ma lus pa 'ga' zhig dmigs par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mtha' med pa tha dad pa'i yul can gyi tha snyad ma lus pa 'ga' zhig dmigs par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not the case that all conventions with an infinite number of different objects are observed.

original: gcig gi tshe yod pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i tha dad pa dag la lan cig ma yin par tha snyad dmigs nas de'i rigs can ma mthong ba dag la yang sgra de sbyor bar byed pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig gi tshe yod pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i tha dad pa dag la lan cig ma yin par tha snyad dmigs nas de'i rigs can ma mthong ba dag la yang sgra de sbyor bar byed pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But when one sees that different things that exist at one time and so on are designated by the term ‚Äúexistent‚Äù more than once, one applies that term to those of the same type that one does not see.

original: ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because they are not seen.

original: ma mthong ba'i 'das pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa mtha' yas pa'i tha dad pa dag la brda srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i 'das pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa mtha' yas pa'i tha dad pa dag la brda srid pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible to designate an infinite number of different things that are different by way of the specific unapprehended past and so on.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro//
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro//
translated: Because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: @314b rnam par rtog pa'i blos sgro btags pa dag la ston par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: @314b rnam par rtog pa'i blos sgro btags pa dag la ston par byed do zhe na /
translated: But one teaches by superimposing designations with the conceptual mind.

original: 'o na de lta na rnam par rtog pas sgro btags pa'i don gyi yul nyid la sgra sbyor gyi don dam par tha dad pa dag la ma yin no zhes bya ba thob ste /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na rnam par rtog pas sgro btags pa'i don gyi yul nyid la sgra sbyor gyi don dam par tha dad pa dag la ma yin no zhes bya ba thob ste /
translated: Well then, it follows that one applies terms to the mere objects that are superimposed by conception, but not to ultimately different things.

original: 'di ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag gis med pas mi nye ba nyid kyi phyir de la rnam par rtog pa'i blor 'gyur ba ni yul med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes sgro btags pa ni med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag gis med pas mi nye ba nyid kyi phyir de la rnam par rtog pa'i blor 'gyur ba ni yul med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes sgro btags pa ni med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, since the past and future do not exist, they are not present, and the conceptual mind that occurs in regard to them is said to be ‚Äúwithout an object‚Äù because it is nonexistent.

original: de lta yin dang de la brda med pa'i phyir ji ltar don dam pa dngos por gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang de la brda med pa'i phyir ji ltar don dam pa dngos por gyur pa yin te /
translated: If that is so, then how can the ultimate be a thing, since there is no conventional expression in regard to it?

original: spros pas chog go //
analyzed: spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this elaboration!

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir sgra rnams kyi yul rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin par grub po //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir sgra rnams kyi yul rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin par grub po //
translated: Since the reason is not contradictory because it exists in similar instances, it is established that the objects of words are not particular inherent identities.

original: 'di snyam du gang dag ri gangs can la sogs pa'i dngos po de dag bstan pa dang gcig pu'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir yul dang dus la sogs pa'i tha dad pa srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gang dag ri gangs can la sogs pa'i dngos po de dag bstan pa dang gcig pu'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir yul dang dus la sogs pa'i tha dad pa srid pa ma yin te /
translated: If you think that the things of the snowy mountains and so on are the same entity as the teachings, then it is not possible for them to be different in terms of place, time, and so on, because they are singular natures.

original: de'i phyir brda dang tha snyad phyin pa'i dus su khyab pa'i phyir de la brda srid pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub pa yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de'i phyir brda dang tha snyad phyin pa'i dus su khyab pa'i phyir de la brda srid pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub pa yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: Therefore, since the pervasion is possible at the time of the convention, since the convention is possible in regard to that, therefore the reason is not established in part of the similar class.üîΩIf you think that, then to respond:

original: gang yang gangs ri zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang yang gangs ri zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The Himalayas, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni ri ma la ya la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ri ma la ya la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes Mount Malaya, etc.

original: gang gi phyir 'di dag ni rdul phra rab tu ma tshogs pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di dag ni rdul phra rab tu ma tshogs pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: Because these are not by nature a collection of atoms,

original: de'i phyir 'di dag gi yan lag ma lus pa bzung bas brda byed pa yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag gi yan lag ma lus pa bzung bas brda byed pa yod pa ma yin la /
translated: therefore, since all of their parts are not apprehended, the convention is not possible.

original: skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa yang bsgrubs zin te /
analyzed: skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa yang bsgrubs zin te /
translated: Moreover, their momentariness has already been proven.

original: des na de dag la yang brda'i dus su mthong ba tha snyad kyi dus su rjes su 'gro ba yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de dag la yang brda'i dus su mthong ba tha snyad kyi dus su rjes su 'gro ba yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since what is seen at the time of the convention does not exist at the time of the convention, the reason is not established.

original: de ltar re zhig rang gi mtshan nyid la tha snyad mi 'thad pas brda don med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir brda mi srid do zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rang gi mtshan nyid la tha snyad mi 'thad pas brda don med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir brda mi srid do zhes bstan nas /
translated: Thus, since it is untenable to designate things by their own characteristics, it follows that it would be impossible to designate the referent of a term.

original: de ni brda bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir mi srid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni brda bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir mi srid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that it is impossible because it is impossible to designate things by their own characteristics,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid 'di dag kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid 'di dag kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the text says, ‚ÄúAll these things that are characterized by their own characteristics . . .‚Äù

original: dngos po thams cad skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa ni sngar bsgrubs zin te /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa ni sngar bsgrubs zin te /
translated: It has been established earlier that all things disintegrate as soon as they arise.

original: de dag la brda byed pa na res 'ga' ma skyes pa la byed pa'am skyes pa dag la byed /
analyzed: de dag la brda byed pa na res 'ga' ma skyes pa la byed pa'am skyes pa dag la byed /
translated: When one designates a thing, does one designate it as something that has not yet arisen or as something that has already arisen?

original: de la re zhig ma skyes pa rnams la brda rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig ma skyes pa rnams la brda rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not tenable to designate something that has not yet arisen.

original: med pa ni shes pa dang brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyis gzhir mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa ni shes pa dang brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyis gzhir mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it does not exist, it is devoid of all cognition and expression, and thus it is not tenable as a basis.

original: yang dag pa smos pa ni kun rdzob pa dgag pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa smos pa ni kun rdzob pa dgag pa'i don du ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúreal‚Äù is used to refute the conventional.

original: des na bum pa la sogs pa ma skyes pa la yang @315a * //
analyzed: des na bum pa la sogs pa ma skyes pa la yang @315a * //
translated: Therefore, even though a vase, for example, has not arisen,

original: brda mthong ba'i phyir mthong ba dang 'gal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: brda mthong ba'i phyir mthong ba dang 'gal ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not contradictory that one sees because one sees a sign,

original: de'i yul ni rnam par rtog pas sprul pa'i don nyid yin pas med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul ni rnam par rtog pas sprul pa'i don nyid yin pas med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object of that is a nonexistent object that is a conceptual emanation.

original: rta'i rva bzhin no zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'i mtha' can gyi 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: rta'i rva bzhin no zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'i mtha' can gyi 'dra ba yin no //
translated: Like the horn of a horse is the seventh case.

original: skyes pa la yang brda rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes pa la yang brda rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not reasonable that a sign is made for that which has arisen,

original: 'di ltar nyams su myong ba skyes pha de la de sngon du 'gro ba can gyi ming ni khyad par dran pa na brda byed kyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyams su myong ba skyes pha de la de sngon du 'gro ba can gyi ming ni khyad par dran pa na brda byed kyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: because when one recalls the name that precedes the experience of that which has arisen, one makes a sign, but not otherwise.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be an absurd consequence.üîΩIf that were the case, then when one recalls the name of a particular thing, the thing would be like that which has not arisen, because its own character would have ceased due to momentariness.

original: de lta yin dang ming gi khyad par dran pa'i dus na skad cig 'jig pa nyid kyis rang gi mtshan nyid 'gags nas ring du lon pa'i phyir ma skyes pa bzhin du dngos po skyes pa rnams la yang brda yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang ming gi khyad par dran pa'i dus na skad cig 'jig pa nyid kyis rang gi mtshan nyid 'gags nas ring du lon pa'i phyir ma skyes pa bzhin du dngos po skyes pa rnams la yang brda yod pa ma yin te /
translated: A sign is not made for things that have arisen,üîΩbecause it is not reasonable that a sign is made for that which has arisen.

original: brda byed pa'i dus na yang gnyi ga yang mi nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brda byed pa'i dus na yang gnyi ga yang mi nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and when the signifier is uttered, both are distant.

original: 'di ltar re zhig nyams su myong ba'i gnas skabs na yang de'i rgyu yin ba nyid kyis rang gi mtshan nyid skad cig ma nye ba yod pa can du mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig nyams su myong ba'i gnas skabs na yang de'i rgyu yin ba nyid kyis rang gi mtshan nyid skad cig ma nye ba yod pa can du mi 'gyur na /
translated: Thus, when the object is experienced, the signifier does not exist in the present moment that possesses its own characteristics, because it is the cause of that experience.

original: nyams su myong ba'i dus phyis 'byung ba'i ming gi bye brag gzo ba dang dran pa skye ba'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i dus phyis 'byung ba'i ming gi bye brag gzo ba dang dran pa skye ba'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: If that is so, then what need is there to mention that the signifier will not arise at the time of the arising of the memory that is the later designation of the object that was experienced?

original: ci ste yang de'i nus pa'i mthu las byung ba de'i rigs can brda byed pa'i dus na 'byung ba'i skad cig ma la brda byed par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste yang de'i nus pa'i mthu las byung ba de'i rigs can brda byed pa'i dus na 'byung ba'i skad cig ma la brda byed par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the signifier arises from the power of its potential and that the signifier is uttered at the moment of the arising of the signifier that is of the same type,

original: de'i phyir gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúBut if another . . .‚Äù

original: gal te yang brda byed pa'i dus na nye ba'i skad cig gzhan yod pa de lta na yang brda gzo ba mi srid pa'i phyir brda mi rigs te /
analyzed: gal te yang brda byed pa'i dus na nye ba'i skad cig gzhan yod pa de lta na yang brda gzo ba mi srid pa'i phyir brda mi rigs te /
translated: Even if another present moment exists at the time of the signifier, the signifier is still illogical because it is impossible to understand the signifier.

original: 'di ltar rta dmigs na de'i ming drang ba'i rim pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi brda byed pa na de'i dus na nye ba'i ba lang la sogs pa la gzo ba'i yul du byas nas brda byed pa 'ga' zhig rta'o zhes brda byed pa ni ma yin
analyzed: 'di ltar rta dmigs na de'i ming drang ba'i rim pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi brda byed pa na de'i dus na nye ba'i ba lang la sogs pa la gzo ba'i yul du byas nas brda byed pa 'ga' zhig rta'o zhes brda byed pa ni ma yin
translated: Thus, when a horse is perceived, and a name is given to it by the process of applying a conventional symbol, at that time, one does not make the object of the horse the object of one‚Äôs thought, and then apply the conventional symbol, saying, ‚ÄúThis is a horse.‚Äù

original: no // ci ste yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skad cig thams cad 'dra ba yin te /üîΩdes na gcig nyid du zhen par byas nas brda byed par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: no // ci ste yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skad cig thams cad 'dra ba yin te / des na gcig nyid du zhen par byas nas brda byed par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: Now, suppose one thought that all the moments of the intrinsic nature are similar,

original: de'i phyir / 'dra ba nyid kyang brtags pa yin //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'dra ba nyid kyang brtags pa yin //
translated: and that one applies the conventional symbol, thinking that they are identical.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says:üîΩEven similarity is imagined.

original: 'dra ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i blos sgro btags pa yin te /üîΩde sgra rnams kyis ston na rang gi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dra ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i blos sgro btags pa yin te / de sgra rnams kyis ston na rang gi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarity is a superimposition by the conceptual mind.üîΩIf that is taught by words, then the intrinsic nature would not be inexpressible.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rang gi mtshan nyid la brda srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rang gi mtshan nyid la brda srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, in that way, it is not possible to apply a conventional symbol to the intrinsic nature.

original: sgra rang gi mtshan nyid kyi brda yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra rang gi mtshan nyid kyi brda yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there a convention of the intrinsic identity of a word,

original: de ltar brda byed pas gzhan pa nyid kyi ming gi khyad par don la sbyor bar byed la /
analyzed: de ltar brda byed pas gzhan pa nyid kyi ming gi khyad par don la sbyor bar byed la /
translated: because one who makes a convention connects a particular name with a referent by way of something other than that.

original: don dam pas dran pas nyams su myong ba nyid kyi @315b brjod par 'jig par nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam pas dran pas nyams su myong ba nyid kyi @315b brjod par 'jig par nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it possible to express an object that is experienced by memory through the ultimate,

original: de 'gags nas ring du lon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'gags nas ring du lon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a long time has elapsed since it ceased.

original: gang yang brjod pa de ni sngar nyams su myong ba'i phyir de dran pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang yang brjod pa de ni sngar nyams su myong ba'i phyir de dran pa ma yin la /
translated: And that which is expressed is not a memory of that, because it was previously experienced.

original: yul du ma byas pa des 'dzin par nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yul du ma byas pa des 'dzin par nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it possible to apprehend that which was not made an object.

original: des na dran pas gzhag pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis mtshams sbyor ba rnams ni rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyi brda ma yin no //
analyzed: des na dran pas gzhag pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis mtshams sbyor ba rnams ni rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyi brda ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the referents of the conceptual thoughts that are posited by memory are not intrinsic identities, they are not conventions of intrinsic identity.

original: de lta bas na rang gi mtshan nyid ni bstan par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na rang gi mtshan nyid ni bstan par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Thus it is established that intrinsic identity is not something that can be indicated.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin pa 'di nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir tshad ma gzhan bshad pa ni dro ba la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin pa 'di nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir tshad ma gzhan bshad pa ni dro ba la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to prove that the intrinsic identity is not an object of expression, he explains another means of valid cognition, beginning with ‚Äúheat, etc.‚Äù

original: ji ltar dro ba la sogs pa'i don gyi yul can gyi dbang po gsal bar snang bar rig pa de bzhin du dro ba la sogs pa'i sgra las byung ba ni ma yin no //üîΩji ltar mig la sogs pa ma nyams pa'i dbang po'i blo dag gis nyams su myong ba bzhin du mig dang lce dang sna la sogs pa nyams pas ma tu lung ga la sogs pa'i sgra thos pa las gzugs dang ro la sogs pa nyams su myong bar
analyzed: ji ltar dro ba la sogs pa'i don gyi yul can gyi dbang po gsal bar snang bar rig pa de bzhin du dro ba la sogs pa'i sgra las byung ba ni ma yin no // ji ltar mig la sogs pa ma nyams pa'i dbang po'i blo dag gis nyams su myong ba bzhin du mig dang lce dang sna la sogs pa nyams pas ma tu lung ga la sogs pa'i sgra thos pa las gzugs dang ro la sogs pa nyams su myong bar
translated: Just as the sense faculty that has the object of heat, etc., is clearly manifest, so it is not the case that the cognition arises from the word ‚Äúheat,‚Äù etc.

original: 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Just as the cognitions of the undamaged sense faculties, such as the eyes, experience, so it is not the case that the cognitions of the damaged sense faculties, such as the eyes, experience form, taste, etc., from hearing the words ‚Äúmatulunga,‚Äù etc.

original: ji skad du /üîΩme dang 'brel pas bsreg bya ba //
analyzed: ji skad du / me dang 'brel pas bsreg bya ba //
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe cognition of the object to be burned

original: tshig par shes pa gzhan yin la //üîΩtshig pa'i sgra yis tshig pa'i don //
analyzed: tshig par shes pa gzhan yin la // tshig pa'i sgra yis tshig pa'i don //
translated: By contact with fire is one thing,üîΩAnd the cognition of the burned object

original: yang dag gsal ba gzhan yin no //
analyzed: yang dag gsal ba gzhan yin no //
translated: By the word ‚Äúburned‚Äù is another.

original: zhes bshad blta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad blta bu'o //
translated: This is the example.

original: de yi don can dbang shes bzhin //
analyzed: de yi don can dbang shes bzhin //
translated: The meaning of that is like a sense consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
translated: This is the dissimilar example.

original: dro ba la sogs pa'i don gyi yul de gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya la /
analyzed: dro ba la sogs pa'i don gyi yul de gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya la /
translated: The object of the meaning of heat and so on is the object that exists for that consciousness.

original: 'di ni de'i don yang yin la dbang po'i shes pa yang yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i don yang yin la dbang po'i shes pa yang yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: This is the meaning of that and it is a sense consciousness.

original: gal te de de lta bu ma yin pa de lta na yang ci'i phyir sgra'i don rang gi mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de de lta bu ma yin pa de lta na yang ci'i phyir sgra'i don rang gi mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is not like that, then why is the meaning of a word not its own character?

original: gang zhig des byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang zhig des byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response is ‚ÄúThat which is produced by that . . .‚Äù

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gis byas pa'i shes pa la mi snang ba de ni de'i don ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gis byas pa'i shes pa la mi snang ba de ni de'i don ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is not manifest to the consciousness produced by it is not the meaning of it,

original: gzugs kyi sgras bskyed pa'i shes pa la ro bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi sgras bskyed pa'i shes pa la ro bzhin no //
translated: like a taste to the consciousness produced by the word form.üîΩThe response is: ‚ÄúThe meaning of a word is not manifest to a consciousness produced by a word.‚ÄùüîΩThe response is: ‚ÄúThe meaning of a word is not manifest to a consciousness produced by a word.‚Äù

original: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la yang rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ngo zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la yang rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ngo zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúThe meaning of a word is not manifest to a consciousness produced by a word.‚ÄùüîΩThe response is: ‚ÄúThe meaning of a word is not manifest to a consciousness produced by a word.‚ÄùüîΩThe response is: ‚ÄúThe meaning of a word is not manifest to a consciousness produced by a word.‚ÄùüîΩThe response is: ‚ÄúThe meaning of a word is not manifest to a consciousness produced by a word.‚ÄùüîΩThe response is: ‚ÄúThe meaning of a word is not manifest to a consciousness produced by a word.‚ÄùüîΩThe response is: ‚ÄúThe meaning of a word is not manifest to a consciousness produced by a word.‚ÄùüîΩThe response is: ‚ÄúThe meaning of a word is not manifest to a consciousness produced by a word.‚ÄùüîΩThe response is: ‚ÄúThe meaning of a word is not manifest to a consciousness produced by a word.‚ÄùüîΩThe response is: ‚ÄúThe meaning of a word is not manifest to a consciousness produced by a word.‚ÄùüîΩThe response is: ‚ÄúThe meaning of a word is not manifest to a consciousness produced by a word.‚ÄùüîΩThe response is: ‚ÄúThe meaning of a word is not manifest to a consciousness produced by a word.‚ÄùüîΩThe response is: ‚ÄúThe meaning of a word is not manifest to a consciousness produced by a word.‚ÄùüîΩThe response is: ‚ÄúThe meaning of a word is not manifest to a consciousness produced by a word.‚ÄùüîΩThe response is: ‚ÄúThe meaning of a word is not manifest to a consciousness produced by a word.‚Äù

original: 'dir yang ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma ste /
translated: Here, the argument of absurd consequence is the valid cognition that refutes.

original: 'di ltar sgra des rjod par byed pa nyid ni yul can gyi shes pa skyed pa nyid la brjod kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //üîΩrnam par shes pa gang zhig gang gi rnam pas stong pa de ni de'i yul @316a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra des rjod par byed pa nyid ni yul can gyi shes pa skyed pa nyid la brjod kyi gzhan ni ma yin no // rnam par shes pa gang zhig gang gi rnam pas stong pa de ni de'i yul @316a * //
translated: Thus, the term ‚Äúdenotation‚Äù refers to the production of a cognition that has an object, but not to anything else.

original: can du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: can du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical for a consciousness that is empty of the aspect of something to be the consciousness of that thing.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it would lead to an absurd consequence.

original: gang gis mi gsal ba dngos por gtogs pa nyid kyi ngo bo'i sgra rnams rjod par byed do zhes bya bar 'gyur ba dngos po gcig la gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i ngo bo gnyis yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis mi gsal ba dngos por gtogs pa nyid kyi ngo bo'i sgra rnams rjod par byed do zhes bya bar 'gyur ba dngos po gcig la gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i ngo bo gnyis yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that a single thing has two natures, one clear and one unclear, by virtue of which one could say that the term ‚Äúunclear‚Äù denotes the nature of a thing.

original: gcig la gnyis kyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la gnyis kyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because two mutually exclusive natures cannot belong to a single thing.

original: gzhung lugs tha dad pa la gnas pa rnams kyang /
analyzed: gzhung lugs tha dad pa la gnas pa rnams kyang /
translated: Even those who maintain different philosophical systems

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang bzhin du bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang bzhin du bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: establish that they are of a mutually exclusive nature.

original: rigs pa can rnams ni gsal ba dang rnam pa dang rigs rnams kyi tshig gi don no zhes smra ste /
analyzed: rigs pa can rnams ni gsal ba dang rnam pa dang rigs rnams kyi tshig gi don no zhes smra ste /
translated: The NaiyƒÅyikas say that the meaning of a word is a particular, a universal, and a manifestation.

original: tshig gi don ni tshig gi don te sgra'i don zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni tshig gi don te sgra'i don zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of a word is the meaning of a word; it is a synonym for the meaning of a sound.

original: de la gsal ba'i sgras ni rdzas dang / yon tan gyi khyad par dang / las rnams brjod do //
analyzed: de la gsal ba'i sgras ni rdzas dang / yon tan gyi khyad par dang / las rnams brjod do //
translated: Among them, the word particular refers to substances, qualities, and actions.

original: de skad du yang mdo las yon tan gyi khyad par gyi rten gyi lus can ni gsal ba'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de skad du yang mdo las yon tan gyi khyad par gyi rten gyi lus can ni gsal ba'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: A s≈´tra says, ‚ÄúThe body that is the basis of a particular quality is a particular.‚Äù

original: re zhig 'di'i don rnam 'grel byed pa'i lugs kyi brjod pa /
analyzed: re zhig 'di'i don rnam 'grel byed pa'i lugs kyi brjod pa /
translated: Here is the explanation of the meaning of that according to the system of the V·πõttikƒÅra:

original: khyad par du byed pas khyad par can la yon tan dag las khyad par ni yon tan gyi khyad par te las la brjod do //
analyzed: khyad par du byed pas khyad par can la yon tan dag las khyad par ni yon tan gyi khyad par te las la brjod do //
translated: Since it is distinguished, that which is distinguished is a particular quality. The particular is a quality, and it is said to be an action.

original: khyad par gyi lus kyi rten ni lus can gcig bsdus pa byas pas 'di la yon tan gyi khyad par gyi sgra gnyis pa yang bstan te /
analyzed: khyad par gyi lus kyi rten ni lus can gcig bsdus pa byas pas 'di la yon tan gyi khyad par gyi sgra gnyis pa yang bstan te /
translated: The body that is the basis of a particular is a body. Since it is a collection of one, it is a body. The second word particular is also taught here.

original: des na yon tan gyi tshig don gzung ngo //
analyzed: des na yon tan gyi tshig don gzung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the word quality is understood.

original: de dag ni yon tan yang yin pas yon tan gyi phyir khyad par ro //
analyzed: de dag ni yon tan yang yin pas yon tan gyi phyir khyad par ro //
translated: Since these are also qualities, they are distinguished as qualities.

original: khyad par smos pa ni rnam par gsal ba'i don du ste /
analyzed: khyad par smos pa ni rnam par gsal ba'i don du ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúdistinguished‚Äù is for the sake of clarity.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa ni ldan pa'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin yin pas //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa ni ldan pa'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin yin pas //
translated: Thus, the form is the nature of the distinction of possession.

original: ldan pa yang yon tan gyi tshig gi don gyi khongs su 'du ste /
analyzed: ldan pa yang yon tan gyi tshig gi don gyi khongs su 'du ste /
translated: Possession is also included in the meaning of the term ‚Äúquality.‚Äù

original: de lta yin dang khyad par ma smos pa rnam pa yang bzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang khyad par ma smos pa rnam pa yang bzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then the form would be included even without the term ‚Äúdistinguished.‚Äù

original: de'i gsal pa'i khongs su 'du bar mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de'i gsal pa'i khongs su 'du bar mi 'dod de /
translated: But it is not accepted that it is included in the term ‚Äúdistinguished.‚Äù

original: de ni sgras logs shig tu gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sgras logs shig tu gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is grasped separately by the term ‚Äúform.‚Äù

original: rten gyi sgras ni rdzas brjod de /
analyzed: rten gyi sgras ni rdzas brjod de /
translated: The term ‚Äúbasis‚Äù expresses substance.

original: yon tan gyi khyad par de dag gi rten ni de'i rten te rdzas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yon tan gyi khyad par de dag gi rten ni de'i rten te rdzas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The basis of those qualities is their basis, which means substance.

original: 'dir ni de'i sgra mi mngon par byas nas bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir ni de'i sgra mi mngon par byas nas bstan to //
translated: Here, the term ‚Äútheir‚Äù is not expressed.

original: 'di ltar tshig rnam par sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshig rnam par sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Thus, the sentence should be analyzed as follows.

original: yon tan gyi khyad par rnams zhes bya ba yon tan khyad par dag ste /
analyzed: yon tan gyi khyad par rnams zhes bya ba yon tan khyad par dag ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúqualities‚Äù is ‚Äúqualities distinguished.‚Äù

original: yon tan gyi khyad par dag dang de'i rten ni yon tan gyi khyad bar gyi rten no //
analyzed: yon tan gyi khyad par dag dang de'i rten ni yon tan gyi khyad bar gyi rten no //
translated: The basis of the distinction of quality is the support of the distinction of quality.

original: 'di ni gcig tu bsdus pa'i zlas dbye ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni gcig tu bsdus pa'i zlas dbye ba ste /
translated: This is a compound in which the last member is predominant.

original: rtags ni 'jig rten la brten pas de'i phyir ma ning gi rtags su ma bstan to //
analyzed: rtags ni 'jig rten la brten pas de'i phyir ma ning gi rtags su ma bstan to //
translated: The neuter gender is not taught because it is based on the world.

original: des na don ni 'di yin te gzhi yon tan khyad par la brten pa ni @316b gsal ba dang lus can zhes bya bar yang brjod de /
analyzed: des na don ni 'di yin te gzhi yon tan khyad par la brten pa ni @316b gsal ba dang lus can zhes bya bar yang brjod de /
translated: Therefore, the meaning is this: The basis of the distinction of quality is also called manifest and corporeal.

original: de la gang gi tshe rdzas la lus can gyi sgra yin pa de'i tshe gnas bzhi bsgrub par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe rdzas la lus can gyi sgra yin pa de'i tshe gnas bzhi bsgrub par blta bar bya ste /
translated: When substance is the meaning of corporeal, then the four bases should be understood to be established.

original: 'di la yan lag gsal bas lus can no //
analyzed: 'di la yan lag gsal bas lus can no //
translated: Here, it is corporeal because it has the member manifest.

original: gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa la yin pa de'i tshe byed pa po sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa la yin pa de'i tshe byed pa po sgrub pa yin te /
translated: When it is form and so on, then the agent is established.

original: rdzas la 'jug pa ste 'du bas gzugs la sogs pa lus can no //
analyzed: rdzas la 'jug pa ste 'du bas gzugs la sogs pa lus can no //
translated: It is corporeal because it is engaged in and combined with substance.

original: lus can gyi sgra rdzas la las su sgrub pa yin la /
analyzed: lus can gyi sgra rdzas la las su sgrub pa yin la /
translated: The word corporeal establishes substance as its object.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la byed pa sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la byed pa sgrub pa yin no //
translated: It establishes form and so on as its agent.

original: bshad par byed pa'i lugs kyis mdo'i don ji ltar thos pa bzhin du yin te /
analyzed: bshad par byed pa'i lugs kyis mdo'i don ji ltar thos pa bzhin du yin te /
translated: The system of the expounders is that the meaning of the sutra is just as it is heard.

original: yon tan gyi khyad par rnams kyi rten rdzas nyid gsal ba dang lus can yin no zhes de 'dod de /
analyzed: yon tan gyi khyad par rnams kyi rten rdzas nyid gsal ba dang lus can yin no zhes de 'dod de /
translated: They assert that the substance of the special qualities is the basis of the qualities, it is manifest and it has parts.

original: ji skad du yon tan gyi khyad par gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang / reg pa dang / lci ba dang / gsher ba nyid dang / mkhrang ba nyid dang / 'dus byas ba rnams dang / khyab pa'i tshad rnams kyi khyad par gyi rten ni ji ltar srid par de'i rdzas yin la ;
analyzed: ji skad du yon tan gyi khyad par gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang / reg pa dang / lci ba dang / gsher ba nyid dang / mkhrang ba nyid dang / 'dus byas ba rnams dang / khyab pa'i tshad rnams kyi khyad par gyi rten ni ji ltar srid par de'i rdzas yin la ;
translated: As it is said, the basis of the special qualities of form, taste, smell, tactility, heaviness, fluidity, viscosity, composition and the measure of pervasion is its substance, as is possible.

original: yan lag gsal pa'i phyir lus can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag gsal pa'i phyir lus can zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it has manifest parts, it is called that which has parts.

original: rnam pa'i sgras srog chags kyi yan lag la sogs pa'i cha shas sor mo la sogs pa'i ldan pa brjod de /
analyzed: rnam pa'i sgras srog chags kyi yan lag la sogs pa'i cha shas sor mo la sogs pa'i ldan pa brjod de /
translated: The term aspect refers to the parts of the limbs of living beings, such as fingers and so on.

original: de skad du yang mdo las /
analyzed: de skad du yang mdo las /
translated: A sutra declares:

original: rnam pa ni rigs kyi rtags su brjod ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa ni rigs kyi rtags su brjod ces 'byung ngo //
translated: Aspect is said to be the sign of type.

original: 'di'i bshad pa ni gang gis rigs dang rigs kyi rtags su brjod pa ni rnam par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di'i bshad pa ni gang gis rigs dang rigs kyi rtags su brjod pa ni rnam par rig par bya ste /
translated: The explanation of this is as follows: The indication of a class and the mark of a class are to be understood as the representation.

original: de yang sems can gyi yan lag rnams dang / de'i shas rnams kyi bkod pa nges pa las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang sems can gyi yan lag rnams dang / de'i shas rnams kyi bkod pa nges pa las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is not other than the arrangement of the members of a living being and their parts.

original: bkod pa'i sgras ni ldan pa'i khyad par brjod ces nges pa smos pas bcos ma'i ldan pa bsal te /
analyzed: bkod pa'i sgras ni ldan pa'i khyad par brjod ces nges pa smos pas bcos ma'i ldan pa bsal te /
translated: The word ‚Äúarrangement‚Äù expresses a particular possession. The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù excludes a fabricated possession.

original: de la rigs kyi rtags ni srog chags kyi yan lag ni mgo bo dang lag pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la rigs kyi rtags ni srog chags kyi yan lag ni mgo bo dang lag pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: In this regard, the mark of a class is the members of a living being, such as the head, the hands, etc.

original: de dag gis ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rigs mtshon no //
analyzed: de dag gis ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rigs mtshon no //
translated: By them, the class, which is the characteristic of cowness, etc., is indicated.

original: rnam pa ni res 'ga' dngos su rigs gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: rnam pa ni res 'ga' dngos su rigs gsal bar byed de /
translated: The form sometimes directly manifests the class,

original: gang gi tshe mgo bo dang lag pa la sogs pa'i gnas lugs mthong ba las ba lang nyid gsal ba na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mgo bo dang lag pa la sogs pa'i gnas lugs mthong ba las ba lang nyid gsal ba na'o //
translated: when cowness is manifested by seeing the arrangement of the head, hands, etc.

original: res 'ga' ni rigs kyi rtags te /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni rigs kyi rtags te /
translated: Sometimes it is the mark of a class,

original: gang gi tshe rva la sogs pa'i yan lag so so ba'i cha shas kyi gnas lugs kyi gsal ba rnams kyis ba lang nyid la sogs pa gsal ba kho na'o //üîΩdes na rnam pa ni rigs dang rtags gsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rva la sogs pa'i yan lag so so ba'i cha shas kyi gnas lugs kyi gsal ba rnams kyis ba lang nyid la sogs pa gsal ba kho na'o // des na rnam pa ni rigs dang rtags gsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: When the manifestations of the individual parts of the horns and so on are the manifestations of cowhood and so on,

original: rigs @317a * //
analyzed: rigs @317a * //
translated: then the aspect is the cause of the manifestation of the type and sign.

original: kyi sgras ni tha mi dad par brjod pa dang shes pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi spyi brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: kyi sgras ni tha mi dad par brjod pa dang shes pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi spyi brjod pa yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äútype‚Äù is used to express the undifferentiated and the reason for the arising of the cognition.

original: de skad du yang mdo las /
analyzed: de skad du yang mdo las /
translated: It says in a sutra:

original: mtshungs pa skye ba'i bdag nyid can ni rigs yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: mtshungs pa skye ba'i bdag nyid can ni rigs yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of the arising of the similar is the type.‚Äù

original: mtshungs pa'i shes pa skye ba'i rgyu ni rigs yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i shes pa skye ba'i rgyu ni rigs yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the type is the cause of the arising of the similar cognition.

original: de la gsal ba dang rnam pa dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid sgra'i don yin pa gsal ba 'di gnyis kyi sgra'i don yin pa gsal bar rtogs par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa 'di dag nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la gsal ba dang rnam pa dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid sgra'i don yin pa gsal ba 'di gnyis kyi sgra'i don yin pa gsal bar rtogs par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa 'di dag nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the manifestation and the aspect are the meaning of the word that is the individual characteristic, he says, ‚ÄúBy these aspects alone,‚Äù and so on.

original: rigs kyang phyis sel bar 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyang phyis sel bar 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: and the type is also later eliminated.

original: gsal zhes bya ba ni sgra'i don nyid yin pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gsal zhes bya ba ni sgra'i don nyid yin pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúClear‚Äù is the meaning of the term.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gang phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because of that, etc.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni gsal ba dang rnam pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni gsal ba dang rnam pa dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the clear and the aspects.

original: des na ji ltar rang gi mtshan nyid la brda ma byas pa'i phyir sgra'i don ma yin pa de dag kyang yin pas de'i phyir brda ma byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yin zhing ma nges pa yang ma yin no snyam du
analyzed: des na ji ltar rang gi mtshan nyid la brda ma byas pa'i phyir sgra'i don ma yin pa de dag kyang yin pas de'i phyir brda ma byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yin zhing ma nges pa yang ma yin no snyam du
translated: Therefore, since they are not the meaning of the term because the convention is not applied to their specific characteristics, the reason ‚Äúbecause the convention is not applied‚Äù is not unestablished, nor is it indefinite.

original: bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is the thought.

original: gzhan yang gsal ba'i rdzas dang yon tan gyi khyad par dang las kyi mtshan nyid yin la rnam pa yang ldan pa'i bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gsal ba'i rdzas dang yon tan gyi khyad par dang las kyi mtshan nyid yin la rnam pa yang ldan pa'i bdag nyid yin te /
translated: Moreover, the clear is the nature of substance, quality, and action, and the aspects are the nature of inherence.

original: rdzas la sogs pa 'di dag kyang nyid du bkag zin pas na 'di las kyang 'di dag med pa'i phyir yang dag par sgra'i don nyid du rigs pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: rdzas la sogs pa 'di dag kyang nyid du bkag zin pas na 'di las kyang 'di dag med pa'i phyir yang dag par sgra'i don nyid du rigs pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Since substance and so on have already been refuted, therefore they are also not tenable as the referents of words.

original: rdzas la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is indicated by ‚Äúsubstance and so on.‚Äù

original: de ltar re zhig dang gi mtshan nyid la brda mi srid par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig dang gi mtshan nyid la brda mi srid par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, first, having demonstrated that it is impossible to designate a word to the characteristic of a thing,

original: rigs la sogs pa gsum la brda mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir rigs dang 'brel pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa gsum la brda mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir rigs dang 'brel pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: in order to demonstrate that it is impossible to designate a word to the three, namely, the class, the individual, and the universal, he says, ‚ÄúThose related to the class and so on.‚Äù

original: de'i 'og ces bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi 'og tu bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og ces bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi 'og tu bshad pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAfter that‚Äù means after the explanation of the characteristic of the thing.

original: rigs dang de dang 'brel pa dang // zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rigs dang de dang 'brel pa dang // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe class and that which is related to it‚Äù is explained.

original: rigs dang ldan pa mi srid pa'i phyir de dang ldan pa yang mi srid pa yin te /
analyzed: rigs dang ldan pa mi srid pa'i phyir de dang ldan pa yang mi srid pa yin te /
translated: Since it is impossible to possess the class, it is also impossible to possess that which is related to it,

original: de'i tha snyad ni de dag gis byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tha snyad ni de dag gis byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the convention is made by them.

original: de dang ldan pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i phyogs la 'byung ba'i skyon mtshungs pa kho na'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i phyogs la 'byung ba'i skyon mtshungs pa kho na'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: And since it is the nature of its own characteristic, the error that occurs in that position is exactly the same.

original: tsam pa'i bu ni rigs sgra'i don yin no zhes zer zhing /
analyzed: tsam pa'i bu ni rigs sgra'i don yin no zhes zer zhing /
translated: The son of the one who is just a little is the meaning of the word ‚Äúgotra.‚Äù

original: bya chen gyi bu'i rdzas yin no zhes zer la /
analyzed: bya chen gyi bu'i rdzas yin no zhes zer la /
translated: The son of the one who is great is the meaning of the word ‚ÄúmahƒÅ.‚Äù

original: drang srong ba ni gnyi ga'o //
analyzed: drang srong ba ni gnyi ga'o //
translated: The sage is both.

original: zhes zer ba de yang 'di nyid kyis bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes zer ba de yang 'di nyid kyis bsal ba yin no //
translated: This also refutes the assertion of the sage.

original: rigs mi rung ba'i phyir dang / rdzas kyang rang gi mtshan @317b nyid kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i phyogs la 'byung ba'i skyon mi 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mi rung ba'i phyir dang / rdzas kyang rang gi mtshan @317b nyid kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i phyogs la 'byung ba'i skyon mi 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not suitable to be a type, and because substance is the nature of its own characteristic, the error that occurs in that position is not imposed.

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /üîΩde'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir / de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to conclude, he says,üîΩTherefore, etc.

original: de'i phyir ni de lta bas na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ni de lta bas na'o //
translated: Therefore means ‚Äúfor that reason.‚Äù

original: ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
translated: It has no essence means it has no intrinsic reality.

original: blo'i rnam pa la yang brda mi srid par bstan ba'i phyir /
analyzed: blo'i rnam pa la yang brda mi srid par bstan ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is also impossible to designate a convention in the aspect of cognition, he says,

original: blo gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: blo gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The line ‚ÄúThe aspect of consciousness, etc.‚Äù

original: blo'i rnam pa ni de'i bdag nyid yin pas blo la gnas pa'i phyir 'di ni blo de'i ngo bo bzhin du bstan par bya ba'i phyir don nam blo gzhan la rjes su 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: blo'i rnam pa ni de'i bdag nyid yin pas blo la gnas pa'i phyir 'di ni blo de'i ngo bo bzhin du bstan par bya ba'i phyir don nam blo gzhan la rjes su 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: is stated because the aspect of consciousness is the nature of consciousness. Since it is based on consciousness, it is not the case that the object or another consciousness is engaged in order to demonstrate the nature of that consciousness.

original: de lta yin dang brda dang tha snyad du phyin ba'i dus su ma khyab pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid bzhin du de la yang brda srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang brda dang tha snyad du phyin ba'i dus su ma khyab pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid bzhin du de la yang brda srid pa ma yin no //
translated: If that were the case, then, because it would not be pervasive at the time of the understanding of signs and conventions, it would be impossible to create signs for it, as is the case with a particular.

original: tha snyad kyi dus su rjes su 'gro ba yin du chug mod /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi dus su rjes su 'gro ba yin du chug mod /
translated: Even if it were the case that it is pervasive at the time of the convention,

original: de lta na yang de la tha snyad 'dogs pa bo rnams brda byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang de la tha snyad 'dogs pa bo rnams brda byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: even so, it is not reasonable for those who create conventions to create signs for it.

original: 'di ltar sgra tha dad pa las don byed pa don du gnyer ba'i skyes bu don byed par nus pa'i don shes nas 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra tha dad pa las don byed pa don du gnyer ba'i skyes bu don byed par nus pa'i don shes nas 'jug ste /
translated: This is because a person who seeks to perform an action understands the object that is able to perform the action from a different word and engages in it.

original: de dag la'o snyam du sems pa'i tha snyad 'dogs pa po rnams kyis rjod par byed pa sbyor bar byed kyi zhen pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag la'o snyam du sems pa'i tha snyad 'dogs pa po rnams kyis rjod par byed pa sbyor bar byed kyi zhen pas ni ma yin no //
translated: The conventional expressions ‚Äúthose‚Äù are applied by those who express and apply them, but not by those who are attached.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i blo'i rnam pa 'di ni grang ba sel ba la sogs pa mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu de don du gnyer bar bsgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i blo'i rnam pa 'di ni grang ba sel ba la sogs pa mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu de don du gnyer bar bsgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: This aspect of the conceptual mind does not establish the desired result, such as the removal of cold, as its goal.

original: de nyams su myong ba skyes na yang de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyams su myong ba skyes na yang de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even when the experience of that arises, it does not exist.

original: des na de la yang brda med pa'i phyir brda ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de la yang brda med pa'i phyir brda ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is no convention in that, the reason ‚Äúbecause there is no convention‚Äù is not unestablished.

original: 'di snyam du yod pa'i don la sogs pa sgra'i don gzhan yod de /
analyzed: 'di snyam du yod pa'i don la sogs pa sgra'i don gzhan yod de /
translated: If you think that the meaning of the word ‚Äúexists‚Äù and so on is a different object,

original: de lta bas na de la brda srid pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de lta bas na de la brda srid pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: and therefore the reason is not unestablished because it is possible to make a convention in that,

original: 'dis bsal nyid ces bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: 'dis bsal nyid ces bya ba smos te ;
translated: then the root text states, ‚ÄúThis is refuted by that.‚Äù

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa sgra'i don yin pa bkag pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa sgra'i don yin pa bkag pa nyid kyis te /
translated: The meaning of the word ‚Äúown characteristic‚Äù and so on is refuted.

original: de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa kho na'i khongs su byas pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa kho na'i khongs su byas pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: because they are included only within the sphere of their own characteristics and so forth.

original: yod pa'i don la sogs pa de dag kyang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yod pa'i don la sogs pa de dag kyang gang yin zhe na /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúWhat are those existent objects and so forth?‚Äù

original: bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: sgra kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te zhes bya ba'i rim pa gzhan du ste /
analyzed: sgra kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te zhes bya ba'i rim pa gzhan du ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAll words‚Äù and so forth. The order is different:

original: don zhes bya ba'i mjug tu sbrel bar bya'o //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba'i mjug tu sbrel bar bya'o //
translated: ‚Äúobject‚Äù should be connected to the end.

original: des na don 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning:

original: yod pa'i don zhes bya ba 'di rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni sgra thams cad kyi brjod par bya ba ste rtogs par bya ba'i mtshan nyid de sgra'i don gyi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha @318a * //
analyzed: yod pa'i don zhes bya ba 'di rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni sgra thams cad kyi brjod par bya ba ste rtogs par bya ba'i mtshan nyid de sgra'i don gyi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha @318a * //
translated: That which is the understanding of this ‚Äúexistent object‚Äù is the characteristic of the object of expression of all words, that is, the characteristic of the object of expression of words.

original: tshig go // des na yul du gyur pa'i don la ba lang la sogs pa la ba lang la sogs pa'i sgra rtogs par bya ba gang yin pa de ni snga na med pa dang lha dang mtho ris dag dang mtshungs so zhes smra'o //
analyzed: tshig go // des na yul du gyur pa'i don la ba lang la sogs pa la ba lang la sogs pa'i sgra rtogs par bya ba gang yin pa de ni snga na med pa dang lha dang mtho ris dag dang mtshungs so zhes smra'o //
translated: The meaning of the words ‚Äúin the case of the words ‚Äòcow‚Äô and so on‚Äù is that the object that is understood is not a real entity, such as a cow, etc.

original: snga na med pa la sogs pa'i sgra'i don dang de dag mtshungs so zhes bya ba de bzhin du smras so zhes bya ba'i don no //üîΩji ltar snga na med pa la sogs pa'i sgra rnams don gyi rnam pa'i yul can gyi blo rnams la 'jug pa ma yin gyi /üîΩgang dag la snga na med pa la sogs pa'i sgra sbyor ba'i don 'ga' zhig yod do zhes bya ba de tsam zhig rtogs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //

original: de bzhin du mthong ba'i don can ba lang la sogs pa'i sgra la yang mtshungs te /üîΩgang gi phyir de dag las kyang 'di ltar rtogs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong ba'i don can ba lang la sogs pa'i sgra la yang mtshungs te /üîΩgang gi phyir de dag las kyang 'di ltar rtogs te /
