original: ba lang la sogs pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba ba lang nyid kyi spyi'am 'brel pa zhes bya ba don 'ga' zhig yod do //
analyzed: ba lang la sogs pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba ba lang nyid kyi spyi'am 'brel pa zhes bya ba don 'ga' zhig yod do //
translated: The word ‚Äúcow‚Äù expresses a universal, or a connection, called ‚Äúcowness.‚Äù

original: gang du de la rnam pa'i khyad par yongs su 'dzin pa 'ga' zhig 'byung ba de dag gi de ni grub pa'i mtha'i stobs las yin gyi sgra las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang du de la rnam pa'i khyad par yongs su 'dzin pa 'ga' zhig 'byung ba de dag gi de ni grub pa'i mtha'i stobs las yin gyi sgra las ni ma yin no //
translated: In some cases, the universal is apprehended in the form of an individual, but that is due to the power of a philosophical theory, not to the power of the word.

original: sogs pa'i sgras bzung ba yod pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras bzung ba yod pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the meaning of the word ‚Äúetc.,‚Äù

original: yang na kha cig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang na kha cig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúOr, some people, etc.‚Äù

original: kha cig ni bram ze la sogs pa'i sgra dag gis bsdu ba dang rnam par brtag pa dag med par yang dka' thub dang / rigs dang / thos pa la sogs pa'i tshogs pa brjod par gyur pa yin no zhes smos te /
analyzed: kha cig ni bram ze la sogs pa'i sgra dag gis bsdu ba dang rnam par brtag pa dag med par yang dka' thub dang / rigs dang / thos pa la sogs pa'i tshogs pa brjod par gyur pa yin no zhes smos te /
translated: Some people, without using the words ‚ÄúBrahmin,‚Äù etc., or the operations of inclusion and exclusion, express the collection of austerities, caste, learning, etc.

original: dper na nags tshal la sogs pa'i sgra dag gis da ba la sogs pa bzhin no //üîΩ'di ltar nags tshal zhes brjod pa na da ba'am /
analyzed: dper na nags tshal la sogs pa'i sgra dag gis da ba la sogs pa bzhin no // 'di ltar nags tshal zhes brjod pa na da ba'am /
translated: For example, the words ‚Äúforest,‚Äù etc., express bamboo,

original: seng ldeng ngam /
analyzed: seng ldeng ngam /
translated: ashoka trees,üîΩand kashmari trees.

original: pa la sha zhes rnam par brtags pas rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin la /
analyzed: pa la sha zhes rnam par brtags pas rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin la /
translated: It is not understood by the analysis of the word ‚Äúbrahmin‚Äù into its parts, such as ‚Äúbrah‚Äù and ‚Äúmin.‚Äù

original: da ba dang / seng ldeng dang / pa la sha zhes bsdu bas rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: da ba dang / seng ldeng dang / pa la sha zhes bsdu bas rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it understood by the combination of the parts, such as ‚Äúda,‚Äù ‚Äúva,‚Äù ‚Äúkhadira,‚Äù and ‚Äúpala≈õa.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang da ba la sogs pa mtha' dag rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang da ba la sogs pa mtha' dag rtogs pa yin no //
translated: But rather, the totality of ‚Äúda,‚Äù etc., is understood.

original: de bzhin du bram ze zhes brjod pa na dka' thub bam /
analyzed: de bzhin du bram ze zhes brjod pa na dka' thub bam /
translated: In the same way, when the word ‚Äúbrahmin‚Äù is uttered, it is not understood by the word ‚Äúausterity,‚ÄùüîΩor by the word ‚Äúcaste,‚Äù

original: rigs sam / thos pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: rigs sam / thos pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: or by the word ‚Äúlearning,‚Äù

original: dka' thub dang / rigs dang / thos pa zhes pas kyang rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dka' thub dang / rigs dang / thos pa zhes pas kyang rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: or by the combination of the words ‚Äúausterity,‚Äù ‚Äúcaste,‚Äù and ‚Äúlearning.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang gzhan dang 'brel pa rnam par bcad nas dka' thub la sogs pa'i tshogs pa mtha' dag rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan dang 'brel pa rnam par bcad nas dka' thub la sogs pa'i tshogs pa mtha' dag rtogs pa yin no //
translated: But rather, the totality of the collection of austerity, etc., is understood, having excluded what is not related to them.

original: de la rnam par brtag pa ni tshogs pa las mang po dag la gcig gi khyad par ma nges @318b par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par brtag pa ni tshogs pa las mang po dag la gcig gi khyad par ma nges @318b par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: In this regard, analysis is the apprehension of the particular of one thing among many, which is not ascertained in the collection.

original: bsdu ba ni gcig la gcig mngon par 'brel par nges pa du ma'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba ni gcig la gcig mngon par 'brel par nges pa du ma'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Combination is the ascertainment of the connection of one thing with another, which has the nature of many.

original: gang la rnam par brtag pa dang bsdu ba yod pa ma yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la rnam par brtag pa dang bsdu ba yod pa ma yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is neither analyzed nor synthesized is called ‚Äúinexistent.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag ni rdzas nyid la sogs pa nges par gzung ba'i ngo bo dag dang 'brel pa'i rdzas la sogs pa gang yin pa de sgra'i don yin te ;
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rdzas nyid la sogs pa nges par gzung ba'i ngo bo dag dang 'brel pa'i rdzas la sogs pa gang yin pa de sgra'i don yin te ;
translated: Others say that the meaning of the word is that substance, etc., which is related to the nature of substance, etc., as determined.

original: de yang 'brel pa can dag gi sgra'i don yin pa nyid kyis med pa'i phyir med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'brel pa can dag gi sgra'i don yin pa nyid kyis med pa'i phyir med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And that is called ‚Äúinexistent‚Äù because it is the meaning of the word of those related, and because it does not exist.

original: yang na yi ge gcig bzhin du gcig tu mi snang ba'i phyir dka' thub dang thos pa la sogs pa 'di dag phan tshun med pa sre ba yin te /
analyzed: yang na yi ge gcig bzhin du gcig tu mi snang ba'i phyir dka' thub dang thos pa la sogs pa 'di dag phan tshun med pa sre ba yin te /
translated: Or, like a single letter, it does not appear as a single unit, and so these austerities, learning, etc., are mutually inexistent.

original: 'di ltar 'di dag ni re re'am bsdus nas rang gi ngo bos dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag ni re re'am bsdus nas rang gi ngo bos dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, they are not perceived by their own nature, either individually or collectively.

original: 'on kyang mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin du 'di dag gi tshogs pa ni rang rang gi ngo bo las 'das pa snang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin du 'di dag gi tshogs pa ni rang rang gi ngo bo las 'das pa snang ba yin no //
translated: However, their collection appears, like a firebrand wheel, as if it transcends its own nature.

original: gzhan dag ni med pa'i khyad par can gyi yod pa gang yin pa de ni sgra'i don yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni med pa'i khyad par can gyi yod pa gang yin pa de ni sgra'i don yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The meaning of a word is that which exists as qualified by non-existence.

original: de la sgra'i don nyid kyis med pa'i khyad par gyi bye brag gdu bu dang sor gdub la sogs pa rnams tha dad pa thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug pa gser la sogs pa'i spyi'i bdag nyid kyi yod pa gang yin pa de'i med pa'i khyad par can
analyzed: de la sgra'i don nyid kyis med pa'i khyad par gyi bye brag gdu bu dang sor gdub la sogs pa rnams tha dad pa thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug pa gser la sogs pa'i spyi'i bdag nyid kyi yod pa gang yin pa de'i med pa'i khyad par can
translated: In that regard, the meaning of a word is that which exists as qualified by non-existence, which is the nature of gold, etc., that pervades all individual differences, such as bracelets, rings, etc.

original: gyi yod pa ni sgra'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gyi yod pa ni sgra'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is qualified by non-existence is the reason for the word.

original: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan brjod bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan brjod bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe reason for the application of a word is the object to be expressed‚Äù is that.

original: gzhan dag ni mngon par brjod par gyur pa'i sgra nyid sgra'i don yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni mngon par brjod par gyur pa'i sgra nyid sgra'i don yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The meaning of a word is the word itself that is used.

original: de la mngon par brjod pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de la mngon par brjod pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /
translated: In that regard, what is this so-called expression?

original: de la 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, the root text states, ‚ÄúHere, etc.‚Äù

original: sgra nyid don yin no zhes de ltar sgra la don zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: sgra nyid don yin no zhes de ltar sgra la don zhugs pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe word itself is the meaning‚Äù is that the meaning is contained in the word.

original: de 'di la zhes 'brel pa de'i phyir te /
analyzed: de 'di la zhes 'brel pa de'i phyir te /
translated: Because of that, that is, because of that cause,

original: rgyu'i phyir gang gi tshe sgra don dang lhan cig tu byas pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i don gyi rnam pa bdag gir byas pa'i sgra de ni mngon par brjod pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rgyu'i phyir gang gi tshe sgra don dang lhan cig tu byas pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i don gyi rnam pa bdag gir byas pa'i sgra de ni mngon par brjod pa zhes brjod do //
translated: when sound has the nature of being produced together with the object, and the aspect of the object is appropriated by the sound, that sound is called ‚Äúan expression.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag gis blo la yong pa nyid kyi rnam pa phyi rol gyi dngos po'i yul can phyi rol gyi dngos po nyid du bzung ba blo'i ngo bo nyid du rnam par ma phyed pa sgra'i don du smra'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis blo la yong pa nyid kyi rnam pa phyi rol gyi dngos po'i yul can phyi rol gyi dngos po nyid du bzung ba blo'i ngo bo nyid du rnam par ma phyed pa sgra'i don du smra'o //
translated: Others say that the aspect that comes to the mind, which has an external thing as its object, is apprehended as an external thing itself, and is not distinguished as having the nature of the mind.

original: de ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ston pa ni /
translated: That is taughtüîΩby ‚ÄúSome say that the objects . . .

original: kha cig don dag ces bya ba la sogs pa te /üîΩblo'i yul zhes bya ba ni blo la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig don dag ces bya ba la sogs pa te / blo'i yul zhes bya ba ni blo la 'jug pa ste /
translated: ‚Äù and so forth.üîΩ‚ÄúThe object of the mind‚Äù means that which engages the mind.

original: blo la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: blo la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for ‚Äúthat which abides in the mind.‚Äù

original: phyi'i dngos po'i rgyu mtshan can zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa'i phyi'i dngos po'i rgyu mtshan yi ge'i mtshan ma lta bu rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i don du 'jug pa gang la yod pa de ni phyi'i dngos po'i rgyu mtshan can no //
analyzed: phyi'i dngos po'i rgyu mtshan can zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa'i phyi'i dngos po'i rgyu mtshan yi ge'i mtshan ma lta bu rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i don du 'jug pa gang la yod pa de ni phyi'i dngos po'i rgyu mtshan can no //
translated: That which is called ‚Äúhaving an external entity as its reason‚Äù is that which engages for the sake of teaching the nature of an external entity as its reason, such as a letter sign, whether it exists or does not exist.

original: phyi'i dngos po zhes @319a * //
analyzed: phyi'i dngos po zhes @319a * //
translated: ‚Äú External entity‚Äù is a designation

original: 'dzin te zhes bya ba ni blo'i ngo bo nyid du rnam par ma phyed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzin te zhes bya ba ni blo'i ngo bo nyid du rnam par ma phyed pa ste /
translated: for that which is not differentiated as the nature of cognition.

original: phyi rol nyid du nges pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi rol nyid du nges pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is ascertained as external.

original: 'di ltar ji srid du blo'i ngo bo nyid kyi don la mi 'jog pa de ni blo'i ngo bo nyid do snyam du de kho na nyid sgom pas 'dzin pa de srid du de sgra'i don nyid du ma nges te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji srid du blo'i ngo bo nyid kyi don la mi 'jog pa de ni blo'i ngo bo nyid do snyam du de kho na nyid sgom pas 'dzin pa de srid du de sgra'i don nyid du ma nges te /
translated: Thus, as long as the meditation on reality does not posit the object as the nature of cognition, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is the nature of cognition,‚Äù for that long it is not ascertained as the meaning of the term,

original: de la bya ba'i khyad par dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bya ba'i khyad par dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not related to a particular action.

original: ba lang khrid de shog cig / zho 'thung shig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i bya ba de 'dra ba'i blo'i ngo bo la srid pa ma yin la /
analyzed: ba lang khrid de shog cig / zho 'thung shig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i bya ba de 'dra ba'i blo'i ngo bo la srid pa ma yin la /
translated: The nature of the cognition that is like Bring the cow! Drink the milk! and so on is not possible.

original: bya ba dang ldan pa srid pa'i don yang sgra rnams kyis brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba dang ldan pa srid pa'i don yang sgra rnams kyis brjod pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of possible is that it is expressed by words that have action.

original: de'i phyir blo'i ngo bo nyid du bzung ba 'di ni sgra'i don ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir blo'i ngo bo nyid du bzung ba 'di ni sgra'i don ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this apprehension of the nature of cognition is not the meaning of the word.

original: gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi dngos po la 'jog pa de'i tshe de la rtog pa po phyi rol nyid du phyin ci log yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi dngos po la 'jog pa de'i tshe de la rtog pa po phyi rol nyid du phyin ci log yin te /
translated: When it is posited as an external thing, at that time the thinker is mistaken about external reality.

original: de bya bsgrub par byed nus par sems pa'i phyir sgra'i don yin no //
analyzed: de bya bsgrub par byed nus par sems pa'i phyir sgra'i don yin no //
translated: Because it is thought to be able to perform a function, it is the meaning of the word.

original: 'on te sel ba smra ba'i phyogs dang 'di la khyad par ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'on te sel ba smra ba'i phyogs dang 'di la khyad par ci zhig yod /
translated: But what is the difference between this position and the position of the proponents of exclusion?

original: 'di ltar sel ba smra ba rnams kyis kyang blo'i rnam pa phyi rol gyi ngo bo nyid du bzung ba sgra'i don du 'dod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sel ba smra ba rnams kyis kyang blo'i rnam pa phyi rol gyi ngo bo nyid du bzung ba sgra'i don du 'dod pa kho na ste /
translated: In this way, the proponents of exclusion also assert that the aspect of cognition apprehended as the nature of an external thing is the meaning of the word.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de yi ngo bos sgro btags rtogs //
analyzed: de yi ngo bos sgro btags rtogs //
translated: It is understood through superimposition with its nature.

original: gzhan las ldog pa'i blo rtogs kyang //
analyzed: gzhan las ldog pa'i blo rtogs kyang //
translated: But the cognition that is the opposite of thatüîΩIs not contradictory when it is said

original: sgra don don de nyid yin zhes //üîΩbrjod pa la ni 'gal ba med //
analyzed: sgra don don de nyid yin zhes // brjod pa la ni 'gal ba med //
translated: That the meaning of the word is that very object.

original: ces bshad do zhe na /
analyzed: ces bshad do zhe na /
translated: This is explained.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: blo'i rnam par smra ba 'di ni phyi rol gyi dngos po la ma 'khrul pa yul dang bcas pa rdzas la sogs pa don dam pa la yang dag par blo'i rnam par ma nges pa ni sgra'i don du 'dod kyi /
analyzed: blo'i rnam par smra ba 'di ni phyi rol gyi dngos po la ma 'khrul pa yul dang bcas pa rdzas la sogs pa don dam pa la yang dag par blo'i rnam par ma nges pa ni sgra'i don du 'dod kyi /
translated: This theory of the proponents of mental aspects is that the nonerroneous cognition of external things, together with its object, is not ascertained as the ultimate, such as substance, and so on, and is asserted to be the meaning of the word.

original: tha dad pa dag la tha mi dad par zhen nas 'jug pa'i 'khrul pa phan tshun ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can 'dod pa ni ma yin no //üîΩgal te / de ltas don la gcig bdag tu //
analyzed: tha dad pa dag la tha mi dad par zhen nas 'jug pa'i 'khrul pa phan tshun ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can 'dod pa ni ma yin no // gal te / de ltas don la gcig bdag tu //
translated: It is not asserted that the error of engaging in apprehending things that are different as not different is the reason for the mutual exclusion.üîΩIf that is so, then this conception

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog 'di 'khrul pa //üîΩming don gang ldan phan tshun du //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog 'di 'khrul pa // ming don gang ldan phan tshun du //
translated: That apprehends the object as a single self is an error.

original: tha dad pa 'di'i sa bon yin //
analyzed: tha dad pa 'di'i sa bon yin //
translated: The seed of this is the mutualüîΩConnection between the meaning of the word and the object.üîΩWhen this is stated just as we have done, then it is established.

original: zhes ji ltar kho bo cag bzhin du brjod pa de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub ste /üîΩde skad du yang //
analyzed: zhes ji ltar kho bo cag bzhin du brjod pa de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub ste /üîΩde skad du yang //
translated: As it is said:

original: gal te phan tshun tha dad 'di'i //
analyzed: gal te phan tshun tha dad 'di'i //
translated: If they are different from each other,

original: sa bon 'di ni nged kyi phyogs //
analyzed: sa bon 'di ni nged kyi phyogs //
translated: this seed belongs to our position.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained later.

original: sel ba smra ba rnams kyis don dam par sgra rnams kyi don phyi rol lam /
analyzed: sel ba smra ba rnams kyis don dam par sgra rnams kyi don phyi rol lam /
translated: The proponents of exclusion do not accept that the meaning of words is external objects,

original: blo'i rnam pa'am /
analyzed: blo'i rnam pa'am /
translated: or the form of the cognition,

original: gzhan cung zad 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan cung zad 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: or anything else whatsoever, ultimately.

original: 'di ltar gang kho na sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la nges pa nyid du snang ba de ni sgra'i don yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang kho na sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la nges pa nyid du snang ba de ni sgra'i don yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the meaning of a word is that which appears with certainty in the cognition that arises from the word.

original: blo'i rnam pa ni sgra las byung ba'i shes pa de la nges par 'gyur ba ni @319b ma yin no //
analyzed: blo'i rnam pa ni sgra las byung ba'i shes pa de la nges par 'gyur ba ni @319b ma yin no //
translated: The form of the cognition does not appear with certainty in the cognition that arises from the word.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then does?

original: don bya ba byed pa'i phyi rol gyi dngos po nyid do //
analyzed: don bya ba byed pa'i phyi rol gyi dngos po nyid do //
translated: The external thing that performs the function.

original: des don dam par phyi rol nges par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: des don dam par phyi rol nges par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But that does not ascertain the external thing ultimately,

original: de kho na ji lta ba bzhin du ma nges pa'i phyir dang / ji ltar nges pa bzhin du de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na ji lta ba bzhin du ma nges pa'i phyir dang / ji ltar nges pa bzhin du de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not ascertain reality as it is and because it is not reality as it is ascertained.

original: de'i phyir sgro btags pa kho na sgra'i don yin la //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgro btags pa kho na sgra'i don yin la //
translated: Therefore, the referent of a word is only a superimposition.

original: sgro btags pa gang yin pa de yang ci yang ma yin pa'i phyir sgra dag gis yang dag par cung zad kyang brjod pa med do //
analyzed: sgro btags pa gang yin pa de yang ci yang ma yin pa'i phyir sgra dag gis yang dag par cung zad kyang brjod pa med do //
translated: And since that superimposition is nothing at all, words do not express anything at all.

original: yang sgra'i don gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang sgra'i don gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the referent of a word?üîΩThat very object is the referent of a word.

original: don de nyid do zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ni don dang mtshams sbyar nas sgro btags pa nyid yin la //
analyzed: don de nyid do zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ni don dang mtshams sbyar nas sgro btags pa nyid yin la //
translated: But that is only a superimposition that is connected to an object.

original: blo'i rnam pa smra ba rnams kyis ni don dam par blo'i rnam pa brjod byar 'dod pa'i phyir khyad par che'o //
analyzed: blo'i rnam pa smra ba rnams kyis ni don dam par blo'i rnam pa brjod byar 'dod pa'i phyir khyad par che'o //
translated: The difference is that the proponents of mental aspects assert that the mental aspect is the ultimate referent of a word.

original: gzhan dag gis goms pa'i phyir sgra spobs pa'i rgyu yin gyi phyi rol gyi don rjod par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis goms pa'i phyir sgra spobs pa'i rgyu yin gyi phyi rol gyi don rjod par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that words are the cause of eloquence because they are familiar, but they do not express external objects.

original: de ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching of that is:

original: sgra rnams thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgra rnams thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: All words are like echoes.

original: sgra yul 'ga' zhig la yang nas yang du 'jug par mthong ba ni goms pa yin la /
analyzed: sgra yul 'ga' zhig la yang nas yang du 'jug par mthong ba ni goms pa yin la /
translated: It is familiar when one sees that a word is repeatedly applied to some object.

original: nges pa'i sgrub par byed pa rnam par bcad pa'i bya ba'i rtogs par bya ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes rab ni spobs pa yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i sgrub par byed pa rnam par bcad pa'i bya ba'i rtogs par bya ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes rab ni spobs pa yin no //
translated: The wisdom that is in conformity with the object to be understood, which is the activity of the exclusion of the ascertaining establishment, is eloquence.

original: de ni sbyor ba mthong ba'i 'jug pa dang lhan cig pas bskyed par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de ni sbyor ba mthong ba'i 'jug pa dang lhan cig pas bskyed par bya ba yin la /
translated: It is to be generated by the simultaneous engagement of application and seeing.

original: ngag so so dang skyes bu so so la de tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: ngag so so dang skyes bu so so la de tha dad pa yin no //
translated: It is different for each individual speech and for each individual person.

original: de'i tha dad pa ni tshad med de /
analyzed: de'i tha dad pa ni tshad med de /
translated: Its differences are immeasurable.

original: sgra'i tha snyad mtha' yas pa'i phyir brjod par mi nus so snyam na /
analyzed: sgra'i tha snyad mtha' yas pa'i phyir brjod par mi nus so snyam na /
translated: It is not possible to express it because the conventions of words are limitless.

original: mdor bsdus nas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mdor bsdus nas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In brief, it is said.

original: 'di la dpe bshad pa dper na don rtogs byed ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la dpe bshad pa dper na don rtogs byed ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here, an example is explained, such as the expression understanding the meaning and so on.

original: dper na lcags kyu la sogs pas btab pa'i glang po la sogs pa rnams kyi don rtogs pa'i bya ba la sogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na lcags kyu la sogs pas btab pa'i glang po la sogs pa rnams kyi don rtogs pa'i bya ba la sogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the cause of the activity of understanding the meaning and so on for elephants and so on that are controlled by hooks and so on.

original: de bzhin du shing la sogs pa'i sgra don dang ldan par 'dod pa thams cad gom pa ji lta ba bzhin du spobs pa tsam nye bar sdud pa'i rgyur 'gyur gyi dngos su don ston par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du shing la sogs pa'i sgra don dang ldan par 'dod pa thams cad gom pa ji lta ba bzhin du spobs pa tsam nye bar sdud pa'i rgyur 'gyur gyi dngos su don ston par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, all those who assert that the sound of wood and so on has meaning are reduced to mere sophistry, but they do not actually teach the meaning.

original: de lta ma yin na ji ltar phan tshun 'gal ba'i tshig tha dad pa dang / gtam brgyud sar pa rang gi rnam par rtog pas bkod ba'i dngos po'i khyad par gsal bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ji ltar phan tshun 'gal ba'i tshig tha dad pa dang / gtam brgyud sar pa rang gi rnam par rtog pas bkod ba'i dngos po'i khyad par gsal bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that were not so, then how could the different words that are mutually contradictory and the particular things that are newly arranged by one‚Äôs own imagination be clarified?

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: In response to that, the text says ‚ÄúIf you assert that . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te yod pa'i don sngar bshad pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'dod na de'i tshe sngar bshad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te yod pa'i don sngar bshad pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'dod na de'i tshe sngar bshad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: If you assert that the existent object has the nature of its own characteristics and so on, as explained earlier, then the previously explained faults will ensue.

original: @320a * // gzhan yang yod pa'i don ni khyad par gyi ngo bo bzlog pa'i phyir de 'ba' zhig sgra dag gis ston par byed pa na ba lang dang / ba men dang / glang po la sogs pa'i tha dad pas tha snyad du byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: @320a * // gzhan yang yod pa'i don ni khyad par gyi ngo bo bzlog pa'i phyir de 'ba' zhig sgra dag gis ston par byed pa na ba lang dang / ba men dang / glang po la sogs pa'i tha dad pas tha snyad du byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if the meaning of the word ‚Äúexists‚Äù is the opposite of the meaning of ‚Äúparticular,‚Äù then when those words alone indicate that, the convention of difference, such as cow, gayal, elephant, and so on, would not be made.

original: de ni sgras ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sgras ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is not indicated by the words.

original: ba lang nyid sgra'i khyad par don zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi lan gyi dgos pa bsu ba yin te /
analyzed: ba lang nyid sgra'i khyad par don zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi lan gyi dgos pa bsu ba yin te /
translated: The response to that is stated in the line ‚ÄúCows and so on are words that indicate the particular meaning‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di snyam du ba lang nyid dang sgra dag gis khyad par gyi don yod pa tsam khra po la sogs pa'i tha dad pa dang bral ba sgras rtogs te rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de yin te tha dad pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ro snyam du sems
analyzed: 'di snyam du ba lang nyid dang sgra dag gis khyad par gyi don yod pa tsam khra po la sogs pa'i tha dad pa dang bral ba sgras rtogs te rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de yin te tha dad pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ro snyam du sems
translated: If you think that the particular meaning of the words ‚Äúcow‚Äù and ‚Äúsound‚Äù is mere existence, which is free from the difference of being a cow and so on, it is understood by the words because it is the cause of understanding, and therefore it is the convention of difference,

original: na / 'o na de lta na ji ltar yod pa'i don tsam sgra'i don du 'dod /
analyzed: na / 'o na de lta na ji ltar yod pa'i don tsam sgra'i don du 'dod /
translated: then how do you assert that mere existence is the meaning of the word?

original: gang gi phyir ba lang la sogs pa'i khyad par rtogs pa nyid yin no zhes dogs nas gzhan gyis lan smras pa ni rva dang dbyibs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ba lang la sogs pa'i khyad par rtogs pa nyid yin no zhes dogs nas gzhan gyis lan smras pa ni rva dang dbyibs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs response to the qualm that the word cow does not express a particular is stated in the lines ‚ÄúThe horns and shape, etc.‚Äù

original: rva la sogs pa'i khyad par sgra las mi gsal te mi rtogs pa'i rgyu'i phyir de rtogs par bya ba'i don 'ga' zhig yod do zhes bya ba de brjod kyi /
analyzed: rva la sogs pa'i khyad par sgra las mi gsal te mi rtogs pa'i rgyu'i phyir de rtogs par bya ba'i don 'ga' zhig yod do zhes bya ba de brjod kyi /
translated: The horns and so on are not clearly expressed by the word, because they are not the cause of the cognition of the cow. Therefore, the word cow is said to have some purpose in expressing the cognition of the cow.

original: khyad par du 'gyur ba'i ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i sgra dag ma rtogs pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par du 'gyur ba'i ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i sgra dag ma rtogs pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
translated: But since the word cow does not express the particular cow that is qualified by cowness, etc., there is no error.

original: de lta na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: The response to that is stated in the lines ‚ÄúIn that case, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te ba lang nyid la sogs pas khyad par can gyi don tsam brjod do zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te ba lang nyid la sogs pas khyad par can gyi don tsam brjod do zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the word cow expresses only the object that is qualified by cowness, etc.,

original: de'i tshe de dang ldan pa'i don brjod par khas blangs par byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe de dang ldan pa'i don brjod par khas blangs par byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: then you would have to accept that the word expresses the object that possesses that.

original: de la yang rigs de dang 'du ba bkag pa'i phyir de dang ldan pa'i don mi srid do zhes sngar bshad pa'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: de la yang rigs de dang 'du ba bkag pa'i phyir de dang ldan pa'i don mi srid do zhes sngar bshad pa'i skyon yod do //
translated: And since the existence of that type is refuted, it is impossible for it to possess that.üîΩ

original: gzhan yang de dang ldan pa'i don ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir brda mi byed pa nyid dang / tha snyad med pa nyid dang / gsal bar snang bar thal ba snga ma bzhin du 'byung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang ldan pa'i don ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir brda mi byed pa nyid dang / tha snyad med pa nyid dang / gsal bar snang bar thal ba snga ma bzhin du 'byung ba kho na'o //
translated: Moreover, since the meaning of ‚Äúendowed with that‚Äù is the nature of its own characteristic, it is just as previously explained that the error arises that it would not be a signifier, it would not be a convention, and it would absurdly follow that it would appear as clear.

original: yod pa'i don ni rang gi mtshan nyid las tha dad pa yin no zhe na /üîΩyod don gzhan yang mthong ma yin //
analyzed: yod pa'i don ni rang gi mtshan nyid las tha dad pa yin no zhe na / yod don gzhan yang mthong ma yin //
translated: If the meaning of ‚Äúendowed with that‚Äù is different from its own characteristic,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then it is said:üîΩThe meaning of existence is not seen as different.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa la tha dad pa'i yod pa'i don gzhan dpyod phan blo'i spyod yul du 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa la tha dad pa'i yod pa'i don gzhan dpyod phan blo'i spyod yul du 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of existence that is different from its own characteristic and so on is not engaged as the domain of the mind that analyzes whether it is different.

original: bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyogs la skyon bshad la /
analyzed: bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyogs la skyon bshad la /
translated: The error is explained in the context of the statement of inclusion:

original: bsdu ba brjod pa yin na yang //
analyzed: bsdu ba brjod pa yin na yang //
translated: Even if it is a statement of inclusion,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyogs la rigs dang dka' thub la sogs pa'i khyad par brjod pa gsal por khas blangs @320b pa'i phyir so sor brjod pa'i phyogs la 'byung ba'i nyes pa bsdu ba brjod pa la thams cad cig car 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyogs la rigs dang dka' thub la sogs pa'i khyad par brjod pa gsal por khas blangs @320b pa'i phyir so sor brjod pa'i phyogs la 'byung ba'i nyes pa bsdu ba brjod pa la thams cad cig car 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the position of the statement of collection, the distinction of type, austerity, etc. is clearly accepted, so in the position of the statement of individual, the fault of the arising of all at once in the statement of collection would occur.

original: med pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i phyogs gnyis kyi skyon bshad pa ni /
analyzed: med pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i phyogs gnyis kyi skyon bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the faults of the two positions, ‚Äúthe distinction of non-existence,‚Äù etc. is:

original: nges par ma bzung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nges par ma bzung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNot definitely grasped,‚Äù etc.

original: sngar tshig gi don drug brtag par ldan pa dang 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa bsal ba'i phyir grangs can pa'i tha mi dad pa'i spyi dang / tshig gi don drug brtag par tha dad pa yang bsal ba'i phyir med pa'i ldan pa dang med pa'i khyad par gyi spyi yang brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar tshig gi don drug brtag par ldan pa dang 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa bsal ba'i phyir grangs can pa'i tha mi dad pa'i spyi dang / tshig gi don drug brtag par tha dad pa yang bsal ba'i phyir med pa'i ldan pa dang med pa'i khyad par gyi spyi yang brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: In the examination of the six categories, the relation of the characteristic of possession and inherence was refuted, so the SƒÅ·πÉkhya‚Äôs nondifferent universals and the six categories‚Äô possession and nonexistence were also refuted.

original: mngon par brjod pa'i phyogs la yang //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa'i phyogs la yang //
translated: In the position of the grammarians,

original: tha dad rigs sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tha dad rigs sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúDifferent types‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te sgra la don 'ga' zhig yod na de ni de dang lhan cig gcig tu 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te sgra la don 'ga' zhig yod na de ni de dang lhan cig gcig tu 'gyur na /
translated: If a word had some meaning, it would be one with it.

original: ji srid du rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo sgra'i don du mi srid par sngar bstan te /
analyzed: ji srid du rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo sgra'i don du mi srid par sngar bstan te /
translated: But as long as the nature of the object, such as its own characteristics, is not possible as the meaning of the word, as was previously explained,

original: de ji ltar de dang gcig tu byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar de dang gcig tu byed par 'gyur /
translated: how could it be made one with it?

original: gzhan yang mngon par brjod pa 'di ni blo la gnas pa kho na yin te ;
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon par brjod pa 'di ni blo la gnas pa kho na yin te ;
translated: Moreover, this expression exists only in the mind.

original: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi sgra dang don dag dbang po tha dad pas gzung bar bya ba'i phyir 'di dag las tha dad par 'dod pas de dag don dam par gcig tu byed par 'gyur ba rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi sgra dang don dag dbang po tha dad pas gzung bar bya ba'i phyir 'di dag las tha dad par 'dod pas de dag don dam par gcig tu byed par 'gyur ba rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, since external sounds and meanings are apprehended by different sense faculties, it is not logical to assert that they are different from the mind and to make them one ultimately.

original: de'i phyir sgra dang don blo la gnas pa kho na blos gcig tu rtogs pa'i phyir gcig tu byed par rigs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra dang don blo la gnas pa kho na blos gcig tu rtogs pa'i phyir gcig tu byed par rigs te /
translated: Therefore, it is logical to make them one because the word and the meaning that exist in the mind are understood as one by the mind.

original: 'di ltar brjod bya'i rnam pa 'dzin pa sgra'i rang bzhin bsgribs pa blo la gsal ba sgra'i bdag nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo dang rjes su mthun pa'i don rnam par ma phye bas nang du 'jug pa ni mngon par brjod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar brjod bya'i rnam pa 'dzin pa sgra'i rang bzhin bsgribs pa blo la gsal ba sgra'i bdag nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo dang rjes su mthun pa'i don rnam par ma phye bas nang du 'jug pa ni mngon par brjod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the manifestation in the intellect of the nature of sound, which is the obscuring of the nature of sound that holds the aspect of the object of expression, is called ‚Äúverbal expression,‚Äù because it is not differentiated from the object that is in conformity with the nature of sound.

original: de yang blo'i bdag nyid du rtog pa'i rnam par rigs kyi /
analyzed: de yang blo'i bdag nyid du rtog pa'i rnam par rigs kyi /
translated: Moreover, it is imagined to be of the nature of the intellect,

original: phyi rol ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol ni ma yin te /
translated: but not of the external object,

original: de ni gcig tu phan tshun dben ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gcig tu phan tshun dben ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is of the nature of mutual exclusion.

original: de lta yin dang de ma thag tu brjod pa'i blo sgra'i don yin pa'i phyogs las 'di la bye brag ci yod de ci yang med do //
analyzed: de lta yin dang de ma thag tu brjod pa'i blo sgra'i don yin pa'i phyogs las 'di la bye brag ci yod de ci yang med do //
translated: If that is so, then what is the difference between this and the position that the intellect is the meaning of sound, which was just mentioned? There is no difference at all.

original: gnyi ga la yang blo la snang ba kho na don yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang blo la snang ba kho na don yin no //
translated: In both cases, the meaning is only the appearance in the intellect.

original: sgra don gcig tu byas pa zhes //
analyzed: sgra don gcig tu byas pa zhes //
translated: The meaning of sound is made into one thing.

original: bya 'di tsam zhig tha dad la //üîΩshes las tha dad ma yin pa'i //
analyzed: bya 'di tsam zhig tha dad la // shes las tha dad ma yin pa'i //
translated: This much is different.üîΩHow can the meaning, which is not different from the cognition,

original: ji ltar don gzhan 'brang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar don gzhan 'brang bar 'gyur //
translated: follow the meaning of another word?

original: zhes bya ba'i skyon ni mtshungs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i skyon ni mtshungs pa kho na'o //
translated: The fault is exactly the same.

original: de nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni /
translated: To demonstrate just that, he says,

original: de phyir de ma thag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de phyir de ma thag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore, it is not tenable that the object of the mind is external.‚Äù

original: spobs pa'i phyogs la skyon bshad pa ni /
analyzed: spobs pa'i phyogs la skyon bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the fault in the position of eloquence:

original: gal te phyi'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩgal te spobs pa don dam @321a * //üîΩpar phyi rol gyi don gyi yul can yin na /
analyzed: gal te phyi'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / gal te spobs pa don dam @321a * // par phyi rol gyi don gyi yul can yin na /
translated: If the object of eloquence is external,üîΩthen it is not tenable that the object of the mind is external.

original: de sgra la sogs pa dngos po gcig la gzhung lugs 'gal ba la gnas pa'i spobs pa sna tshogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de sgra la sogs pa dngos po gcig la gzhung lugs 'gal ba la gnas pa'i spobs pa sna tshogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the object of eloquence is ultimately the external object, then eloquence would not be various, since it would be based on the discordant systems of the object, sound, and so on.

original: gcig la rang bzhin du ma mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la rang bzhin du ma mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is impossible for one thing to have many natures.

original: ci ste yul med pa yin na de'i tshe don la 'jug pa dang rtogs pa dag tu mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste yul med pa yin na de'i tshe don la 'jug pa dang rtogs pa dag tu mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is not an object, then it would not engage or understand objects,

original: de'i sgra'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sgra'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not be the object of sound.

original: ci ste rang gi snang ba don med pa la don du zhen nas 'khrul pas 'jug ba dang shes pa de dag tu 'gyur ba de'i tshe sgra'i don 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste rang gi snang ba don med pa la don du zhen nas 'khrul pas 'jug ba dang shes pa de dag tu 'gyur ba de'i tshe sgra'i don 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: But if, due to the delusion of conceiving a meaning in the meaningless appearances of one‚Äôs own mind, one engages in them and they become objects of cognition, then the meaning of the term would be delusion.

original: 'khrul pa de'i sa bon te rgyu brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: 'khrul pa de'i sa bon te rgyu brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: And the seed or cause of that delusion would have to be stated.

original: gzhan du 'khrul pa sa bon med pa yin na thams cad du thams cad kyi tsher 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du 'khrul pa sa bon med pa yin na thams cad du thams cad kyi tsher 'gyur te /
translated: If it were delusion without a seed, it would be so at all times and in all ways.

original: gal te dngos po rnams kyi phan tshun tha dad pa nyid 'di'i sa bon yin par khas len na de'i tshe kho bo cag gi phyogs nyid khyed kyis sgrub bar byed pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub po //
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams kyi phan tshun tha dad pa nyid 'di'i sa bon yin par khas len na de'i tshe kho bo cag gi phyogs nyid khyed kyis sgrub bar byed pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub po //
translated: If you accept that the mutual difference of things is the seed of delusion, then you are proving what is already established for us, so your argument is pointless.

original: da ni phyogs thams cad la mtshungs pa'i skyon bshad pa ni /
analyzed: da ni phyogs thams cad la mtshungs pa'i skyon bshad pa ni /
translated: Now, the explanation of the fault that is similar in all positions:

original: gal te 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThese things,‚Äù and so on.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang rigs la sogs pa 'di thams cad skad cig pa'am /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang rigs la sogs pa 'di thams cad skad cig pa'am /
translated: Are all these things, such as specific characteristics and universals, momentary?

original: skad cig ma ma yin grang /
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin grang /
translated: Or are they not momentary?

original: de la phyogs dang po la brda'i dus su mthong ba tha snyad kyi dus su rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir de la brda byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po la brda'i dus su mthong ba tha snyad kyi dus su rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir de la brda byed pa ma yin no //
translated: In response to the first position, since what is seen at the time of the sign does not follow at the time of the expression, the sign is not applied to it.

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyogs la yang rim ma yin pa las rim can 'byung ba med pa'i phyir sgra'i don gyi shes pa rim can med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyogs la yang rim ma yin pa las rim can 'byung ba med pa'i phyir sgra'i don gyi shes pa rim can med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of the position that it is not momentary, since what is not sequential does not arise sequentially, it follows that there is no sequential cognition of the meaning of the sound.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means not momentary.

original: gzhan dag ni sgras don brjod par 'dod pa rjes su dpog par byed do zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni sgras don brjod par 'dod pa rjes su dpog par byed do zhes zer te /
translated: Others say that the desire to express the meaning is inferred from the sound.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: brjod par 'dod pa rjes dpog pa//
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa rjes dpog pa//
translated: The desire to express is inferred

original: sgra las gzhan pa yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu'o //üîΩde la bshad pa /
analyzed: sgra las gzhan pa yod ma yin // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o // de la bshad pa /
translated: From the sound, nothing else.üîΩIn response to that, it is said:

original: 'di nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: By this alone, etc.

original: gal te don dam par brjod par 'dod pa don dam pa po sgra'i don gyi yul du 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te don dam par brjod par 'dod pa don dam pa po sgra'i don gyi yul du 'dod na /
translated: If the desire to express ultimately is asserted as the object of the sound,

original: de ma grub ste rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i sgra'i don 'ga' yang mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma grub ste rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i sgra'i don 'ga' yang mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not established, because the meaning of the term ‚Äúown characteristic‚Äù and so on is impossible in any way.

original: de'i phyir don dam par don 'ga' zhig la brjod par 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par don 'ga' zhig la brjod par 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, ultimately, it is not the case that one wishes to express any object,

original: rjes su 'gro ba can gyi don mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba can gyi don mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because an object that is concomitant is impossible.

original: de ston par byed pa'i sgra yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i sgra yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, the term that teaches that is not existent,

original: thos pa gang zhig ces bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: thos pa gang zhig ces bshad pa yin te /
translated: because it is explained that ‚Äúwhat is heard is not . . . ‚Äù

original: thos pa ni sgra'o //
analyzed: thos pa ni sgra'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is heard‚Äù is sound.

original: brjod par 'dod pa ste rtogs par bya ba la thos pa ste @321b sgra las phyi rol la 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa ste rtogs par bya ba la thos pa ste @321b sgra las phyi rol la 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The object that is wished to be expressed, that is to be understood, does not engage external objects through sound,

original: de ma brjod pa'i phyir don gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: de ma brjod pa'i phyir don gzhan bzhin no //
translated: because it is not expressed, like a different object.

original: ci ste brjod par 'dod ba gsal ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'i don gang yin pa dang phyi rol gang yin pa de dang 'dra ba yod ba yin te /
analyzed: ci ste brjod par 'dod ba gsal ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'i don gang yin pa dang phyi rol gang yin pa de dang 'dra ba yod ba yin te /
translated: But if it is argued that the object that is wished to be expressed, such as a clear form and so on, is similar to what is external,

original: des na 'dra ba'i phyir ma brjod na yang phyi rol gyi don la 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na 'dra ba'i phyir ma brjod na yang phyi rol gyi don la 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: then because of that similarity, even though it is not expressed, one engages external objects.

original: mtshe ma bzhin no zhes bya bar 'dod de /
analyzed: mtshe ma bzhin no zhes bya bar 'dod de /
translated: It is like twins.

original: des na 'dra phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: des na 'dra phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause they are similar.‚Äù

original: de lta na ni thams cad phyi rol la 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni thams cad phyi rol la 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if that is so, then not all would engage in external objects,

original: res 'ga' brjod par 'dod pa gsal ba brjod pa la yang 'jug par 'gyur te mtshe ma dag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: res 'ga' brjod par 'dod pa gsal ba brjod pa la yang 'jug par 'gyur te mtshe ma dag nyid bzhin no //
translated: because sometimes one would engage in expressing the manifest object that one wishes to express, just like twins.

original: gang yang bye brag tu smra ba rnams sgra'i yul ming du brjod pa dang mtshan mar brjod pa don gyi ngo bo ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed du 'dod pa de yang 'dis sun phyung bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang bye brag tu smra ba rnams sgra'i yul ming du brjod pa dang mtshan mar brjod pa don gyi ngo bo ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed du 'dod pa de yang 'dis sun phyung bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Also, this refutes the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika assertion that the object of sound is a name that is expressed and a sign that is expressed, which is a nonassociated compositional factor that does not possess the entity of an object.

original: 'di ltar ming la sogs pa de gal te skad cig ma yin na de'i tshe rjes su 'gro ba mi rung la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ming la sogs pa de gal te skad cig ma yin na de'i tshe rjes su 'gro ba mi rung la /
translated: If those names and so on are momentary, then it is illogical that they are related.

original: skad cig ma ma yin na shes pa rim can du mi 'thad pa dang / phyi rol la 'jug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / 'du ba'i phyir na thams cad du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba sun 'byin pa gang yin pa thams cad nyams pa med bar 'jug go //
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin na shes pa rim can du mi 'thad pa dang / phyi rol la 'jug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / 'du ba'i phyir na thams cad du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba sun 'byin pa gang yin pa thams cad nyams pa med bar 'jug go //
translated: If it is not momentary, then it is not tenable that consciousness is sequential, it follows that it does not engage external objects, and because it would combine, it would not be everywhere.

original: yang na 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni ji ltar srid pa rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa sun phyung bas so //
analyzed: yang na 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni ji ltar srid pa rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa sun phyung bas so //
translated: Or, ‚Äúby this‚Äù refers to the refutation of the characteristics of existence, etc.

original: 'di ltar de la yang 'di skad du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de la yang 'di skad du brjod par bya ste /
translated: In this way, this should be stated:

original: gzhan la brten min bdag nyid kyi //
analyzed: gzhan la brten min bdag nyid kyi //
translated: It is not dependent on another.üîΩThe power of convention does not exist

original: ming sogs rnams la brda nus min //
analyzed: ming sogs rnams la brda nus min //
translated: for names, etc.,

original: de phyir de dag ci zhig ltar //
analyzed: de phyir de dag ci zhig ltar //
translated: Therefore, how could they

original: brjod bya nyid du 'thad ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brjod bya nyid du 'thad ma yin // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: be tenable as objects of expression?

original: brjod par 'dod pa la yod pa'i don gsal bar byed pa na sgra rnams phyi rol la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes gang smras pa 'di la gzhan gyi len gyi dogs pa bsu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa la yod pa'i don gsal bar byed pa na sgra rnams phyi rol la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes gang smras pa 'di la gzhan gyi len gyi dogs pa bsu ba'i phyir /
translated: If the meaning that exists in what is to be expressed is clarified, then it is said that sounds do not engage external objects.

original: brjod 'dod rjes su dpag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: brjod 'dod rjes su dpag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe desire to speak and the inference‚Äù and so on.

original: brjod par 'dod pa yang smra ba po'i rgyud la 'jug la brjod par 'dod pa de'i rjes su dpag pa ni nyan pa po'i rgyud la yod pa'i phyir brjod par 'dod pa dang rjes su dpag pa de dag bsres pa sbrel ba de snang zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa yang smra ba po'i rgyud la 'jug la brjod par 'dod pa de'i rjes su dpag pa ni nyan pa po'i rgyud la yod pa'i phyir brjod par 'dod pa dang rjes su dpag pa de dag bsres pa sbrel ba de snang zhes bya ba'i don
translated: The desire to speak occurs in the continuum of the speaker, and the inference of that desire to speak occurs in the continuum of the hearer. Therefore, the desire to speak and the inference are mixed, that is, connected. The meaning of ‚Äúappear‚Äù is

original: to // rnam pa de phyi rol nyid du nges na smra ba po dang nyan pa po dag 'di la ste phyi rol la 'jug par gyur to //
analyzed: to // rnam pa de phyi rol nyid du nges na smra ba po dang nyan pa po dag 'di la ste phyi rol la 'jug par gyur to //
translated: that if that aspect is ascertained as external, then the speaker and hearer engage in that, that is, the external object.

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: don dam par rang gi snang ba nyams su myong ba la smra ba po 'di ltar zhen par 'gyur te /
analyzed: don dam par rang gi snang ba nyams su myong ba la smra ba po 'di ltar zhen par 'gyur te /
translated: In ultimate reality, the speaker is attached to the experience of his own appearance in this way:

original: bdag gis 'di la phyi rol gyi don nyid @322a * //
analyzed: bdag gis 'di la phyi rol gyi don nyid @322a * //
translated: ‚ÄúI have taught this external object to him.‚Äù

original: bstan to // nyan pa po yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bstan to // nyan pa po yang 'di lta ste /
translated: And the hearer thinks,üîΩ‚ÄúI have understood this external object.‚Äù

original: bdag la 'dis phyi rol nyid ston par byed do zhes de'i phyir rab rib can nyid la zla ba gnyis snang ba bzhin du sgra las byung ba'i tha snyad 'di thams cad de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: bdag la 'dis phyi rol nyid ston par byed do zhes de'i phyir rab rib can nyid la zla ba gnyis snang ba bzhin du sgra las byung ba'i tha snyad 'di thams cad de lta bu yin no //
translated: Because of that, all of these conventions that arise from sound are like the appearance of two moons to one who has eye disease.
